Title: Release of Information Specialist/ Field Agent
Description:
About Us:

Diversified Medical Records Services is a successful and established nationwide company specializing in medical records services for doctors' offices, medical facilities and hospitals. We have been in business over twenty years and our client base exceeds 1,000 physicians, groups and facilities across the country.

Description:

We have a permanent,full-time position available M -F handling medical records requests at client medical offices. This position requires working independently to provide Release of Information services, high level of customer service and driving to client locations up to fifty+ miles per day. Mileage reimbursement is provided. Industry experience is not necessary; we will train. Day time hours only-- no weekends or evening work. Full-time with benefits: Mileage, health, paid holidays, sick time, vacation and 401k.

We are seeking professional and responsible applicants with an exceptional work ethic.

Successful Candidates Must Also Possess:
- High energy level and positive attitude
- Reliable automobile, driver's license and insurance
- Basic computer skills
- Organizational and time management abilities
- Attention to detail

Interested candidates may forward resumes to the link provided herein.Due to the high volume of responses, only selected applicants will receive a reply.

Prior to employment, eligible candidate must pass drug screen and background check.

Title: Project Coordination and Support - FT - $15/hr and Full Benefits
Description:
We are an energy service company that provides solar, energy efficiency, and water conservation products and systems for homes and apartment buildings.  

The job is full time, 7:30 AM to 4:00 PM in the Monterey Park area. 

The position includes benefits (health, dental, vision). Starting pay is $15/hr with paid holidays and opportunities for bonus and pay increases over time. 

We will provide training on our systems, products, and services. 

This position is for someone who is professional and friendly on the phones. You will be the main point of contact for the customers. You will:

-call past customers and schedule inspections of their properties for new projects (mostly solar right now)
-you will forward the inspection information and other information to the customer via email
-you will followup with customer over the phone to see what they think
-if the customer is signs up, you will then be their point of contact for telling them when their project is ready to begin and other information to ensure the project goes smoothly and the customer is happy and informed

-answer inbound phone calls and get answers and solutions for the callers

Aside from talking on phone with customer and emailing, you will track you activity in database, and prepare documents for signature and other paperwork for the project. 

We are hiring ASAP. Please apply to this position by emailing your resume and an optional cover letter. If everything looks good, we will contact you for a phone screening, and invite you in for an in-person interview.

In the body of your email, answer these questions:
•	When are you available to start?
•	Are you currently employed?
•	Where do you live?

Title: Pool Supervisor (Torrance Unified School District)
Description:
TORRANCE UNIFIED SCHOOL DISTRICT
www.governmentjobs.com/careers/tusd

FILING DATE: 
The District Classified application form, supplemental application, Pool Operator Certificate, valid American Red Cross CPR/AED and American Red Cross First Aid Certification must be submitted to the Personnel Commission Office prior to August 31, 2017, 4:30 PM.  

SELECTION PROCEDURE:
This is an OPEN recruitment to establish an eligibility list and fil a vacancy. A permanent eligibility list will be created from this recruitment and will be used to fill permanent vacancies which may occur during the life of the eligibility list.

This position is full-time, 12 months per year. This position includes evening shifts.

The recruitment process will consist of an evaluation of the submitted supplemental application and an oral technical interview tentatively scheduled during the week of September 5-8, 2017.  Qualified applicants will be notified by US mail or email.

BASIC FUNCTION: 
Under the direction of the Deputy Superintendent-Administrative Services or assigned supervisor, acts as the pool operator, supervises, manages, plans, organizes and coordinates pool activities; inspects grounds, building and equipment to assure standards of cleanliness, appearance and efficiency; responsible for staff supervision and facility operations; communicates with staff, pool users and the community in the coordination of programs and operations; maintains a safe environment for pool users and ensures departmental policies, state and county regulations and safety regulations are followed.  (See attached job description for a complete job description)

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: 
Any combination equivalent to:  Associate's degree in business administration or related field and three (3) years
of experience supervising aquatics programs or large public facilities. 

LICENSES AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS: 
•	Valid California driver's license. Employees in this classification must maintain insurability at the District's standard rate during the term of employment.
•	Must possess a Pool Operator Certificate.
•	Must be able to obtain the Los Angeles County Swimming Pool Technician certification within six (6) months of employment. 
•	Valid American Red Cross CPR/AED and American Red Cross First Aid.

Title: Fleet Manager
Description:
The Fleet Manager will oversee the management and daily operations of all fleet maintenance activities at the local facility with the sole objective of achieving maximum productivity with minimal downtime on the repair of company assets. In addition the Fleet Manager is tasked with making concise decisions and effectively communicating directions to members of the team. He must work in tandem with the Shop Coordinator of the maintenance shop to coordinate schedules with supervisors of all departments to ensure adherence to the highest level of safety and optimal performance on each asset. The ability to handle multiple tasks at one time and to effectively diagnose mechanical issues will be a huge plus. This position will also require a high level of computer literacy as all jobs are monitored for specific labor times and procurement of parts.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

- Oversees personnel needs of the department including selecting, coaching, disciplining, and training employees and evaluating employee performance in a positive and professional manner.
- Promote teamwork and cooperation within all departments, while being a positive messenger of change.
- Promote the use of Fleet Management Dossier that will improve work flow and overall shop performance.
- Manages effective utilization of vehicle/equipment assets.
- Ensures proper parts inventory management and organization. Performs regular inspections to guarantee processes are being followed.
- Complies with and ensures adherence to MarBorg's standards, OSHA rules and regulations to encourage safe and efficient operations.
- Ensures the cleanliness and maintenance of the maintenance shops through regular inspections and preventive maintenance programs.
- Conduct department meetings to maintain favorable working relationships among all employees and promote maximum morale, productivity, and efficiency.
- Promote an atmosphere of team spirit through good examples, open communication, good listening and timely problem solving.
- Directs and/or performs the maintenance, repair and overhaul of all vehicles & equipment.
- Maintains an up-to-date preventive maintenance schedules for vehicles & equipment.
- Perform regular spot inspections to all work has been performed and quality standards have been meet.
- Ensures proper parts inventory management and organization. Performs regular inspections to guarantee processes are being followed.
- Keeps up on all DOT and FMCSA rules & regulations that are related to maintenance, repair and inspections of vehicles & equipment.
- Keeps current on the latest technology regarding the maintenance and repair of all vehicles & equipment.
- Must be able to track repairs on the computer, including when a repair is started and completed and what parts were used to complete the repair.

QUALIFICATIONS

- Highly proficient in fleet maintenance and shop operations.
- Capable of maintaining professional demeanor at all times even in stressful situations.
- Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
- Excellent organization skills with a high attention to detail.
- Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office; Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
- CDL A or B with tanker endorsement a plus.
- Bilingual (English/Spanish) a plus.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

- High school diploma. Minimum of 3 years of supervising others and/or directing work flow and working within an equipment/vehicle repair shop environment.
- Minimum of three (3) years' experience working as a shop supervisor or fleet manager supervising others and/or directing work flow.
- Minimum of three (3) years technical work experience required as a mechanic in a trucking or heavy equipment environment.
- Fleet maintenance management experience.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package including medical coverage, dental coverage, life insurance, voluntary life, voluntary vision, 401k, profit sharing and paid vacation, sick and holidays.

To Apply: Interested candidates should send a cover letter, resume, and salary requirements to HRdept@marborg.com

Title: LAMP Engineer - Unique Opportunity for Fast Growing SaaS Company
Description:
Back At You Media is a SaaS marketing technology helping small business with their social marketing. Today we focus on the real estate vertical with plans to roll out the technology to other industries. 

We were selected out of thousands of companies to join the accelerator class of Second Century Ventures, the venture capital arm of the National Association of Realtors (the largest trade organization in the world), won Red Herring's Global Top 100 technology company, our second time winning such honor and were recently selected to be in the Inc. 5000 as one of the fastest growing private companies in America. 

We offer an exciting opportunity to join a quickly scaling technology company in LA. Founders have started successful companies and raised millions of dollar on previous start-ups. You will be joining a start-up that has thousands of paying clients and is expected to triple in the upcoming years. 

You will become an integral part of the development team and have responsibility of the system architecture and scaling requirement as well as building new features and product enhancements.

Requirements:

LAMP - Linux (Ubuntu), Apache, MySQL and PHP
JavaScript, JQuery/Ajax, 
HTML/CSS
Bootstrap
AWS - Amazon Web Services experience (EC2, RDS, S3, etc)
Shell scripting (bash)
Virtual Machine Manager experience (QEMU/KVM)
MVC frameworks
Version control (github)
API integration (Facebook, Yelp, Google Maps, Zillow, etc)
Agile software development (scrum)
Facebook Graph API & Marketing API
Knowledge of OAuth2, SAML, SSO
System admin experience (FTP, VPN, network diagnostics/analytics, security, etc)

Plus (would be nice to have the following experience with the following):

Yii2
Jira
Sendgrid
Recurly
Zendesk
Citrix (webinar)
Wordpress
Google Analytics
SaaS Experience

We are looking for rock stars with vision that want to retire as a result of your equity and our overall success. If you are looking for 40 hours a week and a paycheck, please look elsewhere. We are growing fast and need stars now that are highly motivated and add value.

Title: College Admissions Advisor
Description:
FLEX is seeking individuals with extensive admissions knowledge and strong communication skills to provide admissions consulting services to FLEX clients.  In this role, an advisor will generate detailed, comprehensive written reports that advise students on academic planning, provide information on relevant extracurricular opportunities and standardized testing targets, and generally provide a detailed strategy to maximize a student's chance of getting into his/her target schools.  To accomplish this, an advisor must be very knowledgeable about U.S. college admissions, have strong writing skills, and be able to engage in research specific to each student's needs.  Advisors  will not be meeting directly with students and so do not need to be located in California.  However, advisors will have opportunities to lead presentations/seminars at FLEX events, so a willingness to travel is highly desired.

Projects will be assigned on an as-needed basis; volume of assigned work can be adjusted based on an advisor's availability.  Projects will have hard deadlines but can be completed remotely and during hours most convenient to each advisor.

Successful applicants for this position are:
Former US college admissions staff or closely related
Highly knowledgeable about college admissions in general
Strong writers
Efficient and detail-oriented researchers

Locations:
SoCal: Los Angeles, Irvine, Fullerton, Diamond Bar, Pasadena
NorCal: Los Altos, Cupertino, Almaden, Fremont
Remote (anywhere in U.S.)
 
Why FLEX?
FLEX College Prep has provided admissions consulting, standardized test prep, tutoring and enrichment services for pre-collegiate students since 2001.  In each of these areas, FLEX offers comprehensive strategies personalized to each student's needs and ambitions. 

We help students identify and meet general academic requirements, provide direction and opportunities for students to create unique extracurricular profiles, offer a nuanced understanding of specific colleges and their admissions philosophies, and give thorough, step-by-step instruction in the crafting of the college application, including interview prep and essay-writing assistance.  But most importantly, we at FLEX know that the college admissions process is an opportunity to build relationships.  Our consultants understand that each student has a unique background and a unique set of challenges and goals; we work intimately with families to help each individual student overcome those challenges and achieve their goals.
 
Additionally, FLEX is planning significant domestic and international expansion in the next 12-18 months, providing employees with many opportunities for growth and advancement.  FLEX recently expanded domestically to Pasadena, CA and internationally to the vibrant city of Bangkok, Thailand.
 
For more information about FLEX, visit our website at www.flexcollegeprep.com.

Title: Preschool Teacher
Description:
Us:  Bright Beginnings Family School is a time-honored, nurturing early learning and childcare center located in the heart of West Los Angeles.  We provide a safe and loving environment for children which creates the ideal foundation for development and learning.  We recognize the unique qualities of individual children and carefully arrange opportunities for growth and discovery so that we may best suit their needs and abilities as early learners.  We have an amazing staff of caring and charismatic teachers all of whom are state licensing qualified early childhood learning enthusiasts.  We strive to make this stage of development meaningful and fun.  Check out our website at: www.brightbeginningsfamilyschool.com

You:  This position will require 30-35 hours a week of your creative, resourceful, outgoing, passionately mindful energy. This position requires someone who is able to work with various ages (2-5 years) and can competently foster each child's development as individuals.  The primary position we are hiring for is our 3 year old classroom, however, we all work as a collaborative, and our roles as early childhood educators alters daily. This would be a wonderful opportunity for a preschool teacher who has at least 12 units of E.C.E, 1 YEAR MINIMUM experience in a preschool program, is very reliable, super flexible, and, ESPECIALLY, respects and appreciates the manner in which all children develop and grow individually. An ideal candidate will be able to work varied shifts, including opening and closing. Our new teacher must have knowledge/experience with developmental appropriate practices for children and must be a real team player. Current transcripts and fingerprint clearance is a must!  Please only apply if you have these qualifications!  

Position Perks!: You will have the opportunity to work in a creative environment with hands-on experiences in which you will utilize the early childhood development philosophies and approaches you learned in your ECE courses.  You will be surrounded by a team of supportive, loving, enthusiastic teachers and under the guidance of directors whom are ridiculously kind and accommodating.   We all love what we do!!!  You will immediately acquire  approximately 14-16 paid holiday days off, with additional PTO accrued after your first year.  You will enjoy paid hour long lunches, plenty of teacher resources, rewarding smiles from children, and a priceless camaraderie with fellow teachers and the best families L.A. has to offer.  We will hold out to find our perfect  match...is it you?!?!?  Please email us a resume along with a couple of interesting tidbits about yourself.  We look forward to hearing from YOU!!!!!  


Thanks!!!

Title: Join Mobile Mini as a CLASS A CDL DRIVER- $3,000 SIGN ON BONUS
Description:
The Truck Driver role is the linchpin of Mobile Mini.  You are the eyes, ears and feet of our business; connecting operations and sales to provide the best service to our customers.
 
As a Mobile Mini Driver you will:
-Deliver all portable storage containers to local customers (not an "over-the-road" Driver structure)
-Interact with our customers building relationships throughout your territory
-Work with our internal office and yard staff
 
From the moment you're hired, you'll know you're on the team because Mobile Mini will invest in you. Our Drivers experience 2-3 weeks of training depending on your experience and retention level. After that, you'll continue to get training and support from other Mobile Mini employees including weekly safety trainings.
 
Working at Mobile Mini provides opportunities for advancement. Many of our Drivers have moved up to Lead Drivers, Lead Yard Workers, Dispatch/Office Managers and some have even transitioned to our sales division!  In addition to advancement opportunities, we offer full medical, dental and vision with options of life, 401(k) and savings for all full-time employees and our Driver compensation is extremely competitive.
 
Essential Job Functions Include:
-Great with people: When you join our team, you're given the opportunity to interact with lots of customers. If you like to work with people and are skilled in relating to others, this is a great position for you!
-Skilled time-management: As a Mobile Mini Driver, you'll be in charge of your time management. We're a team-oriented company, so there will be times when you'll be asked to adjust your route or delivery schedule. Being able to adapt is a must.
-Flexible schedule: We're flexible for our customers; Drivers on our team must have the ability to be on-call nights and weekends.
-Ability to handle a physically demanding position: The Driver positions at Mobile Mini are very physically demanding. You'll be responsible for lots of heavy equipment.
 
Equipment used:
-Truck - heavy duty
-Tractor trailer both hydraulic and gas powered
-Unit trailer
-Telephone, radio, handheld dispatch equipment
-Computer
-Load pulling/load securement chains, straps, winch
 
Experience and education:
-High School Diploma or GED
-At least 21 years of age
-Valid Class A commercial vehicle operator's license (issued by one state or jurisdiction)
-3 years' CDL Class A experience OR 2 years' CDL Class A experience and a truck driving school certificate. (Prefer experience within the last 7 years).
-Class A experience during your time in the military is gladly accepted!
-6 months of Class A OR Roll-off truck experience within the last 24 months
-Valid medical certificate and is physically qualified to drive a commercial motor vehicle
-Towing experience, preferred
-Ability to read and speak English in order to speak to your team and customers, drive and understand highway traffic signs and signals, respond to official inquiries and make entries to reports and records
 
Apply with us today! 


Mobile Mini, is committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or any other protected status with respect to recruitment, hiring, promotion and other terms and conditions of employment.  Mobile Mini takes affirmative action in support of this policy to employ and advance in employment individuals who are minorities, women, disabled, and veterans. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

Title: Pool Maintenance Technician (Torrance Unified School District)
Description:
TORRANCE UNIFIED SCHOOL DISTRICT
www.governmentjobs.com/careers/tusd

FILING DATE: 
The District Classified application form, supplemental application and Los Angeles County Swimming Pool Technician Certification must be submitted to the Personnel Commission Office prior to September 5, 2017, 4:30 PM.  

SELECTION PROCEDURE:
This is an OPEN recruitment to establish an eligibility list and fill a vacancy. A permanent eligibility list will be created from this recruitment and will be used to fill permanent vacancies which may occur during the life of the eligibility list.

This position is full-time, 12 months per year. This position may be required to work a flexible schedule in summer and winter and may be required to work evenings, if necessary. 

The recruitment process will consist of a written examination, which is tentatively scheduled during the week of September 11-15, 2017, and an oral technical interview, which is tentatively scheduled during the week of September 18-22, 2017.  Qualified applicants will be notified by US mail or email.

BASIC FUNCTION: 
Under the direction of an assigned supervisor, performs skilled to semi-skilled pool maintenance duties for the District pool; independently maintains the District pool facility by performing custodial and maintenance services to the pool and equipment; ensures sanitary conditions and safety; assists the pool manager in the operations of the District pool assuring compliance of all County Health Department standards. This position may be required to work a flexible schedule in summer and winter and may be required to work evenings, if necessary. 

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: 
Any combination equivalent to: graduation from High School and two (2) years of experience performing custodial services for large facilities. Experience in pool maintenance is desirable.  

LICENSES AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS: 
Valid California driver's license. Employees in this classification must maintain insurability at the District's standard rate during the term of employment.
Must possess Los Angeles County Swimming Pool Technician Certification.

Title: EATALY JOB FAIR | HOSPITALITY PROFESSIONAL POSITIONS
Description:

Title: MIBC Instructor/MAA Instructor - PM Class
Description:
Become an Education Leader and join our team of dedicated Professionals.

North-West College is part of a stable and growing system of seven campuses in California and Nevada which is a leader in Medical Career Training since 1966.Our everyday mission is to train students in short term programs for gainful employment.

POSITION : Medical Insurance Biller and Coder Instructor / Medical Administrative Assistant Instructor

Go to website for opportunities: 

LOCATION AVAILABLE : Van Nuys

PART TIME Monday through Thursday, 6:00 p.m. to 10:00 pm. class

POSITION SUMMARY :

Plans, teaches, directs, and supervises all student learning experiences in the classroom, skills lab, and clinical areas, following the curriculum of the school approved by the Accreditation Bureau.

RESPONSIBILITY:

This is a faculty position directly reporting to the Campus Director

PERSONAL:

Willingness to provide a professional role model for students Ability to work effectively with others. Demonstrates pleasant and effective verbal and written communication. Demonstrates integrity and progressive self-improvement.

FUNCTIONS:

Teaches and implements the total curriculum, as assigned by, and under the direction and supervision of your direct supervisor.
Plans and assigns student activities in the classroom and/or clinical settings. Is instrumental in identifying individual and collective learning needs of assigned students, being cognizant of the physical, mental and emotional status of the learners.
Maintains records of student progress and performance, attendance and grades.
Prepares, administers, and grades, written and practical examinations during course of study.
Devises written lesson plans and implements them through lecture, demonstration, discussion, etc.
Discusses with students their concerns and/or problems directly or indirectly related to learning experience.
Participates in regularly scheduled meetings with Program Director or her designee.
Is responsible to assist the student to develop an understanding of values, attitudes, and ideals appropriate to the health care profession. Participates in the selection and preparation of instructional materials.
Provides a professional role model for students.

REQUIREMENTS AND EDUCATION :

3 years experience in the field as a MIBC
3 years experience in the field as a MA
High School Diploma
MIBC Certification
MA Certification
New Program Starting 09/05/2017

Title: Sr. Accountant, Rachel Roy
Description:
Job Purpose :

The Senior Accountant will act as the primary accounting liaison between the Rachel Roy team in New York and the Topson Downs headquarters in Culver City, CA. Based in Culver City, this person will ensure that all financial information and reporting is accurate and timely and will work synonymously with the Topson Downs team to develop the financial foundation to support the growth of this dynamic company. This position reports to the Accounting Manager of Topson Downs but will also work closely with the CFO, Controller and Finance Manager as a partner.

About Rachel Roy:

Rachel Roy is the founder of her eponymous brand and a tireless activist for using your voice to encourage change and design the life you want to live. The Rachel Roy brand debuted in 2004 and for over a decade has been inspiring women to lead individual and limitless lives through courage, conviction and change. In 2014, Rachel Roy joined forces with Topson Downs to create a fashion power house, and together launched the Rachel Roy ecommerce business in March 2016, with new categories including jewelry, swimwear and home products which have launched since its inception.

About Topson Downs:

Established in 1971, Topson Downs (www.topsondowns.com) has evolved into an industry leader both in the branded and private label segments of the garment business, with more than 350 associates based in Los Angeles, New York, and throughout Asia. Be it denim jeans, high-fashion tops and dresses for juniors and young women, or ground-breaking streetwear for men, we are committed to creating and producing quality garments while being socially and ethically responsible. Through our global sourcing base, we are currently producing over 50 million units per year for many of the leading retailers in all tiers of the market, with our factories being closely supervised by our Global Quality Assurance and Social Compliance teams.

Responsibilities :

    Prepare and review monthly account reconciliations and supporting schedules for the Rachel Roy entities and work with the Topson Downs team to investigate and document variances to Budget.
    Become the subject matter expert in analyzing or recording activity across all Rachel Roy entities.
    Create monthly internal management reporting using a variety of system data across both the general ledger and BI tools utilized by the company.
    Work with the Rachel Roy team and 3PL personnel to ensure that inventory movements and transactions are properly handled and accounted for.
    Ensure that all tasks and projects are being completed in a professional and timely manner.
    Prepare financial statements and the supporting schedules including the preparation of the monthly flux analysis.
    Support external auditors and other vendor requests for information.
    Review, develop and implement policies and procedures in order to ensure proper internal controls and streamlined processes are in place to maximize efficiencies.
    Coordinate resolution of accounting issues with other finance groups as well as other departments.
    Collaborate with the team on system implementations, testing and identifying process improvements.
    Prepare analysis and journal entries for nonrecurring transactions.
    Prepare reports and analysis of financial data as requested by the corporate team.
    Work with financial planning and analysis group to ensure that short and long term financial plans and forecasts properly reflect the impact of accounting policies and practices.

Qualifications:

    Must have Bachelor's degree in Finance or Accounting
    Must have 4-6 years of experience in General Accounting
    CPA certification preferred but not required
    Capability to exercise initiative and fast decision-making while being able to react with professionalism under a variety of circumstances
    Experience working with multiple business units within a company preferred
    Experience with ecommerce or startup businesses a plus
    Exposure to a variety of financial systems, especially Microsoft Dynamics AX
    Must be an expert in Microsoft Office particularly in Excel
    Must have excellent communication, interpersonal, and analytical skills and able to work with personnel of varying technical skill levels
    Must be able to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

No recruiters please.

Title: Experienced Caregivers Needed!!
Description:
Overview:

Elevate Home Health, a division of Covenant Care, is seeking an experienced Personal Caregiver.  

****IMMEDIATE NEED FOR MALE CAREGIVERS ESPECIALLY****

We are a home health service provider enhancing the continuity of care for the patients we serve.

Our services integrate professional and personal care to elevate wellness and recovery and to promote independence, all in the comfort of the patient's home.

Position Summary:

The Personal Caregiver is a paraprofessional member of the homecare team who works under the supervision of a Personal Care Manager, Registered Nurse or Social Worker and performs various personal care services as necessary to meet the patient's needs.

The Personal Caregiver should provide care necessary for each client to remain safe, comfortable and as functionally independent as possible. Assigned jobs are to be done in an efficient, reliable, cheerful and calm manner while showing respect for the wishes and living patterns of the persons being served and their families. The employee is expected to perform all of the duties related to caregiving in a home environment, and requires the knowledge and ability to perform as a health care professional.

Key Job Function:
• Responsible for observing patients, reporting these observations to the Care Manager/Supervisor and documenting observations and care performed
• Assists patients to improve in ADL's (Activities of Daily Living).
• Communicates patient's supply needs to Supervising Clinician or medical staff.
• Maintains confidentiality and does not discuss patient or patient's information outside of the Agency.

Benefits:

We reward our employees' contributions to our success by offering competitive compensation and benefits. A highlight of the many employee benefits available at Elevate Home Health includes:
• Elevate Home Health pays the majority of employee medical coverage.
• You pay less for benefits as contributions for medical, dental, and vision are pre-tax deductions.
• Company-paid time off with an increased benefit based on years of service.
• 401(k) Retirement Savings Account.
• Must have a valid High School diploma or equivalent.
• Minimum 1-year experience as a Personal Caregiver
• Empathy for the needs of the ill, injured, frail and the impaired
• Demonstrates tact, patience, and good personal hygiene
• Must pass a criminal and DMV background check
• Home health experience preferred, but not required

Title: Bilingual - Spanish Case Manager
Description:
Definition: The Case Manager provides a service to the contracted Department by handling an assigned caseload of offender's serving an alternative sentence of electronic monitoring, and is primarily responsible for the comprehensive case management and enforcement of restrictions that are ordered by the Court, Probation, Parole, or Sheriff's Department.

Salary: $12.00/hour
Full-time; Hours: Monday - Friday 0830 - 1700

Job Expectations and Essential Functions:
• Responsible for participant's program orientation. Effectively communicates the program rules, regulations and contract requirements of their sentence.
• Reviews information to determine and verify participant's identity along with residential and telephone information
• Reviews participant's financial information for fee assessment. Determines the daily rate that the participant will be responsible for paying while on the program.
• Sets the guidelines and requirements for the participant while on the Electronic Monitoring program by detailing permitted activities and setting schedule for electronic monitoring.
• Conducts weekly or bi-weekly participant compliance appointments to collect, review and interpret participant activity documentation; review participant activity reports to determine that participant is in compliance with sentencing guidelines meeting the regulations of program and sentence; collects program fees or may make adjustment to daily rate as needed; verifies and/or adjust participant activity schedule as needed; prepares reports and notices for case file and sentencing department.
• Reviews and interprets daily participant exception reports, investigating participant activity that is not in compliance with their sentence.
• Install or visually inspect electronic monitoring equipment being used by participant.
• Testify in court for participants that have not met the requirements of the program.
• Administer required drug testing
• Advise Branch Manager of participants that are not in compliance with their program requirements.
• Recommend to Department that a non-compliant participant be removed from the program.
• Maintain an auditable case file for all participants under their management.
• Enroll and educate participants on the use of the Centurion Kiosk.
• Attend Court to enroll and instruct court order participants in the Supervised Release Program.

Education:
• Bachelor's degree preferred; Associate's degree or equivalent required

Other Requirements:
• Two years experience in criminal justice or related field; education accepted in lieu of experience
• Must successfully pass criminal background investigation and drug screening
• Bilingual English/Spanish preferred

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
• Professional communication skills to communicate with members of the Department, Judges, employees, and program participants
• Ability to work in Microsoft Office applications and other windows based programs
• Bilingual English/Spanish speaking preferred but not required

Sentinel is an Equal Opportunity Employer
and an Alcohol- and Drug-Free Workplace

Title: Professional Chauffeur for High End Limousine Service
Description:
One of  Southern California's premiere Limousine companies based in the East San Fernando Valley is seeking candidates for Full Time & Part Time Chauffeur positions.

With over three decades of excellent service, our clients demand only the best and we are looking for those unique individuals who can meet and embrace that position.


Applicants must be at least 25 years old, possess a professional appearance and attitude, have a thorough knowledge of the Southern California area and be able to work flexible hours.
We are looking for PROFESSIONAL CHAUFFEURS that understand customer Service and want to give 100% professional service all of the time.
Must be fluent in English. Multi-Lingual is a plus.


Applicants must have verifiable prior "Passenger For Hire" experience within the last 3 years. As an example, that could have Chauffeur, TNC, Bus, Shuttle or Taxi experience. Roadshow experience is a plus

We do everything by the book. You are an company employee driving a company owned vehicle. You are paid hourly plus suggested discretionary gratuities on a on a payroll check (not a 1099) with all tax deductions on a weekly basis.


We operate Sedan, Limousine, SUV and Van Vehicles


Applicants that are chosen must submit to a Pre-Employment Drug & Alcohol Test and a thorough background check.


Our company has a stellar track record even in the recessionary times.



Benefits include Medical Insurance after a probationary period.


Salary is commensurate with experience.


You must posses a current CA drivers License.
Class B with  Passenger Endorsement is not mandatory but is a plus
Your DMV record should not have more than 1 point. 
We require an original "H6" DMV printout that is current within the last 30 days.


You must be extremely punctual and able to adhere to uniform dress code requirements . Must have the ability to read and interpret maps, operate GPS and follow directions.


Must have reliable transportation to and from our headquarters. Must have the ability to handle changes in scheduling, including delays and/or unexpected events.


Please do not apply if you are looking for a "Delivery Driver or Shuttle Driver". This is not that job.


E-mail your information/resume to the attached e-mail. Also please leave detailed resume information @ 818-769-3128

Title: Administrative Assistant to Catering Director
Description:
This person will report directly to Director of Catering and provide administrative support in all aspects of planning and executing meeting and events. This is a highly administrative support position, with the opportunity to eventually be responsible for and manage certain club events and meetings. 

The ideal candidate will have had prior administrative experience in the hospitality industry either at an event venue, private club or hotel, as well as prior experience in drafting and writing BEO's and an understanding of the sales process. Only candidates with this level of events experience will be called for an interview, please read job description in full before applying. 

Job responsibilities include:

Provide full administrative support for the Catering Director.

Answer the phone and obtain all necessary information and details for events.

Maintain an organized filing system both electronically and tradition.

Ensure office supplies are stocked.

Manage, Master and distribute Banquet Event Orders (BEO's) to essential departments and update accordingly when revisions are made.

Manage payment schedule.

This is not a day of event coordinator position. Currently no coordination of events is required however a knowledge of and experience with coordination can help with the understanding of the events process.

Qualifications:

Previous experience in an office environment in Event Planning/Catering within a venue, hotel or private club is mandatory. We plan over 750 events a year so high volume of events experience is ideal.

Must have the ability to work independently, producing highly detailed work with accuracy.

Must be organized, pro-active, a problem solver and maintain a professional demeanor.

Must have good communication skills using correct grammar, spelling and the ability to compose written work.

Solid computer skills and knowledge of Excel, Word and system such as Caterease, Delphi, Daylight, Salesforce, Northstar or other event management skills.

Efficient and accurate typing skills is important.

Neat and professional appearance.

Must be able to work on weekends, as the Yacht Club is opened Wednesday through Sunday. 

40 hours per week, $18.25 per hour.

Please send a resume and brief cover letter explaining why you would be a good fit for the position. Qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview, background check and drug test.

Title: Certified Nurse Assistant-  Care Center Retirement Community
Description:
POSITION: Certified Nurse Assistant

If interested to apply for this position you must fill out an application @ 1055 N. Kingsley Dr. Los Angeles CA 90029 

Front Porch is a progressive senior service system that responds to the needs of individuals within a community setting. We are a "community of communities" and the largest not-for-profit provider of retirement living and services in Southern California. Demand for the services our organization provides continues to grow vigorously with the nation's changing demographics, and the company is expanding its presence both regionally and nationally.

Kingsley Manor is a beautiful retirement community in the heart of Los Angeles. From the moment you walk inside, you'll feel the warmth and refinement of a bygone era. Our community is intimate and sophisticated -- every detail created with our residents in mind. They spend time making new friends, developing new talents, or exploring new places. Kingsley Manor is seeking to hire a Certified Nurse Assistant. 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Provides quality Customer Service efficiently to residents, families, co-workers and vendors in a manner to ensure satisfaction.

Arrives to work on time, in proper clean uniform, good personal hygiene and with nametag visible.

Uses equipment correctly and safely in performing patient/resident care.

Follows infection control techniques in performing patient/resident care.

Observes and reports signs and symptoms of changes in condition.

Exchanges information necessary for quality patient/resident care.

Prioritizes patient/resident activities based on current care needs.

Maintains all documentation as required by Federal and State regulations and Company policy.

Performs all duties in a safe and efficient manner. Wears safety equipment as required for the job. Reports any safety hazards and/or accidents to supervisor.

Follows highest standards of cleanliness.  Follows all federal, state and corporate policies, health codes and guidelines in preparation and handling of foodstuffs.

Attends all mandatory in-service meetings. Complies with all department and facilities policies and procedures. 

EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE: Current CNA certification on file.  Experience in long-term care community health, geriatric and/or rehabilitative nursing desirable. Knowledgeable in current State and Federal regulation.

If you or anyone you know is looking for a fantastic career opportunity in an energizing environment where helping others is a priority, come and fill out an application @ 1055 N. Kingsley Dr. Los Angeles CA 90029. We offer a comprehensive benefits package and paid-time off. Final candidates must successfully complete a criminal background clearance, drug screen and a pre-employment physical. 


NOTICE TO APPLICANTS
We are a drug free workplace therefore all final candidates being considered for employment must submit to and successfully complete a pre-employment drug test and physical evaluation. This evaluation will include testing for presence for selected drugs. Any candidate that refuses to take the pre-employment test will not be considered for employment with Kingsley Manor.

Title: Airline Account Manager-LAX
Description:
Pacific Aviation a Leading International Airlines Ground Handler in North America invites resumes for
Airline Account Manager for a prestigious International Airline at the LAX Airport.

Pacific Aviation is seeking a highly skilled Airline Account Manager for a leading International Airline at LAX Airport. The Airline Account Manager will manage and direct the operation and lead a team of Supervisors and Staff while coordinating with our Airline Client to meet the Service Level Agreement and provide Superior customer service. Must be decisive and able to work under demanding operational conditions.

Job Specifications and skills required:

: Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively.
: Ability to communicate effectively through oral and written means.
: Direct and coordinate activities at the airport to provide services for scheduled flight operations.
: Ability to lead a team of 70 staff and maintain good employee relations; handle employee issues   
   In an efficient and effective manner.
: Must be able to bring out the best performance in the team through employee engagement, an
  inclusive working environment and effective communication.
: Identify, develop and lead team to obtain optimum utilization of human resources to ensure the
  operation meets the Airline Service Level Agreement.
: Must have the ability to coordinate station activities and collaborate with multi-functional
  departments and agencies to ensure for a safe, efficient, on-time operation
: Experienced in planning a roster and monitoring work schedules.
: Ensure payroll, billing is prepared and submitted in a timely manner.
: Flexible to work rotating shifts including weekends and holidays.
: Must be legally authorized to work in the United States of America.
: 3 years Airline Experience preferred, of which  Minimum 2-3 years as  Airline Supervisor.

Pacific Aviation Mission-

Pacific Aviation strives to be a leader in the aviation service industry by providing personalized handling services while displaying our emphasis on safety, security and our commitment to excellence. We hire people who make us better and work to build long-term relationships. We engage and empower our people with autonomy, mastery and purpose. We value loyalty and strive to earn it. We treat each customer as if they are our only customer and tailor to their unique needs. We embrace new technology and innovation. We recognize that accuracy and efficiency make us profitable. We keep our promise.

Title: CNC Programmer/Machinist
Description:
The Pilot Group (www.the-pilot-group.com) is a small specialty engineering and R&D firm with expertise in a variety of technologies: mechanics, electro-mechanics, optics, software, dynamics, servo control, heavy machinery, instrumentation, software, and electronics. 

We need a CNC Machinist/Programmer to be the lead man in our shop, running mostly Haas equipment (HS-1, VF-3, TL-1) along with other toolroom machines.  It is all prototype work.  You'll be involved with the assembly and test of the things you make.  Mostly 3-axis, with a little 4-axis.  It has ranged from injection molds, to optical equipment, to parts for the world's largest telescopes.  Materials? Everything.

This is a small shop. You must be happy doing whatever's needed to keep things running and get things done.   You'll  have the chance to use everything you know.


Musts:
--CAM proficiency, Mastercam preferred
--Can work from solid models or hand sketches
--Happy working directly with the engineer designer
--Happy to work with very capable staff.  
--Excellent face-to-face communications
--A track record, preferably with things you can show.

Plusses:
--Fabrication, sheet metal, welding, other technical skills.
--Mechanical design
--AA or BS degree
--5 years' experience in a prototype shop
--Electrical assembly and test

As for the pay, we'll make the money right.  At a minimum, we'll be competitive.

Our recruiting process includes a one day pre-hire "trial-run" in our shop (paid, of course).  

If you fit the description, please respond with a resume. You can expect an acknowledgement e-mail, but due to the volume, we cannot respond individually to each submission.

•Paid holidays

Title: Licensed Acupuncturist - Senior Herbalists for Retail and Wholesale
Description:
Licensed Acupuncturist - Senior Herbalists for Retail and Wholesale Business

Dragon Herbs, a growing and dynamic herbal supplement company based in the Los Angeles area of California and that works directly with retail and wholesale customers, is seeking Senior Herbalists to work in our fast paced retail emporiums and occasionally in our call center. 

Senior Herbalists at Dragon Herbs assist our clientele in developing state-of-the-art health programs based on the principles of Chinese tonic herbalism. Herbalists provide information, education and consultation on the functions of a wide range of herbs, herbal formulations, superfood products and health-support products made from the finest ingredients in the world. In particular, Dragon Herbs features the premier tonic herbs from around the world. Applicants should be motivated, hard working, personable and available to work at least 36 hours per week. Many will apply, few will be selected.

Responsibilities

•	Retail Emporiums

   o	Handle customers on a one-to-one ad-hoc basis
   o	Customer service, answer basic and advanced herbal questions according to training protocols
   o	Sell dietary supplements - primarily Chinese tonic herbs and related products
   o	Provide sophisticated lifestyle coaching to a broad, eclectic clientele
   o	All sorts of retail business operations - including but not limited to: stocking, re-stocking and stocking some more; straightening up shelves, assisting handicapped people, dealing with noisy children, taking inventory, guiding newcomers, and performing opening and closing procedures
   o	Limited administrative tasks and other duties as assigned, including but not limited to, filing, typing, data entry, and general office
   o	Skill growth opportunities for those with real interest in natural health and herbal supplements. Develop true expertise in tonic herbalism.

•	Call Center

   o	Handle inbound and outbound calls in a 12 station call center. 
   o	Must answer all phone calls warmly and professionally.
   o	Order taking and order processing
   o	Customer service, answer basic and advanced herbal questions according to training protocols
   o	Limited administrative tasks and other duties as assigned, including but not limited to, filing, typing, data entry, and general office
   o	Skill growth opportunities for those with real interest in natural health and herbal supplements. Develop true expertise in tonic herbalism.

Requirements

•	Traditional Chinese Medicine training required. Only those who have completed their TCM training need apply. 
•	Knowledge and interest in Chinese herbs are a must. 
•	Interest in tonic herbalism is a must.
•	Willingness to learn the advanced nuances of tonic herbalism
•	Dedication to representing the company professionally

Title: Hollywood Club Promoters Needed!

Title: TITLE: FULL TIME RECEPTIONIST/ADMINISTRATION
Description:
Eyed LA Optometry is searching for their next talent to join the family! 

INSTRUCTIONS FOR APPLYING
Research Eyed LA: www.eyedla.com and Yelp Email ONLY (no calls to the office please) Please include:
a) Cover letter that answers all of these questions
1. If you are currently working: provide your reasons for leaving
2. Please list your entire work history 
3. Considering all the jobs you've had, which was your favorite and least favorite and why
4. What's your dream job? Even if it doesn't exist, what would it be? 
5. Tell us the last time you had an eye exam and how was your experience
b) Resume / CV / Desired Salary
d) Availability / Start Date (Saturdays are a must)

We strive to create a unique experience for each patient using education, humour and a familial connection. We believe this instils an enlightened understanding of ocular health. Often, patients are rushed through the exam process and haven't been heard or attended to in the best way possible. We feel this is where we are different: our appointments are booked each hour with the intention of a thorough assessment by the doctor and staff.  Listening to all concerns, answering questions patients never thought to ask, and leading them toward results that will resolve long standing problems.  Our team wants to deliver more than just an exam, we want to change lives by delivering the best optical experience. The eye is one of the most precious senses of the human body and attending to it is our number one priority. 
We want to attract a new member that believes in the same customer service as we do. We want hungry individuals that yearn to learn, challenge themselves each day and expect the best of themselves.  The job requires an interest in customer services, learning about eyes, styling clients with glasses and lastly learning insurance.  It's a heavy amount of work and time is precious, so please consider our offer as a long term commitment to our company. 
Don't have optical experience? Neither did some of our team when they started with Eyed LA.  Our team gets better each day by learning and teaching one another.  The opinions and creative ideas of our team are hugely valued in our company.  An interest in arts is a quality we feel brings a diverse sense of self that adds an incredible amount of value to the office.  Eyed LA has received 5 Stars (150+ Yelp reviews and counting) since its inception in the winter of 2012 and we want to continue earning our stars with you.  There are lots to learn and time is precious if this sounds like a perfect fit read instructions below to apply.

QUALIFICATIONS 
*High School Diploma required 
*1+ Year experience in retail 
*Strong Organizational, Analytical and Problem-solving skills
*Strong Multi-Tasking abilities 
*Able to handle high volume  /  high-intensity work 
*Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
*Available to work some holidays and All Saturdays (we close our office twice a year for a week for staff vacations)
*Good with people 
*Must be professional yet knows how to be silly when necessary

BONUS REQUIREMENTS
Health Insurance billing experience (EyeMed, VSP, Davis and all medical insurances)
Optical Experience (Dispensing, Measurements, Frame / Lens knowledge)
Electronic Health Records: Revolution EHR experience

Title: Machinist III
Description:
Machinist III
Temp to hire
2nd shift and 3rd shift available

We are seeking an experienced Machinist to join a large medical device company in Sylmar. 

Required Skills, Training, and Experience to Perform the Essential Functions:
•	Knowledge of manufacturing machine tooling and measuring equipment (Mills, Lathes, Mic's, Calipers, etc.)
•	Basic Shop Math and blue print reading. 
•	Minimum of 5 years' experience with operating CNC machinery and or in a machine shop environment. 
•	Understand operation of CNC machines, advanced CNC (G &M) programing code.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
•	Plans machining by studying work orders, blueprints, engineering plans, materials, specifications, orthographic drawings, reference planes, locations of surfaces, and machining parameters; interpreting geometric dimensions and tolerances (GD&T)
•	Ability to understand and write "G" CNC machine language. Complete understanding of programming using MasterCam or Esprit software.
•	Sets up mills and lathes and creates setup instructions for production use.
•	Creates tooling fixtures for prototype and futures production runs.
•	Supports Engineering with fixture design and fabrication. 
•	Work with Engineering on process improvements and new product introduction. 
•	Verifies settings by measuring positions, Inspection of first run part, sample work pieces, and submits first article to QC insuring all customer requirements are met.
•	Create and update current WI (Work Instructions) for setup and production processes.  
•	Maintains specifications by observing drilling, grooving, and cutting, including turning, facing, knurling and thread chasing operations; taking measurements; detecting malfunctions; troubleshooting processes; adjusting and reprogramming controls; sharpening and replacing worn tools; adhering to quality assurance procedures and processes.
•	Collects in process critical dimensional data insuring that all Statistical Process Control (SPC) requirements are met.
•	 Documents actions by completing daily production and quality logs.
•	Maintains safe operations by adhering to all safety procedures and regulations.
•	Identify and correct any possible safety hazards.
•	Maintains continuity among work shifts by documenting and communicating actions, irregularities, and continuing needs.
•	Maintains equipment by completing preventive maintenance requirements; following manufacturer's instructions; troubleshooting malfunctions; reports necessary repairs to direct supervisor.
•	Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading technical publications.
•	Accomplishes organization goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments. 
•	 Develops and focuses efforts toward goals and objectives that delivers tangible quality to our customers and maintain the suitability of our Quality Management System.   

Education/Experience:
High School Diploma 

Certificates and Licenses: 
5S, or Lean Manufacturing certificate (preferred). 
CNC programming, Manufacturing, Machinist certificate (preferred)

Title: Licensed Acupuncturist - Senior Herbalists for Retail and Wholesale
Description:
Licensed Acupuncturist - Senior Herbalists for Retail and Wholesale Business

Dragon Herbs, a growing and dynamic herbal supplement company based in the Los Angeles area of California and that works directly with retail and wholesale customers, is seeking Senior Herbalists to work in our fast paced retail emporiums and occasionally in our call center. 

Senior Herbalists at Dragon Herbs assist our clientele in developing state-of-the-art health programs based on the principles of Chinese tonic herbalism. Herbalists provide information, education and consultation on the functions of a wide range of herbs, herbal formulations, superfood products and health-support products made from the finest ingredients in the world. In particular, Dragon Herbs features the premier tonic herbs from around the world. Applicants should be motivated, hard working, personable and available to work at least 36 hours per week. Many will apply, few will be selected.

Responsibilities

•	Retail Emporiums

   o	Handle customers on a one-to-one ad-hoc basis
   o	Customer service, answer basic and advanced herbal questions according to training protocols
   o	Sell dietary supplements - primarily Chinese tonic herbs and related products
   o	Provide sophisticated lifestyle coaching to a broad, eclectic clientele
   o	All sorts of retail business operations - including but not limited to: stocking, re-stocking and stocking some more; straightening up shelves, assisting handicapped people, dealing with noisy children, taking inventory, guiding newcomers, and performing opening and closing procedures
   o	Limited administrative tasks and other duties as assigned, including but not limited to, filing, typing, data entry, and general office
   o	Skill growth opportunities for those with real interest in natural health and herbal supplements. Develop true expertise in tonic herbalism.

•	Call Center

   o	Handle inbound and outbound calls in a 12 station call center. 
   o	Must answer all phone calls warmly and professionally.
   o	Order taking and order processing
   o	Customer service, answer basic and advanced herbal questions according to training protocols
   o	Limited administrative tasks and other duties as assigned, including but not limited to, filing, typing, data entry, and general office
   o	Skill growth opportunities for those with real interest in natural health and herbal supplements. Develop true expertise in tonic herbalism.

Requirements

•	Traditional Chinese Medicine training required. Only those who have completed their TCM training need apply. 
•	Knowledge and interest in Chinese herbs are a must. 
•	Interest in tonic herbalism is a must.
•	Willingness to learn the advanced nuances of tonic herbalism
•	Dedication to representing the company professionally 
•	Communication skills are a must. Must be capable of communicating clearly, patiently and cheerfully with pleasant and professional attitude and etiquette
•	Passionate about providing outstanding service and building business one customer at a time.
•	People-oriented, with an ability to apply customer service approach and attitude to varying situations and personalities. Must be able to remain calm under stressful situations and with difficult customers
•	Ability to focus and multi-task in a busy environment
•	Basic computer skills such as word processing, file management, email. Ability to learn a proprietary point-of-purchase software program
•	Strict attendance requirement
•	Detail oriented
•	Team spirit a must. Can work effectively with co-workers and share ideas in a constructive and positive manner. 
•	Customer service and/or sales experience required

Hours
36 hours per week minimum. Must be able to maintain a 3 month schedule at a time. 1 year minimum commitment.  Longer commitment preferred. 

Pay
Pay will be based on skills and performance. 

Note
The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Please submit your resume with a cover letter in MS Word or PDF.  We highly recommend all applicants review the Dragon Herbs website and visit one of our Los Angeles area herbal emporiums prior to the interviews.

Title: Quality Control Specialist
Description:
Quality Control Specialist
Temp to hire
$18/hr

We are seeking a quality control specialist to join a large medical device company in Sylmar. 

Summary Description of Position:
The Quality Control Specialist is responsible for collecting and maintaining all documents necessary to define product configuration and control of manufacturing processes and company procedures that insure compliance to FDA, and ISO regulations, develop and maintain a comprehensive filing system and computer database for all documents to be retained and controlled, and develop and monitor the company training database and ensure that all users have access to the latest revision of the appropriate documentation in a timely manner.

Required Skills to Perform the Essential Functions:
•	High school diploma/equivalent (College/Tech school experience, a plus)
•	Accurately communicate ideas, facts and technical information, both written and verbal
•	Detail oriented, self-auditing and have high quality standards.
•	Able to work with a high volume of documents in a fast-paced environment.
•	Follow safety and security practices and maintain confidentiality of information.
•	Ability to apply deductive reasoning and understand complicated issues.
•	Able to assist in technical writing according to organizational standards regarding order, style, terminology and format.
•	Detailed technical experience applicable to standard Document and Data control activities in a Quality System regulated environment.
•	Working knowledge of Microsoft Office programs and the ability to use personal computers to operate company systems e.g. MS Word, Excel, Power Point, QMS software.

Desired Skills to Enhance the Position:
•	Technical Education or Training equivalent to an Associate Degree or Bachelor Degree
•	Preferred knowledge of FDA Quality System Regulation, ISO 13485, ISO 9001, 21 CFR 820 and how they impact Document Control activities.
•	Understanding of machining and assembly operations
•	Experience in using electronic Quality Management Systems (eQMS, such as uniPoint, MasterControl, or similar)
•	Ability to read blueprints
•	Knowledge of standard inspection and test equipment (e.g. Calipers, Micrometers, Height gage)
•	Understanding of Quality Methods
•	Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Training

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
•	Execute the company's document control process and assure conformance to GMP and company standard documentation practice.
•	Create, update, review, and release Standard Operating Procedures, Specifications, Protocols, Work Instructions and Forms.
•	Coordinate storage, archiving, and retrieval of documents and quality system records.
•	Contribute to maintaining Device Master Records (DMR), Device History Records (DHR), and Production Files.
•	Maintain CAPA and Complaint records and tracking systems.
•	Process Change Control Documentation.
•	Generate Non-Conforming Material Report (NCMR) when materials are observed defective and conduct proper containment.
•	Create, update and route for approval documentation as directed by the Change Control Process.
•	May assist in performing audits and responding to third party audits as required.
•	Sample and inspect raw materials, sub-assemblies and final products to approved specifications for conformance.  Inspection processes are identified as receiving, in-process, and final inspections.
•	May assist in conducting product inspections and engineering studies associated with a qualification/validation.
•	As required generate inspection records and verify information for accuracy.
•	Ensure that documents and records meet company's good documentation practices.
•	Support Quality Department in developing and optimizing systems/processes that are aligned with the overall business strategies.
•	Perform other projects and duties as assigned.

Education/Experience:
•	High school diploma or equivalent
•	High school diploma required. Some college or technical school preferred.
•	Experience with ISO 9001/ISO 13485 and/or FDA regulations preferred. ISO 13485 Auditor training desired. Lean Six Sigma Green Belt certification desired.

Computer Skills:
•	Good understanding of Excel, Word, and Outlook
•	Understanding of eQMS and MRP (such as Made-2-Manage or JD Edwards) software desired

Certificates and Licenses:
•	ASQ member is desirable but not required.

Qualified applicants please submit your resume for initial review.

Title: Part-Time Cheer Coaches & Dance Instructors Needed!!
Description:
Now hiring Dynamic, High-Energy Cheer Coaches and/or Hip-Hop Dance Instructors!

We are seeking enthusiastic candidates who have experience working with children, who have had the responsibility for motivating individuals and guiding their behavior as well as fostering a team environment.

If you have experience in cheerleading and/or hip-hop dance, an enthusiastic attitude & enjoy working with youth, please apply for this amazing part-time opportunity.

Requirements:
-	18 years of age or older
-	2-3 years' experience as a Cheer Coach and/or Hip-Hop Dance
-	Reliable transportation
-	Valid driver's license
-	Auto Insurance kept current
-	Strong interpersonal skills
-	Retail/sales experience is a plus

Attributes: 
Leader
Positive
Enthusiastic
Dependable
Punctual

Specific Locations for Cheer and/or Hip-Hop Dance: 
Covina - CHEER
El Monte - HIP-HOP DANCE

(other programs & cities available - hip-hop dance, soccer, art, basketball & self-defense/karate)

Salary: 
Great base pay PLUS equipment sales commission; paid training is provided along with a dynamic cheer curriculum.

Class Times: 
One evening a week or Saturday mornings

Please note that this is a VERY part-time position, approximately 3-6 hours per week.

How To Apply: 
Please send your resume with the specific sport and city you are interested to teach.

ABOUT US: 
Since 1987, Young Champions has taught children ages 5 to 15 various sports and recreation activities. Our goal is to enhance self-esteem, build self-confidence, foster positive socialization and promote physical fitness.  Our students learn the skills necessary to enjoy a lifetime of participation in their favorite activity. 

Though we provide lesson plans, Coaches are encouraged to use their experience to create fun-filled and engaging lessons for their students. Our sports and recreation programs are held in various community facilities throughout southern California. Students are placed in co-ed classes according to age and skill level. 

Our Cheer Program teaches cheers, chants, arm motions, jumps, dance steps and voice projection. Coaches create a fun competition routine that their students perform for parents & friends at our Cheer Competition! 

To learn more about Young Champions, please visit our website at www.youngchampionsca.com

Description:

Requirements:

Title: Tech Writer & Researcher. Recent Grad Ok. No Exp Necessary.
Description:
We're  looking for a talented writer who loves to write. We are a Technology Research company providing research products, consulting and technology news to the high-tech community, focusing on the cloud market, covering companies like Google Cloud, Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure. 

The job entails performing extensive research, analysis and writing. The content we produce for clients includes competitive intelligence reports, Power Point presentations, brochures, blog post, articles and marketing collateral. Must be able to grasp complex concepts quickly. 

This is a fantastic opportunity to get into the high tech field. We'll train from the ground up. No job experience necessary.

*Bachelors: English or Screen Writing 
*High GPA
*Copy-edit skills, fact-checking, and proofread a high volume of reports for grammatical and formatting errors

*Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Keynote, Power Point or similar program experience a plus
*Competitive salary - P/T, F/T, Contract Work, Freelance

Title: Wireless Assistant Store Manager
Description:
The primary role of the Assistant Store Manager (ASM) is managing and growing sales, while maintaining operational excellence at their assigned iMobile location. Each ASM will work within a predetermined store and will be assigned to assist the Store Manager. In addition, to increasing sales of the assigned store, each ASM will be responsible for coordinating and managing operational issues that affect sales as well as protecting all company assets.


It is expected that each ASM will spend the vast majority of their time on the floor of their assigned store. The ASM will function as a motivator in order to assist our stores in increasing sales of iMobile products. Their roles are to coordinate the stores operations (Inventory, S&R and staffing), and in their role the ASM will be responsible for achieving and maintaining a set quota and Management Based Objectives.

About us: 

Sprint Preferred Retailer committed to providing superior customer service. iMobile has store locations across 16 states and employs over 800 employees. We are looking for an Assistant Store Manager to make a positive impact in one of our locations. 


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT NOT LIMITED TO:
• Maintain a complete understanding of the wireless industry, wireless phones, rate plans, features
and services offered by Sprint
• Build long-term customer relationships through timely account management, and develop
sales prospects and referrals
• Actively work with existing customers to provide additional accessories, features and add-on's
• Participate in outside sales generation activities - flyers, events etc
• Proactively follow up with customer service
• Meet and exceed month performance quotas set for both personal and store performance
• Maintain store inventory in a secure area
• Conduct daily, weekly and monthly counts of inventory as outlined by policy
• Research inventory discrepancies immediately upon discovery
• Ensure retail displays are complete and fully stocked, as well as price tags displayed in a
clear and professional manner
• Adhere to all iMobile equipment handling procedures and/or policies
• Assist sales team in building customer base
• Coach employees to actively work with existing customers to provide additional accessories,
features and add-on's
• Ensure each employee training and development meets all corporate established deadlines
• Assist Store Manager with in store daily operations
• Reconcile and deposit all cash daily as assigned
• Adhere to all company cash handling policies
• Ensure sales floor is clean and organized
• Complete daily tasks and reports as assigned by store manager and iMobile


Compensation:
Status: Full-time, Non-Exempt
Department: Retail
Reports To: Store Manager


Assistant Store Manager
REQUIREMENTS:
• Minimum of 1 year retail experience
• High Diploma or equivalent
• Must have prior sales experience, wireless industry a plus
• Experience in an environment requiring multi-tasking
• Experience with improving customer service, educating customer on product, improving inventory system
efficiency and/or improving processes is essential
• Must be a self-starter with a "can do" attitude
• Possess a strong work ethic, enthusiastic personality, self-confidence and intelligence
• Takes direction well and is a team player
• Quick learner
• Must be able to pass background check

Title: Leasing Coordinator
Description:
The Onni Group is a leading real estate firm based in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada with offices in Toronto, Los Angeles and Chicago. This diverse company is vertically integrated with in-house departments responsible for execution of the company's activities including property development, construction and management as well as leasing, sales and marketing.

There is an exciting opportunity for a talented professional to join the Property Management team in Los Angeles as a Leasing Coordinator. Their main responsibility is to assist with the overall function of the Leasing department by coordinating leasing activities and providing support to various stakeholder.



•	Conduct market information research and analysis
•	Lease documentation preparation (LOI/OTL, lease, assignments, modifications, surrenders, renewals, etc) - commission invoices for Brokers- Office and Retail
•	Enhance in-house marketing tools and templates
•	Create and update marketing materials, brochures, tenant information packages, property hand-outs, etc)
•	Point of contact for updating commercial properties Websites and Social Media
•	Identify potential Retailers by conducting cold calls, mail drops, signage, e-blasts, etc
•	Prepare presentations, reports, documents and communications/correspondence
•	Follow-up on document submittals, as required
•	Assist with on-site tours
•	Assist in coordinating broker events
•	Attend real estate events including: ICSC and NAIOP
•	Field inquiries with potential clients/prospects
•	Liaise with other departments, such as Legal, Development, Marketing, Construction and Accounting
•	Enter, update, and verify various database information and electronic records
•	Prepare travel arrangements, organize meetings, social events and maintain calendars/schedules
•	Other duties or projects as assigned



•	Minimum College diploma/University degree (preferred) in Business Administration or related field
•	Minimum 1-2 years' experience in commercial real estate
•	Valid Driver's License with access to own vehicle
•	Proficient in MS Office (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
•	Proficient in Adobe (Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, etc)
•	Proficient in Lasso or similar CRM system (asset)
•	Strong written and verbal communication skills
•	Excellent organizational, multi-tasking and prioritizing skills
•	Ability to meet tight deadlines and to work under pressure
•	Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
•	Strong relationship-building skills, proactive and results-oriented
•	Positive attitude and willingness to learn
Please note that we offer competitive pay, a comprehensive benefit package and programs to continuously develop and recognize employees. 

All interested applicants please submit your resume and cover letter stating your salary expectations to: 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please.

Title: BUSSER Needed Now At Tao Restaurant Los Angeles
Description:
TAO Restaurant is an unparalleled Asian-inspired restaurant in the heart of Hollywood. Drawing strong inspiration from TAO Downtown in New York, TAO Los Angeles is a dynamic 300-seat restaurant and lounge, complete with four private dining rooms and a large bar. The menu, developed by Chef/Partner Ralph Scamardella, will feature a diverse selection of Asian-inspired specialties, focusing on Chinese, Japanese and Thai techniques and ingredients.

Title: Paralegal (Glendale)
Description:
Seeking paralegal for a growing, boutique Workers' Compensation defense firm in Glendale, CA, with a casual but ​diligent work atmosphere and manageable caseloads. We represent both self-insured employers and insurance companies. 

Time management, organization, analytic capabilities, multi-tasking abilities, writing skills, and interpersonal communication skills are required. 

Tasks may include coordinating medical treatment, reviewing medical records and medical billing, negotiating medical liens over the telephone​, appearing at the Workers' Compensation Appeals Board on lien issues, preparing trial exhibits, legal research, drafting memorandum or pleadings, and drafting correspondence to opposing counsel, lien claimants or clients. 

Bachelor's Degree and ABA-certified paralegal certificate are required. Workers' Compensation experience is not required, but is helpful​. Lien resolution experience is particularly helpful. 

Current position available is a full time,​ 40 hours per week position with competitive pay and comprehensive benefits. 

Please submit a resume and writing sample in pdf format. Resumes will be considered on a rolling basis.

Title: Make Money & Have Fun -- Drive With Scoobeez
Project Coordinator - Museum Exhibit / Specialty
Description:

We are involved in all stages of projects all over the world with a quality and service first attitude along with a highly creative work environment.

•	Communication- Strong written & oral communication skills with internal and external project stakeholders.  Proficiency in MS Excel, Word & PowerPoint a must, MS Project and Adobe Acrobat and Illustrator a plus.

Qualified candidates must have: 
Understanding of architectural and related construction drawings.
Working knowledge of the various components of Scenery & Exhibit Construction including materials and building techniques.
3 years' experience in the construction, exhibit, or related fields and the understanding of museum class quality standards.
Flexible attitude, able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Strong time-management skills with ability to organize details, prioritize and meet deadlines.

Additional duties may include:
Billing and financial tracking.
Review & Preparation of contract documents.
Coordination of logistical issues with clients and sub-contractors.
