Interface with job-site field superintendents, and subcontractors.
Provide support services to the project team as required such as purchasing & scheduling. 
General administrative tasks such as travel arrangements, expense reports, and meeting minutes.
Coordination of several major activities at once, while analyzing and resolving specific problems.

Please visit our website www.cinnabar.com to learn more.

Title: **Asst. Property Manager*178 Unit Apartment Complex*Full BENEFITS!!
Description:
At First Pointe Management Group (FPMG), we specialize in acquiring and developing distinctive properties. We aim to attract and reward the most talented associates in our industry. We aspire to challenge you daily and develop enduring skill sets built on core values like trust, integrity, respect and excellence. We know that every day you can make a difference in someone's life. If you are looking for a rewarding career with a proven career path, FPMG is the place for you! 

 Apply today for an Assistant Property Manager position at our 178 unit Apartment Community located in Agoura Hills, CA. 

 Assistant Property Manager Job Duties:
 Will assist in the daily property operations: Tenant Relations, Maintenance Administration, Rent Collection, Marketing/New Resident Identification and Processing, General Administration, Staff supervision, and reporting. 

 General Office Duties: Assist the manager with: maintaining occupancy and delinquency rates. Ensure the property provides an exceptional living environment for the residents. Complete all lease applications, assists in rental collection, servicing of appropriate notices regarding rent increases, delinquent rents, and other lease infractions. Perform apartment move-in and move-out inspections as scheduled. Greet prospective tenants and tour available units when necessary. Maintain traffic reports and following up on all prospects. Help participate in resident functions. Maintains and enforce guidelines for Fair Housing Act. Update reports for manager as required. Supervise leasing and maintenance staff in the absence of property manager. Perform routine physical inspection of property to report any service needed to maintenance staff.

 Leasing: Maintain knowledge of available rental units. Taking prospective tenants on tours of the model/community. Following up on leads through telephone inquiries and guest cards. Preparing market reports for comps within the area and make recommendations. Being able to physically shop the market and know the current "specials" of competitive properties. Prepare weekly traffic/renewal status reports. Assist leasing consultants with: training, motivating, role playing and leasing when needed.

 Job Requirements:
 1-2 years of prior experience in an assistant manager in an apartment community(100 Units Plus).
 Computer knowledge with the following software: MS Office. Yardi, Yieldstar and Pop Card. 
 High School diploma is required.
 Knowledge of Fair Housing rules and regulations.
 Ability to be assertive and possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
 Ability to project a professional appearance at all times.
 Must have a reliable automobile, insurance, and good driving record.

 About the role: 
 Schedule: Tuesday-Saturday from 9am to 6pm
 Location: Agoura Hills, CA
 Compensation: Competitive salary range
Benefits: Full benefits package and free on site apartment

 What's in it for YOU?
 We offer competitive compensation and excellent benefits including: * Medical, Dental, Vision * 401(k) plan * Life and Long Term Disability Insurance * Paid time off and holidays*Personal and Professional Development Opportunities* Tuition Reimbursement*

 Apply today! Please submit your online application through this link:

Title: Behavior Therapist (ABA)
Description:
Here at California Behavioral Treatment Center, we believe that each human being is unique. Therefore, we design our treatment programs based on each individual's needs. 
At CBTC we are positive that a treatment plan works to the fullest of its potential when it takes into consideration the child's cultural background, traditions, language spoken at home, and personal likes and dislikes. Our team of professionals are devoted to making a difference in each child's life by facilitating children to communicate, play, and socially interact with adults and peers.

Requirements: 
•	Minimum of 6 months of experience in ABA working in-home (direct) and/or BA in Psychology or related subjects
•	Reliable transportation
•	Proof of auto insurance
•	Must pass TB test
•	Must pass criminal background check
Bilingual is a plus (Spanish)

We offer:
•	Competitive pay based on experience and number of units in ABA coursework
•	Comprehensive initial & ongoing paid training
•	Regular training, support, and mentorship by Supervisors
•	Excellent opportunities for advancement
•	BCBA supervision hours
•	Paid mileage from client to client

Title: Hiring FT/PT Teacher for Preschool
Description:
We are looking to hire experienced teachers and teachers aid for Valley Nursery School in the heart of Van Nuys. We offer childcare and preschool education for infants to five year-olds. Since 1991, we have made it a mission to provide an environment that encourages our children's cognitive, social, emotional and physical growth at their own pace. We are looking for bright, vibrant, energetic, sympathetic and patient team players to join our team!

We are looking to fill several positions - full time teacher, full time teachers aid, and part time teachers aid. 

To qualify for full time teacher:
- must have at least one year experience working with children or in a school/classroom setting
- must have bachelors degree in related field
- must be able to work in the states (we do not sponsor)
- must be able to pass fingerprinting and background check
Compensation DOE.

To qualify for full time teachers aid/part time teachers aid:
- must have at least one year experience working with children or in a school/classroom setting
- must have high school diploma
- must be able to work in the states (we do not sponsor)
- must be able to pass fingerprinting and background check
 Compensation DOE. 

Please email over cover letter and resume. 
Applicants without a cover letter will not be considered.

Title: Certified Massage Therapist - West Hollywood
Description:
Massage Therapist - 


The NOW, a new concept in massage boutique, has quickly become LA's hottest new wellness destination. With locations in West Hollywood, Santa Monica, Silver Lake and, opening in April 2017, Studio City, The NOW has officially changed the game in the massage space.

The NOW offers a luxury service in a convenient, accessible way. Whether a guest comes in for a 25-minute massage after a long day or an 80-minute massage to nourish their soul, The NOW's thoughtfully selected and highly trained massage therapists strive to ensure all guests leave feeling rested and recharged.

Do you believe the power of touch can inspire?
Do you believe the power of touch can transform?
If you do, The NOW wants you.

With our rapid growth and expansion, The NOW is actively seeking qualified Massage Therapists to meet the ever increasing demand at all of our locations. Join our talented team of Massage Therapists and watch your career grow.


Job Description:

-	Certified Massage Therapist to provide therapeutic massage through a variety of trained modalities
-	Maintain service room to standards. All supplies and clean, crisp linens supplied
-	Full-Time and Part-Time positions available

Position Requirements:

-	CAMTC certification. Must present certificate during interview process
-	Proof of liability insurance
-	Knowledge of Swedish and Deep Tissue Massage required
-	Knowledge of other various modalities (Pre-natal, Sports, Stretching Techniques, etc.)
-	Understands and believes in the healing benefits of massage therapy
-	Excellent guest service skills
-	Dedicated professional that is motivated and has a great positive attitude
-	Must be able to work at least one weekend shift (Fridays counted as weekend shift.)

Benefits:

-	Steady clientele
-	Flexible schedule
-	Monetary incentives and bonuses
-	A positive and supportive work environment 
-	No down-time side work required
-	Premium Time pay rates for qualifying shifts
-	Team member discounts
-	Career growth opportunities
-	An environment where diversity is celebrated


Please, reply with your resume and cover letter along with your preferred work location.

For additional information visit www.TheNowMassage.com


At The NOW, we believe you are the master of your own destiny. 
Be Brave.
Be Authentic.
Be YOU.

Title: Development Coordinator
Description:
The Onni Group is a leading real estate firm based in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada with offices in Toronto, Los Angeles and Chicago. This diverse company is vertically integrated with in-house departments responsible for execution of the company's activities including property development, construction and management as well as leasing, sales and marketing.

There is an exciting opportunity for a talented professional to join the development team in  as a . The ideal candidate is enthusiastic, self-motivated and detail-oriented with strong initiative and an ability to effectively communicate with a wide variety of constituents; and has proven capabilities in multi-tasking, problem solving and prioritizing workloads.



•	Assist Managers in several real estate development projects using outside consultants and supporting development staff 
•	Assist in negotiations for land/zoning approvals with local approving authorities and for agreements with outside Consultants
•	Effectively control project costs through the use of job cost reports 
•	Complete land development projects on time and on budget 
•	Maintain an ongoing working knowledge of local land acquisition markets 
•	Maintain an in-depth knowledge of current market prices in relevant municipalities
•	Participate in the sales and marketing initiatives throughout the development process
•	Support Development team as necessary



•	Degree in Urban Planning, Architecture, or Real Estate 
•	Some experience in the analysis, acquisition, entitlement, development and marketing of residential land is an asset
•	Experience in the residential real estate industry, in particular multi-family residential and mixed-use projects in the in Los Angeles is an asset
•	An understanding of and familiarity with the planning and engineering approval process
•	Understanding of budgeting, cash flows and financial analysis for real estate 
•	Education and/or background in urban planning or architecture is an asset 
•	Knowing your way around a construction site as well as financial statements is essential
•	Experience in reading and understanding consultant's drawings (architectural, landscape, mechanical, electrical, etc.) is an asset


Please note that we offer competitive pay, a comprehensive benefit package and programs to continuously develop and recognize employees.  

All interest applicants please submit your cover letter and resume with salary expectations to: 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please.

Title: HELP OUR DOCTORS SAVE LIVES ACROSS THE WORLD & EARN $12-$16/hour
Room Attendant- Le Meridien Delfina
Description:
Position Title: Room Attendant 
Department: Housekeeping 

Company Overview:
Picturesquely located in one of the most desirable areas in Southern California, the Viceroy Santa Monica Hotel fuses classic sophistication and contemporary chic. Located just steps from the city's distinctive boutiques, restaurants and beach activities, Viceroy Santa Monica offers advanced service in a most unique setting.

Title: Harley-Davidson Service Writer
Description:
Antelope Valley Harley-Davison is currently searching Great Service Writer. 
Service Writer Summary Description
Intakes customer vehicles, help identify and communicate problems and service needs, schedules work, assigns jobs to service technicians as needed. Communicates job status to customer, follows up after pickup to assure customer satisfaction.

1)	Service Department Operations
	•	Assist Service department manager in maintaining a smooth running efficient service department with a high degree of customer satisfaction.
•	Schedule repairs into Talon as per Service Managers guidelines.
•	Communicate problems accurately, and clearly describe them on the repair order.
•	Estimate costs and completion times at point of sale. Clearly communicate them to customer. 
•	Assist in job assignment to technicians based on skill level and current resource utilization.
•	Review work-in-progress to ensure quality and timeliness and notify service manager and/or customer if promised time will be unmet.
•	Determine correct part numbers on repair orders and assist the parts department with picking and posting of parts before job starts and review before close out.
•	Perform accurate cashiering functions.
•	Make estimates for internal and wreck repairs.
•	Open & close all customer paid, warranty, and internal repair orders.
•	Check for open safety campaigns and warranty expiration date every time a bike is written up. 
•	Follow procedures for quick and efficient handling of warranty items, including and proper storage of these items.
•	Call ESP for authorization of repairs prior to repairs being performed.
•	Become familiar and efficient with all phases of the computer system required for service and parts management.
•	Assist in identifying and surveillance of potential shoplifting / security issues both internal and external.

2)	Customer Service
	•	Provide superior customer service to both internal and external customers
•	Acknowledge, greet customers immediately, in a courteous and friendly manner. 
•	Handle telephone transactions quickly, and courteously. 
•	Promptly notify customers of any changes, delays, or additional work needed before they call to check on bike.
•	Assist in maintaining above average CXI scores.
•	Track bikes from time of write up until time of completion and personally check on any delayed repair regularly (what part are we waiting for and get B.O. release date, etc.).
•	Follow up with customer after pickup, especially after difficult repair experience.  
•	Up-Sell additional services by pointing out service specials and/or additional work needed that would benefit the customer.
•	Handle customer complaints reasonably, showing empathy and a positive attitude, and demonstrate our commitment to "Make Things Right".
•	Give special attention to repeat repairs to ensure the situation is corrected. 
•	Avoid making commitments which cannot (or likely will not) be met. Set customers' expectations to a level where they will likely be met.

 
3)  Qualifications & Job Requirements
•	Superior communication and customer service skills.
•	Ability to get along with a broad customer base.
•	Knowledge and experience with servicing Harley-Davidson motorcycles, and other products sold by the dealership, or the demonstrated ability to quickly learn them.
•	Experience with point-of-sale and Parts and Service management computer software or the ability to quickly learn due to general knowledge and experience with computers. 
•	Current, valid motorcycle license desirable.


Pay and Benefits based on experience
•	Hourly plus commission pay
•	Medical, Dental, Vision insurance
•	Life insurance
•	401k Plan
•	Vacation pay

Please reply with resume DO NOT APPLY IF NOT QUALIFIED!

Title: PRODUCTION LEAD (PET FOOD MANUFACTURING)
Description:
Lotus Natural Food for Pets is a privately held canning pet food manufacturer who uses state of the art technologies for a premium brand cat and dog food product. 

POSITION OVERVIEW
We are looking for a Production Lead to oversee and participate in the daily activities of the entire operation of the facility including the batch creating, meat preparation, filling, cooking, labeling and cleaning of the facility.  Based upon the production schedule, the Production Lead determines the staffing needs, the organization of the positions, the direct oversight of activities, and direct follow up of all tasks completed by the workforce.

The ideal candidate can champion, coach, and motivate team members. is able to learn new tasks quickly.

The position is normally a day shift position but there may be some occasions where the position is required to work an afternoon shift.  The ideal candidate must have the ability to work any shift to help cover operational needs when necessary.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
•	Providing direction and management of team members
•	Establishing objectives, work plans, schedules, and ensures resources are available for completion of all necessary activities
•	Training of new hires, temps, and retraining for safety and work positions when required
•	Directly assisting in the meat preparation activities by helping grind, load, cook, and shred the meat
•	Completing all necessary production records and verify the accuracy of the reported information 
•	Completing the Master Sanitation Schedule assigned tasks sheets and review of those activities
•	Participating in the department strategic planning process develops long-term plans and ensures appropriate skills are  available when needed
•	Evaluating and analyzing current work methods to foster continuous improvement.
•	Providing technical direction as required for the operations
•	Evaluating work procedures to make sure actual activities match written procedure and when not in compliance takes necessary steps to correct
•	Developing and implementing new processes/procedures as needed
•	Documenting variances according to established metrics
•	Performing all other duties as assigned

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
•	5 years food processing experience
•	2 years in a lead role in a food facility
•	Canning seamer experience required
•	General mechanical ability is required
•	Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating, and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals   written in English
•	Ability to write routine reports and correspondence in English
•	Basic math skills including the ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.
•	Good attendance and safety record

DESIRED SKILLS
•	Trade School Graduate
•	Fluency in Spanish

Centinela Feed and Pet Supplies is a Drug Free Workplace.

Title: $5,000.00 Signing Bonus
Description:
If you have a relationship with existing businesses, small or large, we can save the merchant money and make you money. There are no quotas or minimum performance levels when joining our team. No stress, no pressure, no sales managers. For as long as the merchant processes with our company we will send you a monthly residual check for the lifetime of the account.

We offer the industry's highest splits, commission, and bonuses! For those who are experienced in Merchant Services, we invite you to place one account and see what the residual income pays. You will be pleasantly surprised. Professional sales reps with no merchant services experience can make large continuing lifetime income by utilizing their business contacts to obtain a recent credit card processing statement. Our staff will do a free one page comparison for you, and if you like us to, we will help you present the savings proposal that will show exactly how much we can save the merchant. It will save your network contact money, and make you continuing lifetime income for as long as the business continues to process with us.

Here are some of the highlights:

$5,000.00 Signing Bonus for 25 approved and installed accounts!

Free training and support
Work from home
Be your own boss
Residuals
Commissions
Bonuses

We have reps who have only submitted one deal and receive a monthly check for $750 per month simply because they knew the right person at a certain business.

**NOTE: If you have an existing portfolio of business that would benefit by moving it to a lower Schedule A. We have program for you, we are your new home!

We also offer multiple revenue commission streams to our agents including the following:

Cash Advances (For processing and non-processing merchants)

Hard Money Loans

Hardware and Office equipment leasing (ApplePay Contactless Terminals)

Payroll Services

POS Systems including The Clover System (ApplePay Contactless Technology Included)




If you would like more information please call 323.400.4034 or email us your resume.

-    Based on experience and Qualifications

Title: $19/hr - CDL Driver - Local Class A Truck Driver
Pediatric - Medical Assistant - Van Nuys
Description:
Eisner Health is looking to fill a Medical Assistant position in the PEDIATRICS department. Under the direction of the department supervisor, this position preforms assigned functions for continuity of patient care and efficient patient flow. Need to maintain a high quality of patient care.

Job Description:

Performs any combination of the following duties under the direction of the physician or health care provider to assist in examination and treatments of patients: interview patients, measure vital signs, such as pulse rate temp. blood pressure, weight, height, and record information accurately and timely in chart. Prepare treatment rooms for examination of patients. Provides information regarding medical treatment and/or services to be offered during the visit and explains them to the patients/parent. Thoroughly completes appropriate forms as per the visit type.

Qualifications and education requirements:

High school graduate or equivalency.
MUST possess current CPR certification.
Certification as a Medical Assistant in the State of California.
Certification through the California Family Health Council (CFHC) Basic Health Worker course, recommended
BILINGUAL IN ENGLISH/SPANISH
AT LEAST 2 YEARS EXPERIENCE as a medical assistant in an outpatient clinic for Pediatric and adolescent patients.

Preferred skills:

Must have genuine desire to work with children.
Possess the ability to work in a fast paced, high volume community clinic environment.
Experience and knowledge of CHDP  requirements, will be required to attend CHDP training as mandated by the program.
Must be familiar with preforming Snellen and Audiometric hearing tests.
Will be required to attend training held by the CAIR ( California Immunization Registry of LA and OC) program in order to provide parents with accurate immunization information at every office visit.
Must be able to read and interpret an immunization record.
Must prepare and administer immunizations as per the AAP Standards of Immunization and as required by the California Immunization Registry.
Must be familiar with the Vaccination schedule for children, and have some knowledge of VFC (Vaccines for Children) program.
Must demonstrate the ability to initiate standing orders as per written guidelines in the department.
Possess the ability and flexibility to function in all positions of the department (Vaccines/Discharge/Float).

Title: Property Management Company seeking Real Estate Agent
Description:
Thank you for your interest in our continued expansion at Utopia Management, Southern California's quality management company since 1994. Utopia manages a wide variety of rental property throughout the state in single-family homes, individual condos, apartment communities, office buildings, industrial buildings, commercial centers and accounting for home owners associations. This is a great opportunity to build a steady stream of income through Property Management while continuing to sell Real Estate. We are providing a propriety marketing strategy and resources to grow and outperform your local competition. , your responsibilities will be to develop and land new property management accounts, provide quality customer service to owners and tenants (maintenance solutions, explaining statements, attend showings, respond to rental inquires and qualify screening), strong lease enforcement and are available to meet Owner's on their schedule. Our clients choose Utopia because they feel confident that their properties and tenants are getting the support that is needed.   This position reports to the Regional Business Development Manager while also getting assistance from various other departments throughout the Utopia organization.   

 

Job Summary   
* Replies to new business inquiries within minutes of inquiry and provides an outline of services whether in person or phone that will generate a Management Agreement  
* Coordinates and communicates with future, current and past tenants   

Job Qualifications   
*   
* Second source of income
* Lives within a 30 minute drive of Culver City  
* Have  in their schedule to meet with new owners when they are available  
* Reliable transportation  
* Knowledge in Microsoft Outlook and Office programs  
* Organized, collaborative and multi- tasking  
* Excellent verbal and written communication   
* Professional service orientation with positive attitude  
* Active listening, patience, understanding and compassionate

Title: Friendly, warm, experienced PART TIME PET GROOMER needed!
Description:
Paws and Effect Pet Spa is a high end pet spa in Santa Monica CA. This PART TIME JOB is in a fantastic environment in a beautiful and unique shop with retail too (Paws-Effect.com), in a state of the art facility with all new equipment and supplies. Opportunity for professional growth and continuing education. If you work for a chain like Healthy Spot or Petsmart, but you're upset because they don't prioritize the health, comfort and beauty of the dog, you need to come work for us! We'll provide everything except your personal tools. 

YOU are. . . an experienced groomer with style! You have a professional attitude and appearance, and great communication skills. You're a team player who will pitch in, do it all, be willing learn new techniques, can work independently and lift 50 lbs. You have experience in styling all dog breeds. Cats and creative skills are a plus. Contact us ASAP and we'll set up a time for a demo session. We'll pay for your time and check your references. You'll receive a highly competitive wage, generous commission plus tips. HOURS ARE 9AM-5PM Fridays and Saturdays, plus one or two more days Tues-Thurs.

Title: Collections Specialist
Description:
The primary collector of 1,000+ overdue domestic and international corporate accounts will contact customers to determine reasons for overdue payments. Exceptional communications skills are required as dispute resolution, billing adjustments and interaction with internal and external clients are essential elements to this role.
Job Duties:
•	Notifying customers of delinquent accounts, email/fax/mail copies of invoices and sending statements to customers
•	Dispute resolution, billing adjustments and interaction with the sales team to resolve issues
•	Work with entire department to assure consistent application of credit and collection policies and procedures
•	Assist other staff members as needed or assigned by the department supervisor

Job Requirements and Experience:
•	2 - 4 years corporate collections experience.
•	Excellent customer service and problem solving skills.
•	Solid verbal, written, interpersonal, analytical and negotiation skills.
•	Excellent presentation and organizational skills.
•	Knowledge of credit reporting and collection practices and principles.
•	Proficiency with MS Word, Excel, Outlook.
•	Experience with Oracle Financials software is desired.


j2 Cloud Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer. 


Founded in 1995, j2 Cloud Services (NASDAQ:JCOM) is an award winning, leading provider of Internet services through its two divisions: Business Cloud Services and Digital Media. 
The Business Cloud Services Division offers Internet fax, virtual phone, hosted email, email marketing, online backup, unified communications and CRM solutions. It markets its services principally under the brand names eFax®, eVoice®, FuseMail®, Campaigner®, KeepItSafe® and Onebox® and operates a messaging network spanning 49 countries on six continents. 
The Digital Media Division, created with j2 Cloud Services' November 2012 acquisition of Ziff Davis, Inc.

Description:
California Speech Pathologist License 
Join Carousel School and help make a difference working with children ages birth to 18 years old (some flexibility with caseload variety, depending on experience). Title: Offering Competitive pay for Butcher Clerk
Description:
We are looking for the following qualifications:











Belcampo is a lot of things: a farm, a processing plant, a neighborhood butcher shop and a restaurant. What unites everything we do is our singular commitment to provide you with delicious, organic, and humane meat you can feel good about buying and eating. 





We offer the following benefits to all of our employees:

Title: Hiring Meat Cutter / Butcher as Independent Contractor
Description:
Gus's World Famous Fried Chicken is hiring a Butcher to trim cases of 8-piece pre-cut chicken (12 heads per case).

The butcher would have the option to work at either one OR both our Los Angeles area locations:

1262 Crenshaw Blvd, Los Angles 90019 (Mid-City)

509 S. Glenoaks Blvd, Burbank 91502 (The Valley)

Drive time between the two locations is about 30 minutes.

Significant prior kitchen/butchering experience with superior knife skills is a requirement. We kindly ask that the
position not be applied for if lacking the necessary experience and skillset.

The candidate must be a U.S. citizen with a valid taxpayer ID # (Social Security Number).

The candidate should have a valid driver's license and a dependable vehicle.

Compensation would be $3/case processed. An average, lesser-experienced prep cook is able to process 5 cases in
an hour (compensation of $15/hour). An experienced chicken cutter can process 8 cases in an hour (compensation
of $24/hour).

For the 2 locations, we process roughly 200 cases a week. Therefore, weekly compensation would be approximately
$600/week ($31,000/year). The expected time to complete one week's amount of work would be between 25 and 40
hours and would include 3 - 4 days of work on site depending on the butcher's speed. The amount of cases, hours
and compensation will increase as we open new locations (likely 75-100 cases per new location).

As this is 1099 independent contractor position, there would be no tax withholdings. Payments will be made weekly.
You are free to deduct any personal expenses for your own tax purposes (mileage, tools, apparel, etc). You would
also have the flexibility to set your own hours within reason.

This is a unique opportunity to grow with us as we expand our brand across Southern California and increase our
chicken case volume!

If interested, please send a resume or description of your background to Octavio at gfcmidcity@gmail.com with the subject heading "Butcher". Please let us know if you are interested in servicing one or both of our locations.
Qualified candidates will be invited to come in for an interview and a brief tryout using actual chicken cases.

Compensation:
Estimated at $20/hour, depending on cutting and processing

Title: Practice Manager for Integrative Medical Center
Description:
Practice Manager For Integrative Medical Center 

Rapidly growing Functional and Integrative Medical clinic is seeking a highly motivated and skilled person to oversee and facilitate the growth and expansion of both our patient volume and number of providers. 
 This position will  grow in complexity and responsibility as the practice grows. 

This person will be responsible for leading the office team in its expansion of a nationally recognized center for excellence and innovation in modern medicine.

About Us: 

Founded in 2013 by board-certified family medicine physician, Dr. Dawn DeSylvia, Whole Life Health MD is an integrative functional medical center that combines global innovations, wisdom, and sound science to provide a unique and effective model of patient-centered care.
 
Guided by up-to-date science and innovations in evidenced based medicine from around the world,  we work to uncover our patient's innate and unique information for healing in order to address root causes and implement the most effective treatments.  

It is our mission to redefine the standard of modern medical care,
bridging wisdom of the past with innovations of the future.

The Ideal Candidate is: 

Highly organized and skilled at multi-tasking. 
Committed and passionate about health, the company's mission and it's success. 
High E.Q. with strong interpersonal skills both in managing staff and patient relations and interactions.
Ability to  identify operational challenges and implement solutions.
 Dedicated to fostering  consistent growth by evaluating the practice, its goals, and outcome measures.
Ability to provide strong team leadership with a willingness to jump in and help out when needed.

Office Management
●	Day to day oversight of office staff and patient interaction creating a smooth and seamless patient experience 
●	Financial and organizational skills with experience and knowledge in QuickBooks
●	Software management: Ability to learn new computer software as well as ability to assess and seek out new software programs that could better serve the office
●	Responsible for knowing all office policies and procedures and ensuring that each staff member is held accountable to those procedures
●	Awareness of laws and guidelines governing medical practice - and or willingness to learn 
●	Is proactive in offering solutions to increase efficiency and elevate the level of experience for the patient
●	Front Office Responsibilities- will initially train in the front in order to manage and oversee the front office. This includes answering phones, checking patients in and out, and all other front office tasks.
●	Continually learn about Integrative and functional medicine in order to explain the practice, answer patient questions when appropriate, and promote the mission of Whole Life Health MD

HR
●	Responsible for recruiting new employees, conducting interviews, and overseeing the hiring of staff
●	Conduct onboarding orientation and paperwork
●	Create team building activities and foster an environment of team efforts with incentive ideas to keep employees and subcontractors inspired and engaged 
●	Routine performance reviews
●	Hold disciplinary meetings with staff when needed
●	Conduct exit interviews and gather all necessary paperwork before leaving
●	Knowledge and understanding of inventory management
●	Work in transition of outsourcing many bookkeeping tasks to having this more in house

Title: Community Organizer
Description:
Community Organizer 

Friends of the Family is accepting exceptional resumes for the position of Community Organizer (CO), a relationship oriented, field based position that has as its primary objective to develop, build and support activities key for the Building Stronger Families (BSF) initiative. The successful candidate will possess a superior record of successful community service and engagement and the ability to organize and manage all of the work necessary for the implementation of neighborhood based parent and resident development activities. The CO will provide support for Parent Café and Parent Resource Liaison trainings and Community Events/Information Fairs.  Additionally, the CO will track and maintain reporting documentation for the BSF initiative. 

Hours: F/T; 40 hours/week (Monday - Friday; (will require some evenings and intermittent weekends)
Salary:  $ 19/hr (DOE)
Start Date:  Immediate 

Duties/Responsibilities including but not limited to:
•Coordinate trainings, gatherings and event details including venue, childcare, audio/visual, food, transportation, translation, registration, and furniture, fixtures and equipment.
•Assist with implementation of Parent Café (parent support groups)
•Develop venues for BSF Initiative activities implementation
•Assist with facilitation of community group meetings and program participant groups
•Recruit participants for program activities
•Assist with the development and design of program flyers, announcements, and award documents
•Track and maintain reporting documentation for the BSF Initiative using Excel spreadsheets, data bases, and MS Word as applicable

Required Attitude, Characteristics, Behaviors: 
This position requires a broad skill set grounded in cultural awareness, equity, human development and group dynamics including:
•The ability to build trust and assist people in managing change
•The ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships across cultural differences with public entities, businesses, community-based organizations, faith-based organ. and the general public
•The ability to  influence and motivate people to be involved 
•The ability to  nurture individuality and independent thinking among group members while simultaneously building consensus in working toward common goals

EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS: 
•A min. of 2 years experience in related field, which includes full cycle event/and or logistics coordination
•Knowledge of project management principles, practices, techniques and tools
•Must have strong oral and written English and Spanish language communication skills
•Possess the capacity and willingness to be flexible and accommodating in challenging working environ.
•Strong organizational skills with experience in scheduling and event/training coordination
•Demonstrated ability to create and produce clear, concise paper and electronic documents
•Must have a passion for  coordinating events with many moving parts, be detailed oriented, have a great sense of humor, be personable, easy to get along with, unflappable and have the desire to work tirelessly to create a fabulous outcome 
•Abundantly energetic, tireless and passionate about work in this domain 
•Ability to work indepent. and as part of a team cooperatively and cohesively with other staff members
•Must be a self starter, organized and be able to prioritize work load
•Proficiency in Word, Excel, Power Point, Access, Publisher & Outlook 
•Strong internet and search/research skills
•Must be able to lift 25 pounds. Must have a car, be able to drive, have a valid CA driver's license, and current auto insurance
•Satisfactory completion of all background screening requirements
Please submit resume to: HR Manager Please, NO CALLS.

Title: Receptionist / Collections for Printer Service Company
Description:
Receptionist / Collections for Printer Service Company

General Description: 

Providing customer service regarding collection issues, process customer refunds, process and review account adjustments, resolve client discrepancies and short payments. Responsible for monitoring and maintaining assigned accounts- Customer calls, account adjustments, small balance, write off customer reconciliations and processing credit memos. Communicating with customers on a daily basis via phone and/or email. Professional verbal communication skills are a must. It is critical in this position to be well organized and friendly with customers and suppliers. In addition, our repair technicians need to be dispatched to the proper locations within designated territories in the most time efficient manner possible.

Duties and Responsibilities:

• Accountable for reducing delinquency for assigned accounts. 
• Perform other assigned tasks and duties to support Accounts receivable
• Enlist the efforts of sales and senior management when necessary to accelerate the collections process
   •  Establish and maintain effective and cooperative working relationships with dealers and sales.
   • Heavy Collections - contacting customers to reconcile unpaid invoices. 
   • Light Reception - answering/directing phone calls to the proper department and employee
   • Placing service requests through the e-automate service console
   • Dispatch/Rerouting technicians in field, prioritizing calls 
   • Manual Closure of Service Ticket if technicians are unable to in the field
   • Invoicing closed service calls (including all inclusives, chargables etc.)
   • Entering data into e-automate relevant to customer service visits
   • Filing Service Work Orders within 24 hours of submittal from technicians
   • Communicating with supervisors to insure a productive day
   • Processes and evaluates information received
   • Follow up on accounts by phone and email
   • Maintaining customer service- responding to all customer issues
   • Responsible for receiving work orders in a timely manner
   • Checking call history information with the hand written work orders
   • Filing work orders in correct ID files
   • Filing new folders for accounts
   • Gathering information for service meetings
   • Assist service manager and field supervisor

JOB REQUIREMENTS
Knowledge, Skills & Experience Required (Essential):
   • Clear communication skills with Customers/Technicians
   • Experience in data entry
   • Ability to communicate verbally and in writing
   • Compassionate yet firm approach to customer relations and collections 
• Good time Management
• Critical Thinking skills
• Experience with computers and basic office programs

(Desirable):
• Experience in service dispatching 
• E-Automate experience 
• Prioritizing and Planning- unexpected emergencies at accounts

Tele-Sales Representatives Needed*Work From Home*
Description:
Sales Representative (Outbound Call Center) 

Please apply here: 

Job Description

Nations Info Corp is looking for an experienced Telephone Sales Representative to contact prospective new customers and explain our lead generation service to them. This position will be remote, meaning you will work from home. We are one of the largest real estate websites in the United States, and offer a popular service for Real Estate agents to generate leads from home buyers. This service includes a marketing program which generates home buyer leads and lets agents promote their listings to our millions of customers nationwide. We are seeking candidates who enjoy a fun and relaxed environment, and who will bring a positive attitude, enthusiasm, and fresh ideas to the team.

Responsibilities

Contacting prospective new customers and explaining our service to them
Providing product instruction and demo, and answering all questions regarding the products and services
Process new orders

Skills and Qualifications

California residents only please
Previous sales experience required. Telemarketing or selling over the phone is desired
Previous experience in real estate or selling to real estate professionals is a PLUS
Ability to communicate clearly and professionally, both verbally and in writing
Strong commitment to customer satisfaction
Demonstrate passion for excellence with respect to treating and caring for potential customers
Demonstrates motivation and ability to maintain a positive attitude
Takes initiative and is outgoing
Demonstrates strong presence on the telephone
Possess a strong work ethic and team player mentality
Dependability and punctuality is a must
Excellent typing, internet and computer skills

Employment Details

Headquarters: Santa Barbara, CA (Hiring for REMOTE employees)

Status: Full time

Benefits include available company sponsored 401K, with company match (after 1 year of employment)

Additional benefits include: Health, Vision and Dental Insurance, Life Insurance, Long Term Disability

Paid Time Off (on accrual basis)

Salary: Starting pay is $10.50 hourly, plus commissions and bonuses. 

If the position is offered, a mandatory back ground check will be conducted, and the final hiring determination will be made after the results have been reviewed.

About Nations Info Corp

Founded in 2005, Nations Info Corp is a leading online provider of real estate and financial information and services to consumers, investors and professionals. The company's overarching objective is to aggregate and synthesize massive amounts of data, which is otherwise difficult to find and interpret, into formats which are easy to access, use and ultimately empowering for its customers. Our goal is to present information which can help our customers make informed decisions to identify opportunities to improve their lives, protect their identity and create personal connections to enhance their businesses and personal network.

To accomplish these goals, we've grown an extraordinarily talented team and have established office locations in Westlake Village, CA and Santa Barbara, CA. We strive to hire and partner with only the best players in the industry.

Title: Touring Truck Driver Needed for Entertainment production company.
Description:
Class A (OTR) Truck Drivers for National Tours
Break the Floor Productions is one of the world's preeminent dance entertainment companies, encompassing touring theatrical productions, dance workshops, photo and video production, corporate events and apparel. With a broad range of business prospects and a reach of over 500,000 dancers annually, we are largely responsible for the transformation of dance entertainment.

Driving in the entertainment industry is extremely specialized and utilizes the best truck drivers the logistics industry has to offer. You will be part of a crew of professionals who make their living setting up the biggest and best shows in the entertainment industry. To that end, professionalism and attitude are an absolute must that need to be displayed at all times when working for Break The Floor. We only hire the best of the best, so please read the following responsibilities and requirements carefully. We are a very fast-paced group of individuals, who have a great time on the road, enjoying each others' company and taking pride in our work.

If you have worked for a dance competition or convention before, please note this in your e-mail as this is a HUGE PLUS. This is a seasonal position.

Please note: We are specifically looking for drivers living in or around Los Angeles, California. If you are interested in applying, you may need to be available for an interview at our facility in North Hollywood.

Main Job Tasks and Responsibilities
- Driving 53' tractor-trailers to all event shows across continental US.
- Assist in Load & Unload of trailer at BTFP's facilities and event venues.
- Assist in setup and breakdown of show in venue (managing local crew, staging, etc). This is usually a 6-8 hour load-in and 3-4 hour load-out in addition to driving duties. This is not required in every city, additional compensation will be given to drivers in cities where extended setup is required.
- Maintaining logbooks.
- Answering directly to Production Manager while on tour.

Requirements
- Clean MVR
- Current DOT medical card and long form
- Must pass background check
- Must be US Citizen with Passport, or have ability to obtain passport (for select tours)
- Exceptional backing skills
- Winter/mountain driving experience
- Must be able to travel 8-10 months a year
- 24/7 professional demeanor
- Team player attitude
- Ability to work long hours in high-stress theatrical production environments.

Time Commitment
We have 3 tours that run concurrently. Your exact schedule will be determined based on tour and geographic travel schedule. The approximate time commitment will be October-May. You will be flown home for major holidays that the schedule permits.

Shop Work
Prior to each tour, drivers may need to commit to 2 weeks of paid training and shop work to prepare for the tour at our production facility in North Hollywood, CA.

Compensation
*$1500/tour city (Drive, Unload/Load & Setup/Teardown)

Please email your resume & related experience with TRUCK DRIVER APPLICATION in the subject line.

Title: CENTURY CITY MALL MiDiCi The Neapolitan Pizza Company is NOW Hiring.
Description:
Thank you for your interest in becoming a part of our team at MiDiCi.

Location :
10250 Santa Monica Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90067

Everything we do is motivated by our will to make the world a friendlier place, and to serve fine authentic Neapolitan pizza. We make a continued commitment to incorporate high quality non-GMO fresh and all natural ingredients, and strive to provide organic products. We respect and value people, food, our planet, Neapolitan tradition, and we hope to spread those values with every pizza we serve. If you enjoy pizza and making new friends, we would love to hear from you!
To begin the application process, please indicate which of the below positions you're interested in being considered for.

Job Descriptions:
Dining Room
The Dining Room position is responsible for maintaining the cleanliness and organization of Front of the House areas including: Dining Room, Restrooms, Condiment Area, Patio, sidewalks, and parking lot.
Host
The Host is responsible to greet all Guest Friends as they enter the Restaurant. The Host will use MidiCi standard operating procedures to inform Guest Friends about the MidiCi Experience and guide them in their visit. The Host is also responsible to manage the waiting line, as well as assist in maintaining the cleanliness and organization of the Front of House as a secondary duty.
Pizzaiolo
The Pizzaiolo is responsible for greeting Guest Friends at the Pizza Line, explaining the process of ordering pizza, guiding the Guest Friend through the process, building the pizzas, ringing in the order accurately, and guiding the Guest Friend through the rest of the ordering process. The Pizzaiolo is also responsible for maintaining the cleanliness, organization, food quality, food safety, and food quantity, on the pizza line.
Expediter
The Expediter is responsible for monitoring the progress of Guest Friend orders as they are produced by the Heart Team Friends and to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of products to Guest Friends when those products are ready.
Specialty
The Specialty position is responsible for greeting Guest Friends at the Specialty Line, explaining the process of ordering specialty, guiding the Guest Friend through the process, building the specialty products, ringing in the order accurately, and guiding the Guest Friend through the rest of the ordering process. The Specialty position is also responsible for maintaining the cleanliness, organization, food quality, food safety, and food quantity, on the specialty line.
Quality Assurance (QA)
The Quality Assurance position (QA) is responsible to ensure the quality of all food products before they leave the Heart. The QA must know all product recipes, including finishes, and verify that all products meet standards. The QA finishes dishes as needed, as passes approved products to the Expediter.
Concierge
The concierge is responsible for ringing Guest Friend's orders, collecting payment, making change, communicating MidiCi processes to Guest Friends, up awards, and ensuring Guest Friend satisfaction at the end of the ordering process.
Barista
The Barista is responsible for greeting Guest Friends at the bar, ringing Guest Friend's orders, collecting payment, making change, communicating MidiCi processes to Guest Friends, up awards, and ensuring Guest Friend satisfaction. The Barista is also responsible for accurate pouring and sales of liquor.
Heart Runner
The Heart Runner is responsible for assisting the Heart Line positions in restocking and maintaining proper fill levels on the line. The Heart Runner also works with the Prep Team Friends to ensure product levels are maintained in the Back of House in anticipation of the line's needs. The Heart Runner is also responsible for maintaining line and prep area cleanliness and organization throughout the shift.
Dishwasher
The Dishwasher is responsible for washing all service and kitchen ware to a completely clean and sanitized level. The Dishwasher is also responsible for maintaining the dish machine area and equipment in a clean and organized manner.

No experience needed! We are here to help you and train you to become the best at what you do! However, we do need enthusiastic and inviting people that will help the customers with their full attention and care.

Additional information regarding the Team Friend experience:
What we can offer you:
• Opportunity for advancement
• Great work environment
• Flexible work schedule
• Be part of a Unique, Dynamic concept
• Full time and part time positions available

The ideal Team Friend candidate will embody the following qualities:
• Hardworking/Punctual
• Willing to learn
• Ability to work in fast paced environment
• Team player
• Smile, Positive can do spirit
• Hospitable, Friendly under fire
• Focus on Positive Guest Experience
• Good communication skills

We officially open in October but will start training in September. Full or part time shifts are available. 
Email us your resume If you don't have one, don't sweat it! Just outline your strengths and weaknesses in a paragraph. 
Let us know why you want to join our community and what kind of features and characteristics you'll bring that'll help us grow. 
we pay $11 per hour, and you'll also be able earn tips. Sign up quick before all the spots are taken!

Title: Seeking House Sitter for Teen/Pet
Description: Single father who travels for business needs sitter for teen daughter and dog, prefer female. I travel out of town usually 2-3 times per month, somewhere around 8-12 days. Some months more, some less. It would mean staying at our house (including overnight) while I am out of town) Daughter is 16 (almost 17) but very mature and old soul. She needs very little "supervision" but really just support with tasks while I am gone. She needs to be taken to and from school morning and afternoon. School is literally right around the corner, minutes away. She sometimes needs rides to activities, until she gets her license, probably in the next month or two. I need the person in this position to make dinners some nights, sometimes it's OK to just order delivery/takeout. We try to eat healthy, so knowledge of healthy cooking is a plus. I will provide groceries and pay for any takeout/delivery meals for the person we choose. The puppy gets fed 3 times daily, walked if you so desire (she likes that), but mostly is a mellow pup who sleeps quite a bit! She needs to be taken out 3 times per day to do her business in her pen in the yard. We have wireless, TV, etc., all available. It's a great gig for someone who can work from "home," not much to do each day. The puppy can be left in her crate for 2-3 hours at a time if the person we choose needs to leave and do things. It wouldn't work well for someone who needs to work for any length of time away from the daughter/puppy. Daughter is very independent and a teenager, so she likes space! Our house is very nice and has a pool. No parties, no guests. The pay rate is $50/day. I need someone who can commit to ALL the hours I need, no negotiation on that, and I want someone who is willing to commit over time. I need someone able to do this for the next year or so if it works out for us all. Please answer telling us why this works for you and why you think you would be GREAT at it. We will set a few interviews from that and decide based on that. Many thanks!

Title: Teach kids to cook after-school! (Simi Valley)
Description:
Do you like to work with kids and have a passion for Cooking?

LIFT Enrichment helps kids become smarter, healthier adults through our signature after-school classes focused on Cooking and Lego Robotics. 

We are a fast-growing company looking for all-star teachers who want to positively impact children's lives by teaching them about health, nutrition and how to cook. It's an ideal position for those who are great working with a group of kids (6-12 at one time) and appreciate part-time work opportunities.

The job as a Chef teacher is to lead students through a 1-hour after-school Cooking class. Our ideal candidate is part entertainer, who is high energy and great in front of a crowd of students, and part cook, who can lead children through a recipe. 

===================================================

- Experience working with kids, preferably in groups of 6-12 in a classroom or camp environment.
- Excellent Cook. No culinary degree required. Must be able to chop an onion, pan-fry a steak, make an omelette, bake cupcakes, etc.
- Outgoing, energetic personality
- Reliable transportation
- No criminal background
- Some heavy lifting (up to 50 lb)
- Availability in the weekday afternoons during the school year (at least 3 days a week). We assign teachers to one school each day of the week, where class is taught typically from 3:15pm-4:15pm

Compensation: $45 per 1-hour class, reflecting 2.5 hours of work including prep, teach and cleanup. Mileage reimbursement. Paid training
Work 2-5 days a week, flexible schedule 

We give you all of the cooking supplies, curriculum and a grocery store gift cards so you don't purchase groceries out of pocket.

Career Growth: Working with our company can lead to summer camp counselor work or full-time employment as a Project Manager of our clients and assisting with creating curriculum.

========================

Also check out our About page to learn more about us and our classes.

Thanks!

Title: Materials and Sampling Technician
Description:
Company Summary:
Alta Vista Solutions (AVS) is a client-centered firm focused on effectively and efficiently solving today's engineering challenges to keep projects moving forward.  Recognized in our industry for providing innovative, realistic, and practical solutions, AVS has helped owners deliver some of the world's largest and most challenging infrastructure projects.  Our team of approachable experts and meticulous technicians work diligently to advance projects without compromising quality. 

Position Summary:
Duties includes performing field and plant inspections during the production and placement of asphalt concrete, portland cement concrete, and other construction related material such as oil binder, aggregates, cements, and admixtures.  Inspectors will also visit quarries and mine pits to witness material source sampling, stockpiling and testing samples of binders, cement admixtures and other related materials.

Skills & Abilities:
•	Knowledgeable on the placement, sampling, and testing of materials used in state transportation projects. Knowledgeable of material testing requirements and QA/QC frequencies as they relate to Caltrans Special Provisions, Standard Specifications, and Construction Manual.
•	Familiarity with weighing and batching equipment.
•	Ability to interpret material test data, provide analytical determination of material acceptability, and visually recognize basic material properties throughout production and placement.
•	Ability to prepare material inspection and testing reports and back up calculations
•	Work independently, make clear recommendations, prepare concise reports/documentation, and work constructively with others.

Minimum Qualifications:
•	Have a minimum of 5 years of current experience in the inspection, sampling and testing of materials used on state transportation projects.
•	Possess current California Test Method certifications for materials typically utilized in state transportation projects including CTM 105, CTM 125, CTM 201, CTM 202, CTM216, CTM217, CTM226, CTM227, CTM231, CTM 308, CTM 309, CTM 382, CTM504, CTM518, CTM523, CTM524, CTM533, CTM539, CTM540, CTM552, CTM556, CTM 557.
•	AASHTO - T11, T27, T84, T85, T96, T166, T176, T209, T275, T308, T329 preferred
•	ACI Field - Grade 1 and ACI Aggregate - Grade 1 certifications preferred.
•	NICET Levels 1-4 - Soils, asphalt, concrete, highway, highway materials preferred.
•	Experienced in performing compaction testing and certified in Nuclear Gauge Operator Training.
•	Possess a valid California driver's licenses
•	Have the ability to lift and carry a minimum of 50 lbs.
•	Have Experience in Material Testing in a QA role for Caltrans or Local Agencies 

Other Duties:
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Title: Lactation Consultant
Description:
Eisner Health is looking to fill the position of Lactation Consultant. The Lactation Consultant is to meet the department goal and objectives, communicate regularly the Health Education Supervisor.  They are to follow the scope of practice of a lactation consultant and protocols of the organization.

Job Description:

The Lactation Consultant, is responsible for providing support for the mother-infant breastfeeding dyad.  The tasks include assessment, planning, interventions, and evaluation of lactation support and education for clients in the postpartum period at the Women's Health Center and Pediatric Department. The Lactation consultant will promote a breastfeeding friendly environment at Eisner Health.   Facilitates breastfeeding support for postpartum clients in coordination with the CPSP services at the Women's Health Center.  Conducts competency-based employee training on infant feeding appropriate to the departments practice.

Full time position.  Flexible schedule including Saturdays.

Qualifications & Education Requirements:

Certified Lactation Consultant IBCLC Preferable.

Bilingual: English/Spanish.

Certified Lactation Educator.

Medical Assistant with Lactation Consultant Certificate qualifies for this position.

Preferred skills:

Experience in lactation management.

Group facilitator skills.

Title: Project Manager In San Luis Obispo
Description:
Atascadero Glass is looking for a Project Manager at our Atascadero, CA location.

We are a time-tested company with a long history of excellence in the industry. The largest company of our kind in Central California, we consistently deliver high-quality storefront specializing only in commerical applications.  Superb craftsmanship, quality-tested products, a highly trained team, and an excellent safety record all testify to our culture of excellence. Located on the beautiful Central Coast and in the Central Valley, Atascadero Glass offers an exciting, teamwork-based workplace environment with the opportunity for personal and professional growth, where the people are what matter most. We infuse integrity, balance, and mutual respect into everything we do.

Our Project Managers play a key role in achieving our business objectives in our growing company.  They must ensure projects are profitable, safe, high quality project. The primary focus of this position is to efficiently and economically schedule and coordinate the labor, material and equipment while meeting the needs of our customers and contracts.   

To Apply - Visit our careers page on our website -- www.atascaderoglass.com

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
•	Communicate clearly, professionally and frequently with your customers looking for ways to meet or exceed their expectations - especially in the areas of scheduling, coordination, quality and safety.  
•	Procure material and rental equipment at the lowest possible cost; within the budget.  Ensure that all materials are ready when needed by the field crews.
•	Schedule field crews for the project, as required, to get the job done while staying within the labor budget.
•	Conduct internal jobsite walks on a regular basis to review safety and quality.  Communicate findings with team.  File required reports.
•	Work collaboratively and proactively with Estimating, Field Operations and Management teams.  Provide status updates and project close out reports.
•	Facilitate lessons learned and best practices.    
REQUIREMENTS
•	Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Construction Management or related field or equivalent years of experience.  
•	Prefer 3+ years of construction, engineering or trade experience.  Must include construction project management experience.  
•	Advanced knowledge of the construction trade.  
•	Must have the ability to read and interpret technical specifications and blueprints.  
•	Strong verbal and written communication skills
•	Ability to effectively communicate with GCs, Owners, Architects, Designers, and other project team members.  
•	Good time management and project organization skills are essential.  
•	Attention to detail and ability to handle and follow up on many tasks.
•	Solid computer skills including Excel, Word and CAD.
•	Requires ability to perform calculations, analyze reports, and engage in strategic and creative problem solving.  
•	Requires ability to read, write and spell in English.
•	Walking, climbing, stooping, reaching, lifting, and bending may be required.  
•	May need to lift or move up to 50 lbs. on occasion
•	May be occasionally exposed to wet, hot and/or humid conditions, rough terrain, fumes, fertilizers, fumigants, airborne particles, and noise level reaching high decibels at job sites.

 We offer competitive wages; benefits and a 401K option after eligibility requirements are met.  Position is bonus eligible.  

This description indicates the general nature and level of the qualifications and duties required of employees in this job classification, as well as the essential functions a person must be able to perform to do this job. It is not designed to be a comprehensive inventory of all duties and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Atascadero Glass is an equal opportunity employer. We hire without consideration to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status or disability

Title: Engineer II
Description:
Company Summary:
Alta Vista Solutions (AVS) is a client-centered firm focused on effectively and efficiently solving today's engineering challenges to keep projects moving forward.  Recognized in our industry for providing innovative, realistic, and practical solutions, AVS has helped owners deliver some of the world's largest and most challenging infrastructure projects.  Our team of approachable experts and meticulous technicians work diligently to advance projects without compromising quality. 

Job Summary:
Alta Vista Solutions is seeking an Engineer Level II for ongoing infrastructure projects that require a Civil engineering background.  
The ideal candidate will perform engineering assignments in project management, construction management, material engineering and material testing for transportation and other infrastructure projects; must possess a solid grasp of fundamental engineering principles and exercise sound technical judgment. Under the supervision of a Professional Engineer, this position will require solving problems of low to medium difficulties. The responsibilities will include: working with internal and external parties to plan, develop and execute engineer projects, filing, research, preparing project estimates or other reports to assess accuracy and conformance; and other duties as assigned. Results are subject to review. 
Some travel may be required.

Job Duties:
•	Preparing calculations, technical reports, estimates and proposals for review and approval by a licensed Professional Engineer
•	Develop technical writing assignments
•	Establish computer-based queries to analyze reported data
•	Responsible for creating, maintaining, and delivering database evaluation reports at all levels from executive summaries to detailed performance reports
•	Ensures projects are completed on time and within budget
•	Attend project meetings or facilitate meetings
•	Ability present in public or to assist with public presentations
•	Additional responsibilities as assigned by supervisor 

Skills & Abilities:
•	Effective written, interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to work as part of a team involving staff, clients and outside agencies
•	Collaborative approach; willingness to work as part of a team and to assist others in their work
•	Proficient using Microsoft Office (Word & Excel) and AutoCAD 
•	Strong problem-solving skills, including identifying data quality issues
•	Strong organizational skills, including an ability to prioritize activities and work with limited supervision
•	Detail minded
•	Results oriented and able to complete tasks on deadline with little supervision
•	Ability to make good decisions using sound, professional judgment

Minimum Qualifications:
•	E.I.T. Required
•	Professional Engineer (PE) or intent to become a professional engineer
•	B.S. in Civil or Mechanical Engineering Required
•	Valid Driver's License Required
•	1-3 years of professional relevant experience required; a Master's Degree in Engineering will be considered as one year
•	Experience working with a public agency preferable
•	Field experience on a construction site preferable

Other Duties:
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Title: ~~Immediate Job Openings -- Perfect for Students!~~
Description:
We are a company that likes to give recognition for hard-workers. We are filling positions in entry-level sales and customer service. If you enjoy working with others and working as a team to achieve a common goal- then we will be the perfect fit for you.


Basic responsibilities include meeting with customers one on one (either in person or virtually), demonstrating products, and writing up any orders. There is no cost to start working with our company and no experience required because we provide training.


The pay starts at $19.00 base-appt.  Let me be clear on this point: that is a flat rate, not based on sales or commissions. Some conditions apply.  Unfortunately there are no benefits as this is an entry level position.  Most people start with ZERO experience.  New team members always say our simple, fun training gives them all the confidence they need.  We look for people that want to improve their resume and communication skills, not just those who want to make money (we DO offer pay-raises for top performers).  Hours are 100% flexible: days/evenings/weekends/part time/& more.


No experience is required, but we do find that people who have experience as a server, golf caddy, cashier, hostess, salon receptionists, fast food worker, call center operator, or retail associate do well with our company. Since the position involves working with people, even if someone doesn't have any prior experience, they will gain great resume experience and build up their communication skills. 


We find it a lot easier and faster for our applicants to be scheduled over text message. So, once you fill out an application, expect a text from one of our receptionists to continue the interview process.

Title: Senior Accountant
Description:
We are searching for a Senior Accountant to add to our talented team!  We operate a hospitality company that specializes in dining establishments.

The Senior Accountant will be the central point of contact for several parties, both internal and external, including Staff Accountants, General Managers and operating partners.  Senior Accountant provides support for all accounting related activities for the Corporate Office and locations.  

Under general supervision of the Corporate Controller, the Senior Accountant is responsible for:

Specific Duties:

•	Perform all aspects of month-end close including JE's and GL  variance analysis and reconciliation
•	Balance Sheet analysis - prepare monthly account reconciliation packages with clear, detailed notes
•	Accounts Receivable
        1.	Cash posting
        2.	AR Analysis
        3.	Follow ups -effectively communicate with unit GM, Hotel, Delivery Companies  account balances, variances and specific account information 
        4.	Monthly AR reporting package to management
•	Fully cross trained with the Staff accountants
•	Assist Corporate Controller in completing the P&L and Forecast reporting packages 
•	Create desktop procedures or update existing documents for all areas of responsibility

Required Skills:

•	Excellent written and verbal communication skills, presentation skills with customer service focus
•	Ability to communicate well with employees that have different levels of accounting knowledge and skills
•	Knowledgeable of internal controls and control procedures
•	Strong analytical skills
•	Strong knowledge and experience with MS Office programs and accounting software
•	Ability to work flexible hours in order to meet various closing periods

Required Experience:

•	BA/BS in Accounting
•	3 years of general accounting and account reconciliation experience with a strong understanding of GAAP
•	CPA a plus
•	Experience with multi unit, multi state operations required
•	Hospitality or Retail industry experience a plus

Candidates with multi-unit retail or hospitality experience are encouraged to apply.

NO RECRUITERS!

EOE

Title: Accounts Payable
Description:
This position handles all accounts payable, invoicing matching, check runs, and related documentation and processes, resolving invoicing and payment discrepancies, communicating with vendors via e-mail and telephone, and creating necessary reports. 


•	Maintain Accounts Payable system by performing vendor balance and invoice audits, requesting vendor records and reconciling AP balances with the vendor records and statements. 
•	Match invoices to purchase orders and other billing documentation before inputting invoices into the SAGE ERP software program, and processing payments. 
•	Follow procedures to validate correct invoicing totals. 
•	Research billing discrepancies and escalate where appropriate.  
•	Assist in month-end closing activities. 
•	Prepare checks and vouchers, using reports to validate accuracy of payments. 
•	Post payments in appropriate accounting software and/or spreadsheet locations. 
•	Match invoices to checks, obtain all signatures for checks, distribute checks accordingly, and file paid invoices.  
•	Prepare corrections as necessary to the A/P accounting system, such as voiding checks, and correcting erroneous entries. 
•	Respond to all vendors inquiries. 
•	Maintain files for vendor Form-1099 and W-9 compliance. 
•	 Prepare year-end reports on vendor transactions to document 1099-MISC filings. 


•	Minimum High School Diploma or GED equivalent required; Associates degree or higher preferred. 
•	Minimum 1 or more years' experience performing accounting functions. 
•	Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel and other Accounting software. 
•	SAGE knowledge is a plus. 
•	Other duties as required.

Title: Project Manager/Engineer
Description:
Harder Mechanical, founded in 1934, is one of the oldest continuously operating mechanical construction companies in the United States. We are recognized as a leader in high-tech, industrial and commercial construction, successfully managing projects throughout the United States. We have been consistently ranked among the top 50 subcontractors by Engineering News Record.

Our Richmond (California), Phoenix (Arizona), Reno (Nevada), and Portland (Oregon) locations have immediate openings for Project Engineer/Project Manager. This position offers an excellent opportunity for growth. We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a professional work environment. Qualified individuals are invited to apply in confidence, include a cover letter, resume, and daytime phone number.

Responsibilities: 
This position will provide services such as planning, estimating, scheduling, and material procurement.

Respond directly to this craigslist ad to submit your resume. For more information about Harder Mechanical, please visit our website www.harder.com
