Title: Commercial Truck Sales Manager Isuzu & GMC
Description:
PROS Auto Recruiting is hiring a Commercial Truck Sales Manager on behalf of Reynolds Buick GMC in West Covina.
  
We are hiring an EXPERIENCED Commercial Truck Sales Manager to support a high volume Commercial Truck Sales Department.  We are looking for a candidate with strong Commercial Truck Management experience. General Motors and Isuzu experience a big plus. 

Reynolds Buick GMC is looking for the person who can help take the Department to the next level.

•	Do you believe that strong leadership is the best way to inspire and motivate your team?

•	Do you believe that clear, constructive and consistent communication is the best way to achieve the goals of your department and the organization?

•	Do you believe that clearly defined processes within your department, that have been shared and trained on, is the easiest way to create an effective and productive Commercial Truck Sales Department?

•	Do you believe that working as a team helps the organization achieve all of its goals and creates a positive work place environment?

If so we want to her from you!

We are looking for someone with a solid sales/management process and a stellar track record for Sales and Customer Satisfaction.
Located in West Covina, Reynolds Buick GMC is a family-owned dealership that is celebrating its 100th year in business.

We would be willing to consider a candidate that is willing to relocate to the West Covina area.

Commercial Truck Sales Manager RESPONSIBILITIES:

•	Responsible for business development, revenue generation and management of our Commercial Truck business.
•	Responsible for the sales of Fleet & Commercial Vehicles for Reynolds Buick GMC
•	Manage the entire sales process for each opportunity, including research, introduction, qualification, needs analysis, proposal generation, presentation, negotiation, order closure, order and customer satisfaction follow-up, receivables management, and account development.
•	Source and develop new sales opportunities through research, prospecting, lead follow-up, and targeted telephone and email communications
•	Research and understand potential customer's organization, key players, needs, opportunities and pain-points
•	Manage accounts and relationships for long-term business development
•	Accurately and timely utilize CRM tool (Eleads) and DMS (Auto Mate)
•	Provide feedback/input into the sales process, marketing opportunities, and inventory
•	Close sales and achieve individual/corporate revenue goals
•	Prepare contracts and oversee the purchase process to ensure customer satisfaction
•	Manage and oversee Finance and delivery paperwork
•	Oversee logistics of vehicle acquisition and delivery to customers
•	Attend business and civic functions as assigned by dealership management
•	Creating a great vehicle delivery experience for the customer
•	Gain superior product knowledge to effectively help customers
•	Transition customers to the service department to support their ownership experience

Commercial Truck Sales Manager REQUIREMENTS:

•	ISUZU and General Motors commercial truck product knowledge and sales experience a BIG PLUS
•	Previous experience as a Commercial Truck Manager with a proven track record
•	Looking for a long-term opportunity
•	Strong management and leadership skills
•	Ability to pass background and drug test
•	Commitment to the Mission and Values of Reynolds Buick GMC


Commercial Truck Sales Manager BENEFITS:

We offer full benefits after 30 days of employment

•	Medical, Dental and Vision Plan
•	401k
•	Life Insurance
•	Vacation and sick days

We offer a very competitive pay plan with salary plus commission. 

MISSION:
For over 100 years, Reynolds Buick GMC has been a family-owned dealership that has been a leader in GM regional sales.  Reynolds is dedicated to its loyal customers by focusing on the legacy of integrity and exceptional customer service.  

Equal Opportunity Employer

Title: Los Angeles Financial Representative
Description:
Who we are . . . 

Foresters Financial Services, Inc. provides everyday families and individuals with financial solutions, guidance, and tools, to meet their needs across all life stages. Our financial representatives, who are among the best trained in the business, offer personalized service combined with a solid, long-term approach and fresh thinking. 

You can also take pride in knowing that you are part of Foresters™, an international financial services provider that gives back to the community and cares deeply about family well-being. Each year Foresters organizes thousands of community activities, providing financial contributions and hands-on volunteerism in support of charitable partners that make a meaningful and lasting impact in local communities. 


What you need . . . 

• Bachelor's degree 
• Strong communication and marketing skills with the ability to work one-on-one with clients 
• The ability to plan your day and achieve goals 
• An interest in developing financial strategies and a genuine concern for the welfare of others 
• An entrepreneurial work ethic and the desire to achieve financial success 


What you will do . . . 

• Recommend solutions to your clients for their investment needs 
• Collaborate with others in developing presentations delivered in group settings or one-on-one 
• Keep in touch with clients to ensure that they have the right products for their current needs 
• Create referral opportunities and build a referral-based practice 
• Determine the course for your career in terms of financial objectives 



How we help you . . . 

Our extensive training program and state-of-the-art learning system is designed to prepare you so you are both business savvy and confident when working with your clients. You will enjoy a professional office environment with all the support and tools you need to 
be successful. 

New Representatives start out earning wages and commissions, so while you take care of your clients, we take care of you. 

Products we offer . . . 

• Mutual Funds 
• Life Insurance (Whole Life, Term Life & Variable Life) 
• Annuities 
• Retirement Vehicles 
• Education Plans 

Foresters Financial is a member of: 

• FINRA (Financial Industry Regulatory Authority) 
• ICI (Investment Company Institute) 
• ASBO (Association of School Business Officials) 
• NTSAA (National Tax Shelter Account Association) 
• PPA (American Society for Pension Professionals and Actuaries) 
• SIPC (Securities Investor Protection Corporation) 

Areas of interests that lead to success . . . 

	Finance			Financial Planner
	Sales			Customer Service
	Marketing		Customer Support
	Hospitality		Public service
	Banking			Communication
	Retail			Entrepreneurship
	Industrial			Sociology
	Military			Social worker
	Insurance			Psychology 


Foresters Financial is building a brighter future . . . one Representative at a time!



Foresters Financial™ and Foresters™ are trade names and trademarks of The Independent Order of Foresters (a fraternal benefit society) and its subsidiaries; including Foresters Financial Services, Inc. Foresters Financial Services, Inc. does not provide legal, tax or estate planning services. All investing involves risk, including the risk that you may lose money.

Title: Freelance Professional Photographer
Description:
Attention all professional photographers - Snappr is now in the greater Los Angeles area and accepting applications!

If you are passionate about creating great photographs, want to increase your experience and schedule more shoots, apply to become a Snappr freelancer today! Snappr is an on-demand professional photography marketplace. By absorbing all of the operational and marketing overhead, we'll allow you to focus on doing what you do best - taking amazing photos. 

Stop waiting around looking for jobs to appear on social media and unleash your creative potential. Our system uses your availability to automatically assign you bookings in your service area at times that best suit you. All you need to do is complete the shoot, submit the edited photos, and get paid. Photographers on our platform have earned on average $100 per hour of shoot time, but it can vary from $50-$130+ per hour, with an average booking duration of 2 hours.

Our ideal photographer:
- Is a full-time or part-time professional photographer with at least 1 year of experience
- Owns professional level equipment (DSLR camera, flash, and a range of lenses)
- Has a solid online portfolio
- Is modern, creative and on trend with their photography and editing style
- Is experienced in Adobe Lightroom
- Is highly personable and friendly
- Is able to service a range of shoot types, e.g. portraits, events, weddings, product, real estate, fashion, etc.

If this sounds like you, please complete our application by August 29 at the link below. If approved, you will be sent further details about onboarding steps, fee schedule, contract terms, etc. We look forward to connecting with you!

Title: **Human Resources Generalist**for Property Management Company
Description:
The Ezralow Company is a well-established Real Estate Development and Property Management Company located in Calabasas. We own and manage over 8,000 apartment units in the Western United States and as an employer; we believe that employees are our greatest asset!

 We are currently looking for an ambitious and experienced Senior Human Resources Generalist to work in our Calabasas Corporate Office. This is a perfect opportunity for a strong and knowledgeable candidate to take their career to the next level. Will be supporting Human Resources efforts for approximately 375 employees.

 Position Summary for HR Generalist:

 Generalist Duties: Create, develop and implement policies and procedures, monitor and ensure company compliance with changing employment laws. Process new hire and termination paperwork, COBRA administration, employee relations, worker's compensation administration, safety administration, create and update job descriptions and update records for personnel files and any other miscellaneous projects as needed.

 Payroll: Will be responsible for performing all upfront audit activities to ensure a smooth payroll process. We use APD Workforce Now Version 13. Duties include: Entering in time card edits into system, verify and approve timecards on a semi-monthly basis, as well as commissions and bonuses. Verify vacation and sick time accruals with payroll on a quarterly basis. Review payroll reports and audit allocations.

 Benefit Administration: Assist the VP of HR with the open enrollment process. Coordinate open enrollment meetings for all plans and administer employee benefits to new and existing employees. Audit benefits bills on a monthly basis to ensure accuracy.

 Recruitment: Will be responsible for all recruitment efforts for all positions: create job postings and candidate sourcing, resume review, phone screening, interviewing, applicant testing, and conducting background screening of candidates.

 Requirements for HR Generalist:
•Minimum of 5 years of past experience as a Sr HR Generalist in a company of 375 employees. Bachelor's degree is required in Business Administration, Human Resources, or Organizational Development or a related field; PHR or SPHR is required
•Must possess a high level of professionalism, the ability to communicate (written and verbal) with many levels and possess a strong work ethic.
•Must be able to work in a fast paced environment with constant competing priorities.
•Organization is vital in this role!
•Must have a working knowledge of legal issues, state/federal labor regulations, ability to create and write policies and procedures.
•Advanced computer knowledge of: MS Office Word 2016, Excel, Outlook, Publisher and Power Point. Knowledge of ADP Workforce Now is required
•Must exercise judgment and discretion involving confidential information.
•Flexibility, multitasking and organization skills are keys to the success of this position.

 We offer a competitive salary range and an excellent benefits package. If you are an ambitious, passionate team player who is committed to being the best, please submit your resume through this link:

Title: Real Estate Operations Manager for Top Producer at Top RE Firm
Description:
We are seeking a talented real estate operations coordinator who is self-reliant, self-motivated and exudes an air of diplomacy and poise. We are a high-performance team, committed to personal development and professional growth and we are looking for the right team member to join us. If you do not have a valid Real Estate License and the required relevant experience, please DO NOT apply.

Responsibilities
◦Oversees other positions on the team and delegate tasks accordingly
◦Prepares all documentation for Leases, Listings, Purchases, and Sales
◦Track team financial goals and YTD sales
◦Manage transactions in their entirety: create documents, schedule inspections, work directly with lender, escrow, and client's to manage timeline accordingly, organize files in Dropbox, follow provided checklists and update them as need be for efficiency, organize walk through(s), ensure checks are received
◦Responsible for the launch of properties: Lease or for Sale. Schedules all needed Marketing, Staging (negotiates pricing), Hand-holds client, Creates over-all schedule for the listing, monitors timeline, etc.
◦Prepare file for TC and monitor executed of disclosures
◦Upload Documents into CRM and Ensure Compliance is met to receive check
◦Knowledge of C.A.R. Forms- Purchase Contracts, Addendums, Request for Repairs, Listing Agreements, Lease Documentation
◦Knowledge of Disclosures
◦Read Inspection Reports and create a punch list for client and team members
◦Database/CRM Input and Management
◦Manage Showings for Listings/Clients
◦Set and Confirm All Appointments
◦Preps all open houses for Agents on team
◦Monitors and Updates accordingly: The organization of the team and the way it
runs. If something isn't done fast enough or well enough, your job is to figure out
how to fix that.
◦Ideally is the front runner for all clients after CEO has converted- makes sure
client's are happy
◦Responsible for setting goals and helping the team achieve them
◦Responsible for creating and implementing new strategies that improves overall
production
◦Responsible for thinking 3 steps ahead of the agent and client

Desired Experience and Qualifications:
•	Valid California Real Estate Salesperson License required.
•	BA/BS degree preferred
•	3+ years of real estate experience (writing offers, managing escrows, handling lenders)
•	Must be proficient with CAR forms, Zip Form, Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook. 
•	Comfortable using advanced search functions on MLS and managing information via CRM system
•	Strong knowledge of real estate sales practice, escrow process etc.
•	Strong oral and written communication skills, with an ability to manage expectations
•	Ability to work non-conventional hours to achieve sales goals

And...
1.	Exceptional relationship management skills
2.	Detail oriented with a proven ability to multi-task.
3.	Highly adaptable with a demonstrated ability to succeed in a dynamic environment
4.	Utilizes priority technology platform to manage leads and contracts
5.	Ensures that all required contract documents are current and accurately executed.
6.	Organizes work activities to maximize efficiency, and communicates effectively to provide clarity and set expectations.
7.	Committed to standards of the highest professionalism and ethics

If you are looking for your next best opportunity, we want to hear from you.

COMPENSATION: Base + Bonus
We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, We comply with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. The policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Title: Maintenance/Hospitality Ambassador - Downtown Santa Monica
Description:
*Like Meeting People and Interacting with the Public?*

This is a job where talking to the public is not only encouraged, but a huge part of what we do. BLOCK BY BLOCK is hiring Ambassadors for Downtown Santa Monica. What's an Ambassador? It's someone who's willing to talk to people, to take ownership in your downtown and do 'whatever it takes' to make sure our city looks great and people feel safe and welcome. 

Downtown Santa Monica's Hospitality Ambassadors are the eyes and ears of the Downtown District. They provide a welcoming smile, assisting pedestrians and motorists with a host of issues ranging from recommending a place to eat to locating a lost vehicle. Ambassadors lend a helping hand, keep sidewalks and public restrooms safe and clean, and liaise with the Santa Monica Police Department and social service agencies to address quality of life issues. 

Attention to detail defines a visitor's experience in Downtown Santa Monica. Maintenance Ambassadors sweep, scrub and pressure wash public sidewalks and parking structures, as well as remove thousands of pounds of trash and graffiti. No detail is overlooked. Attention to details and being observant is key. 

Daily duties include:
• Greeting and giving directions to visitors
• Picking up litter and debris
• Removing graffiti
• Greeting and interacting with the public
• Saying hello and offering assistance to homeless and quality of life issues
• Cleaning public restrooms, sweeping and moping 
• And doing everything with a smile and a great attitude!
• Working outside (yes, in the good and the bad weather!)

Requirements:
• Must pass a drug test
• Must pass a background check
• Must be able to stand and walk for an 8 hour shift

Now for the good stuff:
• Starting pay of $15.36 an hour
• Annual pay increase 
• Health and Dental insurance
• Life insurance
• Paid Time Off/Vacation (40 hours starting the first year)
• Birthday pay (that's right. Your birthday is a holiday around here!)
• Free uniforms
• Weekly pay
• Multiple opportunities for promotion


Full time and part time positions are available. We are a 24/7 operation and offer morning, evening and overnight shifts every day of the week. 

We look forward to hearing from you and hope to see you soon for an interview. 


For more information visit www.blockbyblock.com

To apply go to www.workwithblockbyblock.com

Title: Project Manager -- Full time
Description:
We are nonprofit organization committed to developing and managing affordable housing. We own and manage over 1,700 units of rental housing located within the City of Santa Monica. The organization is fully integrated with housing development, property management, a maintenance staff, and resident services.



Under the direction of the Director of Housing Development, the Project Manager is responsible for activities relating to a project's development from site acquisition to construction completion and conversion to permanent financing.
 


*	Predevelopment
*	Work with the Director of Housing Development to identify new properties to acquire and to perform feasibility analyses.
*	Secure acquisition/predevelopment financing and acquire land/buildings.
*	Secure development entitlements and approvals, including preparing applications and negotiating with public agencies and community groups.
*	Provide input, analysis and oversight of architects, engineers and consultants in the preparation of plans and documents. 
*      Oversee the preparation of construction bidding and contract materials. 
*	Provide input, analysis and recommendations with regards to the selection of contractors, construction managers, and other team members. 
*	Coordinate tenant relocations.
*	Financing / Closing
*	Secure commitments for construction/permanent financing, including preparing applications and coordinating the submittal of required materials. 
*	Negotiate deal terms with lenders and investors with input from the Director of Housing Development.
*	Coordinate the closing of construction financing.
*	Answer questions and resolve issues as they arise.



*	Coordinate with other departments within our organization including Property Management, Maintenance and Accounting. 
*	Monitor construction in progress, prepare payment requests, evaluate change order requests, resolve issues as they arise, and ensure compliance with various requirements. 
*	Provide updates and recommendations to management.
*	Permanent Loan Conversion
*	Ensure all requirements are met to pay-off the construction loan and convert to permanent financing.
*	Other Duties
*	Serve as a project's contact person for all entities, including local, state and federal agencies as well as various community groups. Be able to address and handle issues that arise during the process.
*      Demonstrate professionalism and leadership within company by managing projects with a consideration for all departments' needs.
*	Participate in or lead efforts to enhance use of technology, improve processes and lower risks.
*	Perform other duties as assigned.



*	Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and Word.
*	Demonstrated proficiency in real estate finance.
*	Ability to produce complex financial spreadsheets. 
*	Knowledge of affordable housing and community development programs and issues.
*	Knowledge of real estate entitlement and approval processes.
*	Understanding of urban planning concepts.
*	Understanding of construction management principals.
*	Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and ability to work within a team environment.
*	Strong analytical, mathematical, communication and organizational skills. 



Bachelor's Degree in Economics, Architecture, Public Administration or related field required.  Master's Degree in Planning, Real Estate, Business or related field preferred. Approximately 2 years of related work in real estate finance or development or other relevant work experience for real estate development.

   

This position has work direction supervisory responsibilities without performance management.



This position requires the ability to sit and use office equipment and computers for the majority of the workday.  Must be able to lift up to 10 pounds.  Must be able to drive to worksites and inspect and survey worksites.


This position works in an office environment and is also exposed to outdoor elements such as project sites.



This position requires travel within the region, including but not limited to development sites, other municipalities, consultant offices and government offices.  Infrequent travel out of state may be required.

Must have and maintain a valid driver's license and insurance as required by law.


We offer compensation based on experience. We work a 9/80 schedule with every other Friday off. Benefits include medical, dental and life insurance, as well as paid holidays, sick and 4 weeks' vacation. All new hires must successfully pass a background check.


An Equal Opportunity Employer

Title: Hostess, Server, Bus - Inn of the Seventh Ray
Description:
The Inn of the Seventh Ray has immediate openings for Hostess, Servers, Bus staff
 
The reception station is at the main entrance so you're the first impression of the customer's evening so we hire accordingly. Polished and secure without any artificially friendly attitude.  We cannot train someone to be gracious so we search for people with a naturally friendly manner and a positive sense of themselves.  Hostess and Servers should have some knowledge of healthy dining and the ability to answer questions concerning the menu or a food allergy which will get better as you learn the menu and our Mission Statement regarding food additives and using non-GMO ingredients.  
 
-Mainly evening shifts but there may be a Saturday or Sunday Brunch and you should be available on Holidays.  Shifts are sometimes traded between service staff but you will be expected to work some major holidays:  Thanksgiving, Valentine's Day, Mother's Day, Easter.  We are very busy on holidays.  That said, we are flexible and will do our best arranging the schedule to fit your needs.

Job Duties include:
-Ability to remain a calm presence in a face paced environment
-Good communication skills.  Some customers require more attention than others and you should be able to resolve little problems before they turn into big issues.
-As we are on many "Most Romantic" blogs you will often times be seating couples who have  booked dinner for a marriage proposal, or having their wedding at The Inn and are dining to taste the wedding food.  Many are couples out on their anniversary, others are celebrating a birthday.  Approx. 80% or guests are celebrating a special occasion.  Your personal greeting is at the start of their special occasion and often times a major part of the evening's memories.  
-Answering the phone: confirming or booking reservations on an iPad, giving the caller information, directions, etc.
-Learning and understanding seating table numbers and how to pace seating for the best guest experience.  Some prefer a table by the waterfall, others want a table next to the creek or in the Gazebo, or may want to be inside by the fireplace.  Many times customers didn't know the tables in a certain area look better than what they asked for on the phone.  You should be able to accommodate people's wishes without getting agitated regardless of where the seating software has assigned a reservation.
-Dining out is about customer service and we should strive to make everyone feel special and not just a number on a computer screen.
-2 years upper level dining experience is preferred but not mandatory.  Personality is mandatory.
- Polished and friendly demeanor
- Enthusiastic & Team Attitude
- Good Communication Skills
- Natural Foods background a plus
- Ability to multi-task
- Ability to be a calm presence in a fast paced environment
- Mainly evenings and some private day events
 
MUST HAVE FULL AVAILABILITY, ESPECIALLY THROUGH THE HOLIDAYS
 
-Please send us a resume and we will schedule a face-to-face interview as soon as possible.

Title: LEAD Kindergarten Teacher
Description:
** Please have experience teaching KINDERGARTEN as a LEAD TEACHER in the classroom for at least 3 years.

Position to start IMEDIATE

KINDERGARTEN TEACHER

GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The Elementary Teacher is responsible for implementing the mission and philosophy by creating a flexible elementary grade program and a class environment favorable to learning and personal growth, establishing effective rapport with students; motivating students development of skills, attitudes and knowledge needed to provide a good foundation for upper elementary grade education in accordance with each student's ability and to establish good relationships with parents and other staff members.

Elementary Teacher reports to the Elementary Director

RESPONSIBILITIES

Differentiates instruction according to student academic and development need
Creates, develops, and provides a variety of instructional materials and resources for children to explore, manipulate, and use, both in learning activities and in imaginative play based on student's passions
Creates, develops, and uses instructional material suitable for verbal and/or visual instruction of students who may be cognitively, physically or emotionally diverse
Creates an effective and educationally stimulating environment through displays of student work, bulletin boards, interest centers
The ability to follow child-initiated themes while connecting them to academic subjects and developmentally appropriate practices
Develops lessons and instructional materials and provides individualized and small group instruction in order to adapt the curriculum to the needs of each student
Guides and counsels students with adjustment or academic challenges, or special academic interests
Aware of and practices classroom management techniques required for children to achieve effective participation in all activities
Incorporates flexibility and creativity in their approach to teaching; co-learner approach
Effectively works with Specialists to provide guidance and support in regard to children's individual needs and interests
Assesses academic and social growth of students through assessments and maintains appropriate records
Creates, manages, and provides documentation narratives for each student which includes goal setting, narratives, passion projects and milestones.
Provides appropriate instruction and activities for students to meet individual needs while following school / policy goals and objectives
Plans and supervises class projects, field trips, visits by guest speakers or other experiential activities, and guide students in learning from those activities.
Communicates with parents through conferences and other means to discuss students' progress, develop and discuss individual student learning plans and interpret the school program
Identifies student needs and cooperates with other professional staff members in assessing and helping students solve health and learning problems
Maintains professional competence through pre and in-service education activities provided by the school and/or professional growth activities and courses.
Selects and requisitions instructional materials; maintains inventory records
Collaborates with other teachers and administrators in the development, evaluation, and revision of elementary school programs
Participates in Outdoor education programing for grade level (hikes)
Available to do work outside of the classroom including blogs, documentation, presentations, parent meetings, back to school night, culminations, given ample notice
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, ever-evolving environment
Performs other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in Primary Elementary Education or equivalent
Master's degree in Education desirable
Valid teacher certification preferred
Experience working in project-based/experiential learning contexts
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Must be able to sit, stand and walk for long periods of time
Physically able to reach, bend and stoop
Able to lift 25 pounds and push/pull 30 pounds
We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer committed to nondiscrimination on the bases of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender status, marital status, pregnancy, age, disability, or covered veteran status consistent with applicable federal and state laws.

Salary + Medical, Vision and Dental, 401K plan and generous holiday schedule

Description:
Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts have been ranked FORTUNE magazine's 100 Best Companies to Work For every year since 1998...come and find out why. With 101 hotels in 39 countries, Four Seasons is dedicated to perfecting the travel experience through continual innovation and the highest standards of hospitality. The deeply instilled Four Seasons culture is personified by its employees, people who share a single focus and are inspired to offer great service.

Aloha! Bordering a marine preserve perched on top a rugged red lava cliff above a white sand beach, our ocean side luxury resort in Lanai, Hawaii, will make you swoon - and the spectacular golf course with three cliff side fairways will take your breath away.

The Four Seasons Beach Resort Lanai is looking for Lana'i Travel Advisors (Resort Sales Associates) based in Los Angeles:

The Lana'i Travel Advisor sets the tone for our Guests pre-arrival and inspires the irresistible attraction to our island as a luxurious vacation destination. You will come to know Guests who are anticipating a relaxing vacation, have a specific intention for their trip, and who are adventure seekers looking to see Hawaii in a way they never have before. Lana'i Travel Advisors must make an immediate connection and provide luxury levels of personalized customer service and responsiveness.  The sole purpose of this role is to connect our prospective and return Guests with the Lana'i by Four Seasons experience so each call ends with Guests craving their next experience of a lifetime here with us.

Lana'i Travel Advisors:

•must be comfortable and excel at hospitality focused sales strategies, including high conversion of call volume
•must be able to describe our experience vividly and accurately, inspiring Guests to visit.
•will be skilled in identifying sales opportunities through gaining insight into each Guest's specific intention for their visit to Lana'i
•must be able to demonstrate the value of our experience based on specific Guest's wants, interests, and needs to reinforce that a visit to Four Seasons Resort Lana'i is the best option for them
•will consult with potential and return Guests to design an exclusive and customized package for their visit
•will capture sales from the incoming calls and coordinate details of each reservation to ensure the Guest's satisfaction
•are expected to generate a high volume of revenue through room bookings as well as itinerary planning, activities, transportation, etc...
•are assumptive closers, with a natural ability to direct the conversation and ignite curiosity and excitement around what's new and unique about our experience.

We are looking for someone who is passionate about Lana'i and helping others to Discover Lana'i by Four Seasons. You will process Guest bookings for room accommodations, spa appointments, Lana'i island adventures such as equine adventures, off-road excursions, and water activities, as well as handle other unique and sometimes complicated special arrangements via email and on the phone. Lana'i Travel Advisors will build a positive rapport that lasts beyond just the first call with Guests inquiring about our services and activities. Qualified candidates must be engaging, persuasive, and great on the phone.  You must be a strong communicator, extremely computer literate as well as creative, resourceful, dependable, and have a "solve for yes" attitude. Must be able to work extremely well according to individual sales goals as well as collaborate cross-departmentally. Must be extremely comfortable and effective in upselling and cross-selling various products. Must be able to work a flexible schedule and portray the "aloha spirit" of the Hawaiian islands. Must have impeccable attention to detail and consistent follow-through.

US work authorization is required unless candidate is currently in a managerial position at a Four Seasons location. Current Four Seasons managers may qualify for L-1 visa sponsorship."　

What we are offering as benefits:

•Excellent Training and Development opportunities
•Medical coverage
•Complimentary accommodation at other Four Seasons Hotels (based on length of service)
•Meals on duty and laundered uniform
•Employee Recognition Progams

Open Call interviews will be held on August 17 (9:00a- 2:00p) & August 18 (9:00a- 12:00p) at our LA Sales office,
6100 Center Drive, Suite 1250 LA 90045 (Pepperdine Building)

Direct candidates to apply online, jobs.fourseasons.com, search "Lanai" and then the role
No phone calls/ emails/LinkedIn requests please

We look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Jr. Content /Email Marketing Writer Position
Description:
Are you a storyteller? We need you.  We are looking to hire an email marketer/sales writer. This position is mainly  creative, meaning you should be comfortable with being assigned mostly writing tasks and editing your work on the fly. 

We're looking for someone who is passionate about marketing/sales writing, and driving tangible results. You should feel comfortable writing sales copy. While this is a creative position we are looking for someone with more of a strategic mind, who grasps the concepts of digital marketing and conversion optimization. You will be working on emails, landing pages, website copy and articles, to name a few.

You DO need writing samples. No resumes will be considered without writing samples. We don't care if the writing samples are published works or just fun stuff you've done on your own time. We just need to see your writing style.

This is an in-house position. No telecommuting available. 


 
   


     


You would strategize and write digital content for multiple brands working cross functionally throughout the organization to support key product categories, launches, campaigns and initiatives.




 Scale www.scale.tech  is a tight-knit, fast-paced company with multiple e-retail brands. You will be working with all of these brands. We work hard and play hard. We believe in innovation, big ideas and rewarding great work. We are constantly growing and are looking for someone to grow with us.

Since we're growing rapidly, your opportunity to grow with us is endless. Natural born leaders do well here. The more of a problem-solver you prove to be the faster you'll move up the ranks.
With more responsibility comes even better pay and higher bonuses.

* Lives near South B

Title: URGENTLY LOOKING FOR BOOKKEEPER/OFFICE ASSISTANT
Description:

Title: AUDIO VISUAL DESIGN ENGINEER
Description:
Audio Visual Design Engineer
A leading C7 contractor specializing in structured cable systems, security and AV integration in the Southern California area--seeks a seasoned Audio Visual Design Engineer. This position requires extensive knowledge of the commercial audio visual market and the ability to design and document systems. The Audio Visual Design Engineer will provide sales support and project engineering services by assisting with client need analysis, system design, proposal generation, labor estimation, shop drawing creation, system testing and configuration.
Responsibilities: 
•	Support customer needs with analysis/site surveys
•	Participate in project meetings with clients, architect and other stakeholders
•	Develop pre-sale design documentation 
•	Create proposals with understandable and thorough Scopes of Work, single line drawings of Audio Visual systems, a full bill of materials, labor estimates, etc. 
•	Preserve system configuration and programming files
•	Commission systems
•	Generate as-built documentation
•	Assist with end-user training
•	Act as subject matter expert for after-project support
•	Keep up with market and technological trends
•	Support company training initiatives
•	Perform firmware updates for system components
•	Configure devices (IP addresses, EDID settings, audio adjustments, etc.)
•	Create and adjust DSP files for Biamp, BSS, Clear-One and QSC audio processors
•	Perform on-site service calls after project completion and provide technical support for troubleshooting for field technicians
•	Have the ability to prioritize work efforts and multi-task in a very fast-paced environment
Experience:
•	Industry education and experience required 
•	Minimum (5) years direct related experience 
•	Excellent verbal and written communication skills 
•	Excellent customer service skills 
•	Ability to remain calm and use sound judgment when addressing potentially volatile issues 
•	Ability to operate as part of a team 
•	Aggressive, Self-Motivated drive to enhance overall industry knowledge 
•	Basic Networking 
•	Proficient with Computers and Troubleshooting
•	Travel may be required throughout employment 
•	Must possess ability to pay attention to detail 
•	Work well in busy environment 
•	Experience in Word, Excel, Outlook, Visio, etc.
•	Experience with Crestron Toolbox, Netlinx Studio, Extron Global Configurator, various DSP platforms 
•	InfoComm CTS certification
Base compensation will depend on prior experience and training.  
Full time position based in Duarte, CA.
EEO/AA/D/V

Title: Solar Site Auditor - Inspect Sites for solar feasibility and proposals
Description:
We need to hire site auditor or inspector asap - this week to cover socal. 

Job will entail driving to various multifamily and commercial sites around socal. 
Gathering data from the site to be used for proposals. This is for Solar Thermal (we will train you if you don't know much about solar thermal). Data to gather includes water heater information. 

You will check out the roof and potential locations for the solar thermal storage tank. You will take pics of videos of the site and fill out inspection form on paper, and a shorter version on your phone. We plan to hire this week and train you next week. 

You will need a valid and clean drivers license. A reliable form of transportation (we will reimburse mileage at 50 cents a mile), and a smart phone with internet access. We can also potentially provide a tablet with internet access. Should be familiar with the use of smart phone or tablet. 

Any plumbing or solar knowledge is a plus, but we will train you. 

Compensation will be hourly rate around $15 to $20 per hour DOE, health and dental benefits. Paid Holidays. Mileage reimbursement, and performance bonus. 

Please send your resume and respond to the following questions:
1. Do you have a valid and clean drivers license?
2. Do you have reliable transportation?
3. Where do you live?
4. Can you good at using a smart phone?
5. Do you have any solar, plumbing, or general construction experience?

Title: Showroom Sales Manager
Description:

Title: Sequoyah School After School programs
Description:
Established in 1958, Sequoyah School was one of the first private progressive schools established in the Los Angeles area. Staff and faculty continue to do amazing work with students, kindergarten through high school. We believe in mixed-age classrooms, emergent and integrated curricula, and holistic teaching. We build a community of learners that extends from classrooms into the after school Daycare program, where students are supported to continue exploring and deepening social connections, interests and play. Find out more about the school at k8.sequoyahschool.org

The Daycare program is staffed from 7:30-9:30 am and 2:30-6:30 in the evening daily, during meetings and teacher in-service days. Daycare staff's first priority is always student supervision, but we supervise through activities, games, arts & crafts, learning and play.

Title: Entry Level Management Trainee Financial Advisor
Description:
Experience a rewarding career at Independent Capital Management, Inc. where you help people become financially independent while building your own personal financial wealth with career growth and professional development.  As an advisor with Independent Capital Management, Inc., you will help individuals and businesses accumulate wealth and protect their hard-earned assets. 
Whether you are new to the industry or you are looking to enhance your professional services, Independent Capital Management, Inc. can provide you with the training and marketing support you need to elevate your business to the next level.  As a full-service independent Financial Advisor you can create customized plans to meet your clients' needs in the following areas: retirement planning, executive benefits, asset protection and risk management, estate planning, education funding, liability management, and real estate.
 RESPONSIBILITIES
•	Schedule appointments with confidence that your manager will mentor you through the client planning process, from situation assessment to plan implementation. 
•	Conduct face-to-face meetings, with the support of your manager, during which you will gather pertinent information and educate clients about fundamental financial issues.
•	Analyze and manage clients' assets and liabilities to enhance their net worth.
•	Present and implement tax-efficient planning solutions to help clients accumulate tax-advantaged wealth and generate tax-free distributions.
•	Provide a high level of individualized service throughout your long term consultative relationships with clients to increase loyalty and referral business.
•	Expand your knowledge and financial expertise through ongoing specialized training.
QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS
•	Excellent communication and listening skills.
•	Organized individual who excels in problem solving and multi-tasking.
•	Motivated hard worker who displays self-confidence and a strong desire to learn.
•	Energetic self-starter with a track record of determination, effort and achievement.
•	Bachelor's Degree, or equivalent work experience demonstrating proficiency in marketing, sales, customer service, and/or management skills.
 WHAT WE OFFER
•	Generous compensation package and benefits including medical, dental, vision and disability insurance, 401(k) with matching, tuition reimbursement for CFP designation, and the opportunity to qualify for business conferences in destinations such as Hawaii, Jamaica, Bahamas, Mexico, Costa Rica, and New York.
•	We will provide you with initial training to obtain industry licenses, followed by ongoing advisory and management training to elevate your career to the next level.
•	Implement our proven referral process to market your services and expand your business.
•	Help people from all financial backgrounds, ranging from middle-income to high net worth, as you create customized plans to meet their specific needs.

 Click Apply for immediate consideration to join our dynamic team. Or call
8006002620

Title: Field Investigator
Description:
DigiStream Investigations, Inc.
Field Investigator (Northridge, CA)
Full-time, 40 hours per week minimum, 10 hours per day average
First -year compensation: $38,000-$42,000 first year total pay (entry-level), frequent overtime
Hourly Starting Pay Rate: $14-$15 per hour
Applicants must reside in or near Northridge/San Fernando Valley region
Benefits: Health, Dental, Vision, and Life insurance offered and 401(k) retirement plan with 4% Company Match offered
Company vehicle provided, and you will be paid to commute to and from your cases

DigiStream Investigations, Inc., a technology-centric private investigations firm, seeks a full-time Field Investigator to work under general supervision, investigating suspicious worker's compensation claims from various corporate clients in the Northridge/San Fernando Valley region and surrounding areas.

Duties including, but not limited to: Monitoring and videotaping various individuals as they conduct their normal day-to-day activities. Note-taking and detailed report rendering on the activities captured by the investigator.

Requirements:
Must possess Bachelor's Degree
Must reside in the Northridge/San Fernando Valley region
Strong computer skills
Ability to pass DMV, pre-employment physical and background check
Ability to start work as early as 6:00am daily
Must be a morning person
Flexibility to work weekends and some holidays
Must possess critical-thinking skills
Must be willing to travel out of town for extended periods of time

Candidate must have great intuition and the ability to process many mitigating factors during the course of the investigation. Decisions are expected to be made in an accurate and timely manner and in the best interest in preserving the confidentiality of the assignment in question.

All equipment is provided including: a vehicle, company laptop, wi-fi access, a gas/maintenance card, and video equipment.

Only apply if you can work a Tuesday - Saturday schedule (or similar) with an average of 10 hours per day. You will be paid to commute to and from cases. MUST be available to work weekends.

No phone calls please. No resumes accepted at this time, only Employment Applications.

Please fill out our online application at:

www.digistream.com/Company-Info/Employment-Opportunities/Personal-Information

Title: Client Services Representative, Fulltime & Weekends
Description:
24Hr HomeCare is an innovative healthcare company that provides in-home care services to the elderly as well as individuals with developmental disabilities. If you are looking for a mission you can be excited about, teammates you'll adore, and the chance to be part of a quickly growing company -- you've found your future home.

We are an award-winning in-home care company that has been listed at No. 24 on FORBES annual ranking of America's Most Promising Companies -- a list of one hundred privately held, high-growth companies with bright futures. 24Hr HomeCare joined the prestigious INC 5000 list of America's Fastest Growing Companies in 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2016 and the company's Co-Founders, David Allerby, Ryan Iwamoto, and Tyner Brenneman-Slay, have been listed as EY Entrepreneur of the Year Finalists in 2014, 2015, and 2016, and winner of the EY Entrepreneur of the Year award and the Gold Stevie Award for Company of the Year in 2017!

With 13 locations throughout California, Arizona and Texas, we are a company that celebrates achievements, promotes individual and professional growth, cares about our employees, our clients, and our community, and ultimately competes to be the best in our industry.

We are currently seeking energetic, driven, and goal-oriented individuals to play a key role in our growth. We have multiple openings for a Client Services Representative in our Call Center based in El Segundo, CA. This is an hourly, non-exempt level position. 




• Work with our clients in a call center environment and build solid relationships with parties involved in their care
• Take incoming phone calls from clients and caregivers and address any issues surrounding care that may arise
• Be available during various shifts including evenings, overnights, weekends and holidays
• Find caregivers whose skills match client's needs and schedule emergency shifts 
• Provide customer service and directly resolve any issues and concerns
• Receive extensive hands-on training on the healthcare industry, medical terminology and customer service 


• High School Diploma or GED
• Available to work swing shift or overnight shift
• Available to work weekends and holidays
• 1-2 year's customer service experience
• Strong interpersonal skills, positive "Can Do" attitude 
• Highly dependable - excellent attendance record & strong work ethic
• Highly Organized


• Flexible Scheduling 
• Stocked office with food/snacks/drinks
• Verizon and Sprint Discount
• Corporate Perks - receive a variety of discounts and special offers for Department Stores, Travel, Dining, and More!
• Fun, fast-paced environment

Title: Have fun working at First Dessert Lounge w/ Liquor Ice Cream and more
Description:
Newly opening first Dessert Lounge in Los Angeles - Milk Tavern 
Liquor based ice cream, cereal desserts, champagne floats, games and much more!

Please apply via link at the very below
Now accepting applications for Team Member / and Assistant Manager position:

-----

You are the heart and soul of our company representing our brand and people to our guests. Our team goal is to create an amazing experience and smile to all of our customers, while having fun doing it. Milk Tavern is a fun, one of a kind, ultimate dessert lounge location in most condensed food district in America - Korea Town Los Angeles. From cereal ice creams, champagne floats to unique community events, team at Milk Tavern will be creating new dessert culture for the neighborhood. 


*TEAM MEMBER POSITION*

Job overview -
Milk Tavern's team members are the face and the main core of our business. You will be responsible to interact with guests and make sure that store runs as sweet as possible. 

Qualifications -
21 years of age or older
At least 1 year or more experience in food and/or beverage industry
Ice Cream Parlor experience is a huge plus 
Respect food safety and health standards
Able to work schedule that can change due to seasonal demand and special events
Great communication skills and problem solving skills
Great guest service
Team player
Great time management

*ASSISTANT MANAGER POSITION*

Job overview -
Assistant manager must be a motivational leader, constantly listening and learning from our team members and more importantly from our guests to make Milk Tavern experience a one of a kind. Milk Tavern is a fast pace & high volume environment store where assistant manager is expected to be creative, problem solving and leading the team member during any shift hours. 

Responsibilities -
Communications between company and team members
Product quality check and food safety programs
Manage team member scheduling to meet the needs of the business

Title: Seeking a Gorgeous - Model like Egg Donor! Compensation up to $25k!
Description:
UNIQUE CASE: We are a well respected boutique egg donation and surrogacy agency in Southern California. We currently have a high profile intended parent actively searching for a Model-like Caucasian donor with naturally light hair and light eyes.

The compensation for this cycle will range up to $25,000 for the candidate that is chosen. 

***When replying to this ad using the "reply" button above, please reference Genesis Model in your email OR you can go directly to the website and sign up here: www.GenesisEggDonation.com ***

*Please note that these are very special cases and not the "norm" in terms of egg donation cycles. We would love for you to apply to our regular program with regular compensation amounts if you do not meet ALL of the requirements this client has. The typical compensation for a first time donor is between $5,500 - $15,000. This is also dependent on verifiable personal and educational achievements and your compensation may be raised after each subsequent cycle.

Benefits:
•	Generous compensation for your time and energy
•	Thousands of dollars worth of genetic testing results
•	Learn more about your own fertility and valuable information for your future family planning
•	Change someone's life in a way that is truly the world's greatest gift! Intended Parents are typically couples who have been through many years of struggles just hoping to be parents, cancer survivors, women who learned early on that they would never be able to have children from their own genes, or same sex couples.

You must meet all of the minimum requirements (listed below) to become an egg donor. 

Minimum Egg Donor Requirements:
•	You must have a desire to help people and must be mature/responsible.
•	Between the ages of 18 - 29.
•	You CANNOT be a smoker or have ANY drug use within the last 3 months!
•	You must have regular periods. (If you currently have an IUD, it must be non-hormonal or you must be willing to have it removed)
•	You CANNOT have a personal or family history of either emotional disorders or mental illness. 
•	You must have completed at least 1 semester of college/trade school. The only exception to this requirement, is to be actively pursuing a successful modeling/acting/musical/military/art career. 
•	You must be height/weight proportionate (BMI must be less than 27)

Things You Should Know:
•	Being a donor does NOT cause infertility
•	You will need to go to about 6-10 doctor's appointments within a 2 month time frame (paid for by the client)
•	The process should not be painful, and you should be able to go back to work/school the day after your retrieval
•	You can live anywhere in the United States and be a donor
Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster.
do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offers.

Title: Talent Acquisition Manager
Description:
Talent Acquisition Manager

24Hr HomeCare is an innovative healthcare company that provides in-home care services to the elderly as well as individuals with developmental disabilities. If you are looking for a mission you can be excited about, teammates you'll adore, and the chance to be part of a quickly growing company -- you've found your future home.

We are an award-winning in-home care company that has been listed at No. 24 on FORBES annual ranking of America's Most Promising Companies -- a list of one hundred privately held, high-growth companies with bright futures. 24Hr HomeCare joined the prestigious INC 5000 list of America's Fastest Growing Companies in 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2016 and the company's Co-Founders, David Allerby, Ryan Iwamoto, and Tyner Brenneman-Slay, have been listed as EY Entrepreneur of the Year Finalists in 2014, 2015, 2016 and winner of the EY Entrepreneur of the Year award and the Gold Stevie Award for Company of the Year in 2017!

24Hr HomeCare is seeking a Talent Acquisition Manager, Strategic Sourcing & Intelligence at our corporate office in El Segundo to oversee the sourcing recruitment team responsible for attracting and hiring quality caregivers for our company. This is a full time, exempt level position overseeing a team of 6. 

Position Summary:  The Talent Acquisition Manager, Strategic Sourcing & Intelligence will lead the development and execution of 24Hr HomeCare's caregiver recruiting strategy that is aligned with 24hr Homecare recruitment needs, leverages and reinforces 24Hr HomeCare's current and future business and growth strategies, and positions 24Hr HomeCare as an employer of choice. 

Reporting to the Director of Talent Acquisition, the Talent Acquisition Manager, Strategic Sourcing & Intelligence will manage the direct activities of a sourcing, branding and candidate experience with a focus on operational excellence and optimizing performance via innovative technologies and solutions. Our ideal candidate will work to establish and measure KPI's related to recruitment branding impact, source per hire, cost per hire, candidate experience, time in stage, etc. and place a focus on continuous improvement and delivering ROI for 24Hr Homecare recruiting needs.

Essential Functions:

•	Collaborates with General Manager to understand critical staffing needs and key requirements to identify quality talent prospects.
•	Have a complete understanding of internet, using Boolean Logic, scanning resumes, cold calling, networking, referral gathering, and other strategies to identify talent and build talent pipelines.
•	Identifies and participates in events that develop relationships and connections to quality talent.
•	Collect competitive intelligence data in designated territory 
•	Provide leadership, coaching, training and development of assigned TA Sourcers.
•	Access, monitor and evaluate TA Sourcers activities and provide tactical direction where needed to meet recruiting targets; to include workload assessment, customer / client satisfaction, TA Sourcers performance, training needs, tools assessment, and other various activities to meet business needs.
•	Develop and deliver on recruiting approaches/concepts and converting them into action - utilizing both "strategic and tactical" engagements to positively impact our talent acquisition approach.
•	Develop and implement appropriate metrics and tracking mechanisms to measure and improve results, impact and cost-effectiveness of team.
•	Maintain superior collaborative relationships with hiring managers, business partners, key internal stakeholders and peers

What does it take to become a member of Team 24?

•	4 year college degree preferred (BA/BS)
•	2-3 years Recruiting experience, or Human resources/sourcing experience
•	Strong written and oral communication skills 
•	Must be detail oriented and have strong organization skills
•	Must be proficient at Microsoft Word, Excel & Outlook
•	Familiar with iCIMS Applicant Tracking System (preferred) 
•	Strong work ethic
•	Self-motivated


Other Perks:

•	Bi-weekly free lunches and a stocked office with food/snacks/drinks. We often have company lunch/dinners/happy hours
•	Fitness reimbursement 
•	Education Assistance Program
•	Verizon and Sprint Discount
•	Volunteer paid-time off to give back to the community
•	Corporate Perks - receive a variety of discounts and special offers for Department Stores, Travel, Dining, and More!
•	Fun, fast-paced environment 
•	Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401K, LTD, FSA, and other voluntary benefits

Title: Talent Acquisition Coordinator
Description:
24Hr HomeCare is an innovative healthcare company that provides in-home care services to the elderly as well as individuals with developmental disabilities. If you are looking for a mission you can be excited about, teammates you'll adore, and the chance to be part of a quickly growing company -- you've found your future home.

We are an award-winning in-home care company that has been listed at No. 24 on FORBES annual ranking of America's Most Promising Companies -- a list of one hundred privately held, high-growth companies with bright futures. 24Hr HomeCare joined the prestigious INC 5000 list of America's Fastest Growing Companies in 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2016 and the company's Co-Founders, David Allerby, Ryan Iwamoto, and Tyner Brenneman-Slay, have been listed as EY Entrepreneur of the Year Finalists in 2014, 2015, and 2016, and winner of the EY Entrepreneur of the Year award and the Gold Stevie Award for Company of the Year in 2017! 

With 13 locations throughout California, Arizona and Texas, we are a company that celebrates achievements, promotes individual and professional growth, cares about our employees, our clients, and our community, and ultimately competes to be the best in our industry.  

We have an opening at our Culver City office for a Talent Acquisition Coordinator, Senior Care to join our 2 year TAC Development Program. The TA Coordinator Development Program (TACDP) is an entry point for junior human resource professionals interested in a career in recruiting. The TACDP provides qualified individuals exciting opportunities to develop their knowledge, skills and abilities while making a positive impact in the home care community. This is a full time, hourly, non-exempt level position. 

  


•	Year 1 - Focus on Interviews, Onboarding & Sourcing 
•	Year 2 - Focus on Interviews, Onboarding & Competitive Intelligence Project
•	At the end of the program we will pay for your PHR certification 

 
•	Conduct caregiver interviews (individual and group) 
•	Administer all pre-employment paperwork & make conditional offer of employment  

 
•	Conduct 5 hour in-person orientation for external employees, weekly 
•	Onboard Caregivers  


•	Comply with all state and federal regulations
•	Manage workers' compensation mod duty employees, if applicable
•	Pass out caregiver paychecks on paydays
•	Assist the office with putting away Costco/Staples orders and maintaining a clean and professional office space
•	Perform other duties and ad hoc projects as assigned 



•	Associates degree (AA/AS) required, 4 year college degree preferred (BA/BS) 
•	1-2 years Customer service experience, or Human resources/recruiting experience 
•	Strong written and oral communication skills 
•	Must be detail oriented and have strong organization skills 
•	Must be proficient at Microsoft Word, Excel & Outlook 
•	Strong work ethic 
•	Self-motivated 

 
• Bi-weekly free lunches and a stocked office with food/snacks/drinks. We often have company lunch/dinners/happy hours. 
• Fitness reimbursement 
• Education Assistant Program 
• Verizon and Sprint Discount 
• Corporate Perks - receive a variety of discounts and special offers for Department Stores, Travel, Dining, and More!
• Fun, fast-paced environment 
• Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401K, LTD, FSA, and other voluntary benefits

Title: SECURITY OFFICER JOB FAIR-- WED 8/16 and THUR 8/17
Dog Walker Manhattan Beach, El Segundo URGENTLY NEEDED
Description:
**When replying PLEASE INCLUDE your email address and phone number in the body of the email!!** 

5 Star Dog Walking, Pet Sitting and Private Boarding 14 year old company is looking for experienced Dog Walkers urgently PART TIME Monday to Friday in El Segundo and Manhattan Beach  We pay your insurance and bonding! Work is avail from 8:30am to 6:00pm and we also have boarding work and pet sitting work available immediately. 

PLEASE ANSWER ALL THE QUESTIONS BELOW to be considered for these positions. Interviews take place in Lawndale this week and next week, but the dog walking work is currently ONLY in West Los Angeles. Please note that we receive 25 resumes a day, and will delete any submissions that do not answer ALL the questions below....

1. Where do you live? (You must live within 5 miles of the work offered to make financial sense for you to do)

2. DO YOU LIVE IN A PET FRIENDLY BUILDING? Do you have any pets? Can you board a dog in your home/apt? (If so, we have immediate dog boarding available!)

3. What experience do you have with Animals? You must have owned a dog, or have walked large breed dogs and or rescues. VERY IMPORTANT.

4. Can you commit to this position for at least 6 months? This is a REQUIREMENT for Dog walking positions (sorry, this is not just a summer position or a position for a few months). 

5. How many hours a week would you like to, or need to work? What are your monthly income expectations? (Please note this is only a part time job, and most staff makes between $500.00 and $1850.00 monthly)

6. Would this position by your primary income? If not, what other work do you do, and what is your EXACT daily schedule? (This is a great part time job, and perfect for someone who is a stay at home parent, someone who runs a business from home, semi retired, etc) 

7. Can you work weekends and major Holidays and/or 3 day weekends? Almost ALL pet sitting and Boarding opportunities are during long weekend and Holidays.

8. Can you Pet Sit in Clients Homes?

9. Will you allow us to run a criminal and drug background screen on you? (If you have been arrested, our Company Insurance will NOT allow us to hire you). Sorry, we are not 420 friendly.

10. Do you have daily access to a cell phone that receives texts and email? (REQUIRED)

11. What is your email address?

* Must be over 21, IDEALY OVER 40 YEARS OLD, and we LOVE Sr. Staff! * Must be willing to work outside, even in heat and rain for up to 4 hours a day * You cannot bring your own dog, children or partners to walks* This is a very physical job, so you must be in good physical shape.* NO dog parks unless specifically asked to do so by clients* All our walks are PRIVATE unless the client asks us to add another dog *Have a strong work ethic, be detailed, organized and professional* Be dependable and show up on time for all scheduled work* Be flexible in terms of scheduling, lots of on call work available*

Don't forget to include your email!!!!*

The work currently available is:

5:00/5:30 pm 7 days a week for 30 min for a Golden Ret in Manhattan 
3:30/4:00 1 hour walk for a Porteguese Water Dog Manhattan Beach Mondays to Fridays 
2:30/3:00 one hour walk on Mon, Wed and Fridays (female preferred) El Seguno Jack Russel
4:00/4:30 30 min boxer puppy walk Saturdays for a Boxer Puppy Manhattan Beach 
11:00-3:00 on call daycare in clients home Redondo Beach 2 tine dogs
9:00-10:30 Tue and Fridays 1.5 hour walk for a Mon, Wed and Fridays Goldendoodle
LOTS of on call walks and boarding opportunities

Title: production assistant
Description:
Studio Assistant
As a studio Asistant, you have a hands-on role, supervising projects through to completion. You will maintain a safe and orderly studio environment, with a high level of process and organization. You will act as quality control for the standard of project planning and set build briefs given by the contractors and the Director. Making sure resource planning and scheduling is highly organized and efficient. You will run meetings to ensure all staff are informed of the jobs in the studio, their status, progress against plan and the future workload. You will allocate Architects and designers, builders and contractors to projects, also allocating studio space to maximize efficiency.

Skills & Experience:
• Must be a clear and confident communicator both orally and in writing.
• A quick learner, able to grasp design terms and concepts quickly and explain these to non technical users.
• Previous experience in a fast-paced environment working on multi-disciplined campaigns.
• Strong on work-flow management and process.
• Able to clearly communicate a creative brief, deliverables, expectations and time-lines.
• Excellent organisational skills, impeccable attention to detail and able to prioritise projects in order to meet client deadlines.
• Will attend project meetings and play an active role in offering opinions and solutions to project and production challenges.
• If you are ready for a new challenge and would like to find out more about this role please send your cv through.

Measures of Performance:
• Ensure that all marketing collateral/online messages are consistent with brand and corporate standards, speaks the team's 'language' and upholds brand values
• To represent the company in a professional manner at all times
• Consistently meet deadlines.
• Ensuring all projects are delivered on time.
• Ensure director's calendar and appointments are organized.
• You will be in charge of the day-to-day studio admin (ex. ordering studio/office supplies, opening mail and packages, paying invoices, etc)

Qualifications

- Proactive

- Good Command of the English language.

- Strong work ethic

Title: Home Health Agency looking for RN and LVN nurses
Description:
A fast growing Home Health Agency is looking for nurses to handle an increasing workload. We have patients in Los Angeles, Long Beach and San Fernando Valley areas. 


JOB SUMMARY: The Registered Field Nurse is responsible for providing direct patient care under the supervision of a Case Manager and/or Director of Patient Care Services. He/she must be able to function independently in performing the nursing process - from initial evaluation and assessment through planning, implementation and evaluation of the Plan of Care. Proficiency in OASIS-C is required as is the submission of timely documentation. Familiarity with web-based clinical documentation tools such as Synergy is a plus.

JOB DUTIES:

- Conducts in-home patient evaluations.

- Provides direct patient care.

- Implements plan of care initiated by the clinician.

- Provides accurate and timely documentation consistent with the plan of care.

- Provides patient and family/caregiver education.

- Participates in coordination of Home Health services appropriately reporting the identified needs for other disciplines (i.e. HHA, PT, SW, etc.)

The above statements are intended to be a representative summary of the major duties and responsibilities performed by incumbents of this job. The incumbents may be requested to perform job related tasks other than those stated in this description.

REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS:

- Graduate of an accredited nursing program.

- Minimum 1 year experience in home health, hospice or related field.

- IV Proficient (including chemo) a PLUS.

- Wound Care Certified/Proficient a PLUS.

- Psych certified is a PLUS

- Current CPR.

- Professional Liability Insurance.

- Currently licensed as a registered nurse in the State of California.

- Demonstrates good verbal and written communication and organization skills.

- Spanish Speaking, preferred but not required.

- Valid Driver License.

- Active Car Insurance.

- Physical/TB Test must be within 6 months.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS: This position requires good enough overall physical and mental health to handle the physical and emotional demands of caring for patients. Employment Type: Other

Title: Warehouse Driver
Description:
Looking for a Career? 50 years in business and still growing strong!

Warehouse Driver
Northridge, CA  


Under supervision by the Field Service Manager the Warehouse Driver ensures that The ICEE Company is always represented in a professional and courteous manner. Customer and Service are always capitalized at ICEE and we have a commitment to success to not only our Customers but also our partners and our peers. The warehouse driver will be held to a high standard of service with both internal employees and external customers. They are to perform all aspects of the day-to-day functions of a Service Center Warehouse. Additionally, the warehouse driver acts as a back-up route driver as needed by the Service Center.


• Receiving/Shipping of packages utilizing: UPS, DHL, etc.
• Assist in loading of ICEE delivery trucks ensuring that they are equipped with ICEE product, current promotional stock and POS (Point of Sale).
• Maintain and order POS for Account Executives.
• Box and palletize product for shipment
• Pull orders for distributor pick up.
• Maintain daily and weekly inventory logs.
• Maintain work area and general upkeep of warehouse/office facility.
• Fill in for route drivers when Service Center is shorthanded.


To perform this job successfully, the warehouse driver must be self-motivated and have the ability to stay on task with minimal to no supervision. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.
• Customer relations, interpersonal relationships, team relations and service.
• Excellent organization and time management skills.
• Must be self-starter and be able to accomplish tasks in a timely manner.
• Great oral and written communication skills. Must be comfortable performing basic mathematical functions as well.


• Drivers need to be at least 21years of age due to DOT regulations
• Valid driver's license with an excellent driving record.
• Ability to lift 55-lbs or more on a regular basis. Occasional lifting in excess of 70-lbs required.
• Ability to Drive 40% of the time.
• Minimum of two (2) years warehouse and/or customer service experience.
• Forklift certification a plus.
• Ability to pass a Background Check.
• Must have steel-toed shoes (ICEE provides uniforms).

ICEE is an equal opportunity employer and we are always actively recruiting for top talent to join our team. We offer competitive compensation with an excellent benefits package including: Medical, Dental, 401k, paid vacation, stock options, and life insurance.  Company provides tools, uniforms, company vehicle and training.  We do a pre-employment physical and drug screen.

For immediate consideration, fax resume to: 866-853-4355 or email resume as a Word attachment to joinicee@icee.com 

Thank you for your interest in The ICEE Company please visit our website that details all open positions and submit an online application, too!! www.icee.com

Title: Construction Accounts Payable Specialist for IMT Residential
Description:
IMT Residential is hiring an Accounts Payable Specialist for our Construction Accounting department. The Accounts Payable Specialist in our Construction Accounting team will organize and process a high volume of payments to our vendors. 

Duties include (but are not limited to):

•Efficiently process a high volume of payments to our vendors for multi-state new construction and renovation projects
•Process, review and track lien waivers/release forms for all vendors/payments
•Maintain and process all payable documents (invoices, contracts, proposals) in a highly organized fashion
•Develop positive working relationships with construction accounting team and our vendors
•Other AP administrative projects, as needed
•Schedule is 8:00-5:00 or 8:30-5:30 with some overtime needed

Please apply if you have:

•1+ years accounts payable experience
•Construction or development experience is a plus
•Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills to efficiently process the high volume of invoices and issue weekly payments
•High level of detail orientation to verify that the invoice and payment amounts are accurate
•Computer proficiency including Microsoft Excel

IMT Residential is a leading, nationwide, multi-family residential investment and property management firm headquartered in Sherman Oaks, California. We are a rapidly growing company always looking to match great talent with our varied career opportunities. 

Founded in 1992 and recognized as a leader in the property management business with over 20,000 units owned and managed, IMT continues to innovate and set new standards for excellence in our field.  The IMT working environment is one where your contributions are valued and recognized through career growth potential, competitive compensation and benefits, and a team-oriented working environment.

IMTeam: Integrity. Motivation. Teamwork. Excellence. Accountable. Memorable.

That describes who we are.

 to experience the IMTeam difference!
