Title: Business Development (BD) Coordinator
Description:
As GGLO continues to grow we continue to need to grow our teams. We are currently hiring a Business Development (BD) Coordinator who is a versatile, organized, resourceful thinker and implementer of GGLO's BD strategy. The Coordinator works closely with Principals, Director of Business Development and the BD/Marketing Team on all Business Development activities for GGLO.

At GGLO, we believe it's both the opportunity and responsibility of design to play a lead role in creating and sustaining community - to design places where our clients' clients prosper. To that end, our approach is focused on improving the relationship between people and place. Our Architects, Interior Designers, Landscape Architects and Urban Designers work across scales and project types to create holistic neighborhoods, blocks, buildings, and public places

Professional Knowledge & Experience
Business Development 
•	Participate in the creation of Market Sector (MS) plans in collaboration with Director of Business Development, Marketing Manager and Principals
•	Guide and monitor MS plans, working with teams and individuals to fulfill plan objectives and goals
•	Work with Principals to support them in reaching their individual business development targets; help individuals improve and succeed in sales efforts
•	Develop new prospect presentations and provide interview preparation, including development of presentations, collateral, graphics, visual aids, and leave-behind packages
•	Lead research efforts on prospective clients as well as market/industry trends and insights; identify and qualify high value prospects
•	Develop ongoing prospect activity summaries for Market Sector teams and individuals in order to ensure follow-through on prospect activities
•	Collect and share market sector and competitor information
•	Leverage CRM to optimize effectiveness in relationship building 
•	Assist Principals in promoting the firm and markets through targeted marketing, speaking engagements, publishing, attendance at conferences, etc.
•	Actively research and suggest improvements to business development processes
•	Provide public relations support
Strategic Planning
•	Share ideas by contributing analysis, observations and recommendations for ways to increase Business Development effectiveness and positive outcomes
•	Assist in developing, planning, implementing, and monitoring MS plans

Administration
•	Develop and track weekly and monthly reporting on business development and weekly assignments for market sector teams
•	Track and prepare BD metrics reporting (financial and CRM performance)
•	Participate in budget reporting and discussions for markets
•	Actively participate in team meetings, Principal/Market Sector meetings, BD Forum discussions and BD financial meetings
•	Gather useful intelligence on selected prospects
•	Incorporate targets into MS BD plan and work with team to pursue 
•	Identify and secure listing in all desirable rosters for notice of RFP
•	Additional administrative, business development, marketing and special projects, as needed


Skill Sets Required
•	4+ years of experience in a professional marketing role 
•	Experience in A/E/C industry strongly preferred
•	Outstanding professional and effective written and verbal communication skills.
•	Excellent time management and organization skills; ability to manage multiple assignments in a deadline-driven environment while maintaining a positive attitude.
•	Must be highly detail oriented with strong drive for results, yet be flexible and adaptable to shifting priorities.
•	Resourceful, good judgment, and strong innovative problem-solving skills.
•	Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (e.g. Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, Acrobat) as well as the Microsoft Office Family (e.g. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
•	Experience with CRM systems.
•	Working knowledge of web development tools preferred.


Who are we looking for? The individual who will excel in this role will have a Bachelor's degree, plus 4 or more years of experience in a professional marketing role and experience in A/E/C industry. 

What does this mean for your career? Our employees are a talented mix of individuals who embody every aspect of an integrated practice, who are catalysts for community through an integrated, research based approach with sustainable design competency as a prerequisite. You will gain valuable, real-world experience all while adding your skills to paramount office projects.

Our salary range for this role is DOE and we offer and excellent, comprehensive benefits package! We offer the opportunity to join one of Seattle Business Magazines 100 Best Employers to Work For, activities such as our Thursday Crit's, Emerging professionals, and weekly lunch 'n' learns. Other benefits include bike parking and bike use, central downtown location, and more.

Send your resume, portfolio samples of writing pieces and graphic communications (5MB or less) and salary requirements today along with a brief paragraph of the requirements you fit. 

Feel free to share links to your blog or website to show off your talent!

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Customer Service Representative
Description:
Digital Room - www.digitalroominc.com

We are a profitable growing global print company in business since 1996 with over 1,000 employees. This is an opportunity to join an organization that is continually growing. We are all about developing and training our employees to reach their career potential and inspiring teamwork!

•	Responds to customer phone calls in a timely manner

•	Provide customer information on product process and status

•	Process change orders
•	Research shipment inquiries and tracking customer shipments through online tracking system
•	Perform other duties as assigned

Requirements:
•	Will be in West LA facility but must be willing to travel to different locations as required (Torrance & Van Nuys)
•	Experience using multi-line phone system 
•	Excellent customer service skills and ability to multi-task 
•	Good organizational, prioritization and problem-solving skills
•	Ability to read, write, communication in English
•	Advanced skills using Microsoft Excel 
•	Strong computer skills
•	Ability to communicate effectively
•	Ability to work in fast paced environment

We are an equal opportunity employer & e-verify employer.  

Please submit resume with salary history.

Title: SOCIAL WORKER BILINGUAL NEW GRADS OK
Description:
Social Worker Bilingual Needed
Libertana is a Lead Organization for the California Community Transition Demonstration Project. 
The California Community Transitions demonstration provides assistance to Medi-Cal eligible clients who wish to move back into the community. This is accomplished by bringing together supportive services to assist persons who have resided in inpatient facilities, e.g., nursing, sub acute, and acute care facilities, and intermediate care facilities for the developmentally disabled, for a minimum of six months or longer to transition to community living. 
Summary of Primary Duties: 
Interview inpatient facility residents to determine their preference to live in a community setting. 
Initiate and maintain contact with new and current facilities 
Travel to potential, new and current facilities for in-person visits 
Conduct sales presentations, referral orientation and training to potential and new facilities 
Monitor facility referrals and address issues as needed 
Assist in the development of related sales, marketing and communication strategies
This position requires significant driving throughout the San Fernando Valley.

Requirements: 
Bachelor Degree 
Current California Drivers License 
Minimum 1-3- years experience working in Long Term Care as a coordinator, social worker, 
or similar experience which demonstrates significant exposure to and familiarity with the Long Term Care industry 
Proven relationship management, professional communication and facilitation skills 
Proficiency in MS applications including Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint 
Demonstrated ability to exercise good judgment, make sound business decisions and work effectively in a self-directed and independent environment 
Ability to drive and travel 85% of time
Ability to work and conduct facility visits on weekdays during business hours 
Ability to perform administrative functions (calls, email, fax, etc) from a home base 
Flexibility to receive calls and make visits as needed

Libertana is an EEO, offers an excellent benefit package.

Title: LVN - Eating Disorder - Residential Program
Description:
The LVN/LPN is responsible for assisting and supporting residents through the entire treatment experience from admission through discharge. The LVN/LPN is responsible for communicating their observation and insight to the treatment team (i.e. therapists, dietitian, psychiatrist, pediatrician and facility administrator) to ensure that the team is comprehensively addressing each individual's particular issues. The LVN/LPN introduces each new resident to her fellow residents and the treatment staff, and orients each resident to the rules, expectations, and routine of the daily treatment schedule.

Qualifications
•Must have considerable knowledge of nursing principles and practice
•Must demonstrate knowledge of Axis I diagnosis and symptoms (and specifically in adolescents)
•Must demonstrate knowledge of medications and their proper application and use
•Able to take vital signs
•Able to provide First Aid
•LVN/LPN Certification
•Must be licensed in current state

Responsibilities
•Completes H&P upon admission for each resident
•Develops and initiates the Nursing Care Plan
•Facilitating therapeutic groups
•Clear resident documentation
•Implements Physician Orders Is available for consultation after hours and returns telephone calls/pages within ten-minute time frame
•Administers medication as prescribed Counts narcotics each day, logs appropriately
•Meets regularly with medical staff to discuss resident treatment
•Provides assessment of medical problems as needed
•Performs primary first aid and determines need for physician notification
•The LVN/LPN consults with the physician and psychiatrist to ensure appropriate medical interventions.
•The LVN/LPN meets with each resident, completes a daily assessment, and administers all prescription medication.
•The LVN/LPN is responsible to carry out any orders received from the physician and psychiatrist, and reports information to the Program Director and Facility Manager

•	Work with Principals to support them in reaching their individual business development targets; help individuals improve and succeed in sales efforts

•	Lead research efforts on prospective clients as well as market/industry trends and insights; identify and qualify high value prospects
•	Develop ongoing prospect activity summaries for Market Sector teams and individuals in order to ensure follow-through on prospect activities
•	Collect and share market sector and competitor information
•	Leverage CRM to optimize effectiveness in relationship building 
•	Assist Principals in promoting the firm and markets through targeted marketing, speaking engagements, publishing, attendance at conferences, etc.
•	Actively research and suggest improvements to business development processes
•	Provide public relations support
Strategic Planning
•	Share ideas by contributing analysis, observations and recommendations for ways to increase Business Development effectiveness and positive outcomes
•	Assist in developing, planning, implementing, and monitoring MS plans

Administration
•	Develop and track weekly and monthly reporting on business development and weekly assignments for market sector teams
•	Track and prepare BD metrics reporting (financial and CRM performance)
•	Participate in budget reporting and discussions for markets
•	Actively participate in team meetings, Principal/Market Sector meetings, BD Forum discussions and BD financial meetings
•	Gather useful intelligence on selected prospects
•	Incorporate targets into MS BD plan and work with team to pursue 
•	Identify and secure listing in all desirable rosters for notice of RFP
•	Additional administrative, business development, marketing and special projects, as needed


Skill Sets Required
•	4+ years of experience in a professional marketing role 
•	Experience in A/E/C industry strongly preferred
•	Outstanding professional and effective written and verbal communication skills.
•	Excellent time management and organization skills; ability to manage multiple assignments in a deadline-driven environment while maintaining a positive attitude.
•	Must be highly detail oriented with strong drive for results, yet be flexible and adaptable to shifting priorities.
•	Resourceful, good judgment, and strong innovative problem-solving skills.
•	Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (e.g. Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, Acrobat) as well as the Microsoft Office Family (e.g. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
•	Experience with CRM systems.
•	Working knowledge of web development tools preferred.


Who are we looking for? The individual who will excel in this role will have a Bachelor's degree, plus 4 or more years of experience in a professional marketing role and experience in A/E/C industry. 

What does this mean for your career? Our employees are a talented mix of individuals who embody every aspect of an integrated practice, who are catalysts for community through an integrated, research based approach with sustainable design competency as a prerequisite. You will gain valuable, real-world experience all while adding your skills to paramount office projects.

Our salary range for this role is DOE and we offer and excellent, comprehensive benefits package! We offer the opportunity to join one of Seattle Business Magazines 100 Best Employers to Work For, activities such as our Thursday Crit's, Emerging professionals, and weekly lunch 'n' learns. Other benefits include bike parking and bike use, central downtown location, and more.

Send your resume, portfolio samples of writing pieces and graphic communications (5MB or less) and salary requirements today along with a brief paragraph of the requirements you fit. 

Feel free to share links to your blog or website to show off your talent!

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Manager, Inside Sales
Description:
Manager, Inside Sales

24Hr HomeCare is an innovative healthcare company that provides in-home care services to the elderly as well as individuals with developmental disabilities. If you are looking for a mission you can be excited about, teammates you'll adore, and the chance to be part of a quickly growing company -- you've found your future home.

We are an award-winning in-home care company that has been listed at No. 24 on FORBES annual ranking of America's Most Promising Companies -- a list of one hundred privately held, high-growth companies with bright futures. 24Hr HomeCare joined the prestigious INC 5000 list of America's Fastest Growing Companies in 2013, 2014, 2015, and 2016 and the company's Co-Founders, David Allerby, Ryan Iwamoto, and Tyner Brenneman-Slay, have been listed as EY Entrepreneur of the Year Finalists in 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017.

With 13 locations throughout California, Arizona and Texas, we are a company that celebrates achievements, promotes individual and professional growth, cares about our employees, our clients, and our community, and ultimately competes to be the best in our industry. 

We are currently seeking energetic, driven, and goal-oriented individuals to play a key role in our growth. We have an opening at our El Segundo office for a Manager, Inside Sales. This is a full time exempt level position, managing the intake and sales process for all inbound home care inquiries. This position is responsible for leading, training, structuring and motivating the Care Advisor team to achieve specific goals and drive company growth.

You'll have the opportunity to:
•	Oversee the intake and sales process for all inbound homecare inquiries
•	Motivate, train, coach and develop a team of Care Advisors
•	Coordinate inside sales activity with field sales and marketing to fulfill the integrated sales model
•	Build call scripts to support campaigns and new distinctions
•	Inspire and foster a high-performing winning culture
•	Assist with implementation of private label partnerships and develop appropriate processes for intake integration
•	Keep track, monitor and report referral key performance indicators (KPIs)
•	Collaborate with other departments in order to develop inside sales strategies for enhancing the company's growth
•	Ensure the policies, practices and objectives established by the company are properly interpreted and uniformly enforced as well as compliance with all applicable laws and regulations

What does it take to become a member of Team 24?
•	4 year college degree (BA/BS)
•	3-5 years of management experience
•	Track record of success in sales, results driven
•	Experience building and leading high performing teams
•	Excellent written and oral communication skills 
•	Strong interpersonal skills, positive attitude 
•	Must be detail oriented and have strong organization skills
•	Must be proficient at Microsoft Word, Excel & Outlook

Other Perks:
•	Stocked office with food/snacks/drinks. 
•	Fitness reimbursement 
•	Education Assistance Program
•	Verizon and Sprint Discount
•	Volunteer paid-time off to give back to the community
•	Corporate Perks - receive a variety of discounts and special offers for Department Stores, Travel, Dining, and More!
•	Fun, fast-paced environment 
•	Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401K, LTD, FSA, and other voluntary benefits

Title: Real Estate Development Assistant
Description:
Real Estate Development Assistant
 
Diversified Real Estate Development Company is seeking a tenacious person to market a high profile project. Pay rate of $13.00 to $15.00 per hour depending on experience plus bonus and growth opportunities. This is perfect for someone looking to advance themselves in real estate and to become involved with all aspects of real estate, such as; acquisitions, sales, and development. This is an opportunity to learn commercial and industrial real estate from the ground up and interact with top line real estate executives. 

Timing: Hiring Immediately. This is a full time position in our West Hollywood office. 

Job Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: 
•	Ensure all maintenance request are accounted for and repaired by maintenance staff
•	Provide support construction supervisor and directors collecting construction bids
•	Perform support tasks related to real estate acquisitions and sales
•	Organization and filing of paperwork
•	Create and maintain contact information databases and spreadsheets as requested. 
•	Utilize the accounting and office computer software programs to prepare and provide reports
•	Review and sort mail
•	Provide all necessary documents for development acquisitions projects
•	Other support responsibilities as assigned

Qualifications: Must be knowledgeable in real estate terms, online data base applications, Microsoft Office, Internet Search. Must possess strong writing skills, be a detail oriented, self-starter that will take initiative. Must have reliable personal transportation as our office is not reachable by public transportation.

To Apply: Please email a resume, and a cover letter describing your real estate experience, education, salary history and the workplace skills that you have developed

Title: Swimming Pool Service Technician ($22 - $30+/hr)
Description:
Living Water Pool Service is a family owned and operated full service and repair company established in 1981. We provide a full line of services ranging from commercial to residential pool service & repair. Specializing in equipment installation, salt system and chlorine free expertise, education in water chemistry, acid washes, new plaster start up, tile bead blasting and miscellaneous pool repairs.

• Some previous swimming pool service experience
• Must live locally to the area where our clientele base is (West Pasadena, Eagle Rock, Glendale, Burbank)
• Working and insured pickup truck
• Valid drivers license

Skills
• Excellent communication skills
• Good manual dexterity
• Reliable at all times

$22-$30+ per hour

Position Type
Full-Time

Weekly gas allowance, 2-3 annual paid vacations, summer bonus, weekends off.

Title: Warehouse Supervisor Wanted
Description:

warehouse supervisor. The company is located at 9820 Bell Ranch Dr Ste 101 Santa Fe Springs CA 90670.

Title: Assistant Manager - Jimmy John's - Seeking Rockstars
Description:
We are looking for a Rockstar who is highly energetic with a killer work ethic and an awesome attitude!

The Assistant Manager manages all functions of a Jimmy John's restaurant and is responsible for the effective execution of fast, accurate orders to ensure world-class customer service while maintaining a clean, organized shift. 
 
Reports to General Manager.  We have three locations: La Palma, Lakewood, Hawthorne.

What We Provide: 
¬	Competitive base pay 
¬	Profit based bonuses  
¬	Excellent higher level management advancement opportunities
o	 We are growing fast so Rock Star Assistant Managers have the opportunity to become General Managers
¬	A fun fast paced work environment and a growing business 
o	We are building lots more new locations
¬	Great food that you can be proud to serve 

Duties and Responsibilities:
•	Manage a staff of approximately 50 employees. 
•	Assigns, oversees and evaluates work, recommends promotions, transfers, or termination of employees.
•	Delegates and is responsible for the ordering, receipt, storage and issuing of all food, labor, equipment, cleaning, and paper supplies for the unit to ensure a minimum loss from waste or theft.
•	Route deliveries and serve drivers to maximize delivery business and speed.
•	Completes daily food preparation (opening procedures, meat and vegetable slicing, bread production).
•	Completes daily and weekly paperwork.
•	Daily account reconciliation.
•	Audits previous shift's systems and procedures for 100% integrity and completeness.
•	Completes preventive maintenance and upkeep on store's equipment and supplies.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
•	Must be able to read and write and communicate in English.
•	Position requires bending, reaching, stooping, climbing, repetitive motions, cognitive skills, standing and moving about the unit the entire workday.
•	Must be able to lift 50 pounds.
•	Must have a valid driver's license, reliable transportation, current automobile insurance, and a clean driving record.
•	Must have the stamina to work a minimum of 50 hours a week.

Special Requirements:
•	Willing to work overtime, holidays, weekends as business dictates.
•	Ability to establish priorities, work independently, and proceed with objectives with minimal supervision.
•	Ability to handle and resolve customer issues.
•	Ability to handle and resolve employee issues.
•	Skills to use a personal computer and various software packages (Word/Excel).
•	Ability to handle stress and high-volume operations.

For more information about Jimmy John's visit us at www.jimmyjohns.com

To apply, reply by e-mail with resume to jobs@gourmetguysllc.com

Title: - Upholstery Technician, Trimmer/ Tapicería técnico
Description:
- Upholstery Technician, Trimmer

Description:

Work in a high pace shop with many demands in a variety of areas. Specialize in every aspect of automotive upholstery and transition to marine, restaurant, medical, home or restoration related tasks. Day to day jobs can range from a recovering a headliner, designing and fabrication boat tops or replacing a convertible top. Major tools such as sewing machine, steamer and air compressor will be provided. Position is full time and will be 95% onsite. 

Required abilities:

*Knowledge of proper sewing machine, steamer and glue gun usage 

*Minimum of 2 years of shop experience

*Canvas and convertible top knowledge

*Ability to construct new interiors from templates or from scratch

*Basic electrical knowledge

*Troubleshooting abilities for convertible tops 
*High degree of professionalism

*Headliners, carpet, seats, leather, vinyl tops, convertible tops, boat covers and bimini tops

*Daily used tools

            Appreciated but not required:

*Woodwork (boat interior repair)

*Welding (seat frame repair)

*Home furniture

- Tapicería técnico, Recortador 

 

Descripción:

 

Trabajo en un alto ritmo tienda con muchos pedidos de trabajo en una variedad de áreas. Nos especializamos en tapicería automovilística, transformación marina, restaurantes, médica, hogar o tareas relacionas con la restauración. 

Día a día los trabajos pueden abarcar desde una recuperación de un revestimiento, diseño y fabricación de tableros en barco o reemplazar una capota convertible. Principales herramientas tales como la máquina de coser, vaporizador y compresor de aire será proporcionado. La posición es de tiempo completo y será del 95% en el local.

 

Habilidades requeridas:

 

*Conocimiento apropiado de máquina de coser, vaporizador y pistola de pegamento

 

*Uso mínimo de 2 años de experiencia en actividades del negocio

 

*Lienzo y conocimiento de la capota convertible

 

*Capacidad para construir nuevos interiores a partir de plantillas o desde cero

 

*Conocimientos básicos de electricidad

 

*Habilidades de solución de problemas para capotas convertibles *alto grado de profesionalismo

 

*Revestimientos, alfombras, asientos de cuero, vinil, tops capotas convertibles, cubiertas de barco y toldos

 

*Herramientas de uso diario

 

Apreciado, pero no es necesario:

 

*Carpintería interior (barco)

 

*Reparación de soldadura (armadura)

 

*reparación de muebles para el hogar

Title: Shop Porter / Driver - Harley Davidson Shop (Born Free Cycles)
Description:
Shop Porter/ Driver
​
***Read First***NO EXPERIENCE NEEDED BUT ALL QUALIFICATIONS AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS MUST BE MET!!!!

This is a great position for someone who is looking get their foot in the motorcycle industry!  This is a entry level position that has many responsibilities.  

Summary Description
Drives to and from specific locations to pick up and drop off motorcycles, parts, accessories and other specified items by Service Manager and Upper Management. 
Moves and cleans motorcycles, keeps the motorcycles in sound working condition, and helps the Service Manager as requested.

Duties and Responsibilities
Clean Driving Record and adherence to all driving laws
Transferring units in and out of the Service Department.
Washing/Detailing all units.
Maintaining the entire lot.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
Must have current driver's license
Proficient in meeting deadlines on a timely manner.
Clean driving record.
Maintain a positive attitude and relationship with all other employees.
Capable of pushing and loading motorcycles.
Valid motorcycle license is a plus but not mandatory.

Physical Demands
May be required to drive long distances.
The noise level in the work environment is usually loud.
Requires the use of both hands.
Frequently required to bend, stop, crouch, reach, handle tools and lift 40lbs of material.
Requires the ability to balance and push a 600+lb motorcycle.

Working Conditions
Frequently works near moving mechanical parts.
Potential exposed to battery acid, gasoline, chemical cleaning materials or other toxic materials commonly found in a motor vehicle service department.
Occasionally exposed to exhaust fumes or other airborne particles.

Apply at www.BornFreeCycles.com

Title: Sales Support &Marketing Specialist | eCommerce FT | Entry Level
Description:
A eCommerce furniture and home decor business has a Sales Support/Marketing Specialist position open. We've been in business for 10 years and is expanding our channels and increasing brand awareness. Please send your cover letter (with your expect pay) and resume to the email address provided.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Title: CARE COORDINATOR WANTED

The Care Coordination Agency demonstration project provides assistance to Medi-Cal eligible clients who wish to move back into the community. Our department is very busy and growing quickly. We are looking for a compassionate and organized individual who is open to challenges and thrives in a fast paced environment. State of the art dental office is looking for a Full Time Registered Dental Assistant (RDA)

Description:

-Superb verbal/written communication skills

Title: Lyft and Uber Drivers Needed up to $1,000 bonus
Description:
Lyft and Uber both need Drivers in Los Angeles County wide! No matter where you live north, south, East or on the coast, you can drive for Uber and Lyft. HOWEVER, there is a Secret not being told! If you sign up at either site WITHOUT a referral code your bonus will be forfeited. 

This is important. You need a referral code from another Lyft or Uber driver to get a bonus. If you don't have one you are welcome to use mine which is 

Lyft :JOE6325 ( ) and 

Uber: JOEG169. If you have a friend of course use theirs, but if you don't know anyone I'd rather see you get your bonus then you don't. Plus as a Thank you for using my referral code 
(I do also get a bonus not as large as yours) I'm here to help you with any questions you may have and give you tips to earning 5-star reviews. 

I know when you first start out there will be a lot of questions so if you use my code just email me and let me know and I'll email you back some great info maybe even a personal video. I promise I'll cut your learning curve by 3 months, and that again will pay you back in tips and more rides. 

So you've got nothing to lose! Just use somebody's referral code no matter what. I'd love to help you however if you use mine there are so many simple things you'd never think of that get you instant 5 star ratings and tips! Uber now has tipping built into their application and has done a great job giving every driver what he wants. Did you know; say you did an airport drop off but don't want to pick someone up going the opposite direction of your house? Now Uber allows you to set only rides towards destinations like your home. So you are ready to call it a day you just push a couple of buttons ( you don't even need to input your home address only once at setup) and now you are set for only rides going back your way. No wasted time driving back without a rider. This is the tip of the ice berg. Use for LYFT (JOE6325) for LYFT (  ) for Uber just go to uber.com click on the driver or become a driver and when prompted use JOEG169. Hope to talk to you soon!

Title: Lead Cooks - Milo + Olive
Description:
Milo + Olive is looking for Lead Line Cooks for AM and PM shifts

The lead cook is responsible for overseeing the restaurant line.  The lead assists in training all new line employees.  The lead cook maintains the integrity of the food, ensures all items are properly handled and stored, is responsible for communication with the chef, and ensures the chef's standards are maintained.

-Oversee that all staff members are using the proper techniques and methods to prep 
-Oversee that everyone is working in a clean and safe way
-Be able to communicate between the line and the managers as well as the FOH operations
-Be able to expedite all food leaving kitchen, including catering orders and to-go items
-Be able to communicate when employees are tardy or not reporting to assigned shift
-Communicate with chef any problems, concerns, issues related to food and/or staffing

-2 Years experience minimum is required to lead in this kitchen, previous management experience is encouraged.  

This is a Full Time position and requires excellent attendance, attention to detail and strong communication and organizational skills.

This position reports directly to all Kitchen Managers.  

Rustic Canyon Restaurant Group supports local, sustainable and organic farmers.  We provide medical benefits to all full time employees at no charge to the employee.  We offer discounts at ALL of our family restaurants which include; Huckleberry, Rustic Canyon, Cassia, Esters Wine Bar, Tallula's and Sweet Rose Creamery. We offer growth opportunities within our group.

If you are interested in this position, please send a current resume with current contact information.

Title: District Sales Manager for Local Kombucha Startup (LA)
Description:
Local startup kombucha company seeks "face" of brand in Los Angeles area.  We're looking for a rock star District Sales Manager for the LA area.  Position focuses on building relationships with buyers, merchandising stores, generating orders, opening new accounts, executing some product demonstrations (around 2-3 per month), and helping with events as needed.
 
We're currently the second best-selling kombucha in Sprouts and are carried in Whole Foods, Vons, Pavilions, Erewhon, Lassen's and other independent grocery retailers.  We regularly partner on events with SoulCycle, Lululemon, WeWork and others.  We're already a force to be reckoned with, but are looking for someone like you to help us take it to the next level.
 
This is a great full-time position for a Brand Ambassador who's looking to transition to sales or a more comprehensive position.  That said, we are also open to applicants who have a broad background of prior experience.  Prior experience/knowledge about kombucha not necessary.  A great attitude, charisma, and the ability to work hard are more important than experience.
 
Position requires:
•	Early mornings (roughly 6a-3p) most days
•	M-F schedule (may occasionally be required to work some weekend events as needed)
•	Reliable vehicle
•       LA Territory is Pasadena to Thousand Oaks, Valencia to Long Beach, & Santa Barbara once every two months
•	Ability to lift 20-40lbs
•       Being out in stores 5 days/week
•	Smartphone and enough data to facilitate proper driving navigation and using required apps (reporting apps, Google Docs, etc)
•	Some beneficial personality traits: road-warrior, morning person, outgoing, likable, assertive, sales-minded, self-motivated, interested in a healthy lifestyle, passionate about the beverage industry, does what's necessary (not afraid to roll up sleeves and get hands dirty), great attitude, ability to be flexible (we're a startup and we sometimes change our direction as needed).
 
The particulars:
•	$22/hr, 40 hrs/wk
•	$700/mo car/fuel allowance
•	5 days paid holidays/year
•	1099 employee
 
Please email resume.  Optional to send a photo or a link to relevant social media as well.  Looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: LAZ is hiring Valets! You can interview from the comfort of your home!
Description:
**Hours Available:  Part-time, full-time and weekends

Hiring Valets for Los Angeles, West Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, Woodland Hills, Playa Vista, Pasadena & Malibu!

The Spirit of the Position:

Do you love driving cars? Meeting new people? Are you energetic and fast on your feet? Well then, we are looking for you. We are hiring Valet Attendants to woo our customers while parking their cars in a professional and responsible manner.
A LAZ Valet Attendant plays a significant role in the success of the company. They are the first person our clients and customers see upon arrival, and the last person our clients & customers see when they depart. A warm welcome, smiling face, and professional demeanor are of the utmost importance.

What Will I Do?

You Are:
•	Dynamic. You're charismatic, full of energy, and happy to help in any way you can.

Title: Kimpton Hotel Wilshire seeking Room Attendant!
Description:
A boutique slice of heaven along L.A.'s Miracle Mile, Kimpton Hotel Wilshire is urban, modern and stylish. It has everything you could want for a stay in L.A., like a rooftop pool and trendy restaurant, helmed by an award-winning chef. You'll be served up views of the Los Angeles skyline, too, including the iconic Hollywood sign. And the luxe location puts you right in the heart of the action: Beverly Hills, the Sunset Strip, Museum Row and shopper's mecca The Grove are just minutes away.

Our mission is to be the best loved Hotel & Restaurant Company so regardless of position, we look for individuals who are passionate about providing genuine heartfelt care to our guest and employees.

What you get to do: The position is responsible for cleaning rooms and hallways in hotel by following service standards.

Your day-to-day:
•	Clean, dust, wax, scrub, polish and service guest rooms daily in accordance with hotel procedures.
•	Greet any and all guests with a "Good Morning" (or afternoon, evening).
•	Replace linens on beds and replenish guest room supplies.
•	Empties wastebaskets.
•	Rearrange furnishings, drapes and room accessories.
•	Provide necessary linen and amenities to guests in accordance with the guest room legend.
•	Leave the guest room in uniform arrangement as determined by the Executive Housekeeper and make sure the door is closed and the room is locked.
•	Report any damage, hazards, repairs, and strangers in assigned areas.
•	Return any items found in guest rooms, hallways, or back of the house to the Housekeeping department as a lost and Found item and writing: the date, where it was found, description of the item, and the name of the person who found it.
•	Clean all corridors and service areas.
•	Respond to any projects or requests developed by the Housekeeping management team.
•	Restock cart at end of shift and organize the linen closet to prepare for the next day.
•	Other housekeeping duties as assigned.

Specific experience we're seeking:
•	To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.
•	Less than high school education; or up to six months related experience or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
•	Ability to read a limited number of two-and three-syllable words and to recognize similarities and differences between words and between series of numbers. Ability to print and speak simple sentences.
•	Must be able to speak English to communicate with guests. Must be able to recognize situations which may involve guests that require immediate supervisory attention. Must know and use reasonable care for the safety and security of the guests.
•	The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 25-30 pounds and frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.

 (Please note: management reserves the right to change, modify, and/or alter any of the duties listed above to meet business demands).

Title: Maintenance Supervisor
Description:
Do you have facilities/wood shop machining maintenance experience?  Do you want to be a part of a company that believes that the heart of what makes us successful is our employees? A leading wood product manufacturer is currently seeking an experienced Maintenance Supervisor for our Gardena, CA location.  This position offers an excellent compensation and benefit package including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, and Life Insurance.  The primary responsibilities of the Maintenance Supervisor is to keep the manufacturing facility and all production processes mechanically operating and producing quality products in a cost effective manner.  

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES 
•	Ensures speed of repairs, minimizes downtime, limits labor usage, avoids start-up glitches, promotes safety, provides staff training and addresses problems in a pro-active way
•	Oversees and maintains preventive maintenance programs utilizing a computerized maintenance management system to optimize asset utilization through scheduled preventative maintenance
•	Conducts regular assessment of facility needs, improvements and repairs and routinely inspects operating machinery, equipment and supporting systems
•	Maintains and repairs machinery, equipment, systems, mechanized vehicles, and building structures.
•	Schedules and oversees outside vendor maintenance and repair projects.
•	Ensures production operations by setting work priorities, supervising and assisting with repairs and maintenance schedules, installation of machinery and equipment
•	Provides emergency response including equipment repair, situation stabilization and the mobilizing of resources as needed
•	Directs maintenance staff on projects, tasks and assignments within cost and time budgets, and on schedule
•	Provides maintenance staff training and development
•	Ensures safe work practices and ensures a safe work environment
•	Verifies and ensures the documentation of all repair records, and preventive maintenance records including logging all maintenance orders. 
•	Develops new tools and techniques to improve monitoring and performance of machinery, equipment and maintenance staff
•	Oversees and monitors the scheduling and safe use of all shop equipment, and that they are in good working order
•	Resolves maintenance problems and issues by interfacing with plant management, shift supervisors, and warehouse production.
•	Thoroughly familiar with physical plant services
•	Attends and participates in production meetings
•	Monitors and minimizes down time, identifies and advocates for improvement opportunities
•	Ability to work additional hours as needed

QUALIFICATIONS
•	High School education or equivalent is required, further education preferred
•	8 years of experience working with manufacturing equipment preferred
•	2 years of supervisory experience
•	Working knowledge in operation and maintenance of manufacturing facility management and equipment maintenance
•	Must possess knowledge of OSHA and Lock-Out Tag-Out requirements
•	Must be computer literate with Office, technical parts and maintenance software packages
•	Must have the ability to plan, organize, develop, implement and interpret programs, goals, objectives, policies and procedures in a manufacturing environment
•	Ability to read, speak, and write English is required
•	Ability to speak Spanish is preferred

Work involves walking, talking, hearing, and using a variety of equipment.  Manual dexterity of hands and fingers are needed to handle or feel objects, tools and controls. Vision abilities require close vision assessments.  May be required to lift, push, pull, and/or carry up to 50 lbs. occasionally and to stoop, bend, kneel, crouch, or crawl.

Qualified candidates who are interested in leveraging their experience into a rewarding career should apply below.
 
This company is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer for females, minorities, disabled individuals, and veterans.    

EEOC Poster:  www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf

Your main mission will be to make phone calls to current customers and prospects with a great and positive service. This will lead to your ability to cross sell insurance products to our existing clients. You will learn the products and services and techniques. Your active listening and courteous demeanor will ensure that clients will know that their issues are being handled by a competent and concerned business professional. 

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT:
We offer a unique compensation program designed to reward individual effort and team performance, which we feel is at the core of our long term success. Compensation is comprised of a competitive starting rate ($10-$14/hr depending on experience) plus commissions and/or bonuses for projects. We are open to creating a flexible full-time opportunity for the ideal candidate with a history of success and leadership ability. 

REQUIREMENTS: 
- Spanish/English bilingual
- Self motivated
- Able to resolve client issues in a professional, respectful, and friendly manner 
- Able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment 
- Possess strong organizational skills including attention to detail and follow-up capabilities 
- Proficient in operating personal computers and performing routine calculations

Title: Seeking B2B Sales Professional for National Digital Marketing Agency
Description:
Are you looking for a sales opportunity with a company that is founded on openness and transparency to its small business customers and has unbeatable support and respect for its sales team?

We are an established marketing services company founded in January 2015, with roots in these services going back to 2006. Our customers love us! In just two years we've become an essential partner and advisor to our nearly 100 clients, with superior retention rates to prove it. When it comes to digital marketing providers, local businesses simply want an affordable, transparent, full-service agency that believes in a long-term relationship.

Come join us if you want to empower small businesses with their online marketing strategies, and if you want to do so on an entrepreneurial path. 

The Digital Director position is a business opportunity for independent agents who want to run their own business. When you become a digital director, you help grow your clients' small businesses by providing them with affordable marketing services to help achieve their goals. Our services include mobile-friendly websites, SEO (search engine optimization), social marketing, listing management, and PPC (paid per click) advertising.

Our Digital Directors are the powerhouses behind the success of Lightpost Digital!

We are looking for candidates who:
•	Love to sell and are motivated by closing the deal and making money
•	Have 3+ years digital advertising/marketing sales experience and want to build an independent business
•	Are a business person at heart and love helping other business owners
•	Believe in honesty and selling successful products to customers who need them
•	Possess extreme motivation to build their client base and grow their income

Digital Directors' most important activities:
•	Create one-on-one meetings with clients in your local market 
•	Meet with clients to establish their goals and marketing strategies 
•	Develop ongoing customer relationships to be responsive as their needs change
•	Attend kick-off calls to get your customers started with their marketing program
•	Keep in touch with clients to maintain a positive relationship and referral base

What we provide:
•	High earning potential and recurring income through commissions on new and past sales
•	100% self-managed schedule to make time for family, friends, and personal hobbies
•	Expert digital marketing team to fulfill your client's services
•	Experienced account management team to upsell and retain your clients
•	Freedom to take your business anywhere you desire

Becoming a Digital Director is not a job, but a professional career that gives you the ability to run your own business under the Lightpost Digital brand. There is no upfront cost and you will be your own boss with outstanding sales leadership and support from an experienced operations team. Our Digital Directors earn between $75k - $125k annually, with higher potential long-term.

Does this sound like something that you would love to do? Click the Apply button or check out our website at Lightpost Digital: 

Please email your resume and any questions by applying to this ad only and do not email to our other Directors or Founder emails you may find on our website. We appreciate the communication, but any emails not received at our careers email will be deleted due to the volume of applications we get for this position. Thanks!

Title: Home Inspection Training - Online - Earn up to $85k a year
Description:
Are you hard working, motivated, and looking for a salary which will reward you for your efforts? Want to begin profiting off the growing Colorado real estate market? Are you interested in a career in home inspection but don't know where to start? LOOK NO FURTHER. 

Axium Academy is a Denver based Home Inspector education and training company that specializes in hands-on, in-class, and online training. 

We are looking to  motivated, professional individuals. We offer a thorough education with live training which will lead to a fulfilling career in the home inspection field. During the training course, you will learn how to inspect newly built homes, old homes, duplexes and all other residential real estate. You will learn the standards, procedures and defects of inspections as well as how to avoid costly mistakes. Then finally how to put it all into the most skillful and sophisticated inspection reports on the market. From field work, to writing a report, to operating the business, we'll teach you all of it.
CALL NOW: (720) 545-0338






We are offering a FREE SEMINAR to help you make an informed decision on your future career. We host one at our downtown office every Tuesday at 5:30PM. Live attendees get a free gift! Choose from a GFCI Tester and an LED Headlight. for more details and to register for the free seminar.





We offer payment plans with every course - just 1 easy payment a month for 6 months! 
• Classes offered in varying lengths for varying prices based on what works for you.
• Certain individuals who complete the course will have the opportunity to partner with or work for Axium Inspections.
• Or begin your own inspection company with the help of Axium's marketing and sales team.
• Payment plans and discounts are available.

PARAMOUNT - 5-Day Inspection Course
 

MASTER YOUR MARKET - 2-Day Marketing Course



ONLINE ANYTIME - Online inspection AND marketing course

This complete course is available online instantly for those who are unable to attend class live or simply prefer the online education experience. This course DOES include the InterNACHI Certification, fully comprehensive training, videos, images, quizzes, homework, daily training, and much more! You can sign up and start your training instantly. Should you decide you want more hands-on training, you can add that on to your course at any time. 


Check out our website to learn more, and contact us for more information. Visit , or call today for pricing, course lists, and details about what we offer. Use discount code "Craigslist" to receive $75 off any of our courses. We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: *** AR/Finance and funding specialist/bilingual in Spanish ***
Description:
A growing and well established solar company is seeking for an outstanding candidate for their finance team. The Finance Administrator is responsible for client billing and will report to the finance Manager. This task is fulfilled through the accurate organization and tracking of funding requests, invoicing, collections, contracts analysis and a daily correspondence with our broad sales team. Heavy usage of our CRM system, Outlook, Word, Adobe Acrobat, Internet and a proprietary customized database. 

Requirements and qualifications: 
•	Construction/Solar/Home improvement invoicing and receivables management highly preferred.
•	Experience in pace programs highly preferred
•	Experience in the Construction/Home improvement highly preferred.
•	Strong communication skills
•	Ability to work in a team and independently
•	Etiquette phone manner
•	Ability to work under pressure Knowledge of CRM, Outlook, Adobe, and Microsoft  
•	Ability to work collaboratively with a team to achieve desired results.
•	Have high attention to detail.
•	Be positive, proactive, and able to always exercise great judgment and common sense.

Title: RENT UBER SUV / BLACK - Make up to $8,000 per month
Description:
***WHAT'S POSSIBLE***

Driving for Uber SUV can be a great opportunity for the right person. Our drivers make $2,000-$2,800 (gross) per week. Best drivers take home up to $8,000 per month.

***HOW IT WORKS***

We provide our drivers with one of our SUVs (commercially licensed and insured) on a weekly rental basis. 
Full-time rental: 24 hours / 7 days per week (you keep the SUV at home)
You rent your SUV from our fleet of brand new 2016 Chevy Suburbans
You will have access to uber SUV and uber BLACK customers. 
You will also have access to Lyft Premier, Lux and SUV customer.

WEEKLY RENTAL FEE: $650 per week 

(Driver pays for fuel and car wash)

***WHAT'S REQUIRED***

This job is not for every one. It's hard work. We're looking for serious drivers who are willing to put in long hours.

YOU MUST MEET THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA:

-Be over 25 years of age 
-Have clean driving record
-Valid CA drivers license 
-Provide H6 form from DMV
-Drug and alcohol free
-Maintain a professional appearance
-Have excellent customer service skills

PREVIOUS UBER SUV or LIMO EXPERIENCE IS PREFERRED.

PLASE TEXT ALEX TO SCHEDULE YOUR INTERVIEW @ (818) 900-5990 

uber, lyft, suv, limo, driver, black, uberx, los angeles, select, xl, lux, premier

Title: FIGHT FOR HUMAN RIGHTS!!! $15/HR + BONUSES
Description:
We are currently hiring passionate staff who are interested in fighting human rights violations with The Outreach Team on behalf of Amnesty International. Come work with us full-time - $15/hr., no commission.

Title: Maintenance Supervisor
Description:
Do you have facilities/wood shop machining maintenance experience?  Do you want to be a part of a company that believes that the heart of what makes us successful is our employees? A leading wood product manufacturer is currently seeking an experienced Maintenance Supervisor for our Gardena, CA location.  This position offers an excellent compensation and benefit package including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, and Life Insurance.  The primary responsibilities of the Maintenance Supervisor is to keep the manufacturing facility and all production processes mechanically operating and producing quality products in a cost effective manner.  

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES 
•	Ensures speed of repairs, minimizes downtime, limits labor usage, avoids start-up glitches, promotes safety, provides staff training and addresses problems in a pro-active way
•	Oversees and maintains preventive maintenance programs utilizing a computerized maintenance management system to optimize asset utilization through scheduled preventative maintenance
•	Conducts regular assessment of facility needs, improvements and repairs and routinely inspects operating machinery, equipment and supporting systems
•	Maintains and repairs machinery, equipment, systems, mechanized vehicles, and building structures.
•	Schedules and oversees outside vendor maintenance and repair projects.
•	Ensures production operations by setting work priorities, supervising and assisting with repairs and maintenance schedules, installation of machinery and equipment
•	Provides emergency response including equipment repair, situation stabilization and the mobilizing of resources as needed
•	Directs maintenance staff on projects, tasks and assignments within cost and time budgets, and on schedule
•	Provides maintenance staff training and development
•	Ensures safe work practices and ensures a safe work environment
•	Verifies and ensures the documentation of all repair records, and preventive maintenance records including logging all maintenance orders. 
•	Develops new tools and techniques to improve monitoring and performance of machinery, equipment and maintenance staff
•	Oversees and monitors the scheduling and safe use of all shop equipment, and that they are in good working order
•	Resolves maintenance problems and issues by interfacing with plant management, shift supervisors, and warehouse production.
•	Thoroughly familiar with physical plant services
•	Attends and participates in production meetings
•	Monitors and minimizes down time, identifies and advocates for improvement opportunities
•	Ability to work additional hours as needed

QUALIFICATIONS
•	High School education or equivalent is required, further education preferred
•	8 years of experience working with manufacturing equipment preferred
•	2 years of supervisory experience
•	Working knowledge in operation and maintenance of manufacturing facility management and equipment maintenance
•	Must possess knowledge of OSHA and Lock-Out Tag-Out requirements
•	Must be computer literate with Office, technical parts and maintenance software packages
•	Must have the ability to plan, organize, develop, implement and interpret programs, goals, objectives, policies and procedures in a manufacturing environment
•	Ability to read, speak, and write English is required
•	Ability to speak Spanish is preferred

Title: START TODAY, Make $100 cash TODAY!!
Description:
Ready to make money?  Petition season is upon us.  

We are in need of outgoing, motivated, self-starters to collect signatures from registered voters.  This is a legitimate employment opportunity. You will not be asked to pay anything to start and you will be paid based on your own success at gathering signatures. 
 
We are so confident that you will be successful, that we offer this guarantee.  If you try it, and work from 10am - 7pm, we will pay you $100 cash at the end of the first day. If for any reason your day ends early,  you will be paid $1 per valid signature.

You simply visit areas where people congregate, such as colleges, markets, and shopping centers and ask people to sign your petitions. There are no quotas. Title: Shipping/ Receiving Production for a small women's clothing company
Description:
In need of someone who is a hard worker with a high attention to detail.

Must be computer literate; Microsoft Excel, and Word Basic, organizational skills. 

Must be able to follow directions, manage time, meet goals, and work efficiently.

Key Roles and Responsibilities: 

Examine contents and compare with records; verify accuracy of incoming or outgoing shipments. 

Prepare documents and shipments for domestic and International orders using USPS, UPS, DHL and FedEx.

Record shipment data; any damages, or discrepancies for credit purposes. 

Must maintain shipping materials and supplies. 

Correspondence with establishment representatives to rectify problems, such as damages, shortages, or issues with specifications. 

Contact carrier representatives to make arrangements or to communicate special instructions for shipment and delivery. 

Daily Shipment pick-ups from UPS, as well as occasional drop-offs at Post office or Fedex locations.


Daily duties:

*Pull product, pack and ship; double-check everything.

*Accurately record and maintain inventory and security of items in warehouse.

*Update our unique inventory sheet daily; as well as our online store inventory.

**Maintain an organized, safe, and clean warehouse 

Prepare International Shipping Documents with accurate shipping information for standard shipping methods, and forwarders. Any stores with special needs. You must be able to comply.

Excellent organizational skills. Detail oriented and fast learner desired.

*** Organization is very important in this position. 

*Awesome communication and listening skills

*A minimum requirement of 2 year of warehouse or shipping experience.

PLEASE PUT "SHIPPING" IN THE SUBJECT LINE.

Include a few words on why you think you would be a good addition to our team.

PLEASE ATTACH RESUME

Title: CAMPAIGN JOBS-WORK ON BEHALF OF DOCTORS WITHOUT BORDERS! $12-$16/hour
FOOD AND BEVERAGE HOUSEMAN
Description:
Summary

The Houseman position is responsible for the set-up and breakdown of all events.  The Houseman is also responsible for the cleanliness and sanitation of the facility, focusing on the proper procedure of storage of operating supplies, constant walk-throughs of space to ensure standards and venue set-up are done according to each BEO as contracted.

Essential function
•	Maintain a safe, secure and healthy facility by following and enforcing sanitation standards.
•	Maintain an organized, clean heart of the house and all storage areas.
•	Accountable for banquet, club event and special event room set up, including tables, chairs, silverware and glassware.
•	Responsible for maintaining the cleanliness of the club inner and outer areas including parking lots, planters, windows, carpets and floors.
•	Put away all food and beverage deliveries in accordance with the "first-in-first-out" method.
•	Ensuring all personnel follows company procedures and breakage polices.
•	Conduct inventories for china, silver, and glassware.
•	Responsible for proper maintenance, washing and cleaning of food and beverage equipment.
•	Organization of furniture/equipment storage in all banquet storage areas.
•	Setup rooms according to floor plans.
•	Polish silverware and glassware and set dining room tables according to banquet event orders.
•	Assisting client with any and all needs prior to the start of their event.
•	Position duties may include any other tasks as deemed necessary by managers in order to fulfill the obligations of the club.

Reports to:
•	Director of Banquets, Upper Club or Food & Beverage Services Manager, Lower Club

Qualifications
•	High level of responsibility and professionalism.
•	Strong oral communication skills, Spanish and English preferred.
•	AV set up experience.
•	Positive attitude.
•	Strong interpersonal skills (people skills).
•	Food hygiene and food regulation knowledge is preferred.
•	Must be willing to be practically involved and lead by example.

Work Hours
This position is a part-time, hourly, non-exempt position, working a scheduled week according to demand, including weekends and holidays.

Title: Hiring Drivers For Our Playa, Century City, And Santa Monica Teams!
School LVN - ASAP Start - Great Pay $$$
Description:

This is a great opportunity for newly licensed LVNs seeking to obtain some clinical experience, and experienced LVNs seeking pediatric experience. 

If interested, please call our office at 818-539-8359 and ask to speak with William, or email your resume in response to this. 

Job Description:
-Cases are 1:1 with a pediatric student

Qualifications:

Benefits:
-Competitive pay & weekly paychecks
-Health, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
-401(k) savings plan
-Continuous professional and clinical training
-Awards and recognition programs

Title: Litigation Secretary - to $80K
Description:
Prestigious, mid-sized law firm seeks an experienced litigation secretary for its Century City office.

The position will assist several attorneys with all facets of their busy litigation practice.

Duties will include the preparation of a variety of litigation pleadings; arranging filing and service of documents; electronically filing and serving court documents as required by the court; extensive client contact including handling incoming calls, correspondence and appointments for timekeepers; creation and maintenance of files and e-files; other administrative support for timekeepers including time entry, travel arrangements, calendaring of due dates, engagement letters, audit letter responses, etc. 

Candidates must have the following;

• Exceptional litigation skills
• Minimum 5 years' experience
• Strong knowledge of all court rules, calendaring and filing procedures, including e-filing
• Strong organizational, communication and multi-tasking skills
• Formatting - including TOC's & TOA's, proofreading, and editing skills
• Advanced knowledge of MS Office is required

Firm offers a competitive salary, rich benefit package and generous bonus structure. This is a great opportunity to work with a dynamic group of attorneys. 

Please submit your resume in Word or PDF format for immediate consideration.

Title: Jr. IT Consultant and Support Representative
Description:
This position is with a growing IT consulting and Managed Services company in the Los Angeles Area.  We are looking for a Jr. IT Consultant and Support Representative who preferably has some previous consulting experience and has skills supporting both Windows and Apple products. You must possess excellent communication and customer service skills, be able to effectively multitask in high stress, fast paced environments and work independently to support high-touch executive end-users. Your primary focus will be supporting clients both in-person and remotely, by phone and/or email, as well as assisting with the maintenance of our managed services infrastructure. 

We are looking for candidates who are energetic, people orientated, well organized, dedicated, and can quickly understand new technologies and client organizational environments.

JOB FUNCTION:

The Jr. IT Consultant and Support Representative will provide a range of desktop and mobile support services to end user clients as well as triage and escalate network and security support requests.  This includes (but is not limited to) user training, hardware and software installation, application configuration and troubleshooting, basic network administration, and system documentation.  He/she will assist in maintaining client satisfaction and loyalty by efficiently solving problems and managing time and expectations effectively.  The intrinsic desire and ability to provide white glove treatment to customers is essential.

Key Qualities
o	Has knowledge of various system configurations and platforms. 
o	Able to determine the configuration for an existing system and recommend hardware and software solutions.
o	Can assess information system needs of client organization or business.
o	Possesses the ability to recommend hardware, software, applications and programs.
o	Provides consultation on special software packages and programs. 
o	Ability to adhere to company standards, including customer service, standards of excellence, IT security and business common sense.
o	Excellent written and oral communication skills, with the ability to present findings of a project/task succinctly to colleagues.
o	Understanding of corporate and client IT security policies.
o	Ability to work independently, be a self-starter and to perform research as needed.
o	Understanding of troubleshooting methodology, and resolve technical issues.
o	Strong attention to detail, while understanding the bigger picture.
o	Desire to independently grow in relevant knowledge and skills.
o	Maintain confidentiality of client identity and data.
o	Bachelor's, AA, equivalent technical degree or experience desired
o	Microsoft, Apple or A+ Certifications desired
o	Ability to pass a background check.
o	Reliable car or other personal transportation

Work activities (in no particular order)
o	Work professionally with clients, either remotely or on location.
o	Work with management and clients to define the scope, plan and fulfill various projects, including scheduling, budgeting, and resource allocation.
o	Understand a client's business, strategy, work practices to understand their needs and provide appropriate and individualized solutions.
o	Communicate with vendors to asses and evaluate their products and services or escalate support issues for existing products.
o	Assist with client onboarding of computers, mobile devices, networks or other at the direction of management.
o	Write documentation.
o	Monitor status of company and client infrastructure for connectivity, backups, logs, scheduled reports and more.  Respond in a timely manner to issues or escalating them to upper management.
o	Use software tools for computer management and remote access.
o	Participate in continuing education and training as needed / assigned.
o	Act as a technical liaison to clients as well as to augment client staff to advance projects to completion. 
o	Use company provided software tools to implement normal business fulfillment.
o	Provide Tier 1 support when needed via phone, text, email or ticketing system, with the ability to interface with staff at all levels of a client organization.
o	Participate in sales and support cycles, including phone calls and onsite meetings, and where appropriate, maintaining contact with client organizations. 
o	Participate in product demonstrations, summarize and give relevant feedback on applicability to unique situations, whether internal or for customers.
o	Research and/or testing of new products as directed.
o	Other tasks as needed / assigned.
o	Be available by phone and email during normal business hours.
o	Travel requirements include the greater Los Angeles area, with other occasional domestic travel possible.

Key Skills 
o	Ability to work under pressure and on deadlines.
o	Effectively use time and resources.  
o	Ability to determine, utilize and/or instruct on most efficient method of completing tasks.
o	Ability to troubleshoot and think logically about issues.
o	Capable of meeting high standards established by the company.
o	Able to work independently and as part of a team.
o	Ability to lead cross functional project teams.
o	Possess strong analytical and interpersonal skills.
o	Strong understanding of standard computing (Operating systems, software suites, networking, etc.)
o	Motivation to learn new skills, desire to advance.
o	Display the highest level of ethics, honesty and confidentiality.

Physical Demands and Working Environment: 
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk and hear. The employee is frequently required to walk and use hands to hold, handle and feel. The employee is occasionally required to stand, reach with hands and arms; stoop, knee, crouch and crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 35 pounds.  Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision and ability to adjust focus.

Next Steps:

If you're interested in applying for this position, send us a cover letter and resume in HTML, Text, or PDF format.  Please include a brief explanation of your professional experience, goals, interests, and why you would like to join our team.  

Please also give us a sense of your availability.

Description:

Work overtime, weekends, holidays, variable shifts, and evenings. 
Drive a vehicle in traffic continuously and safely between six and eight hours a day.
Must have a safe driving record: No more than two (2) Minor violations in the past thirty-six (36) months; No more than one (1) chargeable accidents in the past thirty-six (36) months; no Major violation in the past thirty-six (36) months.

Sitting for long periods of time from 2, 4, 8 or possibly 10 hours a day, during your shift while driving a bus. 
Must be at least 21 years of age.

Title: Amazon is hiring PT Seasonal Associates in Vernon
LOCAL CLASS A DRIVERS WANTED!!
Description:
Road Dog Drivers has exciting opportunities for local runs in the Los Angeles area. We will keep you busy, so your earnings never slow down. We want to put our drivers in ultimate positions where they are able to expand all their skills. We currently have multiple slots and runs that we are trying to fill with drivers that are eager to work and have that stability they are looking for. DEDICATED WORK but we also have supplemental work if needed. $18.00 hourly with overtime pay. Call me!! I'm Karina and I am eager to put you to work (714) 351-7504

Job description:

Driver will operating a 53 ft dry van . Driver will be delivering to local distribution centers. Drivers will be required to assist with the load as needed. At time driver will be required to push pallets to end of the truck so that they can off load from there. Driver is responsible for maintaining a log and his manifest to be turned in at the end of the shift. Smart and final requires that you be open to start at any time of the day. Loads are scheduled per day so they will receive a call between 12:30 pm - 3pm for the schedule the following day. Have AM and PM shifts available. Morning Shift usually start from 4:00 am to 10:00 am and PM shifts start from 12:30 pm to 6:00 pm. Drivers must be willing to work overtime up to 14 hours.

Requirements-
Must have at least 1 years verifiable recent driving experience in a tractor trailer
Must be at least 23 years of age
No more than a total of (3) moving violations within the last 3 years
No more than (1) suspended license for non-payment of ticket within the last (3) years
No more than (1) suspended license for non-proof of insurance within the last (3)
No more than (1) speeding ticket in a commercial motor vehicle in the past (3) years
No DUIs within the last 5 years
No more than 1 at fault accident in any vehicle in the last (3) years

Title: Outside Sales Representative (230)
Description:
ABC Supply, the nation's largest distributor of select exterior building products, is currently seeking a motivated, experienced sales professional to join its success-driven team. ABC Supply has been the recipient of the Gallup Great Workplace Award for 11 consecutive years and is proud to be an employee-first company. ABC Supply finds its success through service and is looking for a like-minded Outside Sales Representative to cultivate relationships and take its sales to the next level. At ABC Supply, Outside Sales Representatives have exclusive sales tools to enhance their success in business to business selling and have high earning potential.

As an Outside Sales Representative, you will sell residential and commercial exterior building supplies to both new and existing contractor customers.  You will manage sales relationships with your existing customers and ensure that they continue to use ABC Supply for all of their exterior building product needs. You will collaborate with your Branch Manager on ways to strategically build new relationships with prospective customers in the industry. In addition, you will provide your customers with superior service as you assist them with a full range of products and services to meet their contracting needs.


-Cultivating and managing customer relationships
-Utilizing sales reports and other data to recognize sales opportunities in customer buying patterns
-Making cold calls to prospective customers
-Following sales leads and scheduling appointments with prospective customers
-Following up with customers and providing solutions, should a service concern arise
-Providing training to customers and their teams on various product lines and services
-Assisting customers in the credit application process
-Connecting with customers to ensure that past due bills are paid and collect payments when necessary


-College degree (Business, Sales or other related field) or equivalent combination of education and experience
-Specific industry knowledge, including both familiarity with product lines and the overall building contractor process, is preferred but not required
-Proven experience in business development
-Valid driver's license, clean driving record, and own reliable vehicle
-Exceptional verbal and written communication, interpersonal and public speaking skills
-Professional appearance and demeanor
-Superior time-management and organization skills

ABC Supply values hard work and dedication and rewards its associates with an excellent compensation package. In addition to a competitive pay and commission structure, Outside Sales Representatives will receive a comprehensive benefits package.


-Health, dental, and vision coverage
-Employer paid life insurance
-401(k) with a generous company match
-Flex spending
-Vehicle allowance    
-Expense account
-Paid holidays and paid time off

If you are interested in this opportunity, please respond to this ad for further application instructions.

Title: CDL Delivery Truck Driver (230)
Description:
ABC Supply, the nation's largest distributor of select exterior building products, is currently seeking a motivated, experienced, CDL Delivery Driver to join its success-driven team. If you are a licensed CDL Driver who is looking for a rewarding, local opportunity with an established company, we want to hear from you! In this role, you will ensure the safety of each delivery from the moment you leave the facility until you have completed each job. You will make both ground and rooftop deliveries.


-Treating customers in a friendly and professional manner
-Conducting a safe work zone during each job site
-Adhering to assigned delivery schedule and following all job directives precisely
-Documenting every step of each delivery by taking and uploading photos with our camera phone system
-Using your discretion to avoid damaging job site property (particularly driveways) when unloading materials
-Obeying all regulatory agency and company safety directives
-Working in cooperation with the Delivery Material Handler to determine where to set the materials and physically unloading them
-Working in a Delivery Material Handler role to assist as needed loading products onto rooftops
-Providing warehouse support as needed
-Completing a thorough load check on your truck before leaving branch, ensuring that all delivery materials are firmly secured and all parts of your truck are in compliance with all federal, state, and local regulations
-Obeying all traffic laws and weight limits
-Completing and filing all logs and required government paperwork in a precise and timely manner
-Providing the customer with an invoice on completion of each delivery and collecting the entire due amount on COD deliveries
-This position does not require over the road travel


-Valid CDL - Class A or B
-The ability to lift 75-100 pounds repeatedly (your most common cargo will be 70 pound bundles of shingles)
-Pre-employment drug screen and random drug screens are required
-Straight and conveyor truck experience is preferred
-Hazmat experience and endorsement a plus


-Health, dental, and vision coverage
-Life insurance
-Flex spending
-401(k) with company match
-Paid time off
-Paid holidays

Description:
In a city renowned for some of the world's finest establishments, Montage Beverly Hills is the perfect setting for shopping and dining, just steps away from the famous Rodeo Drive. Must be able to lift up to 15 lbs. occasionally. Requires grasping, writing, standing, sitting, walking, repetitive motions, bending, climbing, listening and hearing ability and visual acuity. Talking and hearing occur continuously in the process of communicating with guests, supervisors and subordinates; use of these senses will occur on a constant basis.
