We are looking for an individual with passion for working with children with disabilities, a commitment to a progressive and interdisciplinary approach to education and the desire to work within a highly collaborative staff culture.

The mission of Citizens of the World Charter School- Silver Lake (CWC-SL) is to provide a socio- economically, culturally and ethnically diverse community of students in the heart of Silver Lake with an intellectually challenging, experiential learning environment that develops each student's confidence, potential, and individual responsibility as citizens of the world. Having opened in September 2010, we continue to expand as we begin our third year of operation with 381 students in grades K- 5.

Responsibilities:

1. Supports instruction to individuals or small groups of students with special needs as assigned.
2. Assists students in prescribed learning activities.
3. Monitors student behavior and utilizes approved behavior management techniques to redirect and modify inappropriate behaviors
4. Administers one-on-one ABA-based Intensive Behavior Intervention methods to designated students in a school setting.
5. Implements documented therapy plans for Behavior Intervention treatment.
6. Monitors, observes, and reports behavioral data of students according to approved procedures.
7. Performs related tasks as required.

Qualifications:

1. Completion of at least 48 semester units or 60 quarter units. Associate's degree preferred.
2. One year of paid or volunteer experience working with students with disabilities, including students with autism
3. Training in implementing Behavior Intervention techniques as well as demonstrated experience implementing Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) based behavior intervention techniques.
4. Excellent communication/interpersonal skills as well as a desire to collaborate with various different stakeholders to help develop a whole-school community.
5. Maturity, humility, strong work ethic, sense of humor, and can-do attitude.
CWC-SL is an equal-opportunity employer with a strong commitment to a diverse, multicultural staff. 

To Apply:

Interested applicants should email a resume and cover letter. In your letter please include the following: 
1. A description of your experience/accomplishments working with youth
2. Why you are interested in working at CWC-SL
3. Your short, medium, and long-term professional goals

Send materials with "Behavior Intervention Assistant" as the subject. No phone calls.

Title: Inside Sales Representative (230)
Description:
ABC Supply, the nation's largest distributor of select exterior building products, is currently seeking a motivated, service oriented professional to join its success-driven team. ABC Supply has been the recipient of the Gallup Great Workplace Award for 11 consecutive years and is proud to be an employee-first company. ABC Supply finds its success through service and is looking for a like-minded Inside Sales Associate to enhance its inside sales functions and take its service to the next level.

As an Inside Sales Associate, you will provide assistance to customers as they purchase the materials and tools they need for a wide variety of roofing, siding, and window/door replacement projects. From the moment you greet customers until their sales have been finalized, you will provide them with superior service and exterior building supply expertise. In this role, it is helpful to have experience with exterior building supplies, so that you are familiar with the various products and associated terminology.

-Answering customer questions and offering product advice
-Accepting payment and applying it to the appropriate customer account
-Arranging with the warehouse for customer product pickup
-Following-up on each delivery to ensure the shipment arrived on time with all items accounted for
-Balancing out cash drawers and preparing bank deposits at the end of each day
-Arranging product displays and layouts to maximize effectiveness
-Reordering products to keep the store and warehouse shelves well stocked
-Addressing and resolving service concerns, should they arise


-1-2 years' experience with residential roofing and siding and windows (roofing supply sales or site work with a crew) preferred
-Strong wholesale merchandising skills (including shelving and layout)
-Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills
-Solid time management and prioritization skills
-Basic computer skills
-Positive attitude and team player
-Detail and service oriented


-Health, dental, and vision coverage
-Life insurance
-401(k) with company match
-Flex spending
-Paid time off
-Paid holidays

Title: Apartment Complex Security Guards Needed $12
Description:
Job Scope
Job involves a moderate degree of complexity. Operates from established and well-known procedures typically, but may have to use a high degree of creativity in meeting the individual needs of residents. Operates independently with minimal supervision.

Job Description
1.	Provide the customer with an experience that will always be remembered and with the highest level of responsiveness.

3.	Maintain a work environment of cleanliness and organization.

10.	Assist and coordinate with new move-ins as necessary.
11.	Provide access control services and remain vigilant of non-residents and their purpose for being on property.

•	Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
•	Requires strong communication, organizational, decision-making and interpersonal skills.
•	Ability to be detail-oriented while maintaining thorough follow-through.
•	Ability to multi-task and to work well under pressure.

•	Proficiency with electronic resources such as Internet search, Outlook and Word.
•	Possess a valid state Guard Card
•	Ability to stand & walk for Long periods of time and use smartphone device functions.

Position is for Mobile Diesel Technician schedule can vary 
Position Summary: 
An Interstate Truck Center Technician will diagnose, adjust, and repair all series of motor truck and trailer equipment including, but not limited to the following: Diesel Engines, Electrical/Brake/Cooling Systems, Transmissions (manual and automatic), Clutches, Differentials/Power dividers, PTO systems, Starters/Alternators, Refrigeration systems, Air conditioning systems (including cold and hot units), Fan clutches, Engine electronics (gas/diesel), Power steering systems, and Steering gear box (manual and power). 



Major Responsibilities: 
- Perform all levels of maintenance services on truck and trailer equipment. 
- Maintain work area appearance and safety 
- Road test vehicles when necessary to diagnose malfunctions or to ensure that they are working properly. 
- Perform duties with little or no supervision and in a timely and efficient manner 
- Inspect brake systems, steering mechanisms, wheel bearings, and other important parts to ensure that they are in proper operating condition. 
- Adjust and replace brake, tighten bolts and screws, and reassemble equipment. 
- Inspect, test, and listen to defective equipment to diagnose malfunctions, using test instruments such as handheld computers, motor analyzers, chassis charts, and pressure gauges. 
- Examine and adjust protective guards, loose bolts, and specified safety devices. 
- Inspect and verify dimensions and clearances of parts to ensure conformance to factory specifications. 
- Specialize in repairing and troubleshooting of major components such as engine, transmissions and differentials, to include replacing complete assemblies, turbochargers, fuel system components etc. 
Qualifications 
- 3 years experience with tractor trailer maintenance required 
- High school diploma or equivalent required 
- Vocational/Technical or certification preferred 
- Specialized training and experience in the diagnosis/troubleshooting of major components (engines, transmissions, differentials), OEM training courses, ASE Certification, and 608/609 certifications preferred 
- Proficiency in the use of all tools of trade (including welding equipment, diagnostic equipment, hand and power tools) required 
- A valid drivers license is required 


Physical Requirements: 
- The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 
-The associate must regularly lift and /or move up to 25/lbs12kg, frequently lift and/or move up to 50lbs/ 23kg and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100lbs/45kg. 
-Specific vision abilities required by this job include Close vision, Distance vision, Peripheral vision, Depth perception and Ability to adjust focus. 
-While performing the duties of this Job, the associate is regularly required to stand; walk; sit and talk or hear. The associate is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. 


COMPENSATION
- Starting pay at $30 per hour

Title: Driver Associates Wanted - Drive & Make Money Now
Auto Mechanic
Description:
ASE Certified.Perform inspections, diagnose and perform mechanical adjustments, repairs and parts replacements for company, fleet and consignment vehicles and mechanical equipment. Additionally, provide support to auction operations by evaluating sale vehicles for the Run/Drive and Vehicle Starts portion of the auction and performing approved minor.

Key Responsibilities
•Inspect vehicles for damage, missing parts, mechanical problems and vandalism
•Diagnose problems and estimate repair costs according to appropriate guidelines
•Order repair parts as instructed and perform designated repairs (i.e. replace brake pads, rotors, radiators, gaskets, water pump, hoses, plugs, wires, distributor cap, switches, mirrors, knobs, tires, etc.)
•Perform minor electrical repairs (i.e. electrical components, power windows, power, mirrors, door locks, etc.)
•Check Run/Drive vehicles on sale day to ensure vehicles are operational or can start with jump box assistance
•Perform routine vehicle maintenance on company vehicles, fleet trucks and front end loaders (i.e. mechanical work on brakes, fuel pumps, alternators, air conditioning, oil changes, tire balancing and rotation, replacing batteries, etc.)
•Insure repair orders are completed accurately including use of current rates, labor and parts charges, and manufacturer updates and changes of vehicle requirements
•Perform other duties as assigned by manager or supervisor

Qualifications
Education & Specialized Knowledge
•High School Diploma or equivalent preferred
•Valid Driver's License and safe driving record required
•Ability to drive vehicles with standard and automatic transmission
•ASE certification
•Minimum 3 years new car franchise or auto auction experience 

SBAA offers vacation, sick, holiday, 401K and medical insurance

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: QA/QC Food Safety Supervisor
Description:
Job Summary -- Responsible for all day to day QA/QC programs and procedures
 
Essential Job Functions
•	Follow all food safety, HACCP, SQF, GMP, GLP, WHMIS, Occupational Health and Safety, and             Environmental programs.
•	Sample, test and/or arrange for outside testing of raw materials, finished goods and other additives. 
•	Perform product, packaging, label, and documentation inspections as required.
•	Establish and implement laboratory SOPs for calibration and testing.
•	Conduct and follow up on findings from CCP, GMP and other quality audits to maintain standards in the plant.
•	Approve and enter all testing results to track raw material and finished goods and prepare COAs for customers as needed.
•	Develop and maintain the SQF Manual and conduct training on food safety programs for all employees as required.
•	Responsible for maintaining and updating the SQF Manual and quality systems programs and verifying and validating of the systems and processes.

Education/Training & Experience 
•	Food processing quality background with three years' experience is required
•	Understanding of HACCP, SQF, federal food safety regulations. 
•	Supervisory experience in food manufacturing is preferred.
•	SQF practitioner certification is preferred or the willingness and aptitude to obtain one.  
•	Must be able to read, write and perform basic math and have keyboarding skills for data input.  
•	Demonstrated participation and leadership in plant quality assurance programs is necessary.


Qualifying individuals, please fax or e-mail your resume.
Fax # (818)896-3237

Title: Office Manager
Description:
Summary:
Initiates, coordinates, and executes administrative support for Base Camp and Restaurants. 

Responsibilities:
•	Answers and screens telephone calls in a professional and timely manner; takes accurate messages with a high degree of 
       professionalism and courtesy; arranges conference calls.
•	Exercises considerable judgment, confidentiality and discretion in handling requests for appointments, meetings, calendars 
       and telephone calls; coordinates calendars ensuring all parties are informed of and kept in communication as changes occur.
•	Prepares and distributes agendas and other meeting materials, reserves and prepares facilities, and records or transcribes 
        meeting minutes as needed.
•	Coordinates any IT needs for the Base Camp.
•	Distributes daily internal/external mail; handles all delivery logistics with currier services; sends and distributes faxes.

        memoranda to team members, guests and vendors as needed.

        with retention and shredding services.

Title: Social Work-Service Coordinator
Description:
SCLARC is looking for highly motivated, results oriented and dedicated employees.  

POSITION OBJECTIVE/SUMMARY:  Provides case management services for an assigned caseload.  Works closely with consumers and/or their families.  Communicates with staff, vendors and the community.  Organizes and resolves work-related situations.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATION REQUIRED FOR THIS POSITION:  Minimum qualifications include a BA/BS/BSW or MA/MS/MSW degree from an accredited college or university in Social Work, Psychology, Human Services, Special Education or related field required plus two years of professional experience working with developmentally disabled consumers.  Case management experience required to provide services to special needs population.  Qualified candidates must have good client interview skills, assessment skills, and excellent interpersonal skills, and be available to make community contacts.  Bilingual English/Spanish skills preferred.

GERNAL STATEMENT OF FUNCTIONS:  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBLILTIES include the following.  Other duties may be assigned.  Contacts assigned consumers and documents; contacts according to established SCLARC Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and policy, and completes required documentation.  Prepares case transfers as needed.  Attends all unit, division, supervision, staff and in-service training meetings as required.  Attends all Planning Team meetings at primary programs and any other consumer related special meetings/hearings (e.g. SCAN, court, IEPs/IFSPs staffings, mental health, governmental/community agencies, placement etc.) as required.  Handles officer-of-the-day (OD) duties as required.  Handles confidential information and adheres to Welfare and Institution (W&I) codes.  Consults with appropriate specialists regarding the service needs of consumers.  Maintains effective working relationships with top management, peers and staff.  May act as Program Manager in his/her absence.

Title: Online SAT and ACT Tutor for International Students
Description:
ArborBridge is an educational services firm that has pioneered the most scientific and personalized tutoring in the world. Our methods are rooted in the newest advances in technology, pedagogy, and neuroscience.  

We offer a full range of one-on-one programs grouped into three categories:
1.	GMAT, GRE, SAT, ACT, and SAT Subject Test preparation 
2.	ISEE, SSAT, and other high school entrance exams 
3.	K-12 academic tutoring and skill building, including supporting students with learning differences 

ArborBridge is committed to hiring energetic, engaging, top-level college graduates, especially those with advanced degrees, who have a passion for education.  





We are currently hiring online SAT/ACT tutors in the U.S. who are available to work with international students in various time zones.

**This position requires a flexible schedule and an interest in tutoring during odd hours, including early mornings and late evenings.**

A sample tutoring schedule might look like this:
•	Tutor a student in London at 8pm GMT on Wednesday (12:00pm PT Wednesday).
•	Tutor a student in Mumbai at 9:30am IST on Thursday (9:00pm PT Wednesday).
•	Tutor a student in Beijing at 11am CST on Sunday (7:00pm PT Saturday night).


Tutors hired for this position may also receive additional assignments during regular tutoring hours with students in the U.S. Flexibility is a must!


•	Top-level college graduate
•	Minimum commitment through the end of the current school year
•	Complete mastery of both SAT and ACT content   
•	Successful test prep tutoring experience supported by references  
•	Knowledge and use of successful teaching strategies and techniques  
•	Ability to incorporate technology into a tutoring session 
•	Passion for teaching and learning  
•	Experience with web conference technology   
•	A computer with a webcam  
•	Reliable access to a high-speed internet connection 

A typical commitment to one student ranges from 2 to 6 hours per week. We are primarily looking for tutors who will be able to take on multiple students and can commit to a total of 10 or more hours per week. Tutors determine their own programs and schedules, and tutoring takes place online. 


-Flexible hours: You set your own schedule
-Competitive pay: $45/hr, plus pay for administrative tasks
-Opportunity for growth: ArborBridge is a quickly growing company, and the majority of internal full time hires from the last year have come from our existing tutor pool.
-Professional development: ArborBridge's internal staff is made up of some of the most experienced educators in the world. You will become a better tutor and educator by working at ArborBridge.   
-Support: You are never alone as a tutor with ArborBridge. In addition to working with the internal staff on how to best educate your students, ArborBridge creates and fosters a close-knit tutor community.

Title: Hiring Drivers For Our Mid City and Playa Vista Teams, Tips $$!
BEVERAGE TECHNICIAN
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:
Perform on-site installation, service, preventative maintenance, site surveys, repair and service on a variety of beverage dispensing equipment at customer locations and facilities. Provide customer support activities for equipment. Serve as on-site customer contact on technical and service related problems. Instruct customers in proper use and operation of equipment. Assure highest level of customer satisfaction and drink quality.


RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Receive dispatched service calls via dispatcher, cell phone, voice mail or other company methods and ensure prompt response.
- Perform service calls, diagnose and repair reported service issues and all other problems encountered, perform a beverage quality check (ratio/brix, temperature and taste). 
- Assess if equipment can be repaired or make recommendations for replacement.
- Perform preventative maintenance as needed.
- Train customers in maintaining equipment as required. Report any misuse of equipment to supervisor.
- Follow up with account until call is completed and update manager/supervisor, other technicians and dispatcher as necessary to assure customer satisfaction.
- Close out all calls with dispatch upon completion in a timely manner.
- Report all service activities accurately on invoice/service orders at the completion of every call. 
- Complete and submit all other pertinent information required by supervisor/manager in a timely manner.
- Responsible for maintaining accurate parts and equipment inventories. Maintain specified levels on hand as required.
- Responsible for keeping vehicle clean and organized inside and out and scheduling routine vehicle maintenance.
- Operate and manage company issued vehicle, tools and equipment in accordance to company guidelines.
- Report & track receipt of goods for direct shipped parts.
- Support dispatcher in routing and prioritization of calls as needed.
- Travel throughout the region to assist with other projects as necessary.
- Act as liaison between manager and sales team keeping them informed and updated regarding customer concerns.
- Identify areas of opportunities (i.e., flavor changes, new product additions, competitive presence, etc.) as it relates to customer concerns and customer growth activities. Communicate opportunities to manager and sales cross-functional partners as necessary.
- Understanding and completion of all applicable safety programs and processes.


EXPERIENCE / REQUIRED SKILLS:
- Prior experience with beverage dispensing equipment strongly preferred
- Prior beverage, refrigeration, plumbing and/or HVAC experience  
- Must be able to respond in a timely fashion to all service requests issued.
- Assist with refurbishment of equipment in warehouse/shop environment.
- Accurately maintain and manage both equipment and parts issued.
- Basic mechanical aptitude required. 
- Must have the ability to apply basic skills and techniques to perform tasks and resolve routine questions and problems.
- Must have basic computer and data equipment skills.
- Flexibility to work on-call shifts, occasional weekends and varying work schedules

Title: Warehouse/Batch Maker
Description:
Warehouse/Batch Maker

We are a manufacturing facility of lubrication and greases seeking a F/T Batch Maker/Warehouse employee.  This is an entry-level position for an individual who pays great attention to detail and is able to follow instructions provided by management without constant supervision.

Job Functions:
• Follow production schedules & instructions.
• Maintain confidential information pertaining to production, customers, vendors, etc.

• Strong communication skills.
• Bi-lingual a plus, but not required.

This is an entry-level position with potential for growth.

Title: START TODAY, Make $100 cash TODAY!!
Description:
Ready to make money?  Petition season is upon us.  

We are in need of outgoing, motivated, self-starters to collect signatures from registered voters.  This is a legitimate employment opportunity. You will not be asked to pay anything to start and you will be paid based on your own success at gathering signatures. 
 
We are so confident that you will be successful, that we offer this guarantee.  If you try it, and work from 10am - 7pm, we will pay you $100 cash at the end of the first day. If for any reason your day ends early,  you will be paid $1 per valid signature.

Here is how it works:

You simply visit areas where people congregate, such as colleges, markets, and shopping centers and ask people to sign your petitions. There are no quotas. You will not be asked to sell anything, and there is no fundraising. You are paid based on the number of signatures you collect, so you determine how much money you make.

Current signature gatherers are generating $125-300 per day, which can add up to $1500 per week.  Career petitioners can make upwards of $100,000 per year!

There is no experience necessary. You create your own schedule.  Work full time, part time, any hours you want. You can collect signatures anywhere, including your own neighborhood. 

If this sounds like the job for you, please call 323-495-8061 immediately to get started!!

Title: SUPERSTAR WAREHOUSE WORKER NEEDED
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
Company: Awesome Office, Inc. (Parent Company of SnackNation)

Position: Fulfillment/Warehouse Specialist

Location: Carson, CA

Reports to: Fulfillment Manager

Direct Reports: None

Salary: $10-$12 per hour DOE part-time

 

In just over a year, SnackNation has quickly become the market-leader in connecting the millennial generation with healthier snacks from the most innovative natural food brands in the world. As a one-of-a-kind marketplace for businesses (B2B) across America, SnackNation is changing the way people eat and drink in the office.


Oh and for every box of snacks we deliver, SnackNation donates ten (10) meals to Feeding America - partnering with this amazing organization on a mission to eliminate hunger in the US.
 

We are always on the lookout for passionate, intelligent, and driven people to help us build a better company/products, serve more customers, and produce more "magic." 

 

ROLE

As part of the warehouse team, you will play a significant role in delivering a world-class customer experience. This is a unique role, with a unique and fast-paced company, in a brand new facility. We work hard/play hard, and the right candidate can look forward to a truly Awesome culture and environment.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

So what are we looking for? Right now we need 2 to 3 part time individuals to join our warehouse and fulfillment team. Job duties may include some or all of the following:

Typical Duties Include:

Warehouse:

Receiving and slotting freight
Warehouse organization
Product pulling
Inventory counting
Racking and fixture setup

Fulfillment:

Picking product for the fulfillment line
Packing boxes
Assembling boxes
Shipping products to our Members
Quality assurance

It's a warehouse, and fulfillment center so there are a million things to do! Given our growing nature, people often wear multiple "hats" so someone willing to roll up their sleeves and jump in to any task is critical to the role.

So who are we looking for?

Energetic: Physically and mentally you should bring energy to the team. This is CRITICAL.
Coachable: You must be willing to listen and learn and be open to new concepts and ideas. You should have a "thirst" for learning.
Integrity: You understand what honest and transparent mean, and you value doing the things you say.
Reliable: You not only show up everyday ready to support the team, you also consistently give perfect effort; you do not simply "turn it on" one day and not the next.
Flexible: You are ok with an ever-changing environment and your role constantly evolving.
 

 SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS

1 - 2 years in a warehouse, fulfillment, or distribution environment. (For the right candidate other relevant experience and/or incredible character may supplement for this requirement).
Working knowledge of computers and Microsoft programs
Comfortable learning new technologies
Knowledge of Google applications a plus
Experience in prepackaged foods or CPG environment is a plus
Solid understanding of shipping and receiving best practices
Basic mathematics skills
Working knowledge in various pick/pack methods
Ability to stand for long periods
Ability to lift up to 50lbs on a regular basis
Ability to twist, squat, kneel, bend on a regular basis
 

Requirements (non-negotiable and must be verifiable):

Must have a High School Diploma.
Must be 18 years or older.
Must be legal to work in the United States.
Must be able to meet physical requirements of the job provided reasonable accommodations.
Must speak and write English fluently.
 

ABOUT SNACKNATION

In just over a year, SnackNation has quickly become the market-leader in connecting the millennial generation with healthier snacks from the most innovative natural food brands in the world. As a one-of-a-kind marketplace for businesses (B2B) across America, SnackNation is changing the way people eat and drink in the office.
 

Oh and for every box of snacks we deliver, SnackNation donates ten (10) meals to Feeding America - partnering with this amazing organization on a mission to eliminate hunger in the US.
 

Come join our team!

PLEASE USE THIS LINK TO APPLY!!!

Title: Full-Time Bookkeeper Needed
Description:
Apply Now: 

Full-Time Bookkeeper needed for Business and Accounting department of International Contemporary Art Gallery near Culver City.
Duties include, but not limited to the following:
ACCOUNTING:
Maintain all bookkeeping procedures with precision for the gallery including accounts payable and accounts receivable
ACCOUNTS PAYABLE:
Communicate with all departments in the gallery to obtain approvals on invoices and all pertinent information to correctly assign the costs to accounts, artworks, etc.
Correspond with vendors regarding invoicing, sales tax and payments
Entry of invoices into QuickBooks, organization of all invoices unpaid, pending payment, and paid
Generate monthly expense reports for all gallery staff holding a company credit card
Review and enter all expenses into QuickBooks
Reconcile credit card statements for monthly closing procedures
Maintain physical files of all expense reports and corresponding receipts
ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE:
Enter client payments into QuickBooks.
Create bill for artist payments and commissions based on receipt of client payment for work.
Ensure that information in QuickBooks matches that in Artbase
Enter book sale payments for in-gallery book sales and for online and phone sales and maintain records of sales
Enter all other AR payments regarding cost reimbursements such as art shipping and storage for clients
CASH REIMBURSEMENT & PER DIEM REPORTS:
Receive and process cash reimbursement and per diem reports from staff
Enter report data for the Director of Business Operations to review and provide reimbursements or apply unused funds to payroll

A minimum of 3 -5 years' experience and knowledge of Quickbooks is required. Knowledge of Artbase and/or Filemaker is a plus. You will be working in an open office space with 3 people (Director of Business Operations and two Staff Accountants) and a dog or two. We need someone who is intelligent, focused, conscientious, meticulous, analytical and enthusiastic about organizing and overhauling our filing system, with the goal of migrating to a more paperless office. A sense of humor is a huge plus.  Generous benefit package, including health and vision insurance. Please submit a cover letter or statement of intention. Short diagnostic test may be issued, as part of the interview process.
Please, no recruiters. We will only accept direct applications.

Apply Now:

Title: Project Engineer
Description:
Harder Mechanical, founded in 1934, is one of the oldest continuously operating mechanical construction companies in the United States. We are recognized as a leader in high-tech, industrial and commercial construction, successfully managing projects throughout the United States. We have been consistently ranked among the top 50 subcontractors by Engineering News Record.

We have immediate openings in our Portland (Oregon), Phoenix (Arizona), Reno (Nevada), Salt Lake City (Utah), and Richmond (California) locations for a Project Engineer. This position offers an excellent opportunity for growth. We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a professional work environment. Qualified individuals are invited to apply in confidence, include a cover letter, resume, and daytime phone number.

Experience:
It is preferred, that candidates have 1-3 years' experience, working for a mechanical contractor as a project manager or project engineer. Excellent organizational, time management, written, verbal and computer skills, MS Office. High School Diploma, Four year (4) degree preferred. 

Responsibilities: 
This position will provide services such as planning, estimating, scheduling, and material procurement. 

Respond directly to this craigslist ad to submit your resume. For more information about Harder Mechanical, please visit our website www.harder.com 

Harder Mechanical is an Equal Opportunity Employer with a strong commitment to a safe and drug-free workplace.

Title: Medical Assistant
Description:
Beautiful medical/cosmetic practice in the South Bay seeking a positive, personable, experienced and hard-working individual to join our growing practice. 

Note:  After reading the following job description, if you feel you are the right person for this position, please submit the following:

- A cover letter explaining why you feel you are the right person for the job.
- A complete, up to date resume, showing dates of employment at current/prior positions.
- A current photograph, for identification purposes only, to be attached to your resume.

Job Description  

This position involves both back and front office responsibilities.  We are seeking an individual that must be passionate about providing outstanding patient care at all times. The perfect candidate must be a great team player. The position requires excellent communication and listening skills. This person must be able to multi-task, must be able to provide the highest quality customer service, treat patients with friendliness and respect, be able to work independently. Computer literacy and ability to quickly learn medical terminology and software are essential.

Back Office Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

-Getting patients in the room.
-Taking vitals
-Getting patient information.
-Prepping patients.
-Setting up rooms for procedures.
-Assisting on procedures.
-Applying dressings.
-Room turnover.
-Sterilizing equipment
-Making sure inventory is stocked and up to date.

Front Office Job Responsibilities:

-Greeting patients as they come in the door.
-Answering telephones in a cheerful fashion.
-Scheduling patients.
-Ensuring patients complete proper documentation for appointments.
-Checking insurance benefits.
-Calling and confirming upcoming appointments.
-Transmitting correspondence via FAX, Email and mail.
-Taking payments.

We look forward to hearing from you and reviewing your resume!

(**NOTE:  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and we encourage all well qualified applicants who meet the above described criteria to submit their resume for review.  We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.)

Title: WE NEED SOLID REMOTE SALES PEOPLE. GREAT MONEY!
Description:
We are a very busy tax resolution firm looking for great sales people to work from home.  Now don't be scared by the word tax,  it not as boring as it sounds.  We will train you to be great if you are willing to listen.  The tax sales industry can be very lucrative.  Top people make well over 200k per year.  It doesn't happen overnight and there is a learning curve. But if you are trainable and you can control a conversation, you might be great at this.  This is an assumptive consultative close.  THIS IS NOT A CUSTOMER SERVICE CLOSE.  So you have to be able to talk to people the way you would talk to a younger sibling, with conviction and confidence.  If you can do that, we want to hear from you.    
Here is the drill.  We pay a 3k base guaranty VS commission.  We don't start you out remote.  If you have never sold tax, we do require to work from our office here in the San Fernando Valley or our Irvine for a few months, to properly learn our sale.  Once we are confident with you and your skills, it's off to home you go.  We have weekly Skype meetings and ongoing education and training. 
If this sounds like something you're interested in, please email us a resume and a small paragraph about yourself.  Emails without resumes will be ignored.  We look forward to hearing from you.  Thanks and Good Luck!!!

Title: ABA BEHAVIOR THERAPISTS & CASE MANAGERS
Address: West LA, Orange County and surrounding areas
Description:
Are you interested in working with children and young adults, while furthering your career in Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)? 

Bridge for Kids has openings for Behavior Therapists and Case Managers in Los Angeles, West LA, Orange County and surrounding areas. 

We are a reputable company that strives to maintain quality treatment and adheres to BACB ethical guidelines.

Bridge for Kids provides services based on the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) to children with Autism and other developmental disabilities, and typically developing children requiring assistance.

We provide services to children from birth to 22 years of age. Our Behavior Therapists work with children in their home, school, and the community. We utilize evidence-based ABA techniques including Discrete Trial Training (DTT), Pivotal Response Training (PRT), Incidental Teaching, Natural Environment Training (NET), and Verbal Behavior to aid in skill acquisition.

Description:
-Provide 1-on-1 behavior intervention services in the home and community setting
-Participate in program development with Clinical Supervisor
-Conduct parent training in session and inform them about behavioral techniques
-Collect on-going data necessary to determine improvements in behavior 
-Utilize session time appropriately to target all skill areas and guide parent training components
using Parent Education Task Analysis
-Enter raw data/data summary into data file/excel spreadsheet and graph data as instructed
-Complete client timesheet at the end of session
-Communicate with Clinical Supervisor in regards to items required for session, questions about
programming, and any parent concerns.
-Respond to communication from Clinical Supervisor, Clinical Director or Case
Administration, immediately
-Participate in all Staff Meetings to review clinical or administrative issues and training
-Case Manager positions require a Masters degree - BCBA, LMFT, or LCSW credential preferred

Requirements:
-Must have an associate's or bachelor's degree in ABA, education, psychology, child development, or related field
-Must have availability from 3 - 8 throughout the week (earlier availability and weekends a plus)
-Looking for at least a one year commitment
-Experience working with children (children with special needs preferred)
-Valid CA driver's license and reliable transportation.
-Pass a DOJ Clearance
-Hard working, energetic, eager to learn

Benefits:
-Competitive hourly wage
-Paid training
-Mileage reimbursement
-Weekly and monthly bonus opportunities
-On-going training and mentorship from BCBA-level staff
-BCBA supervision
-Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance

Fluency in Spanish is an asset!

Please submit your resume today. We have caseloads available, immediately!

Title: General Manager - Jimmy John's - Seeking Rockstars
Description:
We are looking for a Rockstar who is highly energetic with a killer work ethic and an awesome attitude!

The GM manages all functions of a Jimmy John's restaurant and is responsible for the effective execution of fast, accurate orders to ensure world-class customer service while maintaining a clean, organized shift.  Reports to Area Manager.

What We Provide: 

¬	Competitive base pay 
¬	Profit based bonuses  
¬	Excellent higher level management advancement opportunities
o	 We are growing fast so Rock Star General Managers have the opportunity to become Area Managers
¬	A fun fast paced work environment and a growing business 
¬	Great food that you can be proud to serve 

Duties and Responsibilities:
•	Manage a staff of approximately 50 employees. 
•	Assigns, oversees and evaluates work, recommends promotions, transfers, or termination of employees.
•	Delegates and is responsible for the ordering, receipt, storage and issuing of all food, labor, equipment, cleaning, and paper 
        supplies for the unit to ensure a minimum loss from waste or theft.
•	Route deliveries and serve drivers to maximize delivery business and speed.
•	Completes daily food preparation (opening procedures, meat and vegetable slicing, bread production).
•	Completes daily and weekly paperwork.
•	Daily account reconciliation.
•	Audits previous shift's systems and procedures for 100% integrity and completeness.
•	Completes preventive maintenance and upkeep on store's equipment and supplies.
        Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
•	Must be able to read and write and communicate in English.
•	Position requires bending, reaching, stooping, climbing, repetitive motions, cognitive skills, standing and moving about the unit 
        the entire workday.
•	Must be able to lift 50 pounds.
•	Must have a valid driver's license, reliable transportation, current automobile insurance, and a clean driving record.
•	Must have the stamina to work a minimum of 50 hours a week.

Special Requirements:
•	Willing to work overtime, holidays, weekends as business dictates.
•	Ability to establish priorities, work independently, and proceed with objectives with minimal supervision.
•	Ability to handle and resolve customer issues.
•	Ability to handle and resolve employee issues.
•	Skills to use a personal computer and various software packages (Word/Excel).
•	Ability to handle stress and high-volume operations.

For more information about Jimmy John's visit us at www.jimmyjohns.com.

To apply, reply by e-mail with resume to jobs@gourmetguysllc.com

Through an extensive portfolio of local and regional brands, the Company dispatches approximately 500,000 tows, manages over 300,000 impounds and sells over 60,000 vehicles annually across the United States.

Title: Senior Billing Coordinator - International Law Firm
Description:
We are currently seeking a Senior Billing Coordinator for our Century City office. This individual will work to develop relationships with assigned partners and secretaries and create individualized billing plans according to partner preference. Essential functions include but are not limited to: understanding and administering billing guidelines or protocols provided by the client, maintaining any necessary database to ensure accurate billing information, reviewing, editing and submitting complex bills, and preparing a variety of billing activity reports. The Billing Coordinator will be expected to customize billing formats as necessary and participate in a variety of special projects related to upgraded and best practices. If you are looking to join a very congenial firm that truly values and takes care of their employees, please apply for prompt consideration.

This is an ideal opportunity for an accomplished billing professional with leadership qualities. 

Qualifications:
 -Bachelor's Degree
 - At least 4+ years of solid experience processing complex bills in a mid to large scale law firm
 -Must have experience with Aderant CMS or Elite
 -Must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills

Firm offers full comprehensive benefits (medical insurance, PTO, 401k, etc.) to accompany very competitive salary.

Title: Experienced  Medical Front Office Receptionist Needed
Description:
***PLEASE NO PHONE CALLS ABOUT THIS JOB. Email is our PREFERRED way of communication, or you can fax your resume at 562-427-2219***

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

We are a physical therapist-owned physical therapy clinic specializing in the care of orthopaedic and sports medicine patients since 1984. For more information regarding our facility, you can visit our website at www.reischlpt.com.

We are currently accepting applications for a full time Front Office Receptionist. This is an important position in our clinic, providing support to the staff and patients as well as medical companies and other representatives. Our work environment is fast-paced, challenging and exciting. The qualified applicant will be trained for front desk and other office and clerical duties. 

JOB QUALIFICATIONS
Excellent customer service and phone skills. Must be able to handle a high number of calls efficiently and can answer and direct inquiries.
Good computer knowledge 
Should present a friendly and professional appearance at all times
Excellent telephone skills, pleasant phone voice and can handle complaints 
Ability to multi-task and should have a keen attention to detail
Must have a strong initiative, eager to learn, must be able to work independently while being a team player
Some college coursework preferred and work experience in a medical setting is also preferred but not required
Spanish speaking applicant is a plus

JOB DESCRIPTION
Provides front desk duties which includes but is not limited to:
-Schedules patients for appointments and monitors no shows and cancellation list
-Answers multi-line phones, transfer and screen calls
-Inputs billing information
-Contacts insurance companies for verification of benefits and authorization
-Ordering and maintaining supplies
-General filing and other office organization and clerical duties. Administrative office duties will be developed with time

BENEFITS
We recognize our employees to be our most valuable asset. Qualified applicants will receive paid time off: holidays, sick and vacation hours. Salary will be based on individual experience.

Title: Realtor / Property Research
Description:
Now seeking agents, contractors, and investors for Berkshire Hathaway HomeServices California Properties! 
What differentiates us from other companies is the opportunity we have to use in-house money to invest into real estate. We have what is called The "MAP Program" which allows you to completely purchase a property with our money.
 
 We typically look for fixers, foreclosures, short sales, ect.. The company purchases the home cash, puts up all the money for renovations, (No Liability to you, no money out of your pocket) and when the house is sold, you split the total profit 50/50 with the company. 

All you have to do is find the property to flip, and do the research. There is a lot of money to be made, so if you are looking to make a great earning, give us a call! 

 Also, If your client is having trouble selling their house due to cosmetic issues, and the condition of the home is outdated but they want to sell for more, you can borrow money from our company to invest into their property in order for it to sell quicker, and for more money. By you offering this fixer program, your client must agree to the full 6% commission to you, or we won't loan the money. 

 The seller pays back the money for the renovations when the house is sold (from the back end money). There is no other firm right now that offers this program, therefor you ultimately have the advantage over other agents to get the listing. 
 Call me directly to set up an appointment to get started with our program. 

 Anjianna Grasso
Berkshire Hathaway HomeServices 
949-527-8206

Title: LAZ Parking-NOW HIRING SHUTTLE DRIVERS IN LOS ANGELES!!
Description:
The US spends $160 Billion per year on highways. Every new car model costs at least $1 Billion to develop. Yet cars spend only 5% of their time driving. Where do these cars spend the other 95%? PARKED! 

LAZ Parking is one of the largest operators in the growing multi-billion dollar US parking industry. Founded in 1981, LAZ operates hundreds of thousands of parking spaces from offices all across the country. When it comes to parking, we're the experts! 
Most importantly, LAZ is a PEOPLE FIRST company with a mission to "create opportunities for our employees and value for our clients". If you're looking to join a growing company led by passionate people committed to being the best - contact us today! 

The Spirit of the Position: The Driver effectively, efficiently and safely transports customers when necessary. 

Principal Job Duties:
•	Greet customers, be responsive and timely with correspondence and problem resolution, display a caring attitude, and develop a rapport with the customer base. 
•	Assist customers with general information about local area. 
•	Safely drive and maintain company vehicles when applicable. 
•	Promote good customer relations by consistently providing premier customer satisfaction with a friendly demeanor, can-do attitude, and willingness to help at all times. 
•	Other related duties as assigned.

Requirements:
•         Must be at least 21 years old
•         Must have a valid CDL Class B license
•         Must have 2 forms of a valid Medical Examination Report.
•         Will be required to be DOT drug & alcohol tested.

Education:
•	High school diploma or GED required. 

Experience:
•	Strong customer service experience. 
•	Experience driving 20+ passenger vehicles is preferred. 
•	Parking industry experience is preferred but not required. 

Skills:
•	Ability to communicate professionally and effectively. 
•	Ability to speak, read, and be able to comprehend the English language. 
•	Must be open to feedback, differing opinions and other points of view. 
•	Demonstrates a sense of urgency and timeliness. 
•	Demonstrate the ability to seek improvement. 
•	Excellent teambuilding and interpersonal skills. 
•	Ability to drive a standard transmission. 
•	Knowledge of how to operate various types of motor vehicles. 
•	Ability to produce and maintain an acceptable driving record and unrestricted commercial drivers' license (CDL is required). 

Physical Demands:
•	Willingness to work in the elements - heat, wind, snow, rain, etc. 
•	Ability to lift, push and pull at least 25 pounds. 
•	Ability to stand, walk and run for extended periods of time. 
•	Ability bend, stoop, squat and lift frequently throughout a shift. 

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with qualified disabilities to perform the essential duties/functions.

Title: Guest Services and Ticketing Manager
Description:
Us: 
The Mt Baldy Ski Lifts offers scenic rides on chairlift #1 and dining at the Top of the Notch Restaurant year-round; tent-cabin camping, zip lining, inner tubing, and skiing and snowboarding on an additional 3 chair lifts are offered seasonally. We're a small organization with a start-up-like mentality for getting things done. We have a unique opportunity to cross-train and develop individuals often, possibly making your hopes of working in an office or restaurant as well as out on the mountain a reality. Founded in 1952, with a rich history, the Lifts comes to the table with a lot to teach. We're a team of go-getters with the best commute in the area. Join us. 

You: 
You should embrace day to day tasks with enthusiasm and handle every part of your corner with discipline while jumping into other areas, when called upon, happily. You're willing to learn the idiosyncrasies of an historic business and won't be easily bogged down. We need you to be a major doer. We like to say, talk less and do more. You're an outdoor enthusiasts of some sort and enjoy spending time in your local mountains. You have reliable transportation and might even have some certifications like CPR, First Aid or Cal OSHA. Over all, you just enjoy sharing the mountains with people.

Position Summary:
The Guest Services Manager is responsible for managing ticketing activities and providing an excellent customer experience.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
The essential functions include, but are not limited to the following:

- Schedule Ticketing Cashiers & Guest Services Associates using "When I Work"
- Ensure that guest inquiries brought to the Mt Baldy Ski Lifts Service Network are handled within a timely manner and to a premium level of service
- Service Network includes but is not limited to: answering phone calls, responding to phone messages, responding to written messages via email, and responding to social media messages, comments and inquiries.
- All inquiries to the service network should be responded to immediately and not later than 24 hours
- Must utilize  a thoughtful and caring approach when dealing with guest service issues while maintaining the company's policies as a top priority in remedying issues
- Maintain an up-to-date list of FAQs and answers for addressing the ever-changing situations that the seasons, operation status, weather and various promotional products offered bring to the Guest Services and Ticketing Department
- Train Ticketing Cashiers & Guest Services Associates as it pertains to the operations, opening & closing of the department, as well as answering inquiries brought to the service network
- Be the first line of communication to the service network until it is agreed upon with the General Manager that others within the department can be employed to do so
- Perform other duties as assigned

Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities):
- Two years of previous Management experience required.
- Bachelors degree in business or related field.
- Minimum of five years experience in customer service; previous ski industry experience preferred.
- Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.
- Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.
- Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
- Knowledge of principles and processes for providing guest and personal services. This includes guest needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of guest satisfaction.
- Knowledge of administrative and clerical procedures and systems such as word processing, managing files and records, stenography and transcription, designing forms, and other office procedures and terminology.

Physical Demands and Work Environment:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions.While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands or fingers, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is often required to stand; walk; sit; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

 mtbaldyresort.com/employment/guest-services-ticketing-manager/ ‎

Title: LAZ is hiring Valets! You can interview from the comfort of your home!
Description:
**Hours Available:  Part-time, full-time and weekends

Hiring Valets for Los Angeles, West Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, Woodland Hills, Playa Vista, Pasadena & Malibu!

The Spirit of the Position:

Do you love driving cars? Meeting new people? Are you energetic and fast on your feet? Well then, we are looking for you. We are hiring Valet Attendants to woo our customers while parking their cars in a professional and responsible manner.
A LAZ Valet Attendant plays a significant role in the success of the company. They are the first person our clients and customers see upon arrival, and the last person our clients & customers see when they depart. A warm welcome, smiling face, and professional demeanor are of the utmost importance.

What Will I Do?
•	Park and retrieve cars like a champ. This means carefully, efficiently, and in a timely manner. 
•	Greet all customers by name, take care of their needs, and develop a rapport with each person driving up to your stand.
•	Help direct traffic to keep the flow of cars clean and organized, all with a smile on your face! 
•	Provide a self-reliant attitude when needed. 
•	Must be able to work with or without supervision.
•	Promote awesome customer relations. 
•	Smile, go above and beyond, make them love LAZ Parking the moment they meet you.

You Are:
•	Dynamic. You're charismatic, full of energy, and happy to help in any way you can.
•	Dependable. Responsible is your middle name. You never disappoint because it's not in your nature. 
•	A good driver with a driving record to prove it. You don't speed, you're cautious - ESPECIALLY with other people's property. You can also drive a standard transmission. Vroom, vroom!
•	Good under pressure. You don't fold and get overwhelmed easily. Instead, you prefer chaos so you can kick its butt.
•	Good at communicating and have the ability to speak, read, and comprehend English easily.
•	A team player. You're open to different opinions and can help motivate your team.

Requirements:
•	High school diploma or GED required.
•	Strong customer service experience.
•	Parking industry experience is preferred but not required.

Physical Demands:
•	Willingness to work in the elements -- heat, wind, snow, rain, etc.
•	Ability to lift, push and pull at least 25 pounds.
•	Ability to stand, walk and run for extended periods of time.
•	Ability to bend, stoop, squat and lift frequently throughout a shift.

Title: Customer Service / Print Shop
Description:
LA Prints West Hollywood is seeking a part-time digital print operator / customer service representative . We are a locally owned and operated, full-service print and marketing communications company..


All candidates must possess excellent organizational and problem solving skills, and be able to work in a fast-paced environment with little to no supervision. Candidates must also have the ability to run equipment operations that are controlled via computer interface that requires the ability to navigate through multiple computer screens to quickly and efficiently solve problems. 
You must meet the ergonomic and physical requirements for the position which includes lifting (up to 50 lbs.), standing, bending/stooping. 

MUST have print-shop experience 

As a Digital Print Operator you will be expected to:

•	Operate and complete all digital printing (B&W/Color) production for maximum production efficiency.
•	Operate basic bindery equipment, including cutters, padders, coil-binding equipment, etc...
•	Ensure required resources are available in order to complete job (media, files, job ticket, etc.). 
•	Submit, release, and print jobs to the digital press/large format equipment. 
•	Print press proofs for sign-off and run job according to job ticket specifications. 
•	Evaluate output and make adjustments to obtain a desired level of image quality. 
•	Be proficient with the use of Command Workstation to control digital workflow
•	Respond appropriately to fault, error, and alert messages on the equipment. 
•	Troubleshoot problems that occur during job submission or the printing process. 
•	Ensure proper paper handling, conditioning and loading. 
•	Calibrate the system to maintain optimal color output.
•	Answer in-coming calls and general information inquiries.
•	Other duties as assigned

We prefer someone with computer software experience (Adobe Creative Suite, Acrobat & Microsoft Office Product) in a prepress environment with experience in digital color control, color manipulation, and experience/knowledge of variable digital printing and digital color management software. 

A high school diploma or GED is required. Qualified candidates must demonstrate strong reading, math (basic), and mechanical aptitude. 


PAY/HOURS
- $11/hr
- Looking for up to 25 hours per week to start, can be flexible with your schedule

Please submit resume via email: service@laprintswesthollywood.com ...(NO CALLS)

Title: LAZ is hiring Valets! You can interview from the comfort of your home!
Description:
**Hours Available:  Part-time, full-time and weekends

Hiring Valets for Los Angeles, West Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, Woodland Hills, Playa Vista, Pasadena & Malibu!

The Spirit of the Position:

Do you love driving cars? Meeting new people? Are you energetic and fast on your feet? Well then, we are looking for you. We are hiring Valet Attendants to woo our customers while parking their cars in a professional and responsible manner.
A LAZ Valet Attendant plays a significant role in the success of the company. They are the first person our clients and customers see upon arrival, and the last person our clients & customers see when they depart. A warm welcome, smiling face, and professional demeanor are of the utmost importance.

What Will I Do?
•	Park and retrieve cars like a champ. This means carefully, efficiently, and in a timely manner. 
•	Greet all customers by name, take care of their needs, and develop a rapport with each person driving up to your stand.
•	Help direct traffic to keep the flow of cars clean and organized, all with a smile on your face! 
•	Provide a self-reliant attitude when needed. 
•	Must be able to work with or without supervision.
•	Promote awesome customer relations. 
•	Smile, go above and beyond, make them love LAZ Parking the moment they meet you.

You Are:
•	Dynamic. You're charismatic, full of energy, and happy to help in any way you can.
•	Dependable. Responsible is your middle name. You never disappoint because it's not in your nature. 
•	A good driver with a driving record to prove it. You don't speed, you're cautious - ESPECIALLY with other people's property. You can also drive a standard transmission. Vroom, vroom!
•	Good under pressure. You don't fold and get overwhelmed easily. Instead, you prefer chaos so you can kick its butt.
•	Good at communicating and have the ability to speak, read, and comprehend English easily.
•	A team player. You're open to different opinions and can help motivate your team.

Requirements:
•	High school diploma or GED required.
•	Strong customer service experience.
•	Parking industry experience is preferred but not required.

Physical Demands:
•	Willingness to work in the elements -- heat, wind, snow, rain, etc.
•	Ability to lift, push and pull at least 25 pounds.
•	Ability to stand, walk and run for extended periods of time.
•	Ability to bend, stoop, squat and lift frequently throughout a shift.

**Click here if you would like to do the first interview from the comfort of your home:    **

**Click here to complete the online application & interview in person :  


FLSA Status: Non-Exempt
To be hired, all candidates must pass a background check and pre-employment drug screen.
LAZ Parking is an equal opportunity employer. In all our employment practices, including hiring, we are firmly committed to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, genetics, Vietnam era, special disabled, recently separated and other protected veterans, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. No question in our application process is used for the process of limiting or excluding any applicant's consideration for employment on such grounds.

Title: Experienced Office Administrator/ Sales Support
Description:
Smart Innovations Inc.
Office Administrator/ Sales Support

About the Job
Manage daily operations/scheduling and act as the liaison between the company staff, outside sales agents and clients. The successful candidate will be a highly organized self-starter with strong computer skills, have the ability to interact with individual (at all levels) in a fast paced environment, sometimes under pressure, remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful and efficient, with a high level of professionalism and confidentiality. Expert level written and verbal communication skills, strong decision making ability and attention to detail are equally important.

About the Company
Smart Innovations Inc. is an import manufacturer with over 20 years of tenure providing innovative products that create value to the retailers we supply. We manufacture housewares, kitchen electrics & licensed general merchandise. Our organization is rooted in entrepreneurial endeavors where creativity, hard work & dedication are rewarded. 

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Responsible for entering new purchase orders, on time shipping of existing purchase orders and preparation of samples for presentations 
• Collaborate and act as liaison with other company executives, outside sales agents and manage relationships with multiple internal and external contacts
• Act as an ambassador, responding to incoming calls, mail and customer service requests
• Audit, proof & compose written material on products and services for collateral, ad copy & marketing material
• Actively manage and oversee the auditing of company website.
• Complete various tasks and special projects as assigned.

REQUIREMENTS:
• 3+ years of working as an office/admin administrator with positive, verifiable references.
• Must have a positive "can do" attitude and work well with others as part of a team.
• Must be extremely organized, have consistent attention to detail and be able to multi-task in a fast paced environment.
• Must be comfortable with making decisions and have excellent problem solving skills.
• Intermediate knowledge of QuickBooks, Excel, Word, E-mail, Internet and Windows based computer operations.
• Experience in the Consumer Packaged Goods or Importing/Manufacturing for retail industries is a plus.
• Strong project management skills with a track record of successful execution.
• Proactive and thoughtful; anticipates needs and takes action, able to function independently.
• Exceptional organizational, written and oral communication skills.
• Customer Service experience.

Please send your resume and salary history for immediate consideration.

Title: sweetgreen Sunset Strip: LOOKING FOR NIGHT/WEEKEND AVAILABILITY!
Description:
Do you want to make an impact and be a part of something big? Sweetgreen is looking to hire individuals with food prep experience to be a part of the opening team for our newest LA location: Sunset Strip!

Sweetgreen is a culinary lifestyle brand dedicated to smartly-sourced, seasonal food, and to the commitment of living the sweetlife! Our food is delicious, healthy, and transparent, and we work with like-minded farmers and growers who value sustainability. 

Position Overview:

As a team member you will be an ambassador of the sweetlife and sweetgreen's core values. You will be responsible for interacting with our guests and making sure that our in-store processes run as smoothly as possible. Title: Wave Coordinator
Description:
Job Summary:
The Wave Coordinator creates and coordinates workflow batches ("waves") of customer orders within the PKMS Manhattan application.   Using customer SLA's and order priorities, the Wave Coordinator prioritizes and selects orders to be released and processed in the fulfillment center.  The Wave Coordinator will assist the Operations team in communicating and coordinating the processing of waves through the facility and resolving exceptions in the shipment of customer orders.  Will set up and execute wave planning rules in PKMS/Manhattan WMS.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES

Review order pool and daily backlog to plan & release PKMS/Manhattan waves based on priorities and according to daily schedules and/or demand requirements.
Research and communicate to appropriate team members wave/order related issues that are encountered during waving that are processing barriers which require resolution such as lock codes, inventory availability or pending in process tasks.  
Continually monitor wave status and process flow to minimize impact and ensure wave/order shortages are re-processed and reconciled through current wave shortage processes, within SLA & targeted goal time frames. 
Communicate shortage trends or issues while waving, monitor wave shortage percentages to maximize complete order fill rates and identify opportunities for improvement and resolutions in partnership with Operations.
Manage special requests such as expedite, special handling instructions, etc., to support the brand & customer experience. 
Produce and maintain reports such as wave tracking throughput, wave cancellation rates as required; research order shipments.
Coordinate timely wave throughput by communicating with various processing department's leader including replenishment, picking, sorting, and packing teams.
Suggest improvements to the waving process to improve efficiencies and support any IT implementations or releases that are planned & executed.
Requirements

Advanced computer skills, proficient using Microsoft Office suite including Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint & Access
Experience with PKMS/Warehouse Management Systems
Excellent communication skills, verbal and written, able to communicate with multiple levels of business partners
Strong decision making skills & problem solving abilities,  analytical thinking and detail oriented
Very dependable, team player, able to work in a demanding fast paced environment
Strong organizational , planning, time management and multi-tasking skills
Positive attitude, self-motivated, able to work independently
Strong leadership skills - ability to give direction and follow up with peers;
Ability to perform in a high-energy, fast-paced, SLA driven environment.
 

 

Diversity Vision Statement: 
We are committed to creating an inclusive environment that welcomes and values the differences among all of our associates, customers, suppliers and the communities in which we live and conduct business. We are an equal employment opportunity of minorities, females, protected veterans and the disabled.

We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment, and treating our associates and applicants without discrimination on the basis of their race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected factor.

Title: Social Media Coordinator
Description:
LOCAL APPLICANTS ONLY. IN-HOUSE POSITION.
We are an online digital marketing agency focusing on local businesses in Los Angeles. We believe that a healthy local economy plays a major role in strong communities. Our small team fosters growth and encourages constant learning.

We're looking to add a part time or full time Social Media Coordinator to our team. Our ideal candidate is a creative thinker who can help a company grow through engaging posts. You're also someone who is creative, fun, self driven, and organized. 

You'll be handling multiple accounts and multiple platforms, the joy in that is getting to understand different industries and local businesses. But this role is for someone who is organized and self sufficient and preferably someone who has handled more than one or two accounts at a time.

Must have experience driving campaigns for social media platforms like Instagram, Facebook, Pinterest. 

Your role:
You'll be creating the social media campaigns with original ideas. Bonus points if you know photography and can edit your photos. Must be comfortable with client facing, during photo shoots, marketing meetings, etc. 

We have a wide spectrum of clients and are looking for someone who can easily mold to each client and is willing to work with every department.

Please email a resume and brief cover letter, including successful social media campaigns and efforts. We want to see the details in how you helped a campaign succeed or how you grew an account and fostered engagement.

Title: Legal Settlement Negotiator
Description:
Consumer Law Experts, PC is a rapidly growing and innovative law firm. We are a fast-paced, high volume lemon law firm looking for a hard-working, motivated *Settlement Negotiator* with 2+ years of experience in legal settlement negotiations.

The position primarily involves dealing with the major vehicle manufacturers to settle client lemon law claims on a pre-litigation basis.

Ideal candidates will have excellent communication skills, writing, and analytical skills, as well as the ability to work independently. Candidate should have strong advocacy skills and a competitive spirit. Experience in negotiating legal settlements is required... bonus if that experience is within Lemon Law, Personal Injury or the like. Bi-lingual English/Spanish is a plus.

This full-time position entails:
* Creative negotiation approaches
* Extensive communications with defense counsel/representatives 
* Maximizing client recovery and firm legal fees
* Handling a high volume case load
* Thorough and detailed organization skills
* High proficiency with Word, Excel, and Outlook

We offer competitive compensation packages which include participation in our group PPO health plan and retirement plans.

We are currently located in West Los Angeles and are moving to a much larger and more awesome office in the middle of September off Century Blvd, west of the 405 freeway.

Title: Mold Inspector / Home Inspector
Description:
An established mold inspection company is looking for someone to bring someone on board to complete residential and commercial inspections for indoor mold growth. We perform visual assessments and indoor air quality testing to determine whether or not a property has elevated levels of mold and offer advice on what needs to be done in order to fix it. We do NOT perform remediation, just inspections. 

This is a subcontractor position but we will provide you with everything you need to get started including training for the right individual. Ideal candidate will have experience with home inspections, water damage restoration, mold remediation, plumbing, HVAC, general contracting, handyman or really anyone with a general understanding of home building. Other people that we have had success with are realtors and sales people as it tends to compliment those with a flexible schedule. 

Pay is minimum of $100 per inspection and each inspection takes about an hour or so plus 20 minutes of finishing reports at home. Pay increases depending on how many samples are taken at each property, average per job is $150 and we are doing about 5-10 jobs / week right now in LA.

Please respond with a resume or at the very least a detailed email with your background. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Water Conservation Program Instructors: Part-Time & Flexible
Description:
The Wildwoods Foundation is seeking passionate and experienced educators to deliver a water conservation education program to schoools in the greater LA area. Once trained, applicants are assigned programs based on school reservations. This is a part-time job.

 
A Drop in the Bucket is a water conservation education program serving Los Angeles schools, grades 4 - 6.   The program is offered free to all schools via a mobile unit that delivers the program to schools campuses, as well as at the Vista Hermosa Park in downtown Los Angeles.






•	Enjoy working with children.
•	Possess excellent group facilitation and group management skills. 
•	Be available to work near downtown Los Angeles, anytime Monday -- Friday, between the hours of 7:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. September 2017 through mid-June 2018.  
•	Have experience conducting outdoor or environmental education programs with elementary school aged children, and/or experience conducting similar programs with families and groups.
•	Have knowledge and understanding of basic scientific principles, especially ecology and regional habitats. 
•	Be comfortable with active, physical work outdoors. 
•	Have a professional manner with clientele (teachers and parents). 
•	Submit to and pass a background check. 
•	Provide references upon request.
•	Have reliable access to transportation. (Bikes don't count.  Sorry.)
•	Be flexible and comfortable with last-minute schedule changes. 
•	Have reliable access to email and cell phone. 
•	A clean driving record is required for assignments that require use of company vehicles.


 Instructors will be responsible for the delivery of a 90-120 minute educational program for elementary school classes and families about water in Southern California.  Instructors will be responsible for the maintenance of all program supplies and materials and will notify Program Coordinator of any needed re-stocking or repair.

 
•	Likely applicants will have teaching experience and/or experience leading groups at camps or outdoor schools.  
•	Applicants should have interpretive (as a naturalist or docent) or formal environmental education experience with elementary and middle-school aged children.  
•	Applicants should have experience leading cooperative and team-building games and experiential education activities.  
•	Applicants should have an understanding of Earth Sciences at the elementary and middle-school level.  
•	Applicants should also possess knowledge of regional environmental and socio-economic/eco-justice issues.  
•	Applicants should possess the ability to adhere to a written curriculum and maintain program continuity as well as the ability to accurately pace program activities and stick to a set schedule. 
•	Spanish language skills are helpful. 
•	Familiarity with systems thinking is attractive.
•	All applicants reaching the interview process will be required to submit to a background check.  


  This is a part-time job.  The shortest of workdays, including program set-up and clean up, is at least 4 hours.  Most assignments occur during the school day.  There are a few afterschool and weekend assignments available, if desired.  Programs continue through the end of the school year (June 2018).  

Our offices are south of downtown Los Angeles, however "report to" destinations may be anywhere in the greater Los Angeles region.

$16/hour

Qualified applicants should respond with cover letter and résumé (detailing relevant past experience) via email addressed to Program Coordinator at info@WildwoodsFoundation.org. 

Position is open if post is active.

Only people selected for interviews will be contacted. All resumes received will be held on file for consideration for 12 months from date of receipt. Inquiries from direct applicants only preferred - 

Please note: The Wildwoods Foundation is a project of Community Partners, a non-profit, public benefit 501c(3) corporation, and operates as an equal opportunity employer. This job description is general in nature and is not designed to contain or to be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications of the position.
