Title: School Security Guard
Description:
We are currently looking for a full-time security officer for Campus Security Officer. (2 Locations)

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Campus security officers promote lawful behavior and protect the welfare of students, faculty and staff as a uniformed presence on campus. A campus security officer performs foot patrols of campus to monitor behavior, secure buildings and property, investigate disturbances, maintain order during events and enforce regulations. They monitor the physical safety of campus buildings by locking and unlocking doors, patrolling or monitoring using surveillance systems, and reporting suspicious behavior. Many are also tasked with enforcing traffic and parking regulations, when necessary.

In emergency situations, campus security officers respond to the scene, provide first aid, and alert emergency personnel as appropriate. They maintain radio communication with other safety personnel and officers on campus, helping to coordinate emergency plans. They also write and submit incident reports to public safety supervisors or law enforcement agencies as appropriate. Other duties may include monitoring alarm systems and responding to alerts, training additional security officers and serving as crowd control at special events.

HOURS:
Various. 

REQUIREMENTS:
Must demonstrate excellent customer service skills and the ability to interact with a diverse group of people.
Must have good moral character and integrity.
Must have good hygiene and be able to wear a uniform in a professional manner.
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Must be able to professionally represent our company and the client company.
Must be willing to submit to criminal background checks and drug screen.
Must be at least 21 years of age.
Must have reliable transportation options.

EDUCATION:
Must have High School Diploma or General Education Degree.

LICENSE AND CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:
Must have a valid California ID or DL.
Must have Social Security Card.
Must have original current Guard card.
Must have Baton Permit.
Must have Chemical Agent Permit.
Proof of 40hr AB 2880 training required.

EXPERIENCE:
At least two (2) years security experience preferred. 

IF YOU MEET THE ABOVE CRITERIA, AND ARE INTERESTED IN JOINING OUR TEAM, PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR RESUME AS AN ATTACHMENT ALONG WITH A GOOD CONTACT PHONE NUMBER. 
ALL REPLIES TO CANDIDATES WILL BE MADE BY PHONE - NO E-MAILS WILL BE SENT

Title: Project Architect
Description:
We are currently looking for a Project Architect to join our award winning team.  As our reputation grows, so does our need for skilled and passionate industry leaders who thrive on collaboration and believe deeply in design's ability to elevate the human experience.  

At GGLO, we believe it's both the opportunity and responsibility of design to play a lead role in creating and sustaining community - to design places where our clients' clients prosper.  To that end, our approach is focused on improving the relationship between people and place. Our Architects, Interior Designers, Landscape Architects and Urban Designers work across scales and project types to create holistic neighborhoods, blocks, buildings, and public places.

Professional Knowledge & Responsibilities
•	Exceptional knowledge and proven ability to put together 5+ story wood frame buildings
•	Ability to effectively manage team members to maintain positive interaction while sustaining quality and meeting quality expectations
•	Technical expertise in components of materials and detailing
•	Proven knowledge of code regulations governing the industry 
•	Mentor less experienced staff

Technological Expertise
•	Demonstrated proficiency with Revit, Adobe Creative Suite, SketchUp and Windows OS required
•	Experience with Deltek Vision a plus
•	Proven history of excellent interpersonal, leadership, communication and presentation skills
•	Understands all aspects and phases of the architectural production process
•	Understands and responds to the technical implications of design decisions

Who are we looking for?  The individuals we need must be licensed, LEED accredited (BD+C or ND) is preferred, and will have at least 5 years of professional experience. Demonstrated proficiency with Revit. Experience working on multi-family experience preferred.

Our employees are a talented mix of individuals who embody every aspect of an integrated practice, who are catalysts for community through an integrated, research based approach with sustainable design competency as a prerequisite.  We offer the opportunity to align your long term career goals with a variety of projects and clients while working with Principals from multiple markets.  

Our salary ranges DOE and we offer an excellent benefit's package!  We offer the opportunity to join one of Seattle Business Magazines 100 Best Employers to Work For, activities such as our Thursday Crit's, Emerging professionals, and weekly lunch 'n' learns. Other benefits include formal and informal mentorship, ORCA pass, bike parking and bike use, flexible schedules, casual dress code, employee development programs including paid training, licensure reimbursement, paid vacation, paid holidays,  medical, dental, vision, 401K with matching, and more.

Send your resume and condensed portfolio (5MB or less) today and a brief paragraph of the requirements you fit, be sure to include your salary requirements.  

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Water Conservation Program Instructors: Part-Time & Flexible
Description:
The Wildwoods Foundation is seeking passionate and experienced educators to deliver a water conservation education program to schoools in the greater LA area. Once trained, applicants are assigned programs based on school reservations. This is a part-time job.

 
A Drop in the Bucket is a water conservation education program serving Los Angeles schools, grades 4 - 6.   The program is offered free to all schools via a mobile unit that delivers the program to schools campuses, as well as at the Vista Hermosa Park in downtown Los Angeles.






•	Enjoy working with children.
•	Possess excellent group facilitation and group management skills. 
•	Be available to work near downtown Los Angeles, anytime Monday -- Friday, between the hours of 7:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. September 2017 through mid-June 2018.  
•	Have experience conducting outdoor or environmental education programs with elementary school aged children, and/or experience conducting similar programs with families and groups.
•	Have knowledge and understanding of basic scientific principles, especially ecology and regional habitats. 
•	Be comfortable with active, physical work outdoors. 
•	Have a professional manner with clientele (teachers and parents). 
•	Submit to and pass a background check. 
•	Provide references upon request.
•	Have reliable access to transportation. (Bikes don't count.  Sorry.)
•	Be flexible and comfortable with last-minute schedule changes. 
•	Have reliable access to email and cell phone. 
•	A clean driving record is required for assignments that require use of company vehicles.


 Instructors will be responsible for the delivery of a 90-120 minute educational program for elementary school classes and families about water in Southern California.  Instructors will be responsible for the maintenance of all program supplies and materials and will notify Program Coordinator of any needed re-stocking or repair.

 
•	Likely applicants will have teaching experience and/or experience leading groups at camps or outdoor schools.  
•	Applicants should have interpretive (as a naturalist or docent) or formal environmental education experience with elementary and middle-school aged children.  
•	Applicants should have experience leading cooperative and team-building games and experiential education activities.  
•	Applicants should have an understanding of Earth Sciences at the elementary and middle-school level.  
•	Applicants should also possess knowledge of regional environmental and socio-economic/eco-justice issues.  
•	Applicants should possess the ability to adhere to a written curriculum and maintain program continuity as well as the ability to accurately pace program activities and stick to a set schedule. 
•	Spanish language skills are helpful. 
•	Familiarity with systems thinking is attractive.
•	All applicants reaching the interview process will be required to submit to a background check.  


  This is a part-time job.  The shortest of workdays, including program set-up and clean up, is at least 4 hours.  Most assignments occur during the school day.  There are a few afterschool and weekend assignments available, if desired.  Programs continue through the end of the school year (June 2018).  

Our offices are south of downtown Los Angeles, however "report to" destinations may be anywhere in the greater Los Angeles region.

$16/hour

Qualified applicants should respond with cover letter and résumé (detailing relevant past experience) via email addressed to Program Coordinator at info@WildwoodsFoundation.org. 

Position is open if post is active.

Only people selected for interviews will be contacted. All resumes received will be held on file for consideration for 12 months from date of receipt. Inquiries from direct applicants only preferred - 

Please note: The Wildwoods Foundation is a project of Community Partners, a non-profit, public benefit 501c(3) corporation, and operates as an equal opportunity employer. This job description is general in nature and is not designed to contain or to be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications of the position.

Title: Maintenance Engineer Department  - Boilers License Required- Hiring!!!
Description:
CALL NOW !! 714-509-0711  
¡¡SE HABLA ESPANOL !!

*****  Maintenance Engineer - Boilers License Required  *****

Angelica Corporation, the leading supplier of linen and laundry services to hospitals in the healthcare market has openings for Maintenance Engineers at our commercial laundry facility. 


The Maintenance Engineer is responsible for the overall maintenance of all equipment. The position performs preventive maintenance on all production & supporting equipment. 

PLEASE CLICK ON THE LINK BELOW TO COMPLETE AN APPLICATION AND BE INTERVIEWED 
 


Duties/Responsibilities: 
•	Troubleshoot, support & repair of all production equipment 
•	Determine material, parts, and equipment to be used for repair, installation and stock. Communicate same to Chief Engineer 
•	Coordinate and participate in scheduled/preventive maintenance on all production equipment 
•	Install, inspect, repair and maintain the mechanical, electrical and other related systems in all production and supporting departments 
•	Inspect, operate and maintain steam, heating, cooling and water treatment systems in entire plant
•	Complete all necessary documentation as described under company guidelines. Must comply with all company safety rules and policies 
•	Must be able safely and accurately operate Mig, Tig, and Stick welding equipment


Qualifications
 Minimum Qualifications:
•	Valid City of Los Angeles Stationary Engineer license 
•	Minimum 5 years industrial/commercial maintenance experience, with strong problem solving skills
•	Ability to effectively communicate (both written and oral). Bi-lingual a plus 
•	Ability to read and troubleshoot electrical schematics at basic level 
•	Must have basic hand tools - sockets, wrenches, screwdrivers, multimeter, etc. 
•	Must be able to lift 50 lbs or more.
•	Quality orientation and high attention to detail
•	Able to manage multiple tasks and priorities and easily adapt to changing situations 
•	Strong teamwork skills- ready and willing to work closely with team members 
•	Open to and able to work day or night shifts, and willing to rotate shifts depending on need 
•	Open to long hours and working weekends (Sat/Sun) 

Work Environment: 
This position exists within an office and service center environment, including hot, noisy, and wet conditions. This position requires constant walking throughout the service center, lifting and carrying of tools and equipment exceeding 50 pounds. Within the service center environment, there is constant potential exposure to hazards including noise, rotating equipment, electricity, confined spaces, chemicals, steam under pressure, climbing, working in positions above and under equipment, working at heights in excess of four (4) feet, and throughout and outside of the facility. Pushing/pulling of laundry carts with weights of 250 lbs is common with some cart weights exceeding 600 lbs. Safety toe shoes are required and other personal protective equipment may be required depending on work assignments.

*****  Maintenance Engineer - Department - (Los Angeles) - Boilers License Required  *****

:

Beyond Grades. Beyond Tests. Beyond Tutoring. 


We are seeing a talented, self-motivated, and dynamic Sales Support Specialist to join our growing company. The Sales Support Specialist's primary responsibility is to train, support, and increase efficiencies of our sales representatives with the ultimate goal of helping our sales team meet their quotas.



Our ideal candidate is an experienced professional with knowledge of sales and sales support best practices and can perform well in a team environment and have exceptional people skills.

Title: Accountant
Description:
UCLA is recruiting an Accountant III to join their team.


UCLA is California's largest university and a model for public institutions of higher education with a tradition of advancing higher education and the common good through excellence in scholarship, research and public service. As one of Southern California's top five employers, UCLA is the workplace of more than 42,000 people and contributes $12.7 billion to the economy. Innovation at UCLA has produced an active portfolio of almost 3,000 inventions. More than 140 companies have been created based on technology developed here.

Benefits are an important part of your total University of California compensation package. In addition to being an integral part of your UC compensation, benefits provide peace of mind for you and your family members in almost every area of life, ranging from medical coverage to disability insurance, a day care reimbursement plan and college savings plan, all the way up to retirement. UC offers a wide choice of retirement savings options, including an attractive pension plan. UCLA retirement/benefits/pension (UCRP) reciprocates with CalPERS. For more information please visit the following sites: 
  and 


Under the broad direction of the Accountant IV, this individual substantially contributes to preparing the University's annual financial report, prepares annual UCLA financial schedules, maintains and supervises the integrity of the Financial System, its account code tables, and coordinates the fiscal closing schedule for the campus and General Accounting. The Accountant III is responsible for the financial administration of General Funds, Application Fee Funds, Differential Fee Funds, and monitoring programs funded with state support. This individual will monitor the application of accounting principles of activities. The Accountant III will analyze new accounting treatments and recommend appropriate solutions. The Accountant III will prepare various annual financial statements and reports. In addition , the Accountant III performs other functions as assigned and supports the General Accounting activities of Corporate Financial Services and the Campus.

 
•	Demonstrated working knowledge of accounting principles theory sufficient to make the correct budget and financial journals to achieve desired results.
•	Demonstrated working knowledge of Fund Accounting and to be able to review the General Ledger, input documents, and recognize errors.
•	Demonstrated ability to prepare financial reports for a large complex organization in accordance with policies and accounting principles.
•	Skill in analyzing information, problems, practices, or procedures to:

•	Ability to evaluate impact on workload or upcoming and proposed changes in policies and procedures.
•	Creativity and initiative to develop workable solutions to problems when answers are not readily apparent.
•	Ability to keep abreast of changing University regulations and federal and state laws pertaining to self-supporting activities.
•	Skill in analyzing accounting systems (departmental or central) and recommending necessary changes to improve processes while maintaining sound accounting practice.
•	General knowledge of mainframe-based financial computer systems sufficient to understand flows of transaction data and recommend enhancements.
•	Written communications skills to prepare clear and concise correspondence, reports and procedural documents at a level appropriate for the intended audience.
•	Demonstrated competence in accounting and business practices to advise department professionals engaged in self-supporting activities regarding cost-effective management of their financial affairs.
•	Skill in utilizing tools such macros or SQL queries to analyze financial data.
•	Skill in utilizing personal computer spreadsheet and word processing applications to prepare reports and presentations and to analyze financial data.
•	Excellent communications skills to correspond with various levels of university personnel and external groups to convey complex financial information to non-financial types and to deliver oral presentations to groups of various sizes.
•	Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with staff in Corporate Financial Services, with accounting office staff at the campuses, and with the Office of the President at Oakland.
•	Ability to work independently in setting priorities to ensure that reports are accurate and deadlines are met.
•	Ability to adjust working hours and if necessary, work overtime to meet the needs of the Office.
•	Skill in performing efficiently amid frequent interruptions and/or distractions; ability to work efficiently and effectively in the midst of diversified responsibilities and changing priorities.
•	Degree in Accounting or equivalent experience and 3-5 years' experience or equivalent education and experience.		


•	Working knowledge of the UC system.

The University of California is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age or protected veteran status.

UCLA is a Tobacco-Free environment. For more information, please view the policy at  www.tobaccofree.ucla.edu

Key Words: Senior Accountant, Staff Accountant, Financial  Accountant, Full Cycle Accountant, Fund Accountant, GL, account reconciliations, financial statements, public accounting, Big 4

Title: ILS Instructor
Description:
Looking for an Armenian speaking Independent Living Skills (ILS) Instructor with experience in
the Los Angeles, Glendale, Pasadena and surrounding areas. 
An ILS Instructor provides one on one training in the community and the homes of persons with a developmental disability. The training you would provide generally includes the areas of:
* Medical issues including researching, building relationships and following up with doctors, dentists and medical health professionals.
* Money Management issues including developing and living within a budget and paying bills.
* Community services including addressing Social Services issues, researching and using County Department of Public Services, obtaining and managing IHSS services, meeting court and/or diversion requirements, obtaining housing in the Los Angeles area, and researching and using substance abuse/addiction programs and food banks.
* Parent Education including training parents in working with medical, educational and other professionals, the court and Child Family Services.
Website: www.actinc.info
Required Abilities:
*Ability to communicate well in English, both written and oral
*Ability to establish and maintain interpersonal communications and relationships, while maintaining personal and professional boundaries.
*Ability to interact with people from diverse backgrounds and with different levels of ability.
*Ability to assess, document and recall situations as well as an eye for detail.
*Ability to follow procedures and meet timelines.
*Have a working automobile with insurance.
Spanish speaking a plus.
Employee Type: Full-Time Availability Required: 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.
Will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles
Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.

Title: Luxury Fashion Company Seeking Full Time Stock Associate
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

	Timely execution of the receiving process.
	Organize the storage room floor and stock areas. 
	Unload and unpack new merchandise shipments, and prepare them by folding, hanging, or stacking
	Deliver new merchandise to the appropriate department for placement in main office or supply room.
	Organize and maintain merchandise in stockrooms
	Collect damaged merchandise from designated areas and accurately complete required paperwork
	Perform other duties as assigned
	Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality in all assignments

JOB REQUIREMENTS 

	Ability to read and interpret documents such as memos, safety rules, policies and procedures. Ability to communicate effectively with peers and management
	Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator
	Reasoning Ability:  Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple priorities, and learn new procedures. Ability to work as part of a team, but also able to complete tasks independently with little supervision
	Physical Demands: Position may include frequent lifting, bending, reaching, and the use of ladders and other equipment
	Other Skills: Demonstrates an energetic and positive attitude
	Work Hours: Full Time Monday-Friday 9AM to 6PM, may vary slightly depending on the needs of the business.
	MUST HAVE RELIABLE CAR 

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a diverse environment.

Title: HVAC Service Technician
Description:
Precise Air Systems Inc. is a customer focused heating and air-conditioning company that was established in 1975.  We serve the greater Los Angeles area with air conditioning and heating systems, as well as offer maintenance, repair, cleaning, and consulting services, for residential, commercial and industrial properties. Our top priority is to be the best.  We treat every project, regardless of its size and budget with the same care, consideration and attention to detail.
 
We are seeking an HVAC Service Technician who will be responsible for providing timely repairs of customers' products (either industrial, commercial, or residential) while maintaining the highest level of customer service.  This position will require the Service Technician to work independently, but also with other Service Technicians as needed. 
 
Job Duties/Responsibilities:
Diagnose and repair HVAC equipment and work with the Service Manager to give the customer an accurate estimate of the cost and time line of repair
Works with warehouse manager to ensure all material needed for the job is provided and informs Service Manager of any discrepancies and or issues related to job completion
Installs new HVAC systems and related accessories according to safety and manufacturer's specifications
Removes any equipment necessary for the installation of new HVAC product and material according to manufacturer's specifications
Cleans up work areas, including any areas that were utilized for the installation process
Ensures complete protection of customer's property by installing and servicing Heating Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) equipment and material in a safe, professional and expeditious manner
Maintains the highest level of service standards and communicates openly with Service Manager to assist as needed with resolving HVAC customer issues
Performs other duties as assigned by Service Manager
Conducting point-of-work sales of IAQ services, unit components, unit replacements, add-on units, and residential service contracts
Conducting non-service work in support of the IAQ and Installation Departments, as assigned
Inputs all data in company system electronically
 
Job Qualifications:
Candidate must provide his or her own tool/instruments for this position
Complete knowledge of all tools, equipment and materials used to perform services on Heating Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) units
Ability to communicate, read, understand and apply written text of a technical nature in order to answer questions, solve problems, make decisions or complete job tasks
Ability to read, write and speak English and communicate effectively and clearly, both orally and in writing, with co-workers, managers and allcustomers
Ability to travel up to a 90 minute radius of the warehouse as needed in geographical areas outside area of personal residence
Ability to work variable and flexible hours, including overtime as needed.
Ability to follow appropriate industry specific regulations related to the handling of hazardous materials
Ability to frequently bend, stoop, kneel, stretch, twist, reach, climb and lift/carry up to 50lbs
High school diploma or General Education Degree (GED)
Graduate of a post-secondary HVAC program of instruction of two or more years in duration.
Years of Related HVAC Experience: 3-4 Years
Age Requirement: 18+
Must have a valid Drivers License with a good driving record

"If it deals with air, we deal with it"

Title: Retail Sales Representative
Description:
Have Fun. Travel. Meet New People.

Enovative Technologies is seeking energetic, aggressive, and outgoing outside retail sales representatives (1099 Contractors) to join our nationwide sales group. Entry-level and experienced sales people are welcomed. We train and coach our teams to increase their sales and earnings. Most events are on weekends, so travel and weekend work is required!

- Should have 2+ years of sales experience; healthcare sales experience preferred but not required - training will be provided
- Be detail oriented and customer focused
- Should have the ability to travel to sales events nationwide
- Must have a valid Driver's License

To Apply:
www.enovativetech.com/careers

We are an upscale urban brasserie featuring cutting edge Euro-Japanese cuisine and a fresh kaisen seafood market.. We offer an inviting lounge, warm hospitality, and a lovely patio. Join our team and be part of a brilliant future!

Must have open availability and flexible schedule. 

Experience with the Micros POS system is a plus. 

Apply by responding to this ad AND INCLUDE RESUME.

Title: Senior Interior Designer - Hospitality
Description:
We are currently looking for a Senior Hospitality Designer with 15 or more years of experience as an architectural and/or interior designer with a focus on hotel projects.  As our reputation grows, so does our need for skilled and passionate industry leaders who thrive on collaboration and believe deeply in design's ability to elevate the human experience.
  
At GGLO, we believe it's both the opportunity and responsibility of design to play a lead role in creating and sustaining community - to design places where our clients' clients prosper.  To that end, our approach is focused on improving the relationship between people and place. Our Architects, Interior Designers, Landscape Architects and Urban Designers work across scales and project types to create holistic neighborhoods, blocks, buildings, and public places.

Professional Knowledge
•	Knowledge of the phases of the design process and construction
•	Knowledge of the components of materials and detailing
•	Knowledge of code and regulations governing the hospitality industry and ability to perform research
•	Knowledge of the parts and purpose of contracts, drafted documents and specifications
•	Understanding of GGLO accounting and billing processes
•	Understanding of scope of project in relation to fee
•	Complete knowledge of GGLO Project Management Manual

Technological Expertise
•	Knowledge of computer software, including AutoCAD, Revit, and Adobe Creative Suite
•	Proficient in SketchUp, Windows-based programs, Microsoft Office and Windows OS
•	Experience with Deltek a plus
•	Ability to hand draft and draw freehand
•	Understands how to solve unusual or complex issues

Who are we looking for?  The individual we need must have their Bachelor's degree in Interior Design, Architecture or related field along with 15+ years of experience as an architectural and/or interior designer with a focus on hotel projects.

What does this mean for your career?  Our employees are a talented mix of individuals who embody every aspect of an integrated practice, who are catalysts for community through an integrated, research based approach with sustainable design competency as a prerequisite.  We offer the opportunity to align your long term career goals with a variety of projects and clients while working with Principals from multiple markets.  

Our salary ranges DOE and we offer an excellent benefit's package!  We offer the opportunity to join one of Seattle Business Magazines 100 Best Employers to Work For, activities such as our Thursday Crit's, Emerging professionals, and weekly lunch 'n' learns. Other benefits include formal and informal mentorship, ORCA pass, bike parking and bike use, flexible schedules, casual dress code, employee development programs including paid training, licensure reimbursement, paid vacation, paid holidays,  medical, dental, vision, 401K with matching, and more.

Send your resume and condensed portfolio (5MB or less) today and a brief paragraph of the requirements you fit, please include your salary requirements.  

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Client Service Representative - Pasadena
Description:
The Client Service Representative position requires a high level of client interaction in providing exceptional sales and service. Responsible for following established policies and procedures to resolve customer requests. Individuals at this level are expected to use some independence of thought but refer more complex transactions to other experts. Client Service Representative will identify cross-sell opportunities and make appropriate referrals.  Provide assistance to Office Manager for operational and compliance tasks in the day to day operations of the office.  

*No nights or weekends required
 *Great work/life balance
 *No sales goals

Responsibilities, Duties, and Accountabilities:

Sales & Service
•	Promote service excellence by modeling exceptional client service characteristics to retain and build existing relationships with clients.
•	Meet and exceed sales and service goals and objectives.
•	Respond to difficult or complex product and service inquiries from clients, team members and business partners.
•	Build internal and external relationships through exceptional problem solving, ownership and follow-through.
•	Model exemplary client service behaviors.

Internal Operations
•	Primary focus is on execution within defined parameters, with some expansion based on developing capabilities and or experiences, in partnership with more experienced staff.
•	Ensure compliance with all Federal, State and local laws as well as BPB&TC policies and procedures.
•	Ensure accurate and timely processing of platform transactions.
•	Assist in all office operations with platform and teller processing.
•	Oversee all operations procedures pertaining to the ATM
•	Other duties as required.
•	100% transactional


Qualifications:

•	Degree preferred, not required
•	1+years' experience in retail banking
•	Superior client service skills 
•	Cross Selling Skills
•	Strong communication skills - oral and written
•	Organization Skills
•	Systems & Technical Knowledge including Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access

Equal Opportunity Employer

Title: TEST DRIVER - 1ST & 2ND SHIFTS
Description:
Kett Engineering is currently accepting applications and pre-qualifying candidates to be Test Drivers at our customer facilities in Long Beach and Carson, CA on the 1st and 2nd shifts. We are looking for people who do have flexibility as to when they can work including weekends.

Description: Successful candidates will drive and evaluate test vehicles on "real world" test routes, conduct pre-trip safety inspections as required, perform specialized test procedures and document findings on driver report in clear and concise manner. We are looking for good, dependable, and safe drivers to test vehicles and their systems. If you are detail oriented and have flexibility as to when you can work, including weekends, this may be the perfect job for you.

Starting pay is $12.00 an hour.

Requirements:

-Drivers must have 4 years of verifiable driving experience
-A current California driver's license
-A clean driving record (No moving violation or at-fault accidents in the last 3 years)
-High School Diploma or GED
-Must be able to pass a drug test
-Pass Pre-Employment written and driving tests
-Manual transmission (stick shift) proficiency required

Additional desired qualifications:

-Familiar with current trends in automotive industry and comfortable working with computers
-Ability to learn and operate new vehicle features (Ex: GPS, Navigation, Infotainment systems, etc...)
-Attention to detail with the ability to communicate finding both verbally and in writing
-Able to contribute in a team environment

Job Location: Carson and Long Beach, CA

If you qualify, please send your resume by visiting our career site at:



You can also apply in person at our Carson, CA facility.

1154 E. Dominguez St.
Carson, CA 90746

Title: Traveling Superintendent - Retail Construction
Description:
Gray Construction is seeking experienced Traveling Retail Superintendents for projects located in the Western United States. Candidates must have a proven record at successfully completing projects on time and with a high level of quality and customer satisfaction. Ideal candidates are highly detail oriented, strong problem solvers and possess the ability to work with sub-contractors, owner representatives, city officials and design/ engineering professionals at all levels.

 Candidates must have 5-10 years of experience as a Retail Construction Superintendent successfully completing New Stores and Closed or Open Store Remodels for Mall Based and Shopping Center based Retailers. All candidates must submit a project list along with complete resume.

 Salary is highly competitive and will be based on experience. Project based incentives are also available. This position provides a comprehensive benefits package including Paid Vacation, Paid Holidays, Medical Insurance, Life Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, ESOP (Company Stock), 401k / 403b and 529 College Savings Plan. Gray provides for ongoing training and continuing education reimbursement. 

 TRAVEL IS REQUIRED. 

 ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES include the following:

 Establish and maintain HIGH SAFETY AND QUALITY STANDARDS in accordance to company and industry standards.

 Studies plans and specifications to plan procedures for construction on basis of starting and completion times and staffing requirements for each phase of construction.

 Assists in the development of project schedules and updating of progress construction schedules.

 Prepares and transmits various reports, i.e. daily reports, manpower counts, project status and owner required reports.

 Review all drawings, i.e. shop, architectural, structural, etc. when they are issued to the field and coordinate and maintain a current set at all times.

 Coordinate and manage on-site construction activities from pre-start-up to completion.

 Schedule work, including subcontractors and owner vendors.

 Confers with and directs subcontractor supervisory personnel and engages in planning and executing work procedures, interpreting specification, and coordinating various phases of construction to prevent delays.

 Manages delivery schedule for Owner Supplied Materials and coordinates sub-contractor receipt.

 Maintains a clean and organized work site.

 Confers with supervisory personnel to resolve issues and conflicts and maintain schedule.

 Prepares or review reports on progress and adjusts work schedules as indicated by reports.

 Manages Quality Control and drives to a Zero- Punch project close.

 Job Skills & Required Experience

 Ability to Work to Plan & Specification and to clearly covey conflict and omissions via the RFI process.
 Detail-oriented
 Computer/ Technology-literate (Microsoft Office Suite, Project, Blue Beam)
 Excellent written and oral communication abilities
 Excellent document management
 Understands and drives quality control
 OSHA 10 Hour 

 Experienced Retail Construction Superintendent with 5-10 years of experience in Specialty High End Retail Stores. New and Open Store Remodels for Mall Based Retailers, Fast Track Schedules.


 COMPANY OVERVIEW:
 Gray is one of the nation's leading design, engineering and construction firms focused on best-in-class quality in the construction industry with offices in California, Oregon, Nevada, Kentucky, Alabama, North Carolina and Tokyo, Japan. Gray's experience includes projects for the automotive, distribution, food and beverage, manufacturing, hospitality and retail markets.

 Our West region office, is a leading Retail contractor in the western United States. Gray performs a broad spectrum of contracting services for ground-up, new tenant improvement, phased remodel, takeover renovation, design-build and tenant improvement projects. West Region core markets are retail construction, hospitality construction and industrial manufacturing plant construction. Gray consistently ranks in the top 15 of National Retail Builders.


 CAREERS & COMPANY CULTURE:
 It's the spirit of the people at Gray. It is passion, commitment and a great team environment that makes our company a great place to work. We share an unrelenting focus on customer service, passion for creativity, and drive for success that creates a fulfilling and rewarding work environment.

 Beyond the challenging and rewarding work, it's our people that make Gray a special place. We believe wholeheartedly in learning, discovery, innovation and the joy of work that results in unsurpassed satisfaction for all our team members and every customer. Everyone at Gray brings a dedication and love to the job that is needed to thrive in our fast-paced environment with tight production deadlines. Although we work very hard, we also know how to play when it's time to celebrate our accomplishments.

 Our Company is proactive in employing and advancing qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other protected status.

 Please visit GRAY to apply directly -

Title: SENIOR DESIGNER - MUSCLE BEACH
Description:
Muscle Beach, located on the world famous boardwalk in sunny Venice California is looking for a Senior Designer that will help shape the future personality and visual style of this iconic brand name. To work here you will need a strong understanding of how design is about problem solving and message delivery to a target audience.  Not just making shiny new things.

Working at the Muscle Beach office you will literally see the beach from your office. We've a "headset rocking, head to grindstone" culture that includes an "unlimited" stash of healthy food, drinks, competitive salaries and an emphasis on work-life balance.  You should be a master of Adobe products, fast to react, and ready to roll up your sleeves and get to work on a range of digital and branding projects.  

As our new Senior Designer you will shape the look and feel of an iconic brand name while working from your beach office..... and don't worry about getting bored, we have several brands within the brand to keep things fresh.... it doesn't get much better.

Responsibilities:
•	Standardizing system-wide Visual Design Language
•	Designing all future brand media to include (but aren't limited to):
•	Style Guides
•	UI Kits
•	Pixel Perfect Comps
•	Advertisements
•	Digital/Web Marketing
•	Print Collateral
•	Landing Pages
•	Fully developing and maintaining continuity of the visual design style across all future brand assets and media.

Skills & Experience:
•	At least 8 years of professional experience in an agency or studio environment.
•	A mastery of Adobe Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, Indesign).  We Test.
•	Understanding of brand standards and messaging as relating to design strategy
•	Great photo-compositing and typographical skills.
•	Experience in multiple media formats (print and online minimum)
•	A ridiculous level of attention to detail
•	A digital portfolio review is required for consideration.

Unfortunately, we do not have any junior or mid-level positions available.  Experience designers only.   Please reply with resume, portfolio, and why you would be a good candidate for this awesome job! 

THANKS!!

Title: Join an Educational Movement! Be a Summer Program Director at Galileo
Architect Designer - Hotels
Description:
We are currently looking for an Architect Designer with a portfolio of experience in hotel buildings to join our award winning team. As our reputation grows, so does our need for skilled and passionate industry leaders who thrive on collaboration and believe deeply in design's ability to elevate the human experience. 

At GGLO, we believe it's both the opportunity and responsibility of design to play a lead role in creating and sustaining community - to design places where our clients'clients' prosper. To that end, our approach is focused on improving the relationship between people and place. Our Architects, Interior Designers, Landscape Architects and Urban Designers work across scales and project types to create holistic neighborhoods, blocks, buildings, and public places.

Professional Knowledge & Experience
•	Proven ability to creatively design hotel buildings
•	Portfolio of design concepts using a variety of skills and techniques
•	Participates in design strategy sessions and presentations; manages day to day design concept/process consistent with the project's program, budget and time constraints.
•	Responds to input and changes to project parameters by developing alternative designs; maintains concept continuity.
•	Acts as liaison between senior designers and other support designers; may lead/review the work of other designers.
•	Effectively manage team members to maintain a positive interaction while sustaining quality while meeting client expectations.
•	Maintain client relationships
•	Write reports, business correspondence, contracts, and business development proposals
•	Define, monitor and maintain control of the scope of work and services for the project including project schedule and work plan, 
•	Participate in marketing opportunities and facilitate multi-discipline collaboration within the firm

Technological Expertise
•	Knowledge of computer software, including Revit, AutoCAD, Adobe Creative Suite
•	Deltek Vision a plus
•	SketchUp, Windows-based programs, Microsoft Word and Excel, and Internet and Intranet technologies
•	Ability to hand draft and draw freehand
•	Understands and able to articulate how to solve unusual or complex issues

Who are we looking for? The individual we need must be licensed; LEED accredited is preferred, and have at least 10 years of hotel project experience. If no hospitality experience, individual must have multi-family.

What does this mean for your career? Our employees are a talented mix of individuals who embody every aspect of an intergraded practice, who are catalysts for community through an integrated, research based approach with sustainable design competency as a prerequisite. The opportunity to align your long term career goals with a variety of projects and clients, while working with, and learning from different Principals at multiple times during your employment. 

Our salary ranges DOE and we offer an excellent benefit's package! We offer the opportunity to join one of Seattle Business Magazines 100 Best Employers to Work For, activities such as our Thursday Crit's, Emerging professionals, and weekly lunch 'n' learns. Other benefits include formal and informal mentorship, ORCA pass, bike parking and bike use, flexible schedules, casual dress code, employee development programs including paid training, licensure reimbursement, paid vacation, paid holidays, medical, dental, vision, 401K with matching, and more.

Send your resume and condensed portfolio (5MB or less) today and a brief paragraph of the requirements you fit, be sure to include your salary requirements. 

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: After School Program Leader
Description:
Summary: 

The LBCAP After School Education & Safety (ASES) Program helps students and families by providing free after school care.  Our after school program provides students with homework assistance, academic enrichment activities to supplement what they learn during the school days, as well as recreation time for students in grades 1-8. We are looking for an After School Program Leader who will be responsible for supervising the youth, in addition to creating and executing the implementation of academic enrichment lesson plans during our after-school programs. The ideal candidate for this role will have a working knowledge of outcome based enrichment and recreation activities that promote the physical and emotional growth of youth in our community.  In addition this candidate will also communicate effectively and possess the ability to establish and maintain good relations with a wide range of social and ethnic groups. 

The Program Leader will be responsible for prepares age-appropriate activities (topics include: the arts, athletics, creative writing, leadership, media, STEM, and others), collects and submits necessary documentation and coordinates with staff and volunteers to ensure optimal fidelity and quality for participants. The Program Leader will also provide the proper planning, execution of the day-to-day programmatic and logistical operations while promoting the LBCAP's Mission Statement through the values of caring, honesty, respect, responsibility and faith in all aspects of job performance.

Specific Duties and Responsibilities: 
•	Maintain health, safety and well-being of all children in program.
•	Maintain consistent discipline practices that align with WRAP's Behavior Management procedures.
•	Develop age appropriate activities and lesson plans that support students academic growth.
•	Lead and participate in activities while maintaining a 1:20 ratio.
•	Set-up and clean-up of program areas while ensuring proper care of program materials.
•	Ensure that all students participate in ASES program activities.
•	Be a positive role model and caring adult to all students.
•	Work cooperatively with students, parents, staff, and school faculty
•	Attend all staff meetings and trainings.
•	Report all accidents, incidents and injuries to Site Director.
•	Refer families in poverty to agency resources.
•	Performs other job related duties as assigned.

Skills and Minimum Qualifications: 

•	Experience with arts/crafts, athletics, media, STEM and other educational fields (preferred but not required).
•	48 college units completed, or completion of WRAP Test.
•	Strong communication skills
•	Experience working with children.
•	Ablility to work with diverse ethnic, gender, age and cultural groups.
•	Interest in improving the community, students' lives and families.
•	Tuberculosis Bacillus (TB), background check and Fingerprinting.


Schedule: 1:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. Monday - Friday (Part-Time 20 hours per week) 
Location: Long Beach, CA - 90808

Title: Associate Director of Tutoring
Description:
ArborBridge (www.arborbridge.com) is an Inc 5000-ranked test prep firm dedicated to providing the most effective one-on-one SAT/ACT prep in the world. Founded in 2007 and based in Los Angeles, CA, ArborBridge has 20 full-time employees and works online with students in 50 different countries and 25 states, as well as in-person with students in Los Angeles and New York City. Our industry-leading adaptive curriculum is rooted in the newest advances in technology, pedagogy, and neuroscience. 

We place a high priority on a working culture that is fun and easy going, while stressing ambition, professionalism, accountability, flexibility, autonomy, and a team-first mindset. 



Join ArborBridge as an Associate Director of Tutoring, based in Los Angeles or remotely in another major US or international city with a market for premium ACT/SAT prep!

The Associate Director of Tutoring will be a key team member of the Client Acquisition team. As part of a larger team of Directors of Tutoring, he or she will work closely with our instruction team to deliver amazing tutoring outcomes for our students.  

Passionate about building relationships with parents and counselors, test prep tutoring, and providing concierge-level customer service, the Associate Director of Tutoring will be responsible for liaising with parents, students, counselors, as well as our internal program management and instruction team, with an absolute commitment to top-quality tutoring experiences and client satisfaction. The Associate Director will also be responsible for developing business by building deep relationships with college counselors, domestically and internationally, and other third parties who refer to ArborBridge. 








$50,000 - $80,000 (depends on experience) + Benefits (above) + Potential Bonus + Potential Stock Options

Title: Cyber Investigator / Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Looking for a motivated self-starter to join our team!

We are currently seeking an experienced Cyber Investigator in the greater Los Angeles area to excel in a dynamic fast-paced work environment. Preferably, Spanish speaker. 

This is a full-time position with huge opportunity for growth and advancement. 

Hourly rate is competitive and appropriate to experience and education.

Summary:
Cyber Investigator will investigate, perform research and conduct Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) necessary to support the company's efforts to protect the Intellectual Property Rights of multiple world famous brand owners through detailed investigations, reports and analytical functions. They will be responsible for gathering data and intelligence related to the company's efforts to protect the interests of the company's clients in a dynamic fast-paced work environment.  
 
Duties and Responsibilities:
•	Responsible for supporting global brand protection for multiple brands worldwide.
•	Coordinate research leads on subjects related to criminal or illicit activities with an emphasis on involvement in counterfeit product manufacturing and distribution.
•	Perform due diligence on background investigations for subjects of interest involved in criminal activities, which will require being in an undercover capacity. 
•	Utilize current trending social media and mobile applications to gain access and information on subjects, which may require a communication exchange. 
•	Research, develop, and prepare analytical intelligence and informational reports which will include narrative, tabular and graphic materials.

•	Familiarity with IP addresses, IP anonymizers, and VPNs. 
•	Excellent inquisitive, research, and analytical skills.
•	Creative problem-solving skills.
•	A good eye for detail and a good memory.

•	Excellent planning, time management and organization skills.
•	The ability to meet deadlines.

Organization Overview

Nite-Lite Signs, a local sign company for over 45 years, manufactures and installs signage for stores across the country. 

We strive every day, in every transaction, to reflect our pride in our company, each other, ourselves and in the people and communities that we serve. Title: Seasonal Part Time Sales Associate
Description:
Summary

The Sales Associate's main role is to effectively share TOMS giving stories, our culture and our products with the local communities we belong to.  Sales Associates deliver the ultimate personalized customer care to each and every guest in our stores, consistently going above and beyond customer expectations. Participation in community events, TOMS culture and teamwork is highly emphasized and encouraged.
 
 
Candidate Profile
We expect you to have a passion and knowledge about TOMS giving program. You provide customers with an unforgettable store experience by creating a comfortable atmosphere and demonstrating TOMS culture by storytelling about our giving and wearing relevant TOMS products on the retail floor.  You engage customers in conversation by sharing information on our local events and community initiatives, and create lasting relationships with community influencers. 
 
 
Position Expectations
Ensures exceptional customer care delivered to customers 100% of the time. 
Passionately educates customers on TOMS giving program and the One for One ™ movement on and off the retail floor. 
Takes a stand as an advocate for TOMS' values and culture.
Assists in preparing the store for the day including: replenishing product, cleaning retail areas, answering phone inquiries, ensures POS and payments systems are operating correctly.
Responsible and dependable time management, ability to work independently when given a task.
Extraordinary customer interaction skills, always solution oriented with customers. 
Unpack boxes for inventory as required. Boxes can weigh up to 50 lbs.  
 
 
Success Measures
The TOMS Associate will be successful in this role when they can not only execute the following tasks, but also train fellow associates and see successful results in the following areas: 
Customer: Explains why and how we give and the concept behind story telling
Community: Works directly with store leadership to execute community initiatives, understands what a grassroots participative event looks like, ensures digital content (Instagram) is brand aligned. 
Product: Accurately recalls current season styles and color ways, differentiates between quality and materials used in different lines and corroborating giving stories, describes show-ready visual merchandising. 
Operations: Understands the daily sales goal and give for retail, supporting inventory operational needs.    
 

Qualifications & Experience 

High school diploma or equivalent.
Experience in retail sales, hospitality, merchandising, or marketing.
Self-motivated, organized, and entrepreneurial.
Passionate about giving, upbeat, friendly and authentic.
Knowledge of the footwear marketplace a plus.
Experience using various POS systems.
Ability to work a flexible schedule including nights & weekends as business dictates.
 
 
Company Expectations
Our Mission is to improve lives through business.  As an employee of TOMS we are strongly committed to this mission and to our values.  Everything we do is a balance in profitability and giving and keeping this in balance is key to our success.  In an effort to further our mission and add value we expect our employees to be aligned to our core values.  TOMS values and behaviors are: 
We are a movement - We leverage storytelling to inspire people to connect to our global movement.  We create advocacy for this movement in every interaction with our customers, partners, and employees.
We will be Entrepreneurial - We are curious and innovative.  We allow ourselves the space to fail.  We can be successful by taking a scrappy approach to business.
We expect a lot from each other - Collaboration across boundaries and borders is required in order to achieve our common goals.  Leading with authenticity and humility will be needed.  We work, give, and succeed as a team while also having fun.
We are committed to a long term vision - We do not allow short-term gains to compromise our goals of making a lasting impact.
 

TOMS is an equal opportunity employer and will consider applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the ordinance

Title: PRE-OP / PACU RN / Charge RN-Multiple Locations and Positions Opening
Description:
Prime MSO is a surgical facility management organization. We own and operate six surgical facilities throughout the greater Los Angeles, Orange County, and South Bay areas, with a corporate office located in the heart of downtown Glendale, California. 

This position posting is for multiple RN potions and locations. Our centers are located in the city of, Torrance, Foothill Ranch, Encino, and Newport Beach.

The job description below is for our Operating Room/Peri-operative Registered Nurse, more descriptions are on file: 

The Operating Room/Perioperative Registered Nurse provides professional nursing care for assigned patients in the operating room, before during and after surgery. Assesses, plans, evaluates, and documents the operating room nursing process as needed. OR Nurses also assist the surgeon and the surgical team in their tasks.
Functions:
•	Consults and coordinates with health care team members to assess, plan, implement and evaluate patient care plans.
•	Conducts patient education.
•	Serves as the communication liaison to family and members of the operating team.
•	Ensures that operating on correct patient and the correct procedure is being performed; uses time-out. 
•	Provides basic, bedside care. 
•	Prepares and administers (orally, subcutaneously, through an IV) and records prescribed medications. Reports adverse reactions to medications or treatments in accordance with the policy regarding the administration of medications by a licensed registered nurse.
•	Responds to life-saving situations based upon nursing standards and protocol.
•	Records all care information concisely, accurately and completely, in a timely manner, in the appropriate format and on the appropriate forms.
•	Preps operating room for patient/procedure.
•	Initiates corrective action whenever information from monitoring equipment shows adverse symptomatology.
•	Monitors patients' physical and emotional well-being throughout the care continuum.
•	Initiates patient education plan, as prescribed by physician. Teaches patients and significant others how to manage their post-treatment home care needs, self-administration of medication and rehabilitation.
•	Performs other position-related duties as assigned, depending on assignment setting.
•	Travels to facilities on need be basis. 

During the surgical procedure, OR Nurses can take the role of: 
Circulating Nurse, with the following additional duties: 
•	Assists in positioning, responding to comfort/safety of patient 
•	Provides for accurate care and handling of specimens
•	Observes and enforces strict standards of asepsis 
•	Prior to cases, observes, checks and monitors all equipment used during surgery to confirm they are running smoothly; handles patient documentation

DGPI is proud to offer a US Veterans and civilian professional security training program. We designed this program to help our fellow Veterans transitioning back into the civilian workplace. We're a company founded by parents and startup veterans; looking for the most qualified, reliable and caring drivers to join our family. Childcare experience is required. Driving children is a big responsibility and we take safety and well being - theirs and yours - very seriously.

Title: BCBA Program Director
Description:
Do you love what you do? Would you like to work with people who value and recognize your contributions? Is quality of services important to you?

We have an amazing opportunity waiting for you at Behavior And Education (BAE)! BAE has been recognized as a Top Behavioral Service Provider in the Country by the Behavioral Health Center of Excellence (BHCOE)!

At BAE, our workplace culture centers around staff satisfaction, teamwork, constructive solutions, and mentorship.

•	Oversee the staffing and scheduling of ABA services for assigned clients and staff
•	Review progress reports and assessment reports, editing for grammar, accuracy of content, and appropriateness of analysis, goals, and recommendations 
•	Other activities relevant to the clinical and administrative management of ABA services within the division
Position Requirements:
•	BCBA or BCBA-D certification (required)
•	Master's degree in ABA, education, psychology, child development, or related field
•	Minimum 5 years of ABA experience 
•	Minimum 3 years of ABA supervision and management experience

Title: Make $35 per hour giving rides to great kids on the go!
Description:
Kango is a California-based mobile service that provides Rides and Care for families who want the safest, most pleasant journey for their kids as part of their busy day. Already operating since late 2015 in the SF Bay Area, now we are coming to the LA area, and looking for the safest, best drivers for our young passengers. 

We're a company founded by parents and startup veterans; looking for the most qualified, reliable and caring drivers to join our family. Childcare experience is required. Driving children is a big responsibility and we take safety and well being - theirs and yours - very seriously.

In return, driving for Kango is a great way to earn extra income on a flexible schedule, when and where you want. We offer both pre-scheduled and same-day rides, so you can pre-plan or be as spontaneous as you like.

Drivers who pass our screening make a minimum of $20 per ride, to start.
Unlike other services, if you like, you can also set your hourly rate for babysitting, and make extra money if childcare is needed along with the ride, or as a separate booking. Kids love their Kango drivers, and parents can and often do tip them! 

Our Kango iPhone and Android apps make it quick and easy to view and accept the rides you want to do. Plus, our chat and photo messaging features give the service a human touch. It takes a village!

Apply today at 

Requirements:
Minimum 2 years of childcare experience (parents, teachers, camp counselors, etc. are eligible to apply too!)
21 years old or older
4-door car that is 2007 or newer
Smartphone (iPhone or Android)
Clean driving record
Stellar references
Willing to undergo a background check and fingerprinting

Ready to go places with Kango? Apply online today at 

(mention your exact SoCal location in "Tell us about your experience" field on the form)

Title: P&C Insurance Representative/CSR
Description:
Looking for the stability of a large Nationwide Insurance Carrier coupled with the versatility and learning opportunity of an Independent Brokerage? Look no further.

MCIS is currently seeking a motivated and experienced individual to join our team. We are a boutique agency serving large commercial clients and specialize in comprehensive solutions for towing, trucking, and contractor customers with a range of insurance products. We are also a Farmers Insurance Full Service Retail Agency offering their wide range of products and services.

We are looking for candidates to help us manage a growing book of business; this is an excellent opportunity for an organized and enthusiastic professional to grow and to gain industry experience.

Position Overview

This is an administrative role supporting agency operations, including new business, renewals, customer service, and account management. Daily tasks typical of the position may include:

-Process of endorsements, client and company requests, binders, certificates of insurance and ID cards, applications and proposals
-Assist clients with claim reporting, processing and follow up
-Answer calls from clients, prospects, and carriers each day in a professional manner
-Respond to all client inquiries and requests in an accurate and timely fashion
-Follow up on outstanding customer inquiries
-Work with sales staff to meet and exceed our customers' expectations

Requirements

Successful candidates will have the following attributes:

-2+ years of commercial insurance experience strongly preferred
-California Property and Casualty license preferred
-Strong communication skills, written and oral
-Proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel
-Ability to work autonomously or as part of the team
-Qualified candidates will be considered for a Full Time Position. Our office hours are from 8:30AM to 5PM, Monday through Friday.

Please forward resume including work history and references via email.

Title: Operations Manager / Assistant Marketing Manager
Description:
BDancewear is a fast growing, in-house activewear manufacturer located in the sunny, Santa Clarita Valley. We are looking for a reliable Operations Manager/Assistant Marketing Manager to join our lean team immediately. This person would need to be resourceful and able to wear many hats, as this position holds a significant amount of varied responsibilities within our company.  As an Operations Manager, you would be responsible for facilitating the entire manufacturing process from sale to finished product. As Assistant Marketing Manager, you would be responsible for building BDancewear's social media exposure and relationship with our brand ambassadors. Overall, we need someone who can maintain company-wide organization, efficiency, and brand cohesiveness on the back end, which ultimately reflects in greater customer retention on the front end!
This position is for someone who can be both personable with our customers as well as organized and self-sufficient at their job. You would be working with a great team, but because of the nature of our production, candidates need to be able to work independently and multitask. This position requires extensive use of a PC, so an applicant for this position MUST be tech savvy and extremely comfortable navigating a PC. 

Ultimately, you would be joining a fun-loving team and a casual environment. We are passionate about our brand and enjoy coming to work every day. 

Responsibilities:
•	Respond to customer emails 
•	Take phone orders and inquiries
•	Process returns and exchanges (occasional)
•	Manage product inventory
•	Manage raw materials inventory
•	Oversee production flow throughout the day
•	Grow each social handle with followers while building brand awareness
•	Work with brand ambassadors
•	Shipping via USPS and FedEx
•	Provide support to all departments of the company

Requirements:
•	Administrative and customer service skills
•	MUST be tech savvy and proficient in the Microsoft Office Suite
•	MUST have social media experience as well as a creative eye
•	Reliable transportation required
•	Marketing Experience is a plus
•	Graphic design skills such as Photoshop or Illustrator are a plus
•	Previous Ecommerce experience is a plus
•	Dance experience is a plus!!!

Required Education: 
•	High School diploma required

Job Type: Full time
Compensation: $12-$14/hour
Job Location: Valencia, CA 91354

Title: Accounting Clerk
Description:
We are looking for a skilled Accounting Clerk to perform a variety of accounting, bookkeeping and financial tasks.
Accounting Clerk responsibilities include keeping financial records updated, preparing reports and reconciling bank statements. You will also run accounting software programs (e.g. SAP) to process business transactions, like accounts payable and receivable, disbursements, expense vouchers and receipts. A successful accounting assistant should be familiar with all accounting procedures and have a flair for numbers.
Ultimately, a successful Accounting Clerk will ensure that the company's daily accounting functions run accurately and effectively.

Responsibilities

•	Provide accounting and clerical support to the accounting department
•	Type accurately, prepare and maintain accounting documents and records
•	Prepare bank deposits, general ledger postings and statements
•	Reconcile accounts in a timely manner
•	Daily entry of  key data of financial transactions in Quick Books
•	Provide assistance and support to company personnel
•	Research, track and restore accounting or documentation problems and discrepancies
•	Inform management and compile reports/summaries on activity areas
•	Function in accordance with established standards, procedures, and applicable laws
•	Embrace and project company core values.

Requirements

•	Proven accounting experience, preferably as an Accounts receivable clerk or Accounts payable clerk
•	Familiarity with bookkeeping and basic accounting procedures
•	Competency in MS Office and Quick Books.
•	Hands-on experience with spreadsheets and financial reports
•	Accuracy and attention to detail
•	Aptitude for numbers
•	Ability to perform filing and record keeping tasks
•	Data entry and word processing skills
•	Well organized
•	High school diploma
•	Associate's degree or relevant certification is a plus

Title: Full Time Healthcare Marketing & Sales and Provider Relations
Description:
We are large Imaging group, with 23 locations in Southern California, proud leading providers of quality healthcare to the community. Our centers are equipped to treat diagnostics, traumatic, and life-threatening injuries, with caring and innovative team of healthcare professionals dedicated to enthusiastically improving the health and quality of life of the people we serve.

We are looking for a Provider Relations and Marketing Representative to join our growing team on a full- time basis. You will be working a majority of your day off-site and build relationships with referring physicians and medical offices in the area. You are required to offer superior customer service to existing clients/ contracts (including managed care organizations), physicians, medical offices, IPA's, and other contracted accounts.

 In the position you will:

-  Identify and resolve service issues relating to referring physicians, their staff and patients.
-  Provide turnkey services to referring physician offices by acting as liaison between operations management
-  Corporate management and billing departments, to ensure timely turnaround of service issues and/or concerns
-  Keep sales, operations and radiologists updated on account issues and resolution (status)
-  Maintain special assignment accounts as directed by Operations

 You will assist the VP of Business Development to coordinate effective office visits. 
The purpose of these visits will be to:

* Educate referring and new offices on enhancements, new studies, and advances -- essentially target market
* Increase referral percentages/volume and word of mouth
* Increase referral percentages/volume from currently non-referring offices
* Maintain image in the community as cutting-edge experts
* Bring our level of service to the offices
* Effectively manage territory TBD

 The right candidate must have:

- Strong written and verbal communications skills
- Professional customer service skills
- Good overall clerical skills
- Must be detail oriented and organized
- Must be able to interact effectively and professionally with doctors, referring doctors, patients, vendors, peers, staff and management
- Should posses current California driver's license and good driving record

 Qualifications:
- Minimum of 2 years proven sales & marketing experience 
- Preferred 1 - 2 years experience in healthcare
- Bachelor's Degree is required!
- Knowledge of preparing, and interpreting spreadsheets and reports
- Managed care contracting experience is highly desirable
- Good selling skills is highly desirable
- Bilingual is a PLUS!

 Please respond to jobs5111@umih.com. When applying for the position, please include "Marketing SFV" in the subject heading of your e-mail. NO CALLS PLEASE. All qualified candidates will be subject to a background check. Only candidates being considered will be contacted.

Title: Front Office Agents needed @ The Portofino Hotel and Marina
Description:
The Portofino Hotel and Marina is seeking a couple of Front Office Agents!

We are located only six miles from Los Angeles! We are known as the only Los Angeles hotel in the area located directly on the Pacific Ocean. With waterfront accommodations including lovely suites and hotel rooms with views of King Harbor, our hotel offers more than 8,000 square feet of creative and flexible meeting environments and banquet space, including a freestanding meeting pavilion.

Guests enjoy a ocean-inspired theme for the lobby, guest rooms and baths in a contemporary nautical theme. The hotel offers five luxury suites. In addition to great Pacific views and luxury hotel accommodations, this beautiful oceanfront hotel includes a fitness facility, wireless high-speed Internet access available in the guest rooms and public areas and a 24-hour business center. The guest rooms feature a casual beach look that incorporate hues of blue, yellow and whites, and are as beautiful indoors as the views outdoors. The backdrop of sun and crystal sea is a perfect setting for weddings, beach weekend getaways and business functions.

The staff at Portofino is committed to ensuring that we meet and exceed all of the requirements for the Americans with Disabilities Act. The staff at our hotel is trained to accommodate guests with special needs, so that all of our guests, including those with disabilities are able to have an enjoyable and safe stay. At The Portofino Hotel & Marina, we want to make sure all our guests are able to take advantage of every activity the hotel has to offer.

The Front Desk Agent welcomes and registers hotel guests, explaining the accommodations and establishing credit or method of payment.  Checks guest out of the hotel, preparing and explaining the bill.  Responds to a wide variety of guest requests by assessing the guest needs and requests and then adding personal recommendations and touches to achieve the best guest  satisfaction.

Title: Production Crew Chief - TOURING
Description:
is one of the world's preeminent dance entertainment companies, encompassing touring theatrical productions, dance workshops, photo and video production, corporate events and apparel. With a broad range of business prospects and a reach of over 500,000 dancers annually, we are largely responsible for the transformation of the dance entertainment industry.

We are currently seeking Crew Chiefs for our upcoming tours in the United States, Canada & Mexico.    and have a basic knowledge of theatrical production, including audio, video and lighting, as well as extensive knowledge in personnel and production management.

This is a position for technicians ready to take the next step into a leadership role.

We are currently staffing the following dance convention/competition tours:

     (www.jumptour.com)
     (www.gonuvo.com)
     (www.24sevendance.com)




- booking stagehand labor, production assistants and on-site security local to that tour city
- communicating dock location and call times to your tour truck drivers
- participating in a weekly production recap meeting with convention staff

You will also be required to come into the warehouse on the Wednesday before each tour city for a full day (9:00am-6:00pm). This day is part of your flat weekend rate. You are expected to work at least 1 to 2 weeks in advance when preparing for your upcoming tour cities.


- running local stagehand crew and department heads (video, audio, lighting) from load-in through load-out.
- ensure equipment is maintained either through self-servicing equipment, or informing BTFP office only if equipment cannot be repaired on the road.

This is a physical position and you will be expected to help load & unload trucks, set up staging, and assist with A/V and lighting setup if needed. You are there from beginning to end of each load-in and load-out.


- Ability to oversee crews of 15-20 people. You are expected to keep each of your departments moving simultaneously through load in and load out. 
- Knowledge of dance conventions & competitions is a major plus, but not required. Please include this in your resume.
- Portable staging assembly, basic conventional/intelligent lighting, audio, and video experience.
- Ability to work long hours in high-stress theatrical production environments.


Applicant must be available for all cities of the tour they are assigned. During show weekends, you will be flown out of Los Angeles on Thursday, and return on Monday from any of Los Angeles' major airports including LAX, Burbank, & Long Beach. Break the Floor covers all flight, hotel and transportation to and from the host city airport. You are responsible for getting to and from the airport in LA. 

Applicant must also be available to work our major events in the summer, these include:
   * The Dance Awards Las Vegas (6/30/18-7/7/18)
   * The Dance Awards Orlando (7/12/18-7/19/18)
   * Dance Teacher Summit NYC (8/2/18-8/5/18)
   * DancerPalooza Long Beach (Final dates TBD)
This is typically a 7 day event that will take place in late July or early August.


Prior to each tour, you will need to commit to a minimum two weeks of paid training and shop work to prepare for the tour at our production facility in North Hollywood, CA. This training period will start in early September. There will also be the opportunity to work additional hours at the shop during off-weeks as well as Tuesdays and Wednesdays during the tour season.


$1450 per city average. Shop Pay begins at $20/hr.
We also provide a bonus for successful completion of contract.
