Title: P/T (Year-Round) Lifeguard
Description:
P/T LIFEGUARD POSITION - Pasadena and Sierra Madre Facilities

General Qualifications:
• Must have a genuine passion for working with children
• Competitive swimming experience not required
• Childcare experience is preferred, but not required
• Must have or be willing to get Lifeguarding and Bloodborne Pathogens certifications

To Apply:
Please complete and submit an online application by clicking the link below.



About Us

Waterworks Aquatics is a premier swim school that teaches children ages 3 months through adult how to swim. Our mission is to educate and motivate people of all ages to be safer and learn proper swimming technique. Waterworks Aquatics is the largest provider of swim lessons in the state of California and has 19 swim schools across California and Colorado. We've also been awarded "Best Swim Classes" by the readers of Parenting OC Magazine for eight consecutive years!

Why Waterworks Aquatics?

Waterworks Aquatics understands that our Swim Instructors and Lifeguards are the forefront of our organization, which is why we invest in developing and maintaining a fun workplace. As part of this effort, we provide company sponsored events, incentive programs, team building events, appreciation days, and much more.

Not only is Waterworks Aquatics a fun, family oriented environment, but it is a great place to build a career. Everyone is given an equal opportunity to demonstrate their strengths and talents within the workplace. We are always seeking individuals looking to make a career teaching or in a management position. Many of our current managers have started out as Lifeguards or Swim Instructors.

Why join our team?

Fun Work Environment -- We hire individuals with a passion for working with children, which results in a welcoming, inviting and fun work culture.

Advancement Opportunities -- We pride ourselves on our professional development and believe in promoting from within. Waterworks is opening multiple locations annually and are looking for future leaders to build a rewarding career.

Competitive Compensation- Earn up to $13/hour starting rate. We also give performance reviews every 6 months, which provides additional opportunities to increase your compensation.

Benefits -- Waterworks Aquatics offers our Part-time employees a benefits package that includes dental, vision, and disability.

Flexible Work Schedule -- If you are a student, we work with your school schedules to make sure you are able to balance school and work.

Stable Hours -- With heated indoor pools, Waterworks teaches lessons 7 days a week, year-round.

Opportunity for Relocation -- We are a growing company with multiple locations opening each year.

Title: ACCOUNTS PAYABLE ACCOUNTANT
Description:
Accountants Payable Accountant

Are you looking to work for a distinguished and successful company, in a department filled with professional, positive, hardworking  staff members that work together as a great team?  A company that has been around for 100 years and likely to be around for another 100 years or more?  If so, this is that rare opportunity.    

The Bel-Air Bay Club is a private club situated on the picturesque Santa Monica Bay in Pacific Palisades, California since 1928.  BABC has received the Distinguished Emerald Club of the World Award, a coveted award held by few.  We are actively seeking an energetic and sharp individual to join the accounting team as the Accounts Payable Accountant.   Our newest team member will enjoy competitive benefits and wages while also enjoying unparalleled views of the Pacific Ocean!

Major responsibilities/duties include:

1.	Handles all aspects of Accounts Payable from invoice to payment.  Ensures all payments are within the scope of budget.
2.	Account analysis and reconciliation for various balance sheet accounts.
3.	Tracks and reports profitability compared to budget of Club sponsored events.
4.	Prepares annual property tax returns & 1099's.
5.	Assists with monthly physical inventory
6.	Other general administrative duties

The successful candidate will possess superior attention to detail, excellent Excel spreadsheet skills, 10-key by touch, solid understanding of accounting, excellent communication skills, with a minimum of 3-5 years accounts payable experience.  Experience in hospitality a plus.  

Benefits:  The Bel-Air Bay Club offers a very competitive compensation package to include 401K, medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, 2 weeks vacation, paid sick time and holidays.

Title: Cleaners wanted - up to $27/hour for reliable home cleaners
Cleaners wanted - up to $27/hour for reliable home cleaners
Love Movie Trailers? Get paid to watch them!
Description:
Check us out.....www.moviequ.com

We help Movie studios know about their trailers, where they played and in what sequence.
We pay $14 for the first screen checked and then another $4 per screen you check of the same feature (could be $22 for 3 screens).
We pay via Venmo or Quickpay.

We need stay at home moms, students, restaurant workers, any one that is available Friday mornings all over Greater Los Angeles.
Marina Del Rey, Playa Del Rey, West LA, Santa Monica, Westchester, El Segundo, San Fernando Valley, Pasadena and Hollywood.

We will be meeting and training all successful candidates in person at a movie theater before your first job assignment. You can email us back here or text/call the number in the reply section too! 

What you'll have to do
You download our app and go to the (local) movie theater we ask you to audit. We have a letter of authorization from our clients that you show the manager so you go don't have to buy a ticket. You do some basic checks and then match the trailers in the app using sound recognition. Once the movie starts, your work is done - unless we need you to check another auditorium. We need reliable checkers every week. Most of our checks take place on a Friday, but we do sometimes need people on Saturday too. If it is just one screen, your total time will be around 45 mins at the theater - 25 mins before the show time and 20 mins for the trailers. The total amount of time spent at the theater will vary depending on the number of screens needed to be checked.

iphone is available now, and the android version in about 2-3 weeks

Title: Veterinary Technician and Tech Assistant
Description:
We are looking for two hard-working, motivated, RVT/Tech and a Tech Assistant with 2-3+ years of experience, who loves working with people and animals to join our small team of friendly and easy going staff.
Core Values: Leadership, Teaching, Compassion, Honesty, Excellence, Joy, Direct Communication, Empathy, Humility, Team Work, Balance, Pride, Ethics 

Best Friends Animal Hospital is a small animal only practice in the San Fernando Valley. We pride ourselves in offering the best care for our patients and clients. We are an AAHA accredited hospital, and have top of the line equipment, paperless records, digital radiography, digital dental radiography, tonometry, in-house lab, and soon to come ultrasound. We perform orthopedic as well as soft tissue surgeries.

The ideal technician candidate would be an experienced RVT who is motivated, hard-working, and willing to learn. VIA and leadership experience a plus. 
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
- The ability to restrain animals and place catheters
- Performing venipuncture, imaging, and lab work
- Knowledge and experience in dentistry, emergency/triage, digital radiography, and anesthesia
- Assisting with surgical procedures 
- Great communication skills with both clients and staff members
- Making and presenting estimates to owners
- Accurately invoicing all patient treatments
- Knowledge of prescription medication
- General cleaning 
- General care, feeding, and walking
- Computer literacy
- Must be able to triage incoming patients
- Must be able to lift 40 pounds

Candidates should have open availability. Schedule will be part-time 3-4 days a week and include Saturdays and evening hours. 
Salary dependent on experience and qualifications. We also offer 1-3 weeks PTO after the first year, as well as CE opportunities.

Please e-mail your cover letter and resume. Please include the position title that you are applying for on the subject line of your email.
PLEASE DO NOT CALL THE HOSPITAL TO INQUIRE ABOUT THE STATUS OF YOUR RESUME. 
You can visit us at: www.bestfriendsanimalhospital.com

Title: Operations Manager - San Pedro Storage Facility
Description:
San Pedro Mini-Pac is looking for an Operations Manager!

The Hourly Operations Manager is a professional leader who will bring excellent communication, organizational and customer service skills for a challenging Self Storage Facility.  The Hourly Operations Manager will maximize business results, deploy continuous improvement with revenue reconciliation; collections; payroll; purchasing; invoice processing; employee scheduling and facility management. This position will be responsible for achieving financial and developmental objectives.

Please apply directly on our careers page: 

Primary Responsibilities:

Proactively manage the asset; perform daily site inspections; conduct safety meetings regularly
Collaborate with team to generate opportunities and superior business results.
Translate financial information; observational data; employee & customer feedback into action that will minimize risk
Implement codified processes to transfer skills to others, develop non-person dependent business competencies
Contribute and be accountable for leading; participating in timely and accurate budgeting, variance reporting, competitor analysis, performance dialogues, merit reviews, weekly touch points; business reviews and all single site business initiatives
Maintain oversight for site operating systems, alarms, surveillance, repairs and maintenance, equipment, work processes and provide recommendations for change
Develop cognitive understanding of employment compliance laws, make explicit to site members, provide coaching and document on performance calendars.
Ensure the business is operated in a safe manner for our customers and members
Improve occupancy

Requirements and Competencies:

Minimum 3-5 years' management experience in retail or hospitality, preferably in a high-level guest services environment managing multiple shifts with over 10 employees. 
Bachelor's degree preferred
Work successfully in a demanding, fast-paced environment where multi-tasking and ability to prioritize are required.
Take appropriate action required, based on data and merit, to maintain standards of excellence.
Make effective decisions by thinking critically and exercising good judgment and discernment.
Partner effectively with peers and supervisors to generate superior results.
Meet established standards; follow and improve upon processes.
Good oral and written communication skills
Work in an environment with minimal supervision by pursuing personal excellence, professional discipline, servant leadership, and continuous development and learning for self and others.
Strong written and verbal communication skills

Other Essential Requirements:

Physical requirements include ability to be on your feet for up to 3 hours at a time, walking, bending, and climbing/descending stairs.
 

Other Important Information:

In addition to the performance expectations and requirements listed above, other essential functions, abilities and physical requirements of this position include, but are not limited to: (e.g. Ability to work in an office environment operating standard office equipment, keyboarding, use of phone, use of computers, manual dexterity and fine motor skills for writing, occasional filing, lifting files weighing up to 10 pounds.)

The physical requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job and are not intended to be an exhaustive list. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job consistent with applicable law.

The job description above is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for performing this job and is not an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities, functions or requirements. Your supervisor may add or change duties or responsibilities from time to time in order to meet business needs. 

 Please apply directly on our careers page: 

It is our company's policy to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to sex, race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, religious creed, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, pregnancy, childbirth, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. It is our policy to provide reasonable accommodations to people with disabilities as required by law.

Title: Social Media Coordinator
Description:
TICKETON is a leading online ticket retailer that focuses on the U.S. Hispanic market. Consumers are able to purchase tickets to sports, music, entertainment, cultural, and other major live events, via our networking outlets and our bilingual friendly website.
 
Position Summary
The Social Media Coordinator will execute the social media strategy for the company in order to attract, engage and grow the client base. Coordinator will help develop, manage, edit and post content to the brand's social and digital channels (including, but not limited to, social networks, email, website and blog), track and report on progress and engagement in all social channels to management. The Social Media Coordinator will assist the marketing team in developing a monthly/quarterly strategy based on goals set forth.
 
Qualifications: 
 
•         Bachelor's degree preferably in Marketing or experience in related field.  
•         2-3 years of experience in the field. 
•         Fluent in English and Spanish (excellent written and verbal skills) 
•	Passionate for entertainment, music and sport content
•	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
•	Proficient in Word, Excel, Keynote, Photoshop and basic internet tools
•	Adaptable, committed, punctual and kind (attitudes best left at the door).
 
Knowledge and Skills:
 
•   Develop innovative and creative media content across social media platforms in line with brand and long term goals
•   Implement digital campaigns as needed
•   Accelerate rapid growth of social media platforms including Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, Twitter and YouTube
•   Report to Marketing Manager and collaborate with graphic designers and webmasters to ensure a cohesive social media identity
•   Stay up to date on marketing and industry trends
•   Maintain and track all social media platforms to ensure maximum visibility and increase brand recognition
•   Deliver monthly reports with statistics and results for each account
•   Additional duties as assigned

Description:

We are seeking installation and service technicians with construction experience beneficial to installing products in multi-story projects; an understanding of framing, drywall & sheet metal beneficial.
 
This work requires lifting,  loading / offloading, carrying up stairs and installing heavy objects; fastening or anchoring equipment in place; working within confined space and next to high-rise building edges and shafts; installing vents on roofs; installing, connecting and troubleshooting LV wiring, pneumatics, and hydraulic systems; welding a plus; driving company vehicles and delivery trucks local and throughout the territory.

We have long term (over 10 year) leads and helpers who enjoy the diversity of projects, work, running their own jobs, and representing the best in the industry to the best builders in the market. Compensation may include a mix of regular, union, and prevailing wage rates with comprehensive benefits.

Title: Social Media Marketing Coordinator
Description:
Mediakix is a leading influencer marketing company. Founded in 2011, we were one of the first influencer marketing companies and continue to be one of the fastest growing and most innovative in the space. Based in Santa Monica, CA, Mediakix creates and strategizes influencer marketing and advertising initiatives across YouTube, Instagram, Snapchat, and other social platforms. 

Our clients include the biggest and best brands in the world! Including Blue Apron, Exxon Mobile, Fairmont Hotels, LG, Uber, Sleep Number, Hallmark and many more top brands. We've partnered with the biggest and best influencers as well including Lele Pons, Anwar, Rudy Mancuso, Song of Style, Alisha Marie and pretty much everyone else. We also do our own marketing and PR, writing the biggest industry blog on influencer marketing. We've been featured in Mashable, Buzzfeed, The Verge, Wall Street Journal and pretty much everywhere else.

We're young, fun, creative and passionate. We're doing awesome things in a fast growing, brand new industry that's changing advertising. Yes, we're a part of changing advertising. You can be too! 

What You Will Do:

- Manage Mediakix-owned social media channels (i.e. scheduling posts, engaging across social, increasing social outreach, coordinating with company objectives, etc.)
- Develop and implement social strategy for Mediakix, leveraging channels like Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram. 
- Write content for Mediakix blog (3-4 weekly blog posts on influencer marketing and related industry news and trends)
- Create and curate relevant content and develop social distribution strategy on a weekly basis to engage target audiences.
- Undertake marketing department initiatives to help achieve team business targets supporting social channels and email/newsletter distribution.
- Track and measure success of social media initiatives by using reporting and analytics.
- Conduct social media research on industry trends and marketing projects/initiatives.
- Research latest trends and best practices to stay at the forefront of social media.

What You Will Need:

- Bachelor's Degree from top-ranked school in Business, Marketing, Journalism, Communications, or related field.
- 0-2 years relevant work experience in marketing and/or related field.
- Strong editorial skills: writing, content editing, copy editing, and proofreading.
- Strong research skills: attention to detail, analytical abilities.
- Knowledge and familiarity with social channels and strategy.
- Ability to thrive in fast-paced, deadline driven, startup environment.
- Passion for engaging in social media conversations and developing new ways to utilize emerging platforms.
- Passion for digital media/advertising and knowledgeable about influencer marketing, advertising and marketing, and social media (including YouTube channels, blogs, Instagram, emerging channels, etc.)

This is a full-time salaried position with benefits. DOE.

Please send:
1) your resume
2) a paragraph on why you think you would be the best candidate (no cover letters please)
3) 2 of your best writing samples (can include college papers/projects).

No phone calls.

Title: Chef de Cuisine / Exec Sous
Description:
The FLATS, an exciting new restaurant by chef Kyle Schutte is in immediate need for a professional, organized, dedicated and driven Chef de Cuisine / Executive Sous Chef.  This is a salaried position and will require a minimum of 60 hours per week.  The FLATS has an in-house baking, cheese and charcuterie program and is looking for a hungry restaurant professional with previous kitchen management experience who is ready to learn and grow.  The ideal candidate will have previously held the position of Sous Chef or higher in a full service upscale or fine dining restaurant.  Additionally, they should lead by example, demonstrate the highest of standards, be self-motivated,  able to take constructive critique, excellent in training kitchen staff and holding the staff accountable.  This is a highly technical kitchen and needs someone detail oriented and organized.  Please no baggage or egos.

Job duties include but not limited to:
•	Ensure food execution and prep is executed consistently to specification.
•	Necessary food prep and line execution.
•	Ensure all HACCP logs are completed accurately and consistently. 
•	Training kitchen staff on restaurant standards, sequence of service, recipe execution, station set up and break down, cooking technique, etc.
•	Daily line/ mise en place checks.
•	Constant and consistent staff evaluation.
•	Holding staff accountable to restaurant standards and procedures and necessary disciplinary actions.
•	Daily food orders. 
•	Scheduling BOH staff.
•	Responsible for financial performance in terms of BOH labor.
•	Understand all aspects of restaurant financial performance.
•	Weekly inventory and food cost calculation.
•	Responsible for BOH menu knowledge.
•	Utilization and organization of all necessary H.R. paperwork.
•	Ensure OSHA standard compliance.
•	Maintain health department standards.

If you feel that you meet the above criteria, please respond with a cover letter and resume.

Title: RWM Security Guard (Armed & Unarmed) NO Cost Training/Placement
Description:
RWM Fiber Optics is now offering No Cost Armed & Unarmed Security Training & Career Placement at their corporate campus in Carson, CA. This no cost program is being funded by local AJCC's including, Community Career Development, Managed Career Services, Jewish Vocational Services, Pacific Gateway and multiple other agencies utilizing the Workforforce Innovation & Opportunity Act. You can be on your way into a new career in as little at 10 days. Our 25 year successful history of training and placing individuals into careers is now available to everyone.  The next step is to register for a tour and application on the next available date. Classes start weekly and seating is limited. 

Our Class:

The Private Security Guard with Taser & Firearms program is offered as a 2 week, 80 hour training program. * Vocational Program. Emphasis is in basic knowledge of Private Security Guard (Guard Card), more commonly known as Security Guard. As well as comprehensive specialty training for BSIS Baton Permit and Firearms Training both Classroom and Range, additionally students will also learn Taser CEW (Conducted Electrical Weapon). This intense program consists of theory and extensive hands on lab to cement course work together to prepare the student for certification exams and job market. Successful graduates will qualify as entry level Armed Security Guard or other Personal Security or loss prevention industry company. Successful graduates will become certified by BSIS as Security Guard, Baton Permit and Firearms Permit, receive Pepper Spray and 1st Aid CPR/AED certification as well as Taser CEW Certification.
Your New Career Path:
Average wages for unarmed guards are $10 per hour to $11.50 per hour
Average wages for armed guards are $12 per hour to $15 per hour
Some government contracts for armed guards pay up to $28 per hour
Some of the major security employers in Southern California are:

        Securitas
        G4S
        Inter Con
        Allied Universal
        Paragon
        RMI

The typical career path for a security guard in one of the major companies is:  entry level security officer to patrol officer to shift supervisor to post commander to account manager to operations manager to branch office manager to regional manager.  Security guards can also branch off into specialized security career fields such as Human Resources, Training, and IT.

REGISTER HERE NOW:

Title: *****JOIN Me Flipping Houses- Will Train*****
Description:
Please read this ad very carefully, If interested, please visit my website:  


We are full-time Investors part of a Real Estate Club closing deals throughout Southern California. We are real people, doing real deals, and doing very well in this market but want to do more.  As senior members of the club for the over 5 years, we have been very successful teaching others to work alongside us, helping them to get their start in this business closing deals and splitting profits.  
 
We are not looking for everyone to join us. This business takes time, determination, and persistence. This is NOT a get rich quick or network marketing or MLM system. Having a current job to help pay your bills until you close your first deal is not only important, but necessary.
 
People who want to learn this business are usually concerned about what it takes to get started.  Not having the capital to buy a house is usually the biggest concern.  What most people need is a team, and one that already has the resources available to plug into, allowing you to ride on the coattails of those more experienced. Our office has everything needed to close real estate transactions such as: 
  
•	Title/ Escrow  
•	Transaction Coordinators   
•	Bank Negotiators  
•	Real Estate Agents 
•	Real Estate Attorneys 
•	Contractors
•	Capital to fund deals 
  
We are currently expanding in different cities and looking for individuals with entrepreneurial drive and determination to build a business for themselves.  Most people start on a part-time basis, leaning on others credibility until they can close deals, build their network and replace their primary income.  
  
There's a lot of great deals in So Cal, and how to find those deals is what we teach. Below are the strategies we are currently using:  
  
•	Fix n Flips  
•	Wholesale  
•	Foreclosures  
•	Short Sales  
•	Probate  
•	Lease Options etc  
•	Vacant Houses  
•	Property Tax Defaults 
 
*NO REAL ESTATE LICENSE OR EXPERIENCE IS REQUIRED.  
 
   
  
The key to growth is surrounding yourself with people who are already doing what you want to do. Starting this business is about leverage.  You are looking to leverage what we already have to help you get started.  In turn, we are looking to leverage you to close more deals.  In the process, we get paid when we close deals, splitting profits, and helping you to build your own business.  As club members, we have many benefits that have led to us closing over 100 deals in the past few years. 

You don't need capital to buy a house or experience, but you will have to dedicate time and effort to make money in this business.  Unlike the TV shows and real estate seminars, we do actually tell you that it is impossible to make money overnight.  

We get together several times a month in multiple locations including, Riverside, Irvine, Oceanside and Los Angeles. Our system has a proven record for many years now. What we do has afforded us the opportunity to help others get to their first deal and more. 

If you want to partner with experienced investors who can bring the capital and systems to the table, and are the type of person that wants to run your own business at some point, we should talk. Keep in mind, we are very busy and a large reason for placing this ad is to meet the right people looking to get started in this business who see the value of creating partnerships. 





Once we have you're info, we'll follow up within 48 hours.
***NOTE***
We are looking for potential Business Partners, not EMPLOYEES. Only contact me if you are serious. If you are currently unemployed and need money fast, now is not the right time for you. ALL RESUMES WILL BE IGNORED.
  
Riverside County - Banning, Beaumont, Blythe, Calimesa, Canyon Lake, Cathedral City, Coachella, Corona, Desert Hot Springs, Eastvale, Hemet, Indian Wells, Indio, Jurupa Valley, Lake Elsinore, La Quinta, Menifee, Moreno Valley, Murrieta, Norco, Palm Desert, Palm Springs, Perris, Rancho, Mirage, Riverside, San Jacinto, Temecula, Wildomar Orange County - Aliso Viejo, Anaheim, Brea, Buena Park, Costa Mesa, Cypress, Dana Point, Fountain Valley, Fullerton, Garden Grove, Huntington Beach, Irvine, La Habra, La Palma, Laguna Beach, Laguna Hills, Laguna Niguel, Laguna Woods, Lake Forest, Los Alamitos, Mission Viejo, Newport Beach, Orange, Placentia, Rancho Santa Margarita, San Clemente, San Juan Capistrano, Santa Ana, Seal Beach, Stanton, Tustin, Villa Park, Westminster, Yorba Linda LA County - Alhambra, Arcadia, Azusa, Baldwin Park, Bellflower, Burbank, Carson, Cerritos, Claremont, Compton, Covina, Culver City, Diamond Bar, Downey, Duarte, El Monte, Glendale, Glendora, Hawthorne, Inglewood, La Canada, La Habra, La Puente, La Verne, Lakewood, Lancaster, Los Angeles, Lynwood, Monrovia, Montebello, Monterey Park, Norwalk, Palmdale, Paramount, Pasadena, Pomona, Rosemead, San Dimas, San Gabriel, San Marino, Sierra Madre, South Pasadena, Temple City, Torrance, Walnut, West Covina, West Hollywood

Title: Creative Writer Wanted for NUGG
Description:
GENERAL DESCRIPTION:

Based in Los Angeles, NuggMD (nuggmd.com) is an online telemedicine platform providing patients across California with easy, quick and professional access to medical marijuana. Nugg (getnugg.com) is also California's leading online cannabis delivery marketplace bringing medical marijuana to your doorstep in no time.

Our blog () helps our Nugg family and those interested in the mmj industry stay informed about everything cannabis related.

So if you're passionate about joining our thriving, dynamic company quickly becoming a leader in the cannabis industry, Nugg is the right place for you!

YOUR ROLE:

We're looking for an awesome remote freelance writer and curator who knows how to use technical platforms to create rich, brand building content. You're responsible for consistently producing written work for our blog in the form of cannabis-related articles, product reviews, checklists, industry interviews, and more with the goal of advancing our editorial calendar and mission.

BENEFIT TO YOU:

Besides compensation in the range of $40-70 per article, you'll become a published author at the forefront of America's next great industry, as well as be labeled a thought-leader in the medical cannabis world. The more we grow, so will your opportunity for increased pay and a larger role in our company.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

-Create content for Nugg's blog (blog.getnugg.com) including writing promotional, technical, and creative copy consistent with our company's tone and mission. 
-Must be able to write clean, concise, and well-polished articles.
-Curate new content ideas from around the web, cannabis-related newsletters, and via technical tools to discover trends in content-marketing within our industry.
-You'll need a creative writing style that mixes editorial efficiency with a flair for inspiring and motivating customer action. 
-Must stay on top of medical and recreational cannabis trends and recognize ways to keep Nugg's content sticky and fresh.
-Proofreading and fact checking are key; 100% accuracy and attention to detail a must.
-It's your personal mission to make ordering cannabis online surprisingly easy and exciting.
-Set goals for yourself and attain them.
-Continuously improve yourself and others around you.
-Contribute to the company by providing great ideas and feedback.


ESSENTIAL SKILLS:

-An arsenal of words and phrases written for successful blog posts.
-A grammar expert.
-1+ years (preferable) of content creation/writing experience.
-In-depth knowledge of the cannabis industry: products, strains, brands, trends, laws, current events, etc. 
-Works extremely well collaboratively and takes constructive criticism.
-Excellent communications skills.
-Must demonstrate exemplary organizational skills.
-Ability to carry out tasks independently.
-Self-starter, highly motivated to succeed under minimal supervision.
-Very web-savvy and up-to-date with developing tools and methods.
-Strong self-motivation and multitasking required, while managing writers to meet daily deadlines.
-Experience and/or passion for medical marijuana.

STEPS:

Send your resume, cover letter and a writing sample.

Title: PPC / AdWords Manager - In-House ONLY - Full Time - $65,000 DOS
Description:
We are an interesting PPC firm - definitely unique and nothing like you're used to. We specialize in applying marketing technology and accounting to PPC. We offer hand-coded landing pages, CRM's, hand management, and on-site meetings no matter where the client is located. We manage our accounts differently. We tell our clients to ignore cost per lead. We report every dollar of profit back to AdWords in real time and optimize on that. (Like eCommerce ROI reporting but for lead gen, we can't wait to show you how cool this is)

We have some smaller local accounts for when we get bored, but the majority are larger businesses eager for profit. We advise clients not just on marketing, but on accounting, margin, and sales models. We provide email marketing automation (hand coded by us, no WYSIWYG nonsense) and a whole bunch of other things to facilitate PPC.

We don't have a model where we rapidly onboard accounts. We believe that fewer accounts that pay more money justifies allocating more work hours to each account. Each manager is responsible for up to 10 to 15 accounts, maximum. We meet clients by phone conference weekly, so you should have some degree of communication and sales skills. (We don't expect you to sell, unless you want to.)

We're not interested in your book of business - keep it for yourself. We only want your brain (if it's decent and comes with a good personality). We WANT you to manage your own accounts from work, we WANT you to be involved in outside business.

We pay you well and it's based on your current skill set. Whatever you don't know we'll teach you. We go beyond PPC into marketing theory, accounting, and business/sales management.

We offer our services for AdWords and Amazon (okay, and sometimes Bing but we hate it just like everyone else). We do Facebook too, but not as much.

REQUIRED SKILLS:
Working experience/history in AdWords accounts that you can demonstrate.
History in business ownership/management (even if you failed) OR accounting.
$45,000 plus 5% of gross revenue on accounts managed by you.

QUALIFYING HIRING BONUS AND IMMEDIATE RAISE - +$10,000 Salary, $2,000 bonus:
Accounting degree or equivalent, certification of accounting course, etc. 
BASIC knowledge of HTML/CSS, PHP/MySQL, and/or Photoshop (this is a non-coding job, but you will have to check things out from time-to-time)
$55,000 plus 7-10% of gross revenue on accounts managed by you.

WANT TO SELL YOUR OWN ACCOUNTS?
It's optional. You get 20% of first month management fees, depending on agreement term, in addition to the commission if you manage it too.

PAY INCREASE:
Don't have the accounting or coding skills? If we hire you and you take classes, we will offer you the raise and pay (reimburse) you for the classes. We WANT to pay you more money over time - it means you're worth it to us and won't ever leave.

WE START EARLY. WE WORK HARD.
Work hours are 6:30am to 3:30pm, M-F. Can you hang?

We buy you health insurance after 90 days. 

NO WORK EXPERIENCE? NO PROBLEM
Apply anyway, we might just hire you.

WANNA KNOW WHAT THIS JOB REALLY IS?
It's high-pressure, but pretty fun.
It's a mix of highs and lows, disappointment and elation in perfect proportions.
It's only for smart people and smart clients. Otherwise we aren't interested.
It's a small team of guys who love money, love ideas, and love tech (and sometimes our significant others)
We are compulsive obsessors.
Also, parking is pretty easy. 


::::: NOTE: THIS IS AN IN-HOUSE POSITION ONLY. NO REMOTE EMPLOYEES.

We will test your skills. Your test results dictate our offer to you. We don't play low-ball games. We'll offer you what you're worth, then we'll make you worth more, then we'll pay you what your worth. No bullshit.

RESPOND WITH A RESUME AND A SAMPLING OF YOUR PERSONALITY IN THE BODY OF THE EMAIL.
IMPRESS US, PLEASE.

Title: Earn $650/mo teaching part-time • online from home • 60-90 mins/day
Description:
K-6 Online ESL Teacher - Part-Time Independent Contractor with VIPKID

The Opportunity: 

The future is here! Join a fast growing community of elite educators who are teaching right from their home. As an independent contractor, you will be matched 1:1 with Chinese students on our secure virtual learning platform to teach English online.  You can make your own schedule and use VIPKID resources to instruct - no lesson planning required! 

This opportunity is for you if you have a strong teaching background, are energetic, engaging, and self-motivated. If you consider yourself a global educator and are excited about the use of technology to connect the world, then this is a match. Partner with us and help change the face of online learning. 

About VIPKID
We have offices in Beijing, Shanghai, and San Francisco and have over 100,000 students and 15,000 teachers on the VIPKID platform. Founded in 2013, VIPKID has won several awards including CY Zone's Top 100 Chinese Companies, Top 21 Global Innovation Companies, and the US-China Entrepreneurship Leader Award. We have strategic partnerships with ETS, Coursera, and TESOL, and are venture backed by top investors, such as Innovation Works, Sequoia Capital, Matrix Partners, Northern Light Venture, Yunfeng Capital, Learn Capital, and Kobe Bryant's fund, Bryant Stibel.  

We pride ourselves on giving Chinese children the American elementary school experience.

The Work 
-	1-on-1 online full immersion English language and content classes
-	An American curriculum, based on the Common Core State Standards
-	25-minute highly engaging lessons

Requirements
-	Exposure to the American or Canadian K-12 education system
-	Minimum 1 year of teaching experience
-	Bachelor's degree
-	Tech Requirements: Desktop or Laptop with a fast internet connection and audio/video capability

Opportunity Details

Contract type: Independent contractor
Contract term: 6-Months 
Start date: Immediately
Hours: In order to maximize the number of classes scheduled, teachers are recommended to be available for at least 15 time slots per week (each time slot is 30 minutes) during Beijing peak times. The following hours tend to be the most requested time periods from our families: Monday-Sunday 6-10pm, and Saturday-Sunday 9am-10pm in Beijing time. 

Here are the times converted to US time:

US Times	Monday~Friday
Beijing 6pm ~10pm	Saturday
Beijing 9am ~10pm	Sunday
Beijing 9am ~10pm
EST	6am ~ 10am	Fri 9pm~Sat 10am	Sat 9pm~Sun 10am
CST	5am ~ 9am	Fri 8pm~Sat 9am	Sat 8pm ~Sun 9am
MST	4am ~ 8am	Fri 7pm~Sat 8am	Sat 7pm~Sun 8am
PST	3am ~ 7am	Fri 6pm~Sat 7am	Sat 6pm~Sun 7am
Hawaii	1am ~ 5am	Fri 4pm~Sat 5am	Sat 4pm~Sun 5am

Payment: Our teachers are paid according to the number of classes finished. The minimum service fee rate range is US$ 14-$18/hour. There are incentives for every lesson, so a typical service fee ranges between US$ 14-22/hour. This business opportunity is ideal for independent contractor teachers looking to supplement their income.

HOW TO APPLY
Please apply through our Teacher Recruitment Portal:  

MORE INFORMATION

Facebook: www.facebook.com/VIPKID.com.cn  
Twitter: @TheVIPKIDLife
Linkedin:

Reviews about us on Glassdoor:

Title: hiring part time FOH cashier/server/barista
Description:
hello! 

we're looking to hire someone to work the front of house at a very busy breakfast, lunch and dinner restaurant. 

our perfect match:
 - a friendly human who is able to remain calm when dealing with difficult situations & customers.
 - someone with a knowledge and passion for food, coffee, pastries; you'll be talking about them all day with people!
 - a sense of urgency and the ability to move quickly and efficiently, not glued to your phone
 - strong phone skills and a friendly voice
 - multitasking, multitasking, multitasking!
 - confident with english, CA serv-safe certified; general common sense; CLEAN & tidy
 - reliable and sharp, quick learners embraced with open, grateful arms
 - a team player
 - someone with a flexible availability **must be available holidays and be in town through the rest of the summer and the winter holidays.** we are open 8am-9pm m-f and 8-4 on weekends so our ideal candidate will have a fairly open weekly schedule.

this is not a serving job where you just stand around and check in on your tables every once in a while. no egos, no divas: everyone is expected to clean, restock, buss tables, run food, etc. 
your days here will be fast paced, hands on, often demanding and your passion or lack thereof will show. it's also fun and a strong team environment and offers good learning opportunities! we serve a very high number of regulars and our staff turnover is very low. this is a small, family owned restaurant and tight knit community.

please reply with a resume (prefer as a word or pdf attachment), a little about yourself and why you think you'd be a good fit for the job, a note about your availability and any standing schedule commitments, and whether or not you have experience on a manual espresso bar (not required, but helpful to know). also confirm that you will be around and available for the summer and the winter holidays.

Title: Freelance Professional Photographer
Description:
Attention all professional photographers - Snappr is now in the greater Los Angeles area and accepting applications!

If you are passionate about creating great photographs, want to increase your experience and schedule more shoots, apply to become a Snappr freelancer today! Snappr is an on-demand professional photography marketplace. By absorbing all of the operational and marketing overhead, we'll allow you to focus on doing what you do best - taking amazing photos. 

Stop waiting around looking for jobs to appear on social media and unleash your creative potential. Our system uses your availability to automatically assign you bookings in your service area at times that best suit you. All you need to do is complete the shoot, submit the edited photos, and get paid. Photographers on our platform have earned on average $100 per hour of shoot time, but it can vary from $50-$130+ per hour, with an average booking duration of 2 hours.

Our ideal photographer:
- Is a full-time or part-time professional photographer with at least 1 year of experience
- Owns professional level equipment (DSLR camera, flash, and a range of lenses)
- Has a solid online portfolio
- Is modern, creative and on trend with their photography and editing style
- Is experienced in Adobe Lightroom
- Is highly personable and friendly
- Is able to service a range of shoot types, e.g. portraits, events, weddings, product, real estate, fashion, etc.

If this sounds like you, please complete our application by August 29 at the link below. If approved, you will be sent further details about onboarding steps, fee schedule, contract terms, etc. We look forward to connecting with you!

Title: Innovative Dining Group is Hiring a Temporary Events Assistant
Description:
IDG Special Events and Catering Department is seeking a resourceful, highly-motivated, dynamic and service-minded team player to join our very busy department as a PT Events Assistant.  

The PT Events Assistant is responsible for providing administrative, organizational and operational support to the Catering Events Department in both the development and execution of events.

- Maintain Events calendar and communication liaison between Events department and each restaurant with regards to all bookings.
- Answer inquiry forms in a timely fashion; keep phone log.
- Manage RFP solicitation process for logistic vendors and suppliers.  
- Maintain accurate and up-to-date records and files for all event projects.
- Provide support to overall team operations by preparing meeting agenda, taking notes and administrating follow up reports.
- Create proposals, invoices, receipts, menus, labels/signage for all private dining events.
- Manage the catering/events social platforms, Instagram and Facebook.

Ideal candidates will possess the following skills and qualifications:

- Must have a passion for events.
- Bachelor's degree
- Must be proficient in Microsoft Office and Social Media sites.
- Excellent communication skills:  verbal and written.
- Must have efficient time management skills and the ability to work independently, prioritize, organize, multi-task/manage multiple projects simultaneously, pay attention to detail and meet deadlines.
- Positive attitude, resourceful nature and exceptional problem solving capabilities.
- Position requires weekend and evening availability, when necessary.

If you fit the above description and would like to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment, at a wonderful company that epitomizes hospitality and style, we'd love to hear from you!  Please email your resume.  No phone calls.  


Innovative Dining Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.  We make all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.  We encourage everyone to respond.

Title: LEMONADE IN VENICE IS HIRING PREP COOKS AND STEWARD/DISHWASHERS! COME
Organic Living Superfoods is Expanding!  Looking for Sales Rep in LA
Description:
Please take a look at our website BEFORE contacting us.  www.organiclivingsuperfoods.com

We are looking for a talented and competitive Outside Sales Representatives.  Organic Living Superfoods is a manufacturer and distributor or organic, raw, vegan, gluten-free, dairy-free, paleo snacks and superfoods. We specialize is sprouted flavored nuts, trail mixes, nut crunches, energy squares, dried fruits, dark chocolate superfruits, and superfood powders and smoothie mixes. Your job will be to sell our products at wholesale (pre-packaged or in bulk) to businesses across multiple industries including:

Health Food Stores and Supermarkets
Juice Bars
Coffee Shops
Health clubs/gyms
Yoga/barre/spin studios
Health Spas
Convenience stores
Golf Pro Shops
Colleges and Universities
Hotels and Resorts
Department stores
...and more

We work closely with well-known brands, such as: Whole Foods, Big Y, W Hotels, Tom Brady's TB12 Snacks, New England Patriots, Sun Country Airlines, Costco, Home Goods, and many others.

What does an Inside Sales Representative do?

Outside Sales Reps play a fundamental role in growing our customer base and account database. You must be comfortable walking into retail locations, making dozens of calls per day, sending dozens of emails, generating interest, qualifying prospects and closing sales. You will be given leads to contact within a specific region or industry to reach out to. 

Our products are NOT a hard sell! We are offering healthy snacks....low-ticket items that provide value to a business' customer base. All the businesses you will be contacting already offer food products to their customers....we just offer BETTER options....and they taste GREAT too. Don't worry, you will be able to eat plenty of them!

Responsibilities:

-Source new sales opportunities through outbound cold calls and emails
-Understand customer needs and requirements
-Close sales and achieve quarterly quotas (sales manager will be available to hop on the phone and help close deals as well)
-Research accounts, identify key players and generate interest
-Maintain and expand your database of prospects within your assigned territory or industry
-Team with channel partners to build pipeline and close deals
-Perform effective demos in accounts you close

Requirements:

-Proven outside sales experience
-Strong phone presence and experience dialing dozens of calls per day
-Excellent verbal and written communications skills
-Strong listening and presentation skills
-Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively

Pay Structure:

--Commission PLUS--
10% commissions on both NEW and REPEAT orders. 
$200/month stipend
$50 Bonus for every store you close
$75 for every 3 hour demo at your accounts

For the right type of person, there is HUGE potential to make a very healthy income for yourself.

Interested? Please reply to this posting with your resume and a brief description of why you would make a great candidate for this position and we can schedule a phone call to discuss.

ABOUT PRIDE OF AMERICA

Inaugurated in 2005, Pride of America is the first US-flagged cruise ship in nearly fifty years.

Pride of America was designed to pay homage to the spirit of the United States, with patriotic artwork on the hull and American-themed public spaces.

She is currently the only American registered major cruise ship serving the Hawaiian market from Honolulu, sailing to Kahului (Maui), Hilo (Hawaii), Kona (Hawaii), Nawiliwili (Kauai).

Because she is flagged in the United States, Pride of America is required to carry a US crew. There are 935 crew employed on Pride of America.


IMPORTANT REQUIREMENT FOR ALL APPLICANTS:

•You must have a GED or High School Diploma
•You must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. and qualify for a U.S. Coast Guard Merchant Mariner Credential (MMC) as well as a Transportation Workers Identification Credential (TWIC).
•In order to qualify for an MMC you must:
•Be at least 18 years of age
•Be a US Citizen or Permanent Resident Alien
•Pass Physical Exam/Drug Screen

Title: Senior Wealth Strategy Analyst Sought for Private Client Team
Description:
We are seeking a talented professional to breathe life into the role of Senior Wealth Strategy Analyst for a growing private client team with a global private bank.  Successful applicants will have either a CFA designation or five years of identical experience.   

This is a professional who, under the direction and tutelage of a senior financial advisor, runs all aspects of portfolio management for private investors, including reviewing asset allocation alignment with models, conducting in-depth research to calculate estimated taxes on complex portfolio maneuvers, summarizing fund manager and alternative investment conference calls, running highly complex performance reports with dozens of inputs; and suggesting and engineering improvements in the portfolio management process.  An analyst is an entry-level member whose compensation grows with the team.

Qualities sought: extremism in detail orientation -- the desire to make a masterpiece of client portfolios, individually and collectively; extraordinary intellectual curiosity -- the need to know why something is out of place, doesn't fit, is illogical, or doesn't add up; outstanding empathy -- always treating others in precisely the same way that we ourselves want to be treated: with speed, enthusiasm, care, knowledge, wisdom, and accuracy; the heart of a psychologist -- ability to listen without speaking for long periods of time and understand what the speaker is saying; and carefully cultivated communication skills -- an ever-improving ability to hone in on the single most important point and communicate in writing or in speech accurately and succinctly before moving on to the next most important point.

Title: Regional Manager - Los Angeles, CA
Description:
REGIONAL PROPERTY MANAGER for LIHTC & HUD MULTIFAMILY PORTFOLIO in California

POSITION PROFILE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Overall accountability for the operational and financial performance of a multifamily portfolio consisting of 1,000 - 1,500 units.
• Responsible for staffing, training, team leadership, motivation, compliance, accounting and asset management of each property.
• Overall accountability for all site management operations, staff recruiting, hiring and training, marketing, Section 42, UPCS and HUD compliance, leasing, rent collections, resident relations, supportive services, property upkeep and maintenance, payroll administration and all financial analysis and reporting to lenders and equity partners.
• Establishes and monitors operating budgets, all required porting and ensures the financial and operational excellence of the communities.
• Obtains and analyzes current market and economic data.
• Develop, implement and manage short and long-range marketing and management plans to achieve each community's occupancy, compliance and financial goals.
• Implement and monitor comprehensive operating policies and procedures appropriate to the success of the day-to-day operations of each property.
• Implement and oversight of all resident programs and services to minimize unit turnover and to promote resident retention and customer satisfaction.
• Develop solid business and communication relations with the owners and equity partners of each property.
• Ensure the promotion of resident services and activities that demonstrate quality service to residents.
• Conduct quarterly site/ unit inspections with site personnel to ensure communities are being maintained to UFAS, HUD, Fair Housing, QHS and LIHTC standards within the company and compliance standards.

QUALIFICATIONS: 
• 3-5 years experience managing a multifamily portfolio inclusive of affordable and market-rate properties within a portfolio. 
• Must have prior experience with operating properties Section 42 LIHTC, HUD, LTWFH and market rate programs. 
• HCCP, Fair Housing, CAM, CPM and COS or other comparable training and certifications is required.
• Strong effective leader and communicator.
• Must be a self-starter, work independently in a fast-paced work environment, be result oriented and a problem solver.
• A depth of experience across all aspects of multifamily property management, operations and compliance to include, but not limited to: leasing, marketing, budgeting, financial asset management, maintenance, compliance, reporting, staff development and team building.

This is a great opportunity to expand your career working with a leading business development firm. *Preparing for appointments received from assistant the day prior--all travel is local and typically within a 50 mile radius of your home

*Good communicator--excellent listening skills and ability to uncover the real "pain" a client might be experiencing
*Ability to begin work immediately

This is a 100% Commissioned W-2 Employee Position

We Offer a Fantastic Benefits and Compensation Program
*$65,000 - $85,000 realistic first year commissions
*Potential to earn 6 figure commissions
*Comprehensive new hire and ongoing training and development
*Full benefits after 60 days of employment & 401k after 1 year
*Protected territory and pre-set appointments

Proficient in Microsoft Office.

Knowledgeable in internet research. Interest in event planning.

Title: Become a Plumber Paid Trainees Needed In North Hollywood Neighborhoods
Description:
Change your life for the better
Mike Diamond Services is Offering On-the-Job Paid Training for a small group of talented people.	
	
EXPERIENCED AND NO EXPERIENCED TRAINEES NEEDED	

A NEW JOB AND A CHANCE OF A LIFETIME!  
Mike Diamond Plumbing is looking for a few talented people to become Plumbers.  We are hiring Trainees with no experience.  This is a rare opportunity to apply to work for Los Angeles and Orange County's premier plumbing company.  You will get paid to learn a trade and begin a journey on a successful career as a Smell Good Plumber at Mike Diamond Plumbing.  This is the first time in many years we have offered this special opportunity.
		
CHOOSE TO WORK AT ANY OF THESE LOCATIONS:
- Hollywood-San Fernando Valley East, San Gabriel Valley
- North Hollywood-San Fernando Valley West, Santa Clarita Valley
- Culver City-West Los Angeles, Inglewood 
- Gardena- South Bay, Long Beach
- Anaheim-Orange County Inland
- Costa Mesa-Orange County Coastal, South Orange County
- Pomona-Inland Empire, Ontario

You must have a clean driving record.

THE TRAINING PROGRAM - NO EXPERIENCE NEEDED:
Work with an experienced plumber in the real world.  You will spend time with someone who is successful and has already gone through the steps you're going through.  Trainees may be assigned to one mentor to work with while others may be rotating among a support group of experienced plumbers.  

THE PAY:
We will pay you while you work and learn.  This position includes a 40-hour work week, Monday thru Friday.  Overtime available every other Saturday.  Weekday overtime is also available.  If you are successful, you will be assigned a company truck, full compensation and plenty of opportunities to grow. 

Don't Miss This Chance to Change Your Future!  Call or Write Us NOW, we have limited openings.

Visit  for more information, call Wayne at (800) 510-1760, or fax at (310) 838-4327.

Title: Web Marketing Strategist/Sales
Description:
Agent Image is a premier, privately held Web Design and Internet Marketing solutions company focusing on products and services for real estate professionals throughout the world.

Agent Image's organizational culture is considered one of its keys to success and can be described as open, fast paced, casual and accountable (we expect all team members to perform at a high level). 

Job Description

We are looking for a confident, well-spoken, smart, experienced and highly motivated customer service expert with an outstanding work ethic who wants to take the next step in their career as a welcome addition to our already exceptional sales team. 

Our sales team consults with prospective clients on a daily basis and provides them with the best solutions for their long-term success.

If you've got a positive attitude, great personality, drive and love to provide great customer service for our clients, we're looking for you and are willing to train you with the best sales team in the industry!!!

Responsibilities include:

*Sell products via telephone, email and text to warm leads, existing clients and new prospects
*Provide a high level of customer service to potential, new and existing clients
*Cold call prospects for at least 2 hours a day
*Learning our example websites, pricing, sales pitch, products and services in the 1st month of training through individual coaching with managers and listening to other team members on sales calls
*Sell at least $5,000 in sales of our Website and Internet Marketing products by the end of the 2nd month of training
*Sell at least $12,000 in sales of our Website and Internet Marketing products by the end of the 3rd month of training
*Sell at least $25,000 in sales of our Website and Internet Marketing products by the end of the 4th month on the team
*Average $35,000 or more a month per trimester after the 4th month on the team
*Perform minimum required amount of outbound calls and SF tasks every week
*Be consultative and properly sell our Website and Internet Marketing products with the right client expectations
*Provide prospective clients the best possible Website and Internet Marketing solution to meet their long-term goals
*Coordinate with Managers, Project Managers and Web Developers throughout the sales and project cycles, especially if any sales issues occur
*Make a commitment to our clients and their success
*Work with sales team to achieve monthly and yearly goals
*Give feedback to the management team to improve products, services and customer experience

Key Competencies:

*Self-discipline/strong work ethic
*Consistency
*Likable/Great Personality
*Great attitude
*Desire to learn and grow
*Confidence
*Ability to anticipate clients' needs
*Organized
*Patient
*Tenacious
*Creative
*Good speaking/phone voice
*Team player
*Coachable

Requirements:

*At least 2 or more years of customer service experience
*Work experience in a web-based, technical or real estate industry a strong plus
*Sales experience a strong plus
*Web design and development experience a strong plus
*SEO experience a strong plus
*Real estate experience a strong plus
*Salesforce experience a strong plus
*Excellent customer service skills
*Excellent interpersonal, written and communication skills
*Must have strong organizational skills
*A positive attitude and a willingness to be a part of the team
*Motivated by consistent income, base salary and rewarding commission plan

Electronic Health Record (EHR) Trainer
Description:
EHR Trainers possess and demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of and skill in areas of healthcare applications, technology, and/or education as evidenced by experience in providing classroom and/or on-site training in health information systems. They conduct needs and skills assessments for end users to determine the type and duration of training needed, develop training documentation and outlines, and deliver training to end-users with varying levels of computer literacy and in a range of clinical modules/applications.

Job Description:

Assess the training needs of end users and design effective training materials and techniques for individuals with different levels of computer literacy. Research, interpret, explain, and apply information from computer software, technical manuals and guides, videos and online materials. Use written and oral presentation and communications skills in order to effectively communicate to a diverse audience ranging from unskilled personnel to highly trained and experienced professionals with a wide range of computer skills at all levels. Gain an in-depth understanding of clinical and operational workflows in order to develop and implement workflow documentation for training in clinical software applications. Conduct clinical software application training. Support healthcare workers by providing technical support, troubleshooting, and identifying opportunities for clinical information system improvements. Provide support to development team in the form of comprehensive testing of all aspects of clinical application software. Work independently and work collaboratively with colleagues of various educational levels. Assist with tracking of end user attendance, course completion and testing. Builds rapport and promotes team work by maintaining a professional and positive attitude in the learning environment at all times, working to maintain open and professional and positive attitude in the learning environment at all times, working to maintain open and professional and positive attitude in the learning environment at all times.

Located in Downtown Los Angeles

Qualifications & Education Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree with work or volunteer experience preferred in healthcare.

Preferred Skills:

Experience working with EHRs, specifically NextGen, desirable.

Experience with mentoring, guiding and training in a class room setting, desirable.

Title: UCLA Laboratory Assistant III
Description:
Please apply at:

Search requisition number: 
24898

Under the direct supervision of the Principal Investigator, the Lab Assistant III will help manage and maintain stem cell cultures and assist with experiments under the guidance of the PI involving genome modification techniques and high data content technologies including next-generation sequencing. In this process, the incumbent will assist with basic molecular biology procedures and supervise undergraduate workers involved in these tasks. Research duties include maintaining cell cultures for several weeks; generating transgenic cell lines; genotyping cells: DNA sequencing and Southern blots; quantitative PCR, flow cytometry and preparing DNA libraries for sequencing. Other lab duties include coordinating purchase orders for lab supplies/reagents, maintaining databases (chemicals, biologicals, cell lines), performing computer software updates and serving as laboratory safety officer.  


 	
1. Excellent organizational skills and ability to keep accurate records of cell lines, biological samples, and laboratory supplies.
Required
 	
2. Excellent interpersonal skills.
Required
 	
3. Skill in communicating problems and information in a timely and critical manner.
Required
 	
4. Ability to work independently, supervise others, and follow through with tasks.
Required
 	
5. Ability to think critically
Required
 	
6. Undergraduate degree in a field of science and knowledge of basic molecular biology techniques or an equivalent combination of education or experience.
Required
 	
7. Basic computer skills and proficiency with office related software (i.e.,Word, Excel and Powerpoint, Adobe suite, etc.)
Required

Title: Project Controls Professional
Description:
Harder Mechanical, founded in 1934, is one of the oldest continuously operating mechanical construction companies in the United States. We are recognized as a leader in high-tech, industrial and commercial construction, successfully managing projects throughout the United States. We have been consistently ranked among the top 50 subcontractors by Engineering News Record.

Our Richmond, California office has an immediate opening for a Project Controls Professional. This position offers an excellent opportunity for growth. We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a professional work environment. Qualified individuals are invited to apply in confidence, include a cover letter, resume, and daytime phone number. 

Experience:
Candidates must be self-starters with five or more years of similar construction-cost scheduling experience. Working knowledge of and ability to apply resource monitoring and cost control techniques and computer scheduling techniques. General understanding of the nature of process systems, and construction process is also essential. Excellent organizational, time management, written, verbal and computer skills is required. As a candidate you must have experience with Primavera products and be skilled in spreadsheet and database software applications as they apply to cost control. High School Diploma, Four year (4) degree preferred.


Responsibilities: 
Monitoring project costs as well as measuring project costs/revenues against established project budget and schedule. Support field and estimators with developing and maintaining primary and area specific schedules and labor forecasts. Analyze work progress and develop craft productivity reports. Watch for schedule and cost variances through assessment of progress data supplied by others, as well as personal observation and verification of project completion progress. Communicate potential cost and scheduling problems, interference and schedule difficulties to senior management. Work to prevent and resolve problems so they have minimal impact on project goals. Some travel required. 

Respond directly to this craigslist ad to submit your resume.  For more information about Harder Mechanical, please visit our website www.harder.com

Title: LOCAL INSURANCE OFFICE HIRING AGENT IMMEDIATELY
Description:
Life Insurance License REQUIRED for position (Licensed or willing/working on getting their license). But either way, you gotta get that license through the State in order to be offered the position. 

Are you looking for Time Freedom or Time Flexibility?!?! We have 3 positions available that offer that. 

***POSITIONS***
1. Part Time: 10-20 hours roughly a week
2. Full Time: 25-40 hours roughly a week
3. Agency Manager: Building a team for true passive income. (Typically 18 months to get to this position). We can help you get there!

****HOW MUCH MONEY CAN I MAKE****
Want to answer to a boss? Clock in at a 9-5? This will not be a fit!
Work as little/as much as you want, that's the beauty of commissions! Know if you don't do the work, you won't make money (pretty much like every other job on the planet)! Yay for Flexibility!

Part Time: Potential of $30,000 - $50,000+
Full Time: Potential of $75,000 - $125,000+
Management: Multiple Six Figures INCLUDING Bonuses and potential of a $1,000,000+ income

***THINGS TO KNOW***
1. REQUIREMENTS: Again, you need a license for any of these positions. Everything else can be taught/learned through training.
2. LEADS: We got 'em (we are not a lead generation company). In-house CAPTIVE leads! Too many families and not enough people to help get them what they want! We mail out over 1.5 million letters each week to people and get about 15 to 20 thousand requests every week from people who would like us to show them their options for life or disability insurance. 
3. WHERE DO YOU WORK: Offices are all across the country, but you work from home {for the most part}. You will have to go to client's homes (as the carriers require face to face identity verification) to help figure out what products can fit their budget AND needs! 
4. WHO DO WE WORK FOR: We represent about 13 carriers (Mutual of Omaha, Fidelity & Guaranteed Life, ING etc. . .). We've got some of the most prestigious carriers in the game that partner with us.
5. WHAT PRODUCTS DO WE SELL: ALL of them (except health insurance, the State has Affordable Care Act that handles that)! Such a wide range of products to offer to clients that you can cover ANYONE regardless of their health. Term/Universal Life/Whole Life/Annuities just to name a few. 

Call the Franco Team HR Department at 800-417-6360 x 9354 schedule a telephone interview with our hiring manager! Position will go fast!

Title: SECURITY OFFICERS NEEDED * $11.50 to 15.00
PAID CDL TRUCK DRIVER TRAINING - NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY
Korean Interpreters--Work From Home on Your Own Schedule!
Description:
Lionbridge is currently looking for freelance Korean interpreters. We just won a large new contract with a major US insurance provider and will be starting calls within the next few weeks! You can work from home on a flexible schedule to interpret for these calls! Read on for more details.

Lionbridge, a language services company, holds interpretation contracts with various commercial and government clients. We are currently in need of additional freelance Korean interpreters to work on our telephonic interpretation contracts. The telephonic interpretation may be conducted from any landline phone or VoIP service like Skype or Vonage (NOT a cell phone). Calls are available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, and interpreters may be located anywhere in the United States. Calls are unscheduled, and will vary in length and frequency.

Our interpreters all work with us on a freelance basis. As such, they are free to accept or decline any of the work we present to them. 

Contract requirements for candidacy: 

1) Required--Work permit for USA. Recommended--U.S. citizen or permanent resident with a green card, so you can also work for our government clients
2) Required--Currently live in the USA. Recommended--Have lived in the U.S. for at least 3 of the past 5 years, so you can also work for our government clients
3) Landline telephone access and/or VoIP access (e.g. Skype, Vonage, etc.) that is not on a mobile network
4) Be willing to take a language assessment by telephone in order to qualify
5) Be available to work at least 16 hours per week (on average) Mon.-Fri. between the hours of 8am to 8pm Eastern Time

I would encourage you or anyone you know who meets these requirements and is interested in interpretation to fill out an application on our website ( ) and reply to this ad to let me know when would be a good time for me to give you a call so that I can tell you more about Lionbridge's Korean interpretation opportunities and answer any questions that you might have. I'm usually in my office Mon.-Fri. from 8:30am to 4:30pm EST.

I look forward to hearing from you!

Best regards,

Kristian

Title: Audio Visual Technician
Description:
Experienced Audio Visual Technicians Wanted

Video Tech Services (VTS) the nation's premier labor provider for live corporate conventions, trade shows and events and is currently looking for experienced (minimum 2 years) and qualified Audio Visual Technicians. At VTS, our meticulous attention to detail shows in the outcome of each project. We do it right, the first time and every time.

Responsibilities: Must have experience any of the following areas:

General AV technician who operates or floats simple break-out room sets and exhibit floors, services end clients and presenters, ensures smooth meeting flow, and assists with break-out rooms, re-sets, and strikes.

General AV technician for loading and unloading of trucks, setting up, and striking of equipment. AV Techs are mainly used for the setting of meeting rooms and exhibits and have a fair knowledge of audio, lighting, and video.

Audio specialist who assists the A1 with set up, show, and strike. The A2 assists with running of cables, rigging audio systems, front-of-house and monitor control, backline, stage lines (bands, etc.), management of wireless-microphone frequencies, and other duties designated by the A1.

Lighting specialists who places lighting elements, builds truss, and assists in the focus of the lighting system. May also operate spotlights during show.

A highly trained and experienced Video expert who bears ultimate responsibility for the video display system. The V1 directs the construction, wiring, and timing of the video system. The V1 also color-matches and shades cameras, routes video signals to record bays, projection, and numerous other mediums. This includes Folsom Screen Pro and Screen Pro Plus operators.

A video specialist who assists the V1, projectionist, or tape op in setting and striking of video equipment, running, and labeling cables, building cameras, and similar activities. The V2 may also assist with camera shading during show run.

Requirements:
You must have at least 2 years experience working in live audio visual corporate events . Related experience (i.e. studio/sports/live music) is not applicable . Video Tech Services only recruits qualified, experienced, team players with a positive attitude for independent contract work only. Strong customer services skills are a must. This work requires the ability to travel to various job locations in your city, accordingly, reliable transportation is a must. If you are not reliable or able to arrive on time please do not apply. Due to the volume of resumes we receive, it would be helpful if you included a list of equipment with which you have experience with.

Please put "CITY NAME TECHS" in The Subject Line of Your E-mail.

Title: Forget sign-on bonuses. Discover the HTLD New Driver Mileage Pledge.
Project Accountant
Description:
SmithGroupJJR is an international idea-oriented design firm that is committed to creating inspiring places that enrich the human spirit. We believe extraordinary environments are created when the design process is based on the principles of exploration, experimentation, innovation, sustainability, research, and collaboration. Our expertise in providing thoughtful and innovative solutions keeps SmithGroupJJR at the forefront of architectural, engineering and planning firms around the world. According to the 2017 Building Design + Construction magazine "Giants" ranking, SmithGroupJJR is the 7th largest architecture/engineering firm in the U.S.

The Los Angeles office of SmithGroupJJR is looking for a Project Accountant to join our team.  We are seeking a talented individual who is committed to excellence, who thrives in an environment of collaboration and who demonstrates a high degree of creativity and entrepreneurial spirit.


Working with us, you will:

* Process electronic/paperless expense reports and accounts payable in an accurate and timely manner and in accordance with  departmental procedures.
* Process consultant and vendor payments.
* Assist with the set-up and maintenance of project budgets and client billing information.
(including client billing tables) in the project accounting system (e.g., Deltek Vision).
* Assist with the reconciliation and maintenance of client contract and billing files.
* Work with studio leaders, project managers, and possibly senior project accountants to prepare client invoices and supporting documentation through the electronic/paperless project accounting system.
* Contact vendors to research inaccuracies, discrepancies, and data missing from statements.
* Assist with the research and resolution of payment discrepancies.
* Provide support to studio leaders or project managers on collections.
* Provide support for the preparation of management reports.
* Assist in other accounting areas as requested or assigned.

An ideal candidate has:

* Associate degree; or equivalent from a two year college or technical school
* 3+ years or related experience and/or training or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Experience with accounting software, preferable Deltek Vision.
* A high level of proficiency in the latest Excel, Adobe Acrobat Pro, and Microsoft Word programs.
* The ability to exhibit a high level of attention to detail, accuracy, data input, and organization, and to exhibit excellent customer service and communication skills under pressure.
* Experience with complex client invoicing including consultant invoices and employee expense reports, preferably in an electronic format for a professional services based company.
* Ability to work in a team environment
* Strong ability to clearly communicate in both verbal and written formats
 

SmithGroupJJR offers competitive compensation and an excellent benefit package, including 401(k) and continuing educational reimbursement. We offer three weeks of paid time off within the first year of employment, with the option of purchasing additional time off, and pay for eight federal holidays. We also offer an alternative work schedule that provides employees with an additional 15 days off per year (usually Fridays) to help with work/life balance.

Interested in joining us? Get started today by following the directions below. Be sure to fill in the required information, and submit your cover letter and resume. Please include salary requirements in your cover letter.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled 

SmithGroupJJR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Instructions for applying - please read carefully:

Go to www.SmithGroupJJR.com and go to the Careers page / Los Angeles.
On the Project Accountant posting, please click the Apply here link.
Fill in the required information, and submit your cover letter and resume as attachments.
Please include salary requirements in your cover letter.
