Title: Solar Outreach Representative
Description:
Sunvalley Solar, a public company and leading provider of solar solutions, is looking to hire an Outreach Representative. For nearly 10 years, Sunvalley Solar has been helping California businesses transition to solar power in a collaborative effort to combat global warming and reduce energy expenses. With our operation expanding, we are now looking for a talented individual to help us in our efforts.

We provide:

-A friendly and highly-educated team to help you reach your objectives

-Fair compensation (base pay + referral bonuses)

Role Summary :

Do you support solar power and want to spread the news of its benefits? Then this position is for you.

The Outreach Representative (OR) will have the primary function of making an introduction of our company to other businesses and gathering contact information of decision makers from local businesses within a defined area. The OR will be expected to canvass and make cold calls if necessary in order to generate leads for the company. No technical knowledge about solar systems is required as we will teach you what you need to know to be effective.

Required traits:

-Friendly demeanor

-Fluency in English

-Persuasive communicator (through the use of reasoning and showmanship)

-Willingness to talk to new people

-Resilience in the face of skepticism or rejection

-Intelligent

Required experience:

- (1-2 years of sales in some capacity)

Compensation:

-$13/hour base pay at 20 hours a week to start

-Referral bonuses that can amount to $5000 per lead that signs a contract

-Gas reimbursement for the use of your own vehicle

Salary: $12.00 to $13.00 /hour

Title: Logistics Coordinator
Description:
The purpose of this position is to ensure that internal, external customers and colleagues receive the highest quality of customer service.  This position is more physical and will require warehouse dock area managing, assisting customer with will call orders, loading trucks and dispatching routes.  This may involve answering questions, researching information such as billing of orders, able to facilitate resolution of transport issues and have a firm understanding of logistics compliance. Coordinating orders to operations so that they are processed in a timely manner.  The nature of this job requires an individual that is intelligent, dependable and detail oriented.  This individual will work closing with billing, operations and sales.  This individual must be motivated to meet the goals of the department and be willing to "go the extra mile" in serving the customer.


Primary Position Duties & Responsibilities:
•Assist in the dispatching of delivery drivers
•Organizing dock pallets at the start of each morning
•Research and resolve any problems regarding late orders/deliveries, credits, short shipments/missing products etc...
•Communicate Production/Operational issues with Logistics Manager
•Communicate Logistical issues (routing, drivers) with Logistics Supervisor
•Assist with Fed Ex shipments
•Loading and dispatching
•Checking off orders for accuracy
•Check in drivers and training will be provided on common QA
•Any and all other reasonable requests.
 

Qualifications/Requirements:
•Must have three (1) years of relevant work experience.
•Must have communication and interpersonal skills to interact effectively, both written and verbally, with internal and external customers.
•Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment.
•Must have the ability to multi-task.
•Must have excellent time management skills.
•Knowledge of the transportation industry is a plus.
•Bi-lingual (English/Spanish) is a plus.


 Required Computer Knowledge:
•Proficient in Microsoft Outlook, Excel and word
•Working knowledge of GPS software ( not required but a plus )
•10 Key by touch

Education:
•High School Diploma or G.E.D., or a combination of relevant work experience

Title: Accounting Assistant
Description:
Success Education Colleges (SEC) is a family of institutions comprised of North-West College, Glendale Career College, and Nevada Career Institute. We are and have been a leader in Medical Career Training since 1966. The Campus Support Center of Success Education Colleges is comprised of sector leaders with over 150 years of collective experience.

The members of SEC's Leadership Team are passionate about educating students for success and have proven track records of transforming the lives of the students and prospective students that we serve. Our everyday mission is to train students in short term programs for gainful employment.

SEC is currently seeking an ACCOUNTING ASSISTANT for additional support in the Accounting Department located in West Covina, CA. This is a 38 hours per week, non-exempt, part-time position.

Our everyday mission is to train students in short term programs for gainful employment.

Location: West Covina, CA

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Assists Accounting department with various accounting and financial projects Accounting projects.
Ability to work a flexible schedule.Strong accuracy skills and an attention to detail.
Full cycle A/P, matching, vouchering, and GL coding.
Review all invoices for appropriate documentation and approval prior to payment.
Process 3 way P.O. matching invoices including receipt of goods.
Prioritize invoices according to cash discount potential and payment terms.
Correctly match all checks to invoices, ensure proper approval, appropriate documentation before checks are given to check signers to sign and distribute checks appropriately.
Responsible paying vendor accounts within terms to avoid late payments and analyzing any vendor accounts that become past due.
Responsible for maintaining an accurate organization of all invoices, resolve invoice discrepancies, maintaining efficient, organized files and documentation.
Process year end 1099 forms and report, record and maintain all W9 and 1099 information.
Investigate and resolve contract, invoice, or payment discrepancies and documentation; ensure credit is received for outstanding memos; and issue stop-payments
Perform Journal Entries and month-end for AP accruals.
Assist with other projects as needed.
Sort and distribute incoming mail.
Prepare and verify daily deposit reports
Research discrepancies cash receipts, coding and posting of receipts
Prepare daily journal entries.
Investigate returned items.
Maintain and verify receipt number.
Maintain bank deposit books, tuition receipts and non-tuition receipts.
Maintain all daily deposits on excel.
Organizes and maintains retention files for required period of time.
Education and Experience:

High School Diploma or equivalent required.

Business or accounting courses a plus.Minimum of one (3) years of general office experience.
Previous experience in basic accounting, bank reconciliation for all accounts, journal entries, bookkeeping, and accounts receivables preferred and Accounts Payable including preparation for approval including matching Purchase Order, Process Purchase Order and filing.
Excel and MAS90 required.
Entry Level

Title: Maintenance Technician 1 - The Pacific HOA
Description:
Action Property Management is a privately held company that manages more high-rise residential buildings than any other management company in California. We have over a decade of experience offering exceptional residential building management to some of the most exclusive luxury high rise properties in Los Angeles, Orange County, San Francisco, and San Diego. With a 96% retention rate we enjoy long standing relationships with the buildings we manage.
 
Action is seeking a Full Time Maintenance Technician 1 for our luxury High Rise association, The Pacific, in Long Beach, California. 
 
Schedule:
Sunday: 7:30AM - 4:00PM
Monday: 9:00AM - 5:30PM
Tuesday: 9:00AM - 5:30PM
Wednesday 9:00AM - 5:30PM
Thursday 9:00AM - 5:30PM
 
Summary:
The Maintenance Technician 1, under the direction and supervision of the Supervisor, maintains and repairs all common property not maintained and repaired by a third party. The Maintenance Technician 1 will also, at the direction of the Supervisor, perform limited in unit maintenance services. The Maintenance Technician 1 is a trained responder to property emergencies such as fire, flood, earthquake and other disasters and will be available for emergencies after normal working hours. The Maintenance Technician 1 is expected to be available for emergencies or overtime in special circumstances in order to complete projects or meet deadlines.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Physical Duties:

Perform general laborer work as assigned by the Supervisor, such as loading, unloading and moving materials, and running errands for the Engineering Department.
Patch and paint the common areas of the building.
Change of air filters in spaces where no fans or machinery are in operation.
Assist in the performance of preventive maintenance work orders.
Responsible for general cleaning of the engineering spaces.
Clean and paint non-operating mechanical equipment, which has been shut down, locked out and tagged by Supervisor.
Perform, in a timely manner, all maintenance prescribed by the Operations & Maintenance Manual or the Supervisor.
Provide light electrical duties: Changing light bulbs and assisting in ballast change out, etc.
Provide light plumbing duties: Repairs restroom fixtures, unclogging P traps and assisting in any plumbing project.
Provide light carpentry duties: installing shelving, repairing windows, assemble furniture and accessories.
Provide light HVAC duties: perform in-unit HVAC filter, smoke alarm battery replacement, and minor repairs as scheduled and directed by the Supervisor.
Assist housekeeping staff in the transport of items for cleaning or clearing of areas to be cleaned.
Emergency Response:

Maintain preparedness for emergency response to flood, fire, power outage, earthquake and other disaster.
Respond to project emergencies.

Education, Certifications and Licenses:

High School Diploma / GED required with relevant work experience -- Required.
Maintenance of a valid CA Driver's License -- Required.
One to Two years related experience -- Required.

Action Property Management is an Equal Opportunity Employer and supports a Drug Free Workplace.
 
Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the law.

Title: ACCOUNTS PAYABLE ACCOUNTANT
Description:
Accountants Payable Accountant

Are you looking to work for a distinguished and successful company, in a department filled with professional, positive, hardworking  staff members that work together as a great team?  A company that has been around for 100 years and likely to be around for another 100 years or more?  If so, this is that rare opportunity.    

The Bel-Air Bay Club is a private club situated on the picturesque Santa Monica Bay in Pacific Palisades, California since 1928.  BABC has received the Distinguished Emerald Club of the World Award, a coveted award held by few.  We are actively seeking an energetic and sharp individual to join the accounting team as the Accounts Payable Accountant.   Our newest team member will enjoy competitive benefits and wages while also enjoying unparalleled views of the Pacific Ocean!

Major responsibilities/duties include:

1.	Handles all aspects of Accounts Payable from invoice to payment.  Ensures all payments are within the scope of budget.
2.	Account analysis and reconciliation for various balance sheet accounts.
3.	Tracks and reports profitability compared to budget of Club sponsored events.
4.	Prepares annual property tax returns & 1099's.
5.	Assists with monthly physical inventory
6.	Other general administrative duties

The successful candidate will possess superior attention to detail, excellent Excel spreadsheet skills, 10-key by touch, solid understanding of accounting, excellent communication skills, with a minimum of 3-5 years accounts payable experience.  Experience in hospitality a plus.  

Benefits:  The Bel-Air Bay Club offers a very competitive compensation package to include 401K, medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, 2 weeks vacation, paid sick time and holidays.

Title: Line Cook / Prep Cook / Dishwasher- Water Grill
Description:
Water Grill Santa Monica is looking to hire on cooks! 

The Cook positions are one of the most important positions we have in executing every ticket with consistency, timeliness, recipe adherence, and quality control to ensure that every guest has a memorable meal.   As a line cook, you will be executing multiple tickets throughout the shift with focus on preparation, plate presentation, and timeliness.

As a prep cook, you will be the partner of the cooks and work closely with the opening managers to set up each shift for success. Title: SOUS CHEF
Description:
Position Purpose
Exhibits culinary talents by personally performing tasks while assisting in leading the staff and managing all food related functions. Works to continually improve guest and employee satisfaction while maximizing the financial performance in all areas of responsibility. Areas of responsibility comprise of overseeing all food preparation areas (banquets, in-room dining, restaurants, bar/lounge and employee cafeteria) and all support areas (dish room and purchasing) as applicable.

Duties and Responsibilities

-	 Assisting the Executive Chef to provide direction for all day-to-day operations, including banquet functions and execution of timely food production for all catering/banquet functions.
-	Supervises and coordinates activities of cooks and workers engaged in food preparation.
-	Ensures methods and standards of food production is maintained and consistent.
-	Ensures that cooks are preparing proper amounts of all items needed by setting written par levels for all areas.
-	Monitors the quality of raw and cooked food products to ensure that standards are met.
-	Demonstrates new cooking techniques and equipment to staff.
-	Develops and implements guidelines an control procedures for purchasing and receiving areas.
-	Manages department controllable expenses including food costs, supplies, uniforms and equipment.
-	Participates in the budgeting process for areas of responsibility.
-	Provides direction for menu development.
-	Determines how food should be presented, and create decorative food displays.
-	Recognizes superior quality products, presentations and flavor.
-	Inspects all freezers and refrigerators for cleanliness, organization, and corrective temperatures.
-	Inspects all food products for proper rotation and usage of food to avoid food waste.
-	Responsible for production and presentation of all restaurant menus, in-room dining and employee cafeteria.
-	Possess extensive knowledge of food quality.
-	Responsible for the supervision of all employees in the kitchen. Ensure all kitchen employees 	abide by Company policies and standards.
-	Schedule staff work schedules in accordance to business needs.
-	Ensures all employees practice proper hygiene.
-	Ensures employees take their meal and rest period breaks as scheduled.
-	Supervise and train kitchen staff; taking appropriate corrective actions when required.
-	Responsible for conducting daily pre-shift briefing and/or training.
-	Understands employee positions well enough to perform duties in employees' absence or determine appropriate replacement to fill gaps.
-	Provides guidance and direction to subordinates, including setting performance standards and monitoring performance.
-	Fosters teamwork and possesses effective working knowledge of conflict resolution.
-	Sets and example to ensure compliance with food handling and sanitation guidelines.

Knowledge, Skills and Attributes 

-	Must consistently display a professional and sophisticated presence.
-	Must be able to prioritize and delegate work with effective and consistent follow-through.
-	Must be highly organized with attention to detail, speed, and accuracy.
-	Must be self-motivated with high energy level.
-	Must be service oriented with excellent customer service skills.
-	Must be a team player working with all levels of management and staff, and possess the ability to lead and motive staff.
-	Must be able and willing to work 10-12 hours and flexible schedules, including evenings, weekends, and holidays.
-	Must be able to multi-task in a fast paced work environment.
-	Must possess excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.
-	Must have basic knowledge or arithmetic.
-	Must have the ability to input data and access information on the computer.
-	Must have working knowledge of Microsoft Office.
-	Must possess clear thinking ability and sound judgement.
-	Must possess ability to remain calm and resolve problems under pressure.
-	Must be able to read, write, and understand the English language; bilingual Spanish preferred.
-	Must practice excellent personal hygiene and consistently display a professional presence.
-	Must be able to exercise confidentiality and discretion.

Qualifications

Education:	High school diploma or GED required; college degree in culinary arts or 			food & beverage preferred.
Experience:	Minimum of 2 years' as Sous Chef in a 4-star or higher rated restaurant. 			Experience in multi-outlet and high volume and quality food production. 			Experience with menu development preferred.

Certification:	Must possess current Serve Safe handler certificate.

Title: Nail Technician & Spa Concierge at JW Marriott/Ritz-Carlton LA LIVE!
Description:
JW Marriott is part of Marriott International's luxury portfolio and consists of more than 70 beautiful properties in gateway cities and distinctive resort locations around the world. Our associates deliver sophisticated and warmly authentic service in a comfortable and luxurious atmosphere that cultivates fulfilling experiences for both our associates and our guests.


The Ritz-Carlton, Los Angeles, The JW Marriott, Los Angeles L.A. LIVE and The Ritz-Carlton Residences, L.A. LIVE are, all part of the L.A. LIVE entertainment complex. Positioned at the heart of a world-class entertainment, sports and dining district, we're focused on delivering the luxury and service for which our brands are renowned. Here, we'll provide you with the tools and rewards you need to meet every challenge. Join us in redefining the face of L.A., while redefining your future.


 


 


Job Description: 


Provide nail care services such as manicures and pedicures to guests. Assess guest needs, inquire about contraindications, and examine skin, hair, or nails to evaluate condition, appearance, and appropriateness of scheduled service. Determine and advise guests on proper skin, hair, or nail care. Demonstrate, promote, and sell spa/salon retail products. Answer questions about general property information and amenities. Escort guests to and from treatment rooms. Check with guest to ensure continued comfort throughout service. Monitor and stick to time schedule throughout the day. Clean, maintain, and sterilize tools and equipment. Maintain cleanliness of workstation and/or treatment room throughout shift. Dispose of trash and dirty linens in the proper area. Secure supplies and equipment at the end of each shift. Maintain current licensure in service area. Report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager; complete safety training and certifications.  


 


Job Description: 


Part Time Concierge at the Front Desk of Luxury Spa.  Service Oriented.  Spa experience preferred. Schedule services for individuals and large groups using spa/salon reservations software system. Call guests to confirm scheduled services. Answer questions about available services. Update the reservations/cancellations list throughout the day, inform providers of last minute changes, and resolve scheduling issues as needed by working with supervisor/manager. Check in guests for appointments, confirm first and last name, and provide general spa orientation to guests upon arrival. Promote and sell spa/salon services. Obtain assigned bank and ensure accuracy of contracted monies, obtain change required for expected business level, and keep bank secure at all times. Process guest payments for spa/salon services and obtain payment authorization as needed. Accept and log cash tips for employees. Balance, scan, and drop receipts with Accounting. Notify Engineering of maintenance and repair needs. Report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager.  


FORTUNE magazine recognized Marriott International as one of the "100 Best Companies to Work For", for the twelfth consecutive year. Benefits may include: medical, dental, vision, 401(K) profit sharing, paid time off, tuition reimbursement, career advancement, hotel room discounts and more.

Title: Structural Superintendent
Description:
The Onni Group is a leading real estate firm based in Vancouver, British Columbia with offices in Seattle, Toronto, Los Angeles and Chicago. This diverse company is vertically integrated with in-house departments responsible for execution of the company's activities including property development, construction and management as well as leasing, sales and marketing.

There is an exciting opportunity for a talented professional to join the site construction team in Los Angeles as a Structure Super. The ideal candidate has an excellent knowledge of concrete, formwork and steel fixing and possesses a high level written and oral communication.



•	Read and interpret plans, instructions, blueprints, structural drawings, rough sketches, and specifications to determine work activities
•	Plan, assign, schedule and supervise the work of concrete crews, laborers, truck drivers and equipment operators engaged in the construction
•	Coordinate, issue work orders and be accountable for ordering of all concrete materials
•	Manage a crew of workers
•	Organize labor and material on a daily basis
•	Completion of administrative paperwork relating to the site
•	Manage and coordinate shared resources with other superintendents
•	Maintain a resource schedule
•	Prepare computerized schedule and update schedule reporting
•	Track and report daily job productions
•	Control daily costs and waste
•	Coordinate with Consultants regarding structural inspections
•	Effectively communicate project expectations to team members on an ongoing basis
•	Manage and prevent occupational hazards and ensure site meets all safety standards
•	Communicate with Site Superintendent regarding any concerns, discrepancies, additions, or alterations that may arise during the course of construction to a building or areas affected by a building on the Site
•	Assist all Site Superintendents and Project Coordinators/Estimators in coordinating with the work of trades and consultants
•	Other duties as assigned by direct supervisor



•	Minimum 5 years of related construction experience in all aspects of mixed use, multi-residential wood frame & high rise concrete construction
•	Extensive structures experience, knowledge of post tensioning and concrete
•	Strong technical building knowledge and ability to recognize proper forming techniques to support required dimensions of concrete structures
•	Must have knowledge of practices, methods, equipment, materials and tools used in concrete construction and maintenance
•	Excellent knowledge of BC Building Code and attention to detail is a must
•	Proven performance in leadership and managing both people and construction sites
•	Demonstrated effective communication and team building skills
•	Be results focused with a proven track record of accomplishments in the construction industry
•	Demonstrated ability to analyze, problem solve, make recommendations for change, implement and evaluate and provide a strong process perspective
•	Demonstrated ability to problem solve, juggle numerous and diverse activities, organizing and prioritizing appropriately to meet demands and expectations
•	Be a motivated self-starter who thrives in a fast pace team environment and have a desire to grow with the Company

Please note that we offer competitive pay, a comprehensive benefit package and programs to continuously develop and recognize employees.

All interested applicants please submit your resume with a cover letter stating your salary expectations to: 
We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please.

Title: Full-Time Warehouse Associate for Skateboard MFG
Description:
Carver Skateboards is a pioneering and authentic lifestyle brand founded in 1996 by surfers who longed for a surf experience on the land.  Our vision is the realization of an irreverently diverse, harmoniously flowing, and fully-realized global surfskate community. We are on a mission to lead and dominate the surfskate industry by mainstreaming, spreading the stoke, and inspiring active lifestyles. Today, we proudly sells our products in 50+ countries and lead and inspire our surfskate community as a premium gear maker. Carver Skateboards is a five (5) time consecutive winner of INC. 5000's fastest growing private companies in the US! 

Carver is looking to hire organized, focused, and motivated self-starting individuals for Warehouse Associate Positions in our El Segundo, CA factory. 

We have a great team who has earned the reputation of consistently meeting and often exceeding goals, and who's outgoing attitude makes for a lively and productive work environment. Check out our HQ instagram @carverskatefactory 


How to Apply

If you are a  fast-paced, goal-orientated team player, who is passionate about carving, salty fun, wind, water and active and outdoor lifestyles, please email your resume and cover letters

The Warehouse Associate is responsible for supporting warehouse operations through machine operation, skateboard assembly, shipping, receiving, utility, and picking activities. Works closely with the Director of Manufacturing in an effort to reach production goals, maximize site efficiency, and implementation of good safety practices.

Here is what a day on the job will involve:
-Applying and Cutting Grip Tape
-Using hand tools to complete assembly operations
-Operating machines to process parts for finished assemblies
-Re-stocking shelves
-Picking and packing orders
-Developing strong relationships with other team members
-Facilities Maintenance
-Other duties as assigned
 
Our Ideal Candidate will have:
-2-3 years of experience in a manufacturing setting
-Reliable transportation 
-Punctuality and Reliability
-A positive attitude 
-Sensibility in thought, problem solving and life
-Ability to work comfortably in a team environment
-Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
-Ability to organize and prioritize multiple projects and deadlines

Physical Requirements:
-Ability to lift or move up to 60 pounds unassisted
-Able to withstand temperatures in a typical warehouse environment 
-Position spends majority amount of time standing, walking, lifting, pulling and pushing  
-May require climbing of ladders 
-Specific vision abilities required by this job include:
 close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

Title: Customer Service Reps Needed - INBOUND CALL CENTER (WORK FROM HOME)
Description:
*******Work From Home Customer Service For Inbound Call Center******* 


Apply here: 

Job Description

Nations Info Corp is looking for an experienced Customer Support Representative to service our rapidly growing subscriber base. In our exciting, fast-paced environment, you will be a front-line 
representative, in charge of delivering exceptional customer service to subscribers by telephone 
and email. You will process new orders (or work to retain current customers), describe products 
and services, process cancellations, issue refunds, and ensure customer satisfaction. Candidates 
must have prior customer service experience and bring their enthusiasm and fresh ideas to the 
team.

Responsibilities: 

-Professionally handle incoming requests from customers and ensure that issues are 
resolved both promptly and thoroughly, providing quality service and support.
- Thoroughly and efficiently gather customer information, access and fulfill customer 
needs, educate the customer where applicable and document interactions appropriately.
- Troubleshoot customer issues over the phone.
- Maintain a balance between company policy and customer benefit in decision making. 
- Handles issues in the best interest of both customer and company.

Skills & Qualifications

- Ability to communicate clearly and professionally, both verbally and in writing
-Call center experience preferred
-Work from home experience preferred
- Excellent listening skills
- Strong commitment to customer satisfaction
- Demonstrate passion for excellence with respect to treating and caring for customers.
- Takes initiative
- The ability to analyze and resolve customer issues with minimal supervision
- The ability to sell to and retain customers
- Demonstrates patience, and can maintain a positive attitude
- Possess a strong work ethic and team player mentality
- Bi-lingual a plus
-Must have at home internet access
-Must have experience with Skype

Application Procedures:

This corporation is located in Santa Barbara, California. Nations Info Corp is an Equal 
Opportunity Employer and offers a competitive total compensation package and a casual, results-
driven work environment. When applying please submit cover letter and resume.

Employment Details:

- Headquarter Location: Santa Barbara, CA (REMOTE position); Training: Virtual via Skype
- Status: Full time
- Benefits include company sponsored 401K, with company match (after 1 year of employment)
- Additional benefits include: Health, Vision, Dental Insurance, and Life Insurance
- Paid Time Off (on accrual basis)
- Salary: Starting pay is $11 hourly (plus commissions), depending on experience. (Commissions 
range from $0.50 to $4.00 per hour depending on your ability.)
- Possible wage increase after 90 days for high performance agents
- If the position is offered, a mandatory back ground check will be conducted, and the final hiring 
determination will be made after the results have been reviewed.
- We are open 6am to 6pm Monday through Friday and Saturday & Sunday 9am to 5pm.

About Nations Info Corp:

Founded in 2005, Nations Info Corp is a leading online provider of real estate and financial 
information and services to consumers, investors and professionals. The company's overarching 
objective is to aggregate and synthesize massive amounts of data, which is otherwise difficult to 
find and interpret, into formats which are easy to access, use and ultimately empowering for its 
customers. Our goal is to present information which can help our customers make informed 
decisions to identify opportunities to improve their lives, protect their identity and create 
personal connections to enhance their businesses and personal network. 
We are continually looking to the future by innovating and bringing new data driven, consumer 
products to the marketplace in different verticals. To accomplish these goals, we've grown an 
extraordinarily talented team and have established office locations in Westlake Village, CA and 
Santa Barbara, CA. We strive to hire and partner with only the best players in the industry.

Title: Corporate Sales Manager
Description:
In the heart of Downtown Los Angeles, LEVEL Furnished Living presents a fresh concept in premium extended stay accommodation. Located just minutes from the STAPLES Center and L.A. Live, Grand Park, the Fashion and Financial Districts, a celebrated international dining scene and city-wide transportation links, LEVEL Furnished Living uniquely combines the comfort and convenience of home with the hospitality and style of a boutique luxury hotel.





Are you looking for a successful and exciting company to grow with? Do you have what it takes to grow with us?

We are seeking a dynamic sales person to join our sales team. This unique individual must possess excellent sales and communication skills in customer relations, be aggressive in targeting new business and strive to consistently exceed established sales goals. Our managers understand the meaning of high level luxury customer service, they are professional, team-oriented, possess good work ethics and are extremely results driven.



•	Target and develop new business opportunities through various channels such as prospecting, solicitation, social media outlets, networking events, conducting site inspections and outbound sales calls (travelling required), etc.
•	Strategically develop and maintain key accounts focused on corporate housing, employee relocation, and business travel.
•	Conduct research, surveys, personal investigation and study the current marketplace in order to effectively capitalize on booking opportunities.
•	Adhere to established goals and objectives, reporting guidelines consistently, completing all projects assigned in an accurate and thorough manner.
•	Organize and track sales activities to maximize results.
•	Perform daily telephone solicitations to new and existing accounts.
•	Respond to all leads in a timely manner ( same day )
•	Prepare sales proposals to clients incorporating clearly defined terms and conditions.
•	Strengthen relationships with assigned accounts through sales visits, client entertainment, site inspections and repeated follow-up.
•	Develop and promote product image and awareness by direct mail campaigns, social media presence, and attendance of key travel and tourism tradeshows.
•	Promote and sell indoor and outdoor event space to increase and maximize social catering revenue.
•	Applicants must be able to communicate information and ideas clearly. They must be able to work in a fast-paced environment and be able to handle everyday situations quickly and effectively.
•	Maintain a clear line of communication on sales commitments to property Operations.
•	Entrepreneurial spirit is a definite asset.




•	Achieve a minimum of 85% of sales revenue goals and 100% of activity and productivity goals, as established by management, and possess a strong desire to exceed sales goals.
•	Drive revenue through creative sales techniques with strong public relations, leadership, and client and employee relations skills.
•	Conduct outside sales calls, while targeting results-oriented high revenue potential sales calls to ensure success.
•	Know competitors' top accounts, decision makers, rates and what it will take to move the business.
•	Network with prospects to uncover other decision makers for direct referrals.
•	Write sales proposals and negotiate the close of sale.
•	Plan and organize market reviews, conduct sales blitzes, and organize open houses for new properties.
•	Consult/problem solve with your in-house clients.
•	Perform site inspections, provide client entertainment as necessary.
•	As directed, participate in trade shows, conventions, and promotional events within the industry and customer organizations.
•	Willingness to travel as required.
•	Be an active member of industry and networking organizations.



•	Strong selling skills, above the industry average, including but not limited to prospecting, rate and contract negotiating, business planning and cold calls.
•	A minimum of four years hospitality sales experience in Corporate Housing, Employee Relocation and Corporate Business Travel.
•	Diploma or Degree in Hotel Management would be an asset.
•	Commitment to exceeding guest/client expectations.
•	Computer literate with knowledge of a variety of computer software applications, including a Hotel PMS (Roomkey) and Microsoft Office, Outlook, Excel and Power Point and Sales Force
•	Superior written and oral communication skills.
•	Excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to set daily priorities.
Please note that we offer competitive pay, a comprehensive benefit package and programs to continuously develop and recognize employees. 

All interested applicants please submit your resume and cover letter stating your salary expectations to: 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please.

Title: Hiring Meat Cutter / Butcher as Independent Contractor
Description:
Gus's World Famous Fried Chicken is hiring a Butcher to trim cases of 8-piece pre-cut chicken (12 heads per case).

The butcher would have the option to work at either one OR both our Los Angeles area locations:

1262 Crenshaw Blvd, Los Angles 90019 (Mid-City)

509 S. Glenoaks Blvd, Burbank 91502 (The Valley)

Drive time between the two locations is about 30 minutes.

Significant prior kitchen/butchering experience with superior knife skills is a requirement. We kindly ask that the
position not be applied for if lacking the necessary experience and skillset.

The candidate must be a U.S. citizen with a valid taxpayer ID # (Social Security Number).

The candidate should have a valid driver's license and a dependable vehicle.

Compensation would be $3/case processed. An average, lesser-experienced prep cook is able to process 5 cases in
an hour (compensation of $15/hour). An experienced chicken cutter can process 8 cases in an hour (compensation
of $24/hour).

For the 2 locations, we process roughly 200 cases a week. Therefore, weekly compensation would be approximately
$600/week ($31,000/year). The expected time to complete one week's amount of work would be between 25 and 40
hours and would include 3 - 4 days of work on site depending on the butcher's speed. The amount of cases, hours
and compensation will increase as we open new locations (likely 75-100 cases per new location).

As this is 1099 independent contractor position, there would be no tax withholdings. Payments will be made weekly.
You are free to deduct any personal expenses for your own tax purposes (mileage, tools, apparel, etc). You would
also have the flexibility to set your own hours within reason.

This is a unique opportunity to grow with us as we expand our brand across Southern California and increase our
chicken case volume!

If interested, please send a resume or description of your background to Dan at gfcburbank@gmail.com with the subject heading "Butcher". Please let us know if you are interested in servicing one or both of our locations.
Qualified candidates will be invited to come in for an interview and a brief tryout using actual chicken cases.

Compensation:
Estimated at $20/hour, depending on cutting and processing

Title: ALL SHIFTS IMMEDIATE OPENINGS!!  $11/hr - $11.50
Description:
This posting is for a machine operator position with Connect Staffing, Inc. in Stanton, CA for a plastics manufacturer in Long Beach, CA.

Experience is preferred, but not necessary!

Shifts can vary- 1st shift 8am-4:30pm, 2nd shift 4pm-12:30am, 4th shift Sat/Sun 8am-8:30pm (12hrs), 5th shift 8pm-8:30am(12hrs)

This is a temporary-to-hire position.

The company manufactures injection-molded plastic parts for a variety of industries including furniture and audio equipment.
This position includes good temp to hire prospects and good opportunities for advancement to lead and supervisory positions. Benefits for permanent hires include a pay raise and a 401k plan, as well as medical, dental, and vision insurance.

Requirements:

•	All employees must be able read and comprehend manufacturing specifications in English.
•	All employees must be able to lift at least 25 lbs.
•	Dependability is #1 - these injection molding machines run 24 hours per day and must continue operating
•	Preferred skills include high manual dexterity for precise trimming/cutting and strong math skills for those looking to advance to lead or supervisor positions.

The specific duties include removing parts from the machine when finished, trimming excess material off with retractable blades, weighing the product, gauging for proper dimensions, applying coatings, securing the product for cooling, assembling parts, wrapping them, and finally packaging them for shipment.

We are looking for people who are:

•	Reliable
•	Hard-working
•	Have solid transportation (your own car)
•	Able to lift objects up to 25 lbs or 50 lbs throughout the day
•	Comfortable trimming plastic parts with blades
•	Experienced working in a manufacturing environment

Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $11.00 /hour

Connect Staffing

8220 Katella Ave Suite A 
Stanton Ca 90680

Title: Loan Officer - Experienced
Description:
PacShores Mortgage Inc. is an established brokerage and full-service mortgage company that specializes in originating and arranging Private Party (aka Hard Money) mortgage loans. We are a West Los Angeles, family-owned business, and are seeking a highly motivated, self-starter and experienced mortgage professional to fill an open Loan Officer position.As conventional lending guidelines are continuing to remain very conservative, this is an opportunity for the right candidate to take advantage of being able to originate and close Government and Conventional loans, and have a direct source to close out-of-the box loan originations, via our "easy qual, easy close" Private Money programs.



•Fielding and following up on company's advertisement generated lead inquiries.
•Contacting company's prior closed Hard Money clients for refinancing into lower rate conventional programs.
•Telephone canvassing of local realtors and A-paper lenders/LOs to solicit submissions of loan fallouts for our wholesale program.
•Originate, evaluate, compile and submit new qualified loan applications. Prepare, provide, and secure signed accurate Good Faith Estimates to and from prospects.
•Analyze prospect's credit, and income ratios, review and properly evaluate title, appraisal reports, escrow instructions, and purchase agreements.


•Must have valid and current CA BRE Salespersons and NMLS License.
•Have been active in the industry for the last 2 full years, with a verifiable successful track record.
•Have some college education.
•Be proficient in Outlook, Word, Calyx Point, and Internet research and navigation.
•Must possess superior customer service skills, have an enthusiastic, dynamic attitude, and be highly self-motivated.



•Salary + Commission DOE. Expect to consistently close 5 to 10 transactions monthly with our programs.



•Super fast funding, our typical loans can close in 7-10 days.
•Easy qualifying, limited documentation loans, even for low FICO borrowers (no LOEs, VOMs, VOEs or VODs required).
•In-house processing, docs, and escrow. Able to draw closing docs upon receipt of disclosures, prelim, and appraisal.
•Programs offered both on retail and wholesale basis, allowing you to generate multiple, on-going loan submissions from other LOs and realtors.


We are scheduling interviews right away! Please email me your resume in  including a brief summary about yourself. Don't forget to include your contact information! Looking forward to speaking with you about the position available.


-Angelica

Starting out as a 1 Day Makeup Certification Company taught by some of the most in demand makeup artist in the area, we have expanded into an Agency after our own students have found success. Description:

•	Practice safe food handling procedures at all times.

Title: Software Engineer 2
Description:
GBL Systems Corporation is a leading systems engineering and software development firm with a 25 year history of developing tomorrow's Electronic Warfare capability today. We specialize in the areas of Systems/Software Engineering, Electronic Warfare, Network Centric Warfare, Modeling/ Simulation and Avionics Development.

GBL is based in Camarillo, CA. with many opportunities on base at Pt. Mugu NAS. Work location is at GBL office in Camarillo, CA or Pt Mugu, CA depending on position.

As part of a dynamic team, GBL engineers contribute to planning, designing, developing, documenting, testing and implementing various program requirements. Qualified candidates should have an understanding of system security, networks, web-based product implementations and configuration management processes. Successful applicants should have the ability to work effectively and cooperatively with all management levels, the personality to support team goals and the ability to work independently without close supervision. Applicants should exhibit strong interpersonal and oral/written communications skills. Candidate will be expected to mentor less experienced engineers.

Basic Qualifications:
Applicants will have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field (or equivalent experience) and up to 3-5 years of experience. Required knowledge and experience in software development utilizing Java and C++ programming languages. Strong OOP/OOD skills are needed as well.  Additional desired experience with Intelligent-agents, real-time embedded software, and hardware-in-the-loop implementations. U.S. Citizenship required.

Desired Skills:
Experience with any of the following tools is desired: Agile and/ or Scrum, Machine Learning/ Artificial Intelligence/ Intelligent-agent, Neural Networks, Fuzzy Logic, Drools, Linux,

Additional knowledge and skills include experience with Real-time Software Systems and development, UML modeling, scripting languages (i.e. Java script, Perl, PHP, Bash) and software version control.
M.S. degree in Computer Science or related degree preferred.

ALL SELECTED APPLICANTS MUST BE U.S. CITIZENS AND WILL BE SUBJECT TO U.S. GOVERNMENT BACKGROUND INVESTIGATIONS AND MUST MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS TO ACCESS CLASSIFIED INFORMATION. CURRENT OR RECENT SECURITY CLEARANCE IS DESIRED.

GBL offers a competitive salary, an outstanding 401(k) retirement plan with both Traditional and Roth options and generous corporate contributions, group medical insurance, life insurance, AD&D coverage, Section 125 plans that enable pre-tax payment of medical insurance premiums, paid holiday's, Paid Time Off and a business casual work environment.

GBL is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

Title: Arts District Restaurant Looking for a Dependable Cashier
Description:
We are looking for an accountable and reliable Cashier to process all cash transactions accurately and efficiently in accordance with established policies and procedures. The successful candidate will play a fundamental role in achieving our customer satisfaction and revenue growth objectives. Duties and responsibilities of the cashier will include greeting customers when entering or leaving our establishment, maintaining a clean and tidy checkout area and keeping reports of cash and credit transactions.

Responsibilities

Handle cash transactions with customers using cash registers
Issue receipts, refunds, change or tickets
Make sales referrals, cross-sell products and introduce new ones
Resolve customer complaints, guide them and provide relevant information
Greet customers when entering or leaving establishments
Maintain clean and tidy checkout areas
Keep reports of transactions
Pleasantly deal with customers to ensure satisfaction
Have a strong knowledge of our food and beverage menu 
Requirements

You have:
Proven working experience in retail cashier or sales
Basic PC knowledge and familiarity with electronic equipment (e.g. cash register, scanners, money counters etc)
Strong communication and time management skills
Customer satisfaction-oriented
Attention to detail and mathematical skills
Sales skills

Title: ASSISTANT MEAT MANAGER
Description:
Bristol Farms is NOW HIRING Assistant Meat Manager for our West Hollywood Location. 
Bristol Farms is the world's leading gourmet grocer specializing in quality and customer service. If you have a passion for gourmet food and a willingness to meet our customer's expectations then it's your time to join our team.

Apply Now: www.bristolfarms.com/careers/ Select the West Hollywood, Store #10 location and choose the Assistant Meat Manager position.

Bristol Farms offers a friendly environment with competitive wages, flexible schedules, medical, dental and vision benefits, 401K retirement plan, 20% discount for employees and their immediate family.

***Assistant Meat Manager ***

Duties & Responsibilities  other duties may be assigned: 

•	Practice safe food handling procedures at all times.
•	Assists the Meat Manager with all Meat Department responsibilities.
•	Assist the Meat Manager with the maintaining the appropriate profit margin in accordance to the approved pre-set budget, which entails, but is not limited to: sales goals, cost of goods, expenses, price changes and waste management.
•	Assures high quality and proper quantity of products via proper ordering and receiving while under the direction of the Meat Manager.
•	Assures proper displaying and selling of all meat products to customers and advises customers on quality of food, method of handling, and other factors affecting preparing, freezing, and storage.
•	Engages and coaches others in suggestive selling techniques.
•	Handles customer complaints in such a manner so as to assure customer satisfaction.

Qualifications 

•	1 year of managerial experience, preferred. 
•	Strong communication skills
•	Posses the ability to handle high stress and volume of customers while maintaining a positive shopping experience for the customer.
•	Availability requirements include; but are not limited to; days, evenings, weekends, & holidays.

Physical Demands While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to:

•	Stand for long periods of time; walk; frequent use of hands.
•	Occasionally required to climb or balance and stoop, kneel, or crouch.
•	Frequently lift and /or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 75 pounds.

Title: Inside Sales Customer Service Representative
Description:
JOB OPPORTUNITY: Inside Sales Customer Service Representative

Job Description
Sunset's Customer Service Representatives (Inside Sales) have been the mainstay of the company for over 35 years by providing the highest levels of technical support in the industry. Our Sunset Team, along with our team of suppliers, have the knowledge and skills to collaborate and decipher what product or service our customer needs. By sticking to our motto, "We Do What We Say We'll Do, When We Say We'll Do It", we aim to provide the absolute highest caliber of service in the industry. 
Responsibilities

•	Respond to customer inquiries, provide quotes, and take customer orders
•	Order and source products
•	Follow up on orders to ensure accurate and on-time delivery 
•	Negotiate sale and purchase prices
•	Proactively generate sales and promote company products
•	Expedite backorders
•	Assist with pulling inventory and preparing shipments
•	Assist with customer returns
•	Interact with customers and suppliers to obtain and fill orders correctly
•	Troubleshoot customer concerns

Qualifications
•	Industry experience (Power Transmission and/or Hose)
•	Good customer service and communication skills
•	Reliable, organized, detailed, and focused
•	Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, especially Outlook and Excel
•	High School Diploma or GED
•	Good driving record

Sunset Company Overview: 
Sunset is a Power Transmission parts and Hose distributor who has been helping local companies optimize production performance for over 35 years.  We represent the finest manufacturers and carry the largest local inventory in the industry.  With over 200 years' experience behind our order desk, Sunset has the knowledge to help customers identify and acquire the right solution for their application.  


PLEASE COME IN AND FILL OUT AN APPLICATION & SUBMIT WITH RESUME.

Title: TEASHOT is looking for PART-TIME BARISTAS.
Description:
TEASHOT is a boba tea and coffee shop that want to bring back the natural and ethical ingredients back to boba drinks. We believe in the goodness and benefits of tea, milk, and other natural fruit ingredients without the use of MILK POWDER, FAKE SUGAR, and ARTIFICIAL CHEMICAL FLAVOR. We are opening our first location in Little Tokyo, DTLA.
WE'RE LOOKING FOR: 
A boba tea and coffee enthusiast that care about the quality beverages, while maintaining a fun and positive environment for both customers and the team. As part of the brand and company's vision, we want to create a positive working environment where everyone's opinion is voiced and heard. 
We also want fun and energetic individuals to help create a positive customer experience and to help us promote the goodness we're creating. We understand that you might have other obligations like school and personal activities, so we're willing to work around your schedule. 
RESPONSIBILITIES:
-	Serve drinks while maintaining a friendly, positive, and timely manner
-	Ensure all drinks are well within our standards.
-	Be organized and clean to ensure the store is well up to standards at all time.
-	Assist customers with purchases, drink and ingredient knowledge.
-	Coordinate deliveries with vendors.
-	Perform back-bar kitchen duties such as cleaning equipment, mopping, and taking out trash.
-	Work well in a team settings to execute tasks.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
-	Standing/ Be on your feet is required for the majority of the work day.
-	Must be able to life and/or move up to 25lbs.
-	Must have physical abilities to carry out job responsibilities throughout the day.
-	Preferred: 1+ year experience as a barista or work at boba shops.
DETAILS:
-	Hours: must be able to work a minimum of 15-20 hours/week including 2-3 weekdays and weekends. We'll try to be flexible with everyone's hours so please provide a set schedule.
-	Perks: free 2 drinks per day.

Title: General Manager
Description:
Lotus Communications Corp. is one of the largest privately owned Radio Station Groups in the United States.  In Los Angeles, we operate Lotus Los Angeles Corp., KWKW - ESPN Deportes Radio, KFWB - La Mera Mera, and Lotus Oxnard Corp.,KIRN 670 AM. We are looking for a General Manager with a strong desire to contribute to the overall success at a legendary radio station and to become part of our team.

Position Summary:
The General Manager is responsible for the overall operations of the station.   Responsible for all operations including all aspects of revenue generations and development, community relations, programming, paid staff and volunteer management, financial performance and FCC regulatory compliance.    
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Station Management:
•	Operating budget, human resources, legal (including FCC and CPB) regulations, licensing requirements, state and federal reporting requirements, and technical operations including transmitter, tower, web site, and physical plant maintenance.  
Programming:
•	Oversee all aspects of the station's programming, including live and purchased on-air, streaming, concerts, and community programs. The General Manager will ensure compliance with copyright and royalty regulations.  The General Manager will also be responsible for planning and implementing new technologies and media delivery platforms and for using listener survey data to build listener loyalty and support.   
•	Assuring maintenance and operability of broadcasting equipment.
•	Maintenance and improvement of the stations' facilities which include the studio/office building and various transmitter sites.
Financial Management
•	Responsibly for budgeting and budget tracking, and financial reporting.
Personnel Management/Human resources
•	Responsible for staff hiring, staff training, staff evaluations, and benefits review.

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
•	Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration or related flied.
•	Must have a minimum of 7 years of experience as a radio station General Sales Manager or General Manager in  Los Angeles area.
•	Strong MS Office skills (Power Point, Excel and Word) is required.
•	Effective decision making skills.
•	Experience with developing budgets and writing business plans.
•	Exceptional organizational skills.
•	Exceptional written and verbal communications skills.
•	Ability to work under deadlines and in a fast-paced environment.
•	Ability to prioritize daily routine and urgent tasks.
•	Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work with a wide variety of people.
•	Demonstrate ability to effectively manage personnel.
•	Experience/ability to understand and manager a budget and non profit accounting, including relevant software.
•	General technical skills applicable with radio technology and an ability to readily learn and adapt to new sites and technologies.
Working Conditions and Physical Requirements:
Office environment, some repetitive motion required.  Requires travel to station events and client sites, valid drivers' license is required with good driving record.  Must have a reliable means of transportation and maintain current insurance and registration.
Interested applicants please send cover letter, resume and salary history to the following:

neginn@ lotuscorp.com


Lotus Communications Corp. is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Facilities Director
Description:
Job Description

The Facilities Director is responsible for managing the maintenance of equipment, landscape, buildings and other facilities at a Christian School and Church.  The position carries out plans, budgets and schedules facility modifications, including estimates, labor materials and other related costs.  The Facility Director assures the effective functioning of our facility to provide an efficient and safe working environment for the church and school communities by using best business practices to manage resources, services and processes to meet the needs of our church and school.

Main Job Tasks and Responsibilities

•	develop and implement a facility management program including preventative maintenance and life-cycle requirements
•	conduct and document regular facilities inspections

**Asst. Property Manager*178 Unit Apartment Complex*Full BENEFITS!!
Description:
At First Pointe Management Group (FPMG), we specialize in acquiring and developing distinctive properties. We aim to attract and reward the most talented associates in our industry. We aspire to challenge you daily and develop enduring skill sets built on core values like trust, integrity, respect and excellence. We know that every day you can make a difference in someone's life. If you are looking for a rewarding career with a proven career path, FPMG is the place for you! 

 Apply today for an Assistant Property Manager position at our 178 unit Apartment Community located in Agoura Hills, CA. 

 Assistant Property Manager Job Duties:
 Will assist in the daily property operations: Tenant Relations, Maintenance Administration, Rent Collection, Marketing/New Resident Identification and Processing, General Administration, Staff supervision, and reporting. 

 General Office Duties: Assist the manager with: maintaining occupancy and delinquency rates. Ensure the property provides an exceptional living environment for the residents. Complete all lease applications, assists in rental collection, servicing of appropriate notices regarding rent increases, delinquent rents, and other lease infractions. Perform apartment move-in and move-out inspections as scheduled. Greet prospective tenants and tour available units when necessary. Maintain traffic reports and following up on all prospects. Help participate in resident functions. Maintains and enforce guidelines for Fair Housing Act. Update reports for manager as required. Supervise leasing and maintenance staff in the absence of property manager. Perform routine physical inspection of property to report any service needed to maintenance staff.

 Leasing: Maintain knowledge of available rental units. Taking prospective tenants on tours of the model/community. Following up on leads through telephone inquiries and guest cards. Preparing market reports for comps within the area and make recommendations. Being able to physically shop the market and know the current "specials" of competitive properties. Prepare weekly traffic/renewal status reports. Assist leasing consultants with: training, motivating, role playing and leasing when needed.

 Job Requirements:
 1-2 years of prior experience in an assistant manager in an apartment community(100 Units Plus).
 Computer knowledge with the following software: MS Office. Yardi, Yieldstar and Pop Card. 
 High School diploma is required.
 Knowledge of Fair Housing rules and regulations.
 Ability to be assertive and possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
 Ability to project a professional appearance at all times.
 Must have a reliable automobile, insurance, and good driving record.

 Schedule: Tuesday-Saturday from 9am to 6pm

Title: Facilities Director
Description:
Job Description

The Facilities Director is responsible for managing the maintenance of equipment, landscape, buildings and other facilities at a Christian School and Church.  The position carries out plans, budgets and schedules facility modifications, including estimates, labor materials and other related costs.  The Facility Director assures the effective functioning of our facility to provide an efficient and safe working environment for the church and school communities by using best business practices to manage resources, services and processes to meet the needs of our church and school.

Main Job Tasks and Responsibilities

•	develop and implement a facility management program including preventative maintenance and life-cycle requirements
•	conduct and document regular facilities inspections
•	ensure compliance with health and safety standards and industry codes
•	allocate and manage facility space for maximum efficiency
•	supervise maintenance and repair of facilities and equipment
•	oversee facility refurbishment and renovations
•	plan and manage facility central services such as reception, security, cleaning, catering, waste disposal and parking
•	obtain quotes and tenders from vendors and suppliers
•	calculate and compare costs for goods and services to maximize cost-effectiveness
•	negotiate contracts to optimize delivery and cost saving
•	coordinate and monitor activities of contract suppliers
•	manage contractor and vendor relationships
•	manage and review service contracts to ensure facility management needs are being met
•	ensure delivery schedules, quantity and quality criteria are met
•	check completed work by contractors and vendors
•	verify payment and invoicing match contract pricing
•	plan and monitor appropriate facility management staffing levels
•	ensure efficient utilization of facility maintenance staff
•	performance manage, develop and train staff
•	prepare and track facility budget
•	monitor expenses and payments
•	generate and present regular reports and reviews of facility-related budgets, finances, contracts, expenditures and purchases
•	develop and implement cost reduction initiatives
•	advise on and monitor energy efficiency
•	oversee environmental health and safety
•	assure security of the facility
•	respond to facility and equipment alarms and system failures
•	provide prompt response to requests and issues from facility occupants

Education and Experience

•	Bachelors degree in Facilities Management, Facilities Engineering or certificates in related fields such as project management, business management or construction management
•	working knowledge of principles and practices of project management
•	working knowledge of principles and practices of business administration
•	working knowledge of financial principles and practices
•	working knowledge of human resource management principles and practices
•	working knowledge of electrical and mechanical systems
•	working knowledge of procurement and contracts
•	sound knowledge of health, safety and environmental regulations
•	experience in construction, maintenance and all facets of facility operation
•	supervisory experience
•	solid computer and systems knowledge

Competencies

•	communication skills
•	planning and organizational skills
•	negotiation skills
•	problem analysis
•	decision-making
•	judgment
•	customer service orientation
•	adaptability
•	team work

Title: Bartender Theft Detection Agent
Description:
• Do you have bartending experience
• Server or bar/restaurant manager experience
• Comfortable playing a role 
• Non-judgmental observer 
• Fair and objective 
• Excellent communicator with fluid writing skills 
• Good memory for details 
• Reliable meeting deadlines 
• Follows specific direction 
• Thorough and accurate with detailed paperwork 
• Computer literate with Word, Excel, e-mail and attachments 



Hospitality Checkpoint is a bartender theft detection spotter service company specializing 

in bartender theft detection and deterrents for the hospitality industry. Hospitality 

Checkpoint spots for bartender theft and evaluates service staff standards. We have 

performed integrity reports for restaurants, bars, clubs, and resorts throughout the 

country. Hospitality Checkpoint is in touch with the trends and norms of the vibrant 

dining, bar and hospitality industry. We expect quality reports and compensate 

accordingly. Good writing skills are a must at Hospitality Checkpoint. 



Hospitality Checkpoint Agents are very carefully selected and chosen for the unique 

skills necessary to evaluate at the level expected. Meticulous screening and training are 

the norm, and they are professionals who understand the importance of integrity and what 

proper customer service means to the success of a bar or restaurant. Moreover, all of our 

agents must possess knowledge and years of experience in restaurants, bars, nightclubs, 

and resorts customer service industries in order to properly evaluate for theft and service 

concerns. 


Visit our website and see if you have what it takes to be a Hospitality 

Checkpoint Bar Spotter Service Agent. These are part time contracted positions and you 

can apply online at the website hyperlink . 

Please follow the online process described - No inquiry telephone calls please.

Hospitality Checkpoint LLC, 2017©®™

Title: Automotive Technician/ Mechanic
Description:
At Midas we are locally owned and operated, providing quality services to customer vehicles in the areas of inspection, diagnosis and repair utilizing the expertise attained through ASE Certifications and/or years of automotive repair experience. Minimizes customer complaints through the provision of thorough yet time-effective repair services. Able to work independently of others, while also being able to work collaboratively at times with peers. Assists in ensuring that proper inventory is kept at the shop, that shop equipment is maintained in top working condition, and adheres to shop safety and environmental practices. Operates vehicles safely and responsibly. 

Automotive Technician/Mechanic Requirements:

Minimum 2 years of experience as Automotive Technician/Mechanic
Ability to repair vehicles independently, while also having experience working well in a team environment.
Knowledge in automotive brakes, exhaust, suspension, & engine diagnostics.
Track record of high personal productivity.
Knowledge of, and adherence to, safety and environmental standards for repair facilities.
Experience using shop equipment such as lifts, welders, diagnostic equipment, etc.
May require experience in leading other, less qualified, technicians in vehicle repairs.
High School Diploma or equivalent. Technical Degree a definite plus.
Valid Drivers License that meets insurance guidelines
Personally have hand tools required to complete skills.
Smog Tech License Not required however will earn more if properly certified.

Automotive Technician/Mechanic Contact info: Immediate openings.Send Resume

Title: FIGHT FOR HUMAN RIGHTS!!! $15/HR + BONUSES
Description:
We are currently hiring passionate staff who are interested in fighting human rights violations with The Outreach Team on behalf of Amnesty International. Come work with us full-time - $15/hr., no commission. 

The Outreach Team seeks Membership Engagement Staff to build membership and raise money for our non-profit partners. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who seeks to create social change, revolutionize how non-profits raise money and win campaigns, and move up in both pay and position in a fast growing organization.

About you. You want to work somewhere that shares your values, rewards great work on important social change issues, provides you with a fast track to career advancement, and allows you to work with great people. More specifically, you:

• Have strong communication skills, a good work ethic, and can walk or bike for long periods of time.
• Are able to work within a team, receive feedback, and adapt to rapidly changing political landscapes.
• Preferred previous canvassing, sales, non-profit, customer service or political campaign experience.
• Bilingual is a plus.

The Outreach Team is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from people of color, LGBT individuals, and women.

Title: Now Hiring Part-Time Parking Attendants! $12.50/hr
Description:
Are you looking for a fun job at a positive company? Perfect Parking is hiring!

We are a rapidly growing local business and we are in need of more Grade A employees! If you enjoy working outdoors, helping customers, and working at a company that is small enough to know your name and recognize your work, this is the job for you! Experience is not necessary, we will train the right candidates. Bilingual not necessary, but a plus.

We have open Part-Time positions for Parking Attendants from Mom-Fri! The responsibilities for Parking Attendants are:

1 - Parking and retrieving vehicles
2 - Providing high quality customer service
3 - Inspect vehicles for damage
4 - Enjoys working in an environment that gets fast-paced during peak hours
5 - Able to lift objects up to 25 lbs, push and/or pull objects up to 40 lbs, stand and walk for extended periods of times, and jog during busy periods
6 - Performing work duties in outdoor weather and putting safety first at all times

The requirements for potential candidates are:

1 - Current Driver's License and good driving record
2 - Able to drive Manual and Automatic (Must be able to drive both)
3 - Strong communication skills
4 - Strong enough English skills (written and oral) to communicate with customers, supervisors, and co-workers.
5 - Work well with others
6 - Able to handle cash (basic addition and subtraction skills)

Come in to our office this week and apply during regular business hours (Wednesday 8/15 - Friday 8/18, 9am-4pm) so we can get a chance to get to know you! (please don't reply to this email, just come right in!) Park only in spaces marked "3" and use the staircase located on the right side of the building. Our address is listed below. We look forward to your visit!

Perfect Parking

3rd Floor
Los Angeles, CA 90021

Title: Delivery Drivers Needed!
Salesperson - High-End Health Electronics - Hourly+Commission, Full-Ti
Description:
HOW TO APPLY: Please email a brief introduction telling us that you're interested in a sales position, describe any relevant experience (if you have any), and attach a resume. In your email, please also answer the questions at the end of this post. 

We are a manufacturer of popular health/wellness electronic products that easily get attention. We're looking for ENERGETIC salespeople who can make sales happen by talking to customers. 

This job is full-time and includes benefits, an hourly salary, and per-sale commission on items that retail for over $7k-$10k each. 

Travel by car/truck for overnight sales events is often a part of this job. 

We have good products: if you are a motivated and charming salesperson, you can make a lot of money. 

ROOM TO GROW: We want career salespeople! Each of our branch offices needs a manager to oversee sales in that area and to follow-up and ensure that products are delivered and customers are happy. If you are experienced, please feel free to apply as a manager (we are happy to discuss salary options further). 

If you are just starting out, this company is growing and there is lots of room to grow with us and take on as much responsibility as you're interested in. 

PERSONALITY-DRIVEN: We want quality, friendly people who work well with others, who make our brand look good, and who are motivated to make sales. This opportunity is great for you if you like to manage your own work and time and are an independent but social person.

NEXT STEP - INTERVIEWS: Our headquarters is in the Los Angeles area, so if you're in this area we'll request that you come in for an interview. But if you are in another area, we're happy to arrange a phone interview or, preferably, a video chat. 

HOW TO APPLY: Please email a brief introduction telling us that you're interested in a sales position, describe any relevant experience (if you have any), and attach a resume. In your email, please also answer the following: 

What is your current location: 
[city, state]

-Los Angeles, California
-Orlando, Florida
-Houston, Texas
-Dallas, Texas
-Las Vegas Nevada
-Chicago, Illinois 
-Newark, New Jersey (coming soon) 

What level best applies to you? 
-New/Entry-Level Salesperson; 
-Some Experience-Salesperson; 
-Experienced Salesperson; 
-Management Sales Position

Please note: we have a zero-policy tolerance for drug use and substance abuse. You may be asked to pass a drug test within the first 6 months of hire. You will also need to pass a background check to ensure that you do not have a criminal record.

Title: Software Engineer 3
Description:
GBL Systems Corporation is a leading systems engineering and software development firm with a 25 year history of developing tomorrow's Electronic Warfare capability today.  We specialize in the areas of Systems/Software Engineering, Electronic Warfare, Network Centric Warfare, Modeling/ Simulation and Avionics Development.

GBL is based in Camarillo, CA. with many opportunities on base at Pt. Mugu NAS. Work location is at GBL office in Camarillo, CA or Pt Mugu, CA depending on position.

As part of a dynamic team, GBL engineers contribute to planning, designing, developing, documenting, testing and implementing various program requirements.  Qualified candidates should have an understanding of system security, networks, web-based product implementations and configuration management processes.  Successful applicants should have the ability to work effectively and cooperatively with all management levels, the personality to support team goals and the ability to work independently without close supervision.  Applicants should exhibit strong interpersonal and oral/written communications skills.  Candidate will be expected to mentor less experienced engineers and take on a leadership role.

Basic Qualifications:

Applicants will have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field (or equivalent experience) and 6+ years of experience.  Required knowledge and experience in software development utilizing Java and C++ programming languages.  Strong OOP/OOD skills are needed as well. Some project management skills required.  U.S. Citizenship required.

Desired Skills:

Experience with any of the following tools is desired: MS Project, MS Visio, MS Office, Agile and/ or Scrum, Machine Learning/ Artificial Intelligence/ Intelligent-agent, Neural Networks, Fuzzy Logic, Drools, Linux.

Additional knowledge and skills include experience with Real-time Software Systems and development, UML modeling, scripting languages (i.e. Java script, Perl, PHP, Bash) and software version control.
M.S. degree in Computer Science or related degree preferred.

ALL SELECTED APPLICANTS MUST BE U.S. CITIZENS AND WILL BE SUBJECT TO U.S. GOVERNMENT BACKGROUND INVESTIGATIONS AND MUST MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS TO ACCESS CLASSIFIED INFORMATION.  CURRENT OR RECENT SECURITY CLEARANCE IS DESIRED.

GBL offers a competitive salary, an outstanding 401(k) retirement plan with both Traditional and Roth options and generous corporate contributions, group medical insurance, life insurance, AD&D coverage, Section 125 plans that enable pre-tax payment of medical insurance premiums, paid holiday's, Paid Time Off and a business casual work environment.

GBL is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.
