Title: Director of Engineering
Description:
The Onni Group is a leading real estate firm based in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada with offices in Toronto, Los Angeles and Chicago. This diverse company is vertically integrated with in-house departments responsible for execution of the company's activities including property development, construction and management as well as leasing, sales and marketing.

There is an exciting opportunity to join a rapidly growing company that's unique in the industry. The Onni Group is active in Los Angeles and is poised to deliver 2,000 multifamily units in the years ahead. The Director of Engineering will provide a high level of property maintenance knowledge, and will be responsible for overseeing the in-house and third party engineers in the Los Angeles portfolio. This position has overall responsibility for maintaining the building, grounds and physical plant with particular attention towards safety, security and asset protection. Accountable for managing the budget, capital expenditure projects, preventative maintenance and energy conservation. Develops and implements strategies that will deliver products and services, which meet or exceed the needs and expectations of tenants while maximizing the financial performance. Responsible for maintaining standards and regulatory requirements. Leads the emergency response team for all facility issues.



•	Responsible for ensuring that the building systems are operated in the most efficient and effective manner especially as it relates to utility consumption and environmental responsibility. Implement a systematic program to promote energy awareness and conservation within the facility. Champion energy conservation programs to achieve maximum results from tenants and staff.
•	Develops and manages a plan and/or procedure for controlling, labeling, recording estimated life expectancy, maintenance and inspecting all capital and non-capital equipment within the facility. This plan includes a long-term engineering capital plan.
•	Acquire and maintain knowledge and skills in order to perform the efficient operation of the Energy Management System, in order to ensure the system performance keeps operating costs as low as possible.
•	Supervise the performing of Preventative Maintenance on all facility equipment as prescribed by manufacturer recommendations.
•	Consistently review building and equipment operating logs, operation procedures, equipment operation manuals, PM program equipment histories, emergency and safety training materials, as often as necessary to stay proficient with changing conditions. 
•	Maintain an on-going self-improvement program to keep abreast of new equipment, standards, codes, and maintenance procedures.
•	Hold regular site Engineering Department meetings, emergency and safety program training programs, inventory control programs, and property inspections.
•	Develop and implement key inventory policy at all properties.
•	Develop and implement permit tracking policy.
•	Conduct Annual Reviews of the Engineering Staff.
•	Ensure that all buildings in the portfolio are water tight and that the envelopes are within design criteria standards. Develop long term envelope management programs.
•	Conduct periodic inspections in order to ascertain the performance of the Engineering staff.
•	Provide high level oversight of the tenant improvements within the portfolio.
•	Organize and maintain permanent files such as plans, municipal permits, consultant documents, and any other documents of historical significance in a clean and supportive environment.
•	Provide support as requested by the Owners for supervising, advising or acquiring tasks associated with outside contractor projects.



•	Prefer 7+ years progressive operations experience.
•	Strong employee relation skills, coaching skills and training skills.
•	As required, highest-level relevant state/local license for Stationary Engineer and/or HVAC, plus universal level refrigerant recovery license.
•	BOMA accredited courses desirable.
•	Preferred: High-rise Fire Safety Director, Haz-Mat Certification, Indoor Air Quality Certification, LEED Certification.
•	Strong oral and written communication skills.
•	Ability to work with MS Word, Excel, and Outlook.
•	Computer skills and building automation systems experience required.
•	Certification meeting OSHA ACM awareness training requirements as required.
•	Working knowledge of energy conservation required, formal training preferred.

Please note that we offer competitive pay, a comprehensive benefit package and programs to continuously develop and recognize employees. 

All interested applicants please submit your resume and cover letter stating your salary expectations to: 

We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please.

Title: Delivery Driver
Description:
Description: Crate and office supply delivery.

Duties:
Represent Company when on customer's property and while driving, and further Company's high standard of customer service.
Maintain Delivery/ Pick-up Kit in vehicle; as listed in the Drivers Manual.
Assist in loading and unloading of vehicles at warehouse.
Unload Company products from vehicle at designated customer delivery site and arrange them in an orderly fashion following the customer's specifications, including breaking down stacks and distributing them to workstations if necessary.
Collect products at customer pick-up site and load them onto vehicles.

Liaison between Customer and Dispatcher/ Customer Service Dept.
Report any traffic incidents, accidents, or truck damages immediately to your Dispatcher.

Responsible for a.m. and p.m. safety and damage inspections of vehicles.
Requires a significant amount of warehouse work.

Qualifications:
C License/DOT Medical card. Clean MVR.
Must be able to lift 60 lb. minimum.
At least one year of driving 26 foot liftgate truck.
Must pass drug and background check and DOT physical.
Drivers are expected to operate Company vehicles responsibly to complete deliveries and pick-ups

Although this job description attempts to cover as many aspects of your job as possible, the need may arise for you to perform functions not mentioned herein.

Title: Tax Credit and Special Needs Experience Asst. Property Manager
Description:
To apply for this position, please click on the following link:  

COMPANY SUMMARY:
The John Stewart Company is a full-service housing management, development and consulting organization that began in 1978 with a commitment to providing high quality service in the affordable housing sector. We work to enrich the lives of our residents and employees, while delivering our services cost‐effectively, efficiently and with the highest levels of professionalism, compassion, integrity and respect.

SUMMARY OF THE POSITION:
Under the general supervision of the Property Manager, you assists the manager in the overall operation of the property, day-to-day implementation of policies, procedures and programs; maintains acceptable occupancy level and develops a supportive environment for all residents, including special needs residents. APM interacts with and oversees vendors and establishes and maintains effective working relationships with onsite support staffs.

Responsibilities:
-  Interviews and screens prospective residents for occupancy.
-  Prepares, processes and signs leases and rules.
-  Purchases general supplies, and services following the P.O. policy and procedures.
-  Assists with inspections and monitoring work orders.
-  Rent collection, receipting, prepares deposits using Boston Post property management software.
-  Writes warning letters and prepares legal notices to residents.
-  Submits required reports and maintains records according to JSCo policies.
-  Performs related work and other duties required.

Qualifications:
-  High school diploma or GED required. BA degree desirable.
-  Ability to read, write and communicate fluently in English.
-  Excellent problem solving, listening, and deductive reasoning skills.
-  Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook.
-  Must have 1- 2 years property management experience preferably with Tax Credit properties.
-  Prior experience in managing affordable housing complexes.
-  Must have valid Driver's License and reliable transportation, and be able to travel for training purposes.
-  Knowledgeable regarding company policies, federal, state, and local laws, Tax Credit Section 42, and other rules that pertain to tnants.

Title: Extra Cash - Egg Donor Needed - Between $5,000 - $20,000

.Age 18-29
.Healthy Weight/BMI
.Excellent health and healthy family history
.Non-smoker, no drug use
.Committed and stable
.Reliable transportation

Benefits:
Very generous compensation for your time 
Costly Medical/Genetic test results for your personal records
Depending upon egg quantity, there is the possibility of freezing one or more of your eggs for your future use 
You have the chance to literally change someone's life - how many times will you get that chance?

The donor process is not painful
The process is anonymous, confidential and safe
There is no out of pocket expense for you as a donor

You will be treated by board certified physicians in a world-renowned fertility practice located in the Beverly Hills area. Our staff is extensively trained in fertility treatment. Description:

Candidate must have the ability to work independently, able to complete assigned tasks and enjoy assisting a team dedicated to helping people find their next home!

RESPONSIBLITIES:

Title: Services Reception / Front Desk Concierge at Animal Care Facility
Description:
We are hiring for: Services Reception / Front Desk Concierge

Full Time - Beverly Hills location

Pussy & Pooch is a modern dog/cat lifestyle boutique and services company, providing a colorful and interactive atmosphere for pets and their people. We take great pride in our award winning services including Grooming, Daycare, Training, and Boarding. We are looking to add a quality team member that can make an impact to team revenue and overall client experience.

Position Summary: 
The Concierge/Reception team is responsible for introducing all of our dog/cat clients and their humans to the comprehensive services available at our new facility. You must be extremely comfortable around dogs of all sizes and breeds. This position requires a good eye and attention to little details. This position also requires a high level of customer service and sales recommendations with clients. If you do not like customer service this position is not for you.

The ideal candidate: 
- PLUS - experience at an animal care facility, experience working with animals, understanding of dog breeds, understanding of animal services.
- 2+ years of customer service experience, phone etiquette skills, familiarity with POS systems, and proficient computer skills. 
- Must have knowledge of appointment booking software. Spa/salon booking systems a plus! 
- Outstanding customer service and communication skills and understands the value in developing strong relationships with customers.
- Desire to develop a strong working knowledge of all services/product features and benefits including food/nutrition, heath/wellness, toys, treats and fashion.
- Proficient sales skills and must be comfortable making sales recommendations to clients.
- Stylish and professional appearance and takes pride in presenting him/herself as a reflection of our boutique brand.
- Flexible with scheduling and willing to work mornings, nights, weekends and holiday time periods.
- Self-starter and quick learner.
- Punctual and reliable with own transportation, preferably lives in the local area.
- Capable of working with demanding and eccentric clients.
- MUST LOVE DOGS AND CATS!

Core Responsibilities: 
- Booking appointments for our comprehensive services department. 
- Providing education and introducing our clients to the comprehensive wellness services offered at our facility. 
- Ensuring that our clients are able to experience the entire Lifestyle Center heavily relies on the efficiency and ability of our Concierge team. 
- Maintaining a professional appearance and attitude while under pressure.

Position Conclusion:
- This position will keep you on your toes and will be very rewarding. You will develop relationships with customers and their pets. 
- We offer amazing growth potential. This is an opportunity to join a dynamic young company whose mission centers around the love of pets, and to be a real difference maker who grows with the business.

Wage determined by experience/skills and responsibility. Significant employee discounts and other perks also offered. Health insurance.

Title: Guest Service Agent
Description:
Situated in the heart of downtown Los Angeles, LEVEL Furnished Living presents a fresh concept in premium short and long term accommodation. Located just minutes from the Staples Center and L.A. Live, Grand Park, the Fashion and Financial Districts, a celebrated international dining scene and city-wide transportation links, LEVEL Furnished Living uniquely combines the comfort and convenience of home with the hospitality and style of a boutique luxury hotel.


               
Respond to a wide variety of guest requests by accurately assessing the guest needs and requests and then adding personal recommendations and touches to achieve maximum customer satisfaction.



•	Handles all guest interactions with the highest level of hospitality and professionalism, accommodating special requests whenever possible; resolves customer complaints; assist customers in all inquiries in connection with our services, hours of operations, key personnel, in-house events, directions, etc. Responds to all guest requests in an accurate and timely manner making recommendations based on local knowledge and Level practices. 
•	Processes packages, faxes, messages, and mail which may be either outgoing or incoming in an accurate and timely manner.
•	Complies with Work Rules and Standards of Conduct.
•	Works harmoniously and professionally with co-workers and supervisors.
•	Assure that desk collateral and information for restaurants, museums, attractions, maps, and other local attractions are updated and current. Knows what activities are available in the city (theatre, sports, concerts, shows, special exhibits, sightseeing) and establishes close contacts with vendors in these areas in order to provide information, ticketing, and reservations for guests.
•	Stores and retrieves guest luggage and packages.
•	Utilizes a variety of software programs to accurately input special arrangements the guest has made and to assure proper billing.



•	Assists with responsibilities and duties in the absence of or due to heavy volume in the areas of the Valet Parking, and lobby coverage.
•	Provide basic trouble-shooting support for in-room services such as Internet, TV movies, games, and Web service.
•	Works closely with Valet Parking Staff to ensure smooth handling of guest vehicles, luggage (if applicable), deliveries and special requests.

All interested applicants please submit your resume and cover letter to:

Title: Driver Associates Wanted - Drive & Make Money Now
Retail  Sales Assoicate- Wireless
Description:
Overview:
Turn enthusiasm for wireless technology into a profitable endeavor. Grow your sales success as a Retail Sales Associate at one of our locations! Our Sales Associates are the principal element to our customers' experience. Our associates are knowledgeable, personable, courteous, and strive for personal, professional and financial growth.

Sprint Preferred Retailer committed to providing superior customer service. iMobile has store locations across 17 states and employs over 800 employees. We are looking for a Retail Sales Associate to make a positive impact in one of our locations. 

Responsibilities:
Retail Sales Associates are accountable for achieving or exceeding individual sales goals, set by their store manager. Sales Associates will participate in our week long training to be set up for success. Under the supervision of a Store Manager, the support of a District Manager, the retail sales associates must display, have knowledge of and participate in all the store's promotions, programs, and products. Retail Associates must stay well-informed of the current trends of key competitors in the wireless industry. Above all, retail sales associates must have the ability to connect and build rapport with prospective and current customers in order to provide superior customer service. Sales associates will perform other miscellaneous duties as assigned, (i.e. stock inventory, maintain a neat store appearance, prepare product displays, report any suspected theft to management immediately).

Qualifications:
The desired candidate must possess the following qualifications and attributes:
-High School Diploma or equivalent
-Professionalism
-Previous sales experience a plus
-Self-reliance to perform on an incentive based salary
-Excellent verbal and written communication skills
-Enthusiastic, energetic, personable and friendly disposition
-Ambitious, hardworking and passionate about the wireless industry
-Good listening skills to utilize for selling
-Organized with great follow-up skills
-Willing to work weekends and holidays
-Bilingual in Spanish and English is a plus
-Must be familiar with Microsoft Windows and Excel

COMPENSATION:
Sales Associates will receive the following compensation and opportunities:
-Base hourly wage with a sales commission
-Training and development
-Opportunity for advancement
-Discount on product and services

Title: MAKE DELIVERIES & JOIN OUR TEAM - DELIVER & EARN NOW!
Eureka! Restaurant Group- IT Restaurant System Specialist
Description:
Eureka! is an expression of delight on finding, discovering or solving something and this exclamation of joy starts with you. Our values driven culture is full of passionate people serving those hungry to discover a local blend of America's best. Many of our guests are joining us for the items they crave or offerings they wish to explore. Our aim is to attract and hire talent that provides an enthusiastic experience for all our guests while being a great co-worker for their teammates.

Purpose of the Position

To maintain all IT systems and networks as well as perform both technical and administrative tasks to ensure functionality and efficiency of computer and telecom systems. This position reports directly to the IT Director.

Essential Job Functions:
Passion for the brand
Entrepreneurial spirit
Strong understanding of corporate mission and purpose
Ability to articulate corporate vision
Project competency and confidence dealing with outside vendors
Growth mindset (i.e., a "can-do" attitude)
Ability to handle pressure and work in a constantly changing atmosphere
Effective teamwork skills
Strong communication skills (verbal, non-verbal, and electronic)
Genuinely friendly interpersonal skills
Strong analytical skills
Support in keeping the brand image and reputation

Qualifications:
Outgoing, pleasant and professional demeanor
Excellent telephone, speaking and listening and technical reading comprehension skills
Excellent organization, planning and multi-tasking
Exceptional analytical abilities, problem solving, and follow through skills
Able to learn rapidly and following instructions
Able to work independently with minimal supervision keeping management informed of problems and issues
Commitment to excellence in service and performance

Position Requirements:

Receive, manage, dispatch, and track all Restaurant and Support Center calls and emails through help desk management software
Follow-up on and escalate help desk calls to management as necessary
Communicate professionally and frequently with all levels of Support Center team and restaurant operations
Assist in providing computer/network support of all hardware and software systems at the restaurants and in the Support Center.
Assist in management and maintenance of all software and hardware systems and networks.
Troubleshoots all technology to prevent crashes or business interruption.
Analyze and maintain applications, procedures and systems (hardware and software).
Assist in maintaining security and integrity of all restaurant and corporate databases, web based applications and financial data.
Prepare and submit weekly project status reports to supervisor
Create documentations and procedures for various projects
Dedicate weekly time to learning new skills necessary for self-development in order to contribute to the growth of the IT Team
Update all restaurant application databases including; Food Cost, Menu Pricing, Labor Management, etc.
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals
Ability to write routine reports and correspondence
Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization


Software Used:
Proficient in Microsoft Office, Google Apps,
Basic understanding of relational database a plus
Basic understanding of HTML and SQL a plus
Experience with Aloha POS is a plus

Title: Make Money & Have Fun -- Drive With Scoobeez
Leasing Associate
Description:
Richman Property Services, Inc. is currently seeking a hands-on, team-oriented Leasing Associate with a can-do attitude!

As one of the nation's top ten residential property owners, our mission is to ensure that our residents live in a quality apartment community they can be proud of. Our team accomplishes this by delivering optimal customer service and creating a safe and inviting home.

You will work out of Sage Apartments, our brand new, Class A, luxury, residential community located in Cerritos, CA!

The success of the company is dependent upon the satisfaction of our residents. Our devoted staff maintains direct involvement in managing each of our properties and tending to their needs.

APPLY now through our company careers page here!: 

SUMMARY: Responsible for handling the leasing process of the apartment community, including qualifying prospects, answering phones, obtaining appointments prospects, showing the property and leasing available units in compliance with all applicable regulations. The Leasing Associate is not responsible for management activity or resident issues, position with focus only on leasing and marketing 100% of the time.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
1) Accepts applications for residence
- Ensures application is complete and accurate
- Ensures prospect understands deposit policies
- Determines move-in date and unit desires
- Collects deposit and application fee
- Verifies application and sends paperwork to compliance in a timely manner
- Makes recommendations to Property Manager about desirability of prospects

2) Completes Apartment Lease and Addendum's for Property Manager's review
- Explains lease to prospect with thorough knowledge and details of the lease agreements
- Makes daily traffic entries to computer and/or status reports

3) Completes all move-in details
- Move-in package and lease expiration
- Keys
- Resident copy of lease
- Move-in condition report
- Collection of any deposits or rent due prior to occupancy
- Computer information initiated to include
- Lease beginning and ending dates
- Amount of rent per lease
- Deposits required including pet
- Names of all occupants
- Business and home phones
- Email address

4) Additional duties include:
- Assists Property Manager/Leasing Manager/District Manager with the development and execution of marketing plans
- Assists Manager in shopping competition
- Maintains updated information on competitive area rates, occupancy, incentives and packages
- Assures models and market ready apartments are open daily and are clean, smell fresh and are ready
- Must achieve a closing ratio based on National Standards and/or based on community set goals

POSITION REQUIREMENTS	
EDUCATION: High school diploma or general education degree (GED)

EXPERIENCE: One year prior apartment industry experience; 1-3 months residential rental and office experience and/or training

SKILLS & CERTIFICATIONS: 
- Knowledge of Microsoft Office Word, Excel and Outlook
- Detail oriented with excellent communication, customer service, organizational and analytical/problem solving skills
- Ability to operate various types of office equipment, i.e., computers, printers, copy machines, telephone systems, facsimile machines
- Demonstrated phone sales, leasing, and customer service skill
- A team player with a strong work ethic and customer focus
- Extremely responsive, courteous, reliable, energetic, and upbeat
- Strong attention to follow up technique
- Bilingual Spanish preferred
- Performance driven
- Enjoys working in a high energy, fast paced, new business environment
- Embraces growth and change
- Solves problems and is reliable, self-starting, energetic and upbeat individual 

APPLY now through our company careers page here!: 

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package to include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, long and short-term disability, 401(k), paid time off and bonus potential.

PTO - All employees are eligible to accrue up to 6 days of PTO (paid time off and sick leave).

VACATION - Employees who regularly work greater than 20 hours per week will earn up to 10 days Vacation time with the potential for 15 days after 3 years with us!

If you are looking for a rewarding career opportunity with one of the top Property Management organizations in the country, we'd like to hear from you!

To learn more about Richman Property Services, Inc. please visit our website at www.therichmangroup.com

We conduct criminal background and drug screening.

EOE/DFWP

Title: Associate Attorney
Description:

This position provides hands-on experience to new associates who are looking to gain experience in the courtroom, and hone their verbal and writing skills in motion practice. Title: Personal Assistant needed for unique job w/Travel
Description:
Looking for a big change and unique job opportunity to match your skills?
 
We are looking for an experienced personal assistant to join our team. A healthy, active household residing about half of the year in Los Angeles and traveling to Europe the rest. The head of our household is a very cool, private, very busy business owner and we're looking for someone professional who can provide with personal assistant service.
Teamwork attitude is a must, as you will be working together with other assistants.
Exceptional organizational skills will be required to oversee a busy calendar and process internal documents and special projects.
A confident self-starter with outstanding interpersonal skills and a 'take charge' approach will thrive as part of this top-performing team. Work requires flexibility with standard errand-running, appointment management, personal assistant and other duties as part of regular work associated with this job. 
Travel can be up to six months out of the year so anyone applying for the job should be aware of that as well.  If you don't want to be away from home, this is not the job for you. If you find it difficult to adjust to change, this is not the job for you.  It is however a good job in a relaxed environment and we're looking for someone who is serious about becoming a part of our team of assistants.

Must Haves:
International experience
Current US Passport  (or green card)
Positive Attitude (we like smiling around here)
A willingness to learn
Team work attitude
License and a car in good working condition
 
Skills & experience toolbox:
Bachelor's Degree preferred
3-5 years of personal/executive assistant experience at a high profile household/ executive
Proficiency with Microsoft Office programs
Travelling required. Approximately 50% of the year spent out of LA.
Can do attitude
Self-starter
Positive outlook
Detail oriented 
Reliable 
Flexible
Multilingual: French and/or Hungarian is preferred
 
What you'll do:
Schedule and organize meetings, travel, conferences and other activities
Travel frequently  and support his day-to-day activities, requirements
Answer phone calls and direct calls to appropriate parties, take messages. 
Draft written responses or replies by phone or e-mail when necessary. Responds to regularly occurring requests for information.
Act as a liaison
Work independently and within a team on special nonrecurring and ongoing projects. 
Type reports, memos, letters, and other documents using word relevant computer software.
Ordering supplies
Liaise with all levels of management and staff and provide vital support
 
 
To apply:
Only serious candidates should apply. Send your resume and a brief description of why the job appeals to you to:
applications@doclermedia.com
 
We would like to see your smile, a short video of yourself as an introduction is required

Title: Junior Interior Designer
Description:
DESIGN VIDAL an east side architectural & interior design firm is currently seeking a talented candidate for a freelance JUNIOR DESIGNER position. This person will work directly with the company's creative director Karen Vidal. 

The ideal candidate holds a degree in interior design or architecture and has 1-2 years of experience. 

Must be willing to work under pressure in a busy atmosphere. This is a rare opportunity for a motivated up and coming designer and has potential for growth within the company. Must have a reliable vehicle (mileage paid) and laptop / work station. 

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills & software knowledge:

- free hand sketching (pencil on site)
- SketchUp 
- AutoCad or Revit
- recording on-site dimensions 
- fast worker 
- strong communicator 
- takes direction well 
- team player 
- well developed visualization skills 
- interface with lead designer to draw ideas
- interface with sub contractors to ensure quality control 
- research various elements to be incorporated into designs 

Part-time up to 20 hours to begin. Can lead to full time. 
$20/hour depending on skill level. 

This position is available immediately! 

www.designvidal.com

Title: INSURANCE AGENT
Description:

Position Overview:
We are a successful Farmers Agency located in Westlake Village and we are looking for a qualified professional to join our winning team. Title: Online Marketing Specialist For Growing Nutrition Company (Virtual)
Description:
***PLEASE NO CALLS***

The Institute of Transformational Nutrition (ITN) was founded and is led by Cynthia Pasquella, CCN, an industry leader with real-world experience creating a successful business that includes best-selling books, global media attention and an award-winning product line. Cynthia is famous for inspiring millions of women to discover what they're really hungry for. She is regularly featured in the media including Khloe Kardashian's Revenge Body, The Doctors, Dr. Phil, The TODAY Show, Dr Oz, and more.

We're in the process of a brand new company launch that will disrupt the market in a much-needed way. At ITN, we're certifying the next generation of nutrition coaches, using the world's first Personalized Nutrition Coaching System (PNCS) - and we need your help.

We're looking for an Online Marketing Specialist to drive traffic, increase conversions, solidify our position in the market, and take our brand to the next level.

The person we bring on will need to feel right at home in a start-up environment. The learning curve is steep and the speed will make your head spin but if you're willing to focus and do the work you will be a part of a team that's changing lives around the globe!

A Little About The Position

The Online Marketing Specialist is responsible for increasing brand awareness and growing our audience while increasing conversions and out-educating the competition.

Roles & Responsibilities

Developing and managing a content marketing strategy that supports organizational goals across all brands and customer avatars, from the top to the bottom of the marketing and sales funnel including Increasing Brand and Offer Awareness, Growing Website Traffic, Generating Leads, and Acquiring Customers.
Edit and manage the production of digital and print content that is consistent with the organization's brand, style, and tone.
Develop and maintain a content calendar that attracts and appeals to the organization's target customer avatars.
Creation of standard operating procedures (SOPs) for the planning, execution, optimization, distribution, and amplification of the organization's content.
Assisting in ideation, planning, and execution of the editorial and content marketing calendar that attracts and appeals to the organization's various customer avatars.
Developing and maintaining a social media strategy that actively addresses listening, networking, influencing, and selling on the social web.
Monitoring and responding to customer service and reputation management issues using social listening tools.
Monitoring and measuring the success of social media strategy (i.e. increased engagement, customer acquisition, website traffic, etc.). Identifying, analyzing, and reporting on social media trends to internal team.
Monitoring and reporting on content marketing metrics and KPIs.
Set up opt-ins using Leadpages and Infusionsoft.
Write landing page copy for dedicated emails sent to partners' email lists.
Set up, test, and manage paid media including Facebook Ads and Google Adwords.
Creating copy, engaging headlines and subheads, proof reading, and deep-line editing for spelling, grammar, and brand consistency.
Creating content that is optimized for search and social media traffic
Leveraging interviews, testimonials, demos, and other storytelling styles to meet the needs of the target audience.
Optimizing videos for search engines using keyword-enriched descriptions and tags.
Setting up webinars and optimizing content for the intended audience.
Skill Requirements

Content Marketing - Demonstrated experience with successful management and execution of a content marketing strategy.
Leadership - Successful experience leading a team in a project driven environment.
Search Engine Optimization - A demonstrated ability to drive traffic to web properties from search engines.
Editing - Proven editorial skills including strong language skills and the ability to adjust content to remain consistent with brand, style, and tone.
Blogging - Successful management of a business blog that furthers organizational goals.
WordPress - The ability to create content within and troubleshoot issues with the WordPress platform.
Copywriting - An understanding of how to create and present content that persuades.
Lead Generation - Demonstrated experience with using digital and/or print content to generate leads and sales.
Analytics - An excellent command of analytics platforms, such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics, to adjust marketing strategy and tactics.
Organization - Demonstrated ability to multi-task and meet a variety of deadlines.
Critical Thinkin g - Ability to identify trends and adjust strategy using analytical and quantitative problem-solving.
Journalism - Demonstrated experience in investigating and producing research-based content.
YouTube Optimization - Ability to drive traffic to video content from search engines and optimize videos for YouTube search.
Communication Skills - Superior ability to create compelling narratives for internal and external audiences.
Bonus Skills

Graphic Design - Ability to create images that follow brand and style guides to enhance marketing efforts.
Video Editing - Ability to edit videos and add callouts and other interactive elements to improve marketing efforts.
Experience in a Startup - Experience working in a fast-paced startup environment where no job is too big or too small.
Education & Experience

A minimum of 2 years experience with these or similar responsibilities.

About Us

ITN makes a difference far beyond its industry through scholarships for U.S. Veterans and support for charitable organizations such as Just Like My Child Foundation, which works directly with leaders in Uganda and Senegal to enhance leadership capacity and motivate citizens towards self-reliance and empowerment that will sustain the community into the future without further aid.

We're passionate about our mission, and we absolutely love what we do. If you would like to share in this mission, and you believe you possess an uncommon blend of marketing genius and entrepreneurial irreverence, then we invite you to apply.

Perks And Salary:

First... the perks

Work from home
Enjoy unlimited vacation
Access to professional grade supplements
Access to health testing
Join a positive and upbeat team
Full access to our training courses and certification programs
Full access to digital marketing training courses and certification
Be generously compensated (and actually appreciated!) for results
And now... the salary

Salary will be determined based on education and experience. Please provide your salary requirements when responding to this post.

This is a contract-to-hire position, working remote full time, which would require a handful of overlapping hours between 9am PST - 5pm PST each day. Our mission is to help people worldwide experience transformation and live their dreams, and the truth is, we can't do it without you.

Our mission is to help people worldwide experience transformation and live their dreams, and the truth is, we can't do it without you. Please write a cover letter that includes your favorite travel destination. We are looking forward to reviewing your resume and will contact you if you are the best fit!!!

Job Type: Contract

Title: Kitchen Manager
Description:
Zooies is a new bakery that recently opened in Los Angeles. We bake mainly cookies using only the best ingredients and a lot of love. We take pride in the fact that our cookies don't use any hydrogenated oils, shortening, or preservatives. We make sure the dairy we use is RBST/hormone free, and use cage free eggs. At Zooies we believe that if it doesn't exist in nature, it doesn't belong in you. Zooies also offers self-serve frozen yogurt and/or sorbet and artisan coffee with trained baristas on staff. We believe in feeding people's souls and making their day through a delicious treat and a smile.

We are seeking a Kitchen Manager. Our ideal candidate will have previous experience in the food service industry, with top organizational skills, extensive knowledge in inventory, ordering, scheduling, and managing a team of five or more people. Customer service experience and a general enjoyment for interacting with others is crucial. The Kitchen Manager will work closely with the owner to ensure efficiency in the kitchen and with the staff.

Responsibilities (Including, but not limited to):
- Extensive knowledge of menu (Cookies, Coffee, Frozen Yogurt)
- Understanding of register transactions
- Take orders via phone or email
- Ensuring employees are keeping product and cleanliness up to expected standard 
- Communicating any issues in the bakery with the appropriate parties
- Creating a positive attitude and atmosphere
- Take inventory regularly
- Place orders to ensure we are never out of stock
- Plan daily/weekly menu items with owner
- Scheduling employees to ensure maximum coverage
- Communicating with Social Media Manager regarding upcoming specials and daily features

Please email us your resume and include a cover letter telling us more about your love of food/baking. Please use the cover letter to tell us something that doesn't necessarily come across in your resume.

The hours for this position is Monday to Friday from 6:30 to 2:30, following a regular school year schedule.

Title: Work with children with special needs (ABA)
Description:
Creative Behavioral Consultants, Inc. provides Behavior Intervention and support to children diagnosed with autism and other developmental disorders. We offer complete training in applied behavior analysis (ABA) techniques (see other requirements below).

We provide a supportive, rich and fun working environment, flexible hours, competitive pay, and opportunities to grow. We are looking for a dynamic behavior instructor to join our remarkable core team to make a difference in this world.

This is a PART-TIME position 12-15 hours per week. We do not have full time positions available. Ideal for candidate in school who is seeking a flexible job for supplemental income. Please do not apply if you will be seeking Full-Time employment in the near future.

JOB DETAILS

Areas: Currently looking to fill positions in the following areas:  East and West San Fernando Valley; Agoura Hills.

Interviews and training take place at our office in Calabasas.

Time: Must be available at least 3 weekdays between 3:30 and 7 pm (sessions are usually 2.5 hours within that time frame).
Saturday hours may be available, especially in the A.M.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

1. Bachelor's degree (OR working toward completion) in psychology, child development, social work or related field.

2. Experience working with children preferred.

3. Ability to have fun REQUIRED!

4. Must be reliable and punctual.

5. Must have reliable transportation and be a good driver with a valid California driver's license and auto insurance.

6. Comfortable with paperwork. Heavy emphasis on accurate data collection (training will be provided).

7. Detail oriented. You will be trained in specific protocols and procedures in applied behavior analysis, and must demonstrate competency in those areas following training. In addition, demonstrate ongoing competency in the implementation of these procedures, including accurate data collection. Paid Training will be provided.

QUALITIES NECESSARY FOR SUCCESS AS A BEHAVIOR INSTRUCTOR:

1. Common Sense.
2. Patience.
3. Ability to have fun working with children of all ages.
4. Must work well with others in a structured environment.
5. You must be open to feedback to improve your skill set.
6. Possess stability and consistency.
7. Ability to follow written and verbal instructions.
8. Quick learner.

BENEFITS:
FULL COMPREHENSIVE PAID TRAINING PROVIDED IN APPLIED BEHAVIOR ANALYSIS.

Flexible working hours.
On-going training and professional development.
Opportunities for advancement.
Compensation for mileage and travel time between two clients.

APPLICATION PROCESS
When you submit your resume, please write the words "Part-Time Behavior Instructor" on the subject line. Our office is located in Calabasas (91302). This is where interviews and training take place.

For more information about our company, please visit our website at: 

Key words: behaviorist, behavior intervention, tutor, paraprofessional, ABA, DTT.

Title: Lassen's Wilshire/La Brea Open Positions
Description:
To apply please follow: 



Custodian Summary: Ensures store cleanliness is maintained. Job Duties must be met by working a shift that overlaps with the store closing.



Responsibilities and Duties:


1. Clean floors by sweeping and running the Floor Cleaner on a daily basis
2. Cleans windows and glass display cases
3. Removes stickers from floor, walls, and fixtures
4. Thoroughly cleans floor drains
5. Cleans shelves, counters, or tables
6. Thoroughly cleans all bathrooms
7. Cleans, dusts, and wipes down bulk bins and bulk bin fixtures
8. Sprays down outside front area using Hand-Held Power Washer
9. Assists in the Produce and Bulk Bin deep cleaning
10. Ensures cleaning supplies are stocked sufficiently
11. When needed, provides outstanding customer service and answers customer's questions concerning location and
price of merchandise.


Supervisory Responsibilities
This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

Competencies
To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies :
1. Analytical - Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data.
2. Design - Demonstrates attention to detail.
3. Problem Solving - Works well in group problem solving situations.
4. Project Management - Completes projects on time and within budget.
5. Technical Skills - Shares expertise with others.
6. Customer Service - Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs;
Solicits customer feedback to improve service ; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments.
7. Interpersonal Skills - Remains open to other's ideas and tries new things.
8. Oral Communication - Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Listens and gets
clarification.
9. Written Communication - Able to read and interpret written information.
10. Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views;
Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives;
Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.
11. Visionary Leadership - Displays passion and optimism; Inspires respect and trust.
12. Change Management - Builds commitment and overcomes resistance.
13. Quality Management - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness.
14. Ethics - Treats people with respect; Keeps commitments; Works with integrity and ethically; Upholds organizational values.
15. Organizational Support - Follows policies and procedures; Supports organization's goals and values.
16. Judgment - Exhibits sound and accurate judgment; Includes appropriate people in decision-making process.
17. Motivation - Demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles.
18. Planning/Organizing - Uses time efficiently.
19. Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of
their status or position.
20. Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality.
21. Quantity - Meets productivity standards; Completes work in timely manner; Works quickly.
22. Safety and Security - Observes safety and security procedures; Reports potentially unsafe conditions ; Uses equipment and materials properly.
23. Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment.
24. Attendance/Punctuality - Is consistently at work and on time; Ensures work responsibilities are covered when absent; Arrives at meetings and appointments on time.
25. Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Keeps commitments.
26. Initiative - Asks for and offers help when needed.


Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements
are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable
individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Language Skills
Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write simple
correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on- one and small group situations to customers, clients, and
other employees of the organization.

Mathematical Skills
Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.
Ability to compute margin percentages.

Reasoning Ability
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to
deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

Computer Skills
To perform this job successfully, an individual should have a basic knowledge of Internet software; Spreadsheet software and
Word Processing software.

Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform
the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to
perform the essential functions.

1. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; use hands to finger,
handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear.
2. The employee is frequently required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
3. The employee is occasionally required to sit and climb or balance.
4. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
5. Environmental exposure to extreme temperatures (coolers, freezer, outdoors, etc)
6. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception
and ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing
the essential functions of this job.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Title: Wareshouse/DC Manager
Description:
Consumer Products Design House seeks a dynamic, creative and hard-working individual for the position of Warehouse/Distribution Manager. The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of experience managing a warehouse and a proven track record managing a work force of 50+ permanent employees and 70+ temporary employees.  Candidate must have strong leadership skills and the ability to inspire, direct and mentor their direct reports on a daily basis. Strong follow up and attention to detail is required.

Warehouse/Distribution Manager Job Duties:
•	Ensures the safe, clean and efficient operation of the warehouse to meet service standards.
•	Maintains excellent inventory accuracy through entire material flow process - receipt, storage and replenishment. Responsible for inbound Container management - trucking, expediting and tracking.
•	Supervises Receiving, Warehousing, QC, Assembly, DSDC and Distribution Operations by initiating, coordinating, and enforcing program, operational, and personnel policies and procedures. 
•	Completes warehouse operational requirements by scheduling and assigning employees. Responsible for monitoring/tracking permanent and temporary labor work results and overall labor expenditures to minimize OT. Initiates KPIs for process and efficiency improvements.
•	Maintains warehouse staff by assisting HR with recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training employees. 
•	Maintains warehouse staff job results by planning, coaching, counseling, monitoring, disciplining and appraising employees.
•	Achieves financial objectives by preparing an annual budget, scheduling expenditures, analyzing variances and initiating corrective actions. Forecasts all capital requirements and coordinates IT requirements with It Department.
•	Maintains physical condition of the warehouse by planning and implementing new design layouts, managing audits and coordinating routine inspections and maintenance.  Inspects equipment and issues work orders for repair and requisitions for replacement - keeps equipment to full capacity.
•	Safeguards warehouse operations and contents by establishing and monitoring safety and security procedures and protocols. Maintains C-TPat compliance.
•	Complies with federal, state, and local warehousing, material handling, and shipping requirements. Studies existing and new legislation and enforces adherence to requirement.  Advises management on needed actions. 
•	Works daily with cross functional teams, including Sales and Marketing. Estimates Costing for Marketing Display/Pallet Programs, rework projects etc. 
•	Supports overall DC Operation and assists VP of Operations as needed.  Key member of Operations Leadership Team.

Experience, Education, and Training Requirements:
•	BS in Supply Chain or applicable study preferred, not required
•	Bilingual in English and Spanish (REQUIRED)
•	Minimum of 5 years of fulfillment, warehouse and production management experience 
•	Detailed knowledge of materials flow, shipping and receiving functions (both inbound and out bound) in a fast moving environment
•	Excellent supervisory skills with capability to supervise a work force of 7 leads directly and 50 + warehouse employees
•	Strong process improvement/continuous improvement skills

Title: Wareshouse/DC Manager
Description:
Consumer Products Design House seeks a dynamic, creative and hard-working individual for the position of Warehouse/Distribution Manager. The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of experience managing a warehouse and a proven track record managing a work force of 50+ permanent employees and 70+ temporary employees.  Candidate must have strong leadership skills and the ability to inspire, direct and mentor their direct reports on a daily basis. Strong follow up and attention to detail is required.

Warehouse/Distribution Manager Job Duties:
•	Ensures the safe, clean and efficient operation of the warehouse to meet service standards.
•	Maintains excellent inventory accuracy through entire material flow process - receipt, storage and replenishment. Responsible for inbound Container management - trucking, expediting and tracking.
•	Supervises Receiving, Warehousing, QC, Assembly, DSDC and Distribution Operations by initiating, coordinating, and enforcing program, operational, and personnel policies and procedures. 
•	Completes warehouse operational requirements by scheduling and assigning employees. Responsible for monitoring/tracking permanent and temporary labor work results and overall labor expenditures to minimize OT. Initiates KPIs for process and efficiency improvements.
•	Maintains warehouse staff by assisting HR with recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training employees. 
•	Maintains warehouse staff job results by planning, coaching, counseling, monitoring, disciplining and appraising employees.
•	Achieves financial objectives by preparing an annual budget, scheduling expenditures, analyzing variances and initiating corrective actions. Forecasts all capital requirements and coordinates IT requirements with It Department.
•	Maintains physical condition of the warehouse by planning and implementing new design layouts, managing audits and coordinating routine inspections and maintenance.  Inspects equipment and issues work orders for repair and requisitions for replacement - keeps equipment to full capacity.
•	Safeguards warehouse operations and contents by establishing and monitoring safety and security procedures and protocols. Maintains C-TPat compliance.
•	Complies with federal, state, and local warehousing, material handling, and shipping requirements. Studies existing and new legislation and enforces adherence to requirement.  Advises management on needed actions. 
•	Works daily with cross functional teams, including Sales and Marketing. Estimates Costing for Marketing Display/Pallet Programs, rework projects etc. 
•	Supports overall DC Operation and assists VP of Operations as needed.  Key member of Operations Leadership Team.

Experience, Education, and Training Requirements:
•	BS in Supply Chain or applicable study preferred, not required
•	Bilingual in English and Spanish (REQUIRED)
•	Minimum of 5 years of fulfillment, warehouse and production management experience 
•	Detailed knowledge of materials flow, shipping and receiving functions (both inbound and out bound) in a fast moving environment
•	Excellent supervisory skills with capability to supervise a work force of 7 leads directly and 50 + warehouse employees
•	Strong process improvement/continuous improvement skills
•	Understanding and appreciation of inventory control processes 
•	Strong Safety Management and Training Skills
•	Computer applications experience using MS office, proficient MS Excel skills
•	Excellent knowledge of ERP and WMS systems, Oracle preferred
•	Knowledge of developing and adherence to budgets
•	Experience managing all aspects of maintaining a physical warehouse, including equipment maintenance 
•	Strong Critical Thinking skills and experience exercising sound judgement at all times 
•	Independent leader while capable of being a Team player

Title: Mon-Wed+ Weekends Full Time Customer Support Representative $13/Hr
Description:
OrionClick is a successful Internet Marketing firm located in the heart of Old Town Pasadena.

We are a fun, profitable, and rapidly growing Internet Marketing company, who owns and operates many websites in different markets. We are seeking an experienced call center phone representative to work in the Customer Service department, which receives inbound support request via phone, email, and social channels. This includes handling inbound calls from customers inquiring about service/product knowledge, account details, and order discrepancies. 

There is no cold calling or sales involved. 

We offer the opportunity to grow with a profitable startup at the forefront of Internet marketing, and a fun, fast-paced work environment. This is a full-time position. 

Paid training at $13.00/hr will be provided. 

Hourly rate: $13.00 with bi-weekly pay and bonuses to those that are deemed worthy based on overall performance. 

No Health Benefits available at this time. 

3 Paid sick days and 32 hours of vacation are accrued after passing a 90 day probation period. 

Paid Parking. 

We are hiring for the following shift:

Mon, Tues, Wed - 6:00 AM to 2:30 PM

Saturday - 6:00 AM to 2:00 PM

Sunday - 7:00 AM to 2:00 PM

Thursday & Friday - OFF

--

Applicant should be willing and flexible to work overtime, weekends and holidays when required. You should have full-time availability. 

English and Spanish speakers needed. 

Reliable transportation is a must. Our call center depends on punctual and reliable employees as our lines open to a flood of customers in need of support. 

A professional demeanor and attention to detail are the two main responsibilities of the position. The successful candidate will be a highly motivated and energetic team player capable of handling a high volume of inbound calls and emails. Will research and resolve order discrepancies, review order status reports, and take appropriate action.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Handle incoming emails and calls from prospects and customers regarding services or products. 
Resolve order discrepancies over the phone or by email. 
Absorb all company's information and be able to explain it appropriately and articulately.
Listen intently; take vivid notes when necessary, and have the ability to compute people's information correctly in order to deliver appropriate solutions.

REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum of a High School Diploma required.
Must have 1-2 years in a Customer Service, Call Center, Customer Care environment or related experience.
Ability to handle multiple priorities and adapt to changing situations.
Must have excellent organizational skills and time management focus.
Must be able to work successfully within a team oriented environment.
Strong quality orientation, attention to detail and highly organized.
Strong interpersonal and troubleshooting, problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication, analytical and decision-making skills.
Strong data entry, computer skills required; Google Docs
Must have a professional appearance, demeanor, and conduct.
Adaptability/Flexibility, with the ability to react quickly to changing requirements from internal and external conditions while maintaining good communication with all parties involved.
Excellent listening skills and the ability to ask probing questions, understand concerns and overcome objections. 




Prior experience with the following programs is a plus:

LimeLight CRM
Five9 
Zendesk

Only apply if you are looking for stability, longevity and understand the importance of a call center rep. 

Serious applicants only.

Interviews are being scheduled immediately with paid training to start as early as next week. 

When submitting your cover letter and resume please add the hashtag in the subject field: #Weekend

We look forward to reviewing your resume. 

Promising candidates will be contacted via email for a schedule phone interview prior to the in-person interview in Pasadena.

Description:
POSITION: Dishwasher
STATUS: Full Time

If you are interested in applying for this position you must come in and fill out an applicaton at Kingsley Manor 1055 N Kingsley Dr. Los Angeles CA 90029. 

Front Porch is a progressive senior service system that responds to the needs of individuals within a community setting. We are a "community of communities" and the largest not-for-profit provider of retirement living and services in Southern California. Demand for the services our organization provides continues to grow vigorously with the nation's changing demographics, and the company is expanding its presence both regionally and nationally.

Kingsley Manor is a beautiful retirement community in the heart of Los Angeles. From the moment you walk inside, you'll feel the warmth and refinement of a bygone era. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Cleans and maintains work area. Transports trash and waste to disposal area.

Performs all duties in a safe and efficient manner. Wears safety equipment as required for the job. Reports any safety hazards and/or accidents to supervisor.

Follows highest standards of cleanliness.  Follows all federal, state and corporate policies, health codes and guidelines in preparation and handling of foodstuffs.

Attends all mandatory in-service meetings.  Complies with all department and facilities policies and procedures. 

Must have CA driver's license

Professional kitchen experience preferred

Must be available to work weekends 


NOTICE TO APPLICANTS
We are a drug free workplace therefore all final candidates being considered for employment must submit to and successfully complete a pre-employment drug test and physical evaluation.  This evaluation will include testing for presence for selected drugs.  Any candidate that refuses to take the pre-employment test will not be considered for employment with Kingsley Manor.

Title: Store Manager Needed!
Description:
Client Overview:
Our client is a premier technology company serving as a key player in the consumer electronic and internet industry. Their forward-thinking, innovative, and daring approach establishes them as a leader in the technology sector.  They will be opening up a retail pop-up store and need similar minded talent to support this initiative.

Position Overview:
In this role, you would be responsible for presenting exceptional customer service, driving retail sales, ensuring efficiency of staff and services, and managing daily operations at the store. You would also engage with consumers and demonstrate product and features.  Their ideal customer is a social adopter and technological advanced.

Responsibilities:
• Supervise staff to ensure efficiency and productivity; hire and retain employees; conduct employee performance reviews; maintain attendance records; plan and assign employee work schedules
• Engage with consumers to learn about their lifestyle and preferences; incorporate a customized approach and recommend products to enhance customers' daily routines
• Connect with consumers by providing a fun, extraordinary, creative, and meaningful experience and provide an informative product driven conversation
• Remain knowledgeable about emerging technology trends; champion the brand, share expertise product knowledge, and demonstrate products capabilities and features
• Greet customers, open and close the store, and maintain an organized store presentation


Key Qualifications:
• 5-7 years of retail experience with 2-3 years' related retail management experience
• Passionate about technology
• Possess strong communication, team oriented, customer service, and solution oriented skills

Rate: $29/hr

If interested, please send resume to be considered!

Title: MAINTENANCE WORKER SKILLED (Retirement Community)
Description:
non-profit organization
 POSITION:  Maintenance (Skilled)

 If interested to apply for this position you must fill out an application @ 1055 N. Kingsley Dr. Los Angeles CA 90029 

 Front Porch is a progressive senior service system that responds to the needs of individuals within a community setting. We are a "community of communities" and the largest not-for-profit provider of retirement living and services in Southern California. Demand for the services our organization provides continues to grow vigorously with the nation's changing demographics, and the company is expanding its presence both regionally and nationally.

 Kingsley Manor is a beautiful retirement community in the heart of Los Angeles. From the moment you walk inside, you'll feel the warmth and refinement of a bygone era. Our community is intimate and sophisticated -- every detail created with our residents in mind. They spend time making new friends, developing new talents, or exploring new places. Kingsley Manor is seeking to hire a Maintenance worker. 

 SUMMARY Under the direction of the Manager of Building Services and/or Director of Maintenance, installs, maintains, paints, and repairs machinery, equipment, physical structures, and pipe and electrical systems on the grounds and structures and apparatus of facilities by performing the following duties.

 ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Completes work orders and special projects as assigned by supervisor. 

Repairs and maintains physical structure of establishment.

Is competent in one or more of the following skills: plumbing, electrical, carpentry, metal fabrication and welding, boiler systems, hydraulic systems, an HVAC (heating, ventilation and air conditioning.) 

Sets up and operates machine tools such as lathe, grinder, drill; milling machines to repair or fabricate parts, fixtures, tools, mechanical equipment and other structures.
 
Performs repairs and refurbishment for resident accommodations and other structures of the facility.  Visually inspects and tests machinery and equipment and performs preventative maintenance.

Repairs and installs plumbing, gas and electric water heaters, gas furnace, and other apparatus and equipment as assigned. Dismantles defective machines and equipment and installs new or repaired parts.  Cleans and lubricates shafts, bearings, gears, and other parts of machinery.

Performs all duties in a safe and efficient manner. Wears safety equipment as required for the job. Reports any safety hazards and/or accidents to supervisor.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: Associate's degree (A. A.) or equivalent from two-year college or technical school; or six months to one year related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

NOTICE TO APPLICANTS
We are a drug free workplace therefore all final candidates being considered for employment must submit to and successfully complete a pre-employment drug test and physical evaluation.  This evaluation will include testing for presence for selected drugs.  Any candidate that refuses to take the pre-employment test will not be considered for employment with Kingsley Manor.

Title: $50 cash - Online Health Insurance Research Study (VIRTUAL)
Description:
Did you just buy health insurance through Healthcare.gov or directly through a health plan? If so, we would love to have you participate in our 15 minute online research questionnaire. This research study will help us advocate for consumers like you, as we work with health plans across the U.S. and the government to implement cost efficient plans that you can actually use.


ABOUT THE RESEARCH STUDY

We're looking for individuals who have purchased health insurance for 2017 during open enrollment. You may also qualify if you have valid health insurance and are shopping for a new plan. Here's what you need to qualify for the research study:


----> You bought insurance through your state exchange, Healthcare.gov, through a broker, or directly through a health plan like Oscar, Kaiser, Blue Cross, etc. 

----> You don't receive your health insurance through an employer.

----> You currently have this health insurance active.

----> You are not on Medicaid, Medicare or VA health insurance.

----> You don't receive your health insurance through your school/university.

If this is you - we'd love to get your opinion! We will compensate qualified participants $50 cash through your preferred payment method. Please be advised that you will need to verify that you meet the qualifications above to be a part of our research study. 

If you meet the requirements above, please begin the research study here: 

__________________________________________________________


WHO WE ARE

Joany is a national organization with a mission to make health insurance simple and transparent. We are advocates for consumers, and experts in the health care industry, aiming to help consumers buy insurance they can actually use. Using data + predictive modeling, we have aggregated every single health plan offered across the U.S. into our web platform. Consumers can now shop for insurance without bouncing around website to website. Most importantly, we do the number crunching and analysis equivalent to 10 healthcare & finance experts in the background so you can receive a truly unbiased recommendation of the best plan for you. Since we are consumer advocates, our service is free to consumers. To learn more about us, please visit

Description:

•	Answering phones, reading and returning emails

Title: Urgent Care Physician- Full Time or Part Time
Description:
Our Woodland Hills Urgent Care is currently seeking a physician for a unique opportunity within our state of the art Urgent Care facility. We are seeking full-time physicians with family medicine, internal medicine, occupational medicine, urgent care, and/or emergency medicine experience. We also will consider part-time schedules for the right candidate.

Our Urgent & Family Care will provide episodic care for illnesses and injuries for patients of all ages. Physicians will be supported by our Chief Medical Officer with years of urgent and emergency medicine experience.

 This is an opportunity for professional growth in an environment focused on serving the community.
 We understand that creating a positive patient experience begins with ensuring that the physicians and staff feel they are in an environment where they have a voice and the ability to make a difference.

 Competitive hourly compensation· Bonus Program.  An opportunity to participate in the evolution of medicine

Excellent customer service and an exceptional patient experience is the essence of the organization and largely driven by the leadership of the medical provider(s). Extremely competitive compensation model .

EDUCATION: Graduate of an accredited allopathic or osteopathic school of medicine. A degree as a Medical Doctor or Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine, licensed to practice within the state where the care is being rendered.

EXPERIENCE: 2 years of  urgent care, or emergency medicine experience is strongly preferred.

LICENSE/CERT/REG: Active license to practice medicine in the appropriate state where care is to be rendered. BC/BE in one of the following areas: Family Medicine, Internal Medicine, Emergency Medicine, Occupational Medicine or Urgent Care.

Title: RN Home Health - Inland Empire
Description:
We are hiring in our West Covina  Branch  We are #2 in the State of California!

Assisted is one of the leading providers of home health services with multiple locations in Southern California and Arizona.

Throughout the years, the Assisted care team has offered high quality, compassionate hospice services to patients and their loved ones. Financially and strategically, we are positioned to be a key player in the industry for the years to come.

Assisted has earned a Home Health & Hospice Elite Status several years in a row -- come and join an elite team of hospice professionals! 

As an RN, Registered Nurse Home Health you will:
•	Have flexible hours and working close to home (reduce your commute!)
•	Have an opportunity to earn over a $100,000/ year!
•	Complete initial and on-going comprehensive assessments of the patient's needs
•	Provide service and /or treatments requiring substantial and specialized nursing skills
•	Initiate appropriate preventative and rehabilitative nursing procedures
•	Counsel, support and instruct the patient, family and caregiver in meeting nursing and related needs
•	Support the patient's and family's cultural beliefs
•	Perform duties consistent with the Nursing Practice Act including the Standards of Competent Performance.
•	Participates in the On-Call rotation and as requested
•	Additional list of duties and responsibilities is provided in the Job Description
Qualifications:
•	Current, active RN License in the State of California by the Board of Registered Nursing.
•	Current CPR, health clearance and clinical skills self-assessment.
•	Minimum of one year of professional nursing experience within the last 3 years.

Title: Litigation Secretary for Downtown LA- $70,000-$83,000
Description:
Successful regional law firm is seeking an experienced litigation secretary for their growing Downtown LA office. This is a newly created position due to growth and their office is continuing to expand! The desk supports four attorneys who are all self-sufficient and pleasant to work for. The office is in a beautiful building that's near a subway stop where you will have tons of access to restaurants and shopping! The office has a collegial environment and big firm resources. *Please note, this is a boutique branch office that has nine attorneys, one litigation secretary, one paralegal, one office services clerk and one HR/Office Manager.* You would be one of two legal secretaries in this office location.

Essential Job Duties
·     Prepares and revises legal documents, pleadings, discovery, correspondence, memoranda and e-mails
·     Calendar court dates
·     Assembles documents and exhibits for court filings
·     Handles E-filings with State, Federal and Appellate courts
·     Proofreads documents, schedules appointments and meetings for attorneys
·     Manages and maintains attorney's calendar and the master calendar for deadlines
·     Arranges for travel for attorneys

Requirements
·     8+ years of litigation experience
·     MUST KNOW how to docket court dates
·     Must understand the litigation process from beginning to end
·     Proficiency MS Office Suite 

Additional information:

Software: Filesite, TABS (time entry), Compulaw (docketing)

Benefits: Medical PPO & HMO options, Dental, Vision, 20 days of PTO, 9 paid holidays, 401k matching up to 4%, discretionary profit sharing, STD, LTD, life insurance, and $130 transportation allowance for LA staff. 

*Candidates with prior big firm experience are highly desired!*

Title: Accounts Receivable Coordinator
Description:
DigiStream Los Angeles, Inc.
Position: Accounts Receivable Coordinator (Full-time)
Office Location: Torrance, CA

Starting Hourly Pay Range: $14.00 - $16.00 /hour
Employee Benefits: Health, Dental, Vision, Life insurance, and 401(k) retirement plan with 4% Company Match offered.

Summary:
Technology-centric private investigations firm seeks a full-time Accounts Receivable Coordinator to work locally in our Torrance office. The primary purpose of this position is to make accounts receivable calls and/or correspondence in a fast paced, goal-oriented role. In this capacity, the Accounts Receivable Coordinator will be accountable for reducing delinquency for assigned accounts. Strong customer service skills and professionalism with clients in particular is required for this position.

Specific Duties and Responsibilities:
• Providing customer service regarding collection issues, process customer refunds, process and review account adjustments, resolve client discrepancies and short payments. Responsible for monitoring and maintaining assigned accounts- Customer calls, account adjustments, small balance write off, customer reconciliations and processing credit memos.
• Accountable for reducing delinquency for assigned accounts.
• Perform other assigned tasks and duties necessary to support the Accounts Receivable Dept.
• Enlist the efforts of sales and senior management when necessary to accelerate the collection process.
• Must communicate & follow up effectively with manager on a timely basis.
• Establish and maintain effective and cooperative working relationships
• Other duties as may be assigned from time to time.

Essential Functions:
• Weekly and monthly reporting to direct supervisor
• Monthly delinquency notices
• Processing monthly credit memos and the appropriate reporting
• High-volume phone calls to assigned delinquent customers
• Reconcile customer disputes as they pertain to payment of outstanding balances that are due
• Provide excellent & considerate customer service to dealers and sales
• Internal and External customer interface
• Participate in team planning meetings
• Meet defined department goals and activity metrics

Minimum Qualifications:
• 1-3 years professional experience in an office or administrative setting preferred
• Knowledge of billing and collections procedures
• Accounts Receivable knowledge/experience a plus
• Retail experience a plus
• Strong attention to detail, goal-oriented
• Commitment to excellent customer service
• Excellent written and verbal communication abilities
• Ability to prioritize and manage multiple responsibilities

No phone calls please. No resumes accepted at this time, only Employment Applications.

Please fill out our online application at:

www.digistream.com/Company-Info/Employment-Opportunities/Personal-Information
