Title: Outgoing and Friendly Admin Assistant and Customer Service Wanted!
Description:
If You Have A Great Attitude, A Passion for Learning New Things, and 
A Few Basic Skills, We Have a $11-15/hr, Fast-Paced, and Fulfilling Job 
Opportunity Just for You! 
From: Irma Sandoval, Founder & CEO 

Dear Prospective Team Member, 
Thanks for taking the time to visit this site! You should have arrived here because you saw our job posting and decided to take action! It's our hope that you are exactly the person we are looking for so we can take this page down immediately and offer you the fun and rewarding position we have available. 
So, let me tell you about me, my company, and the job itself. 

My name is Irma Sandoval and I run three fitness facilities located in the West La mid-city area. 
Our business is dedicated to helping women and men achieve their health, fitness, and performance goals through customized fitness and nutrition programs.  

We're looking for an enthusiastic, motivated, hard working, and energetic person to help handle our office work operations.  

We have  one location in 8885 Venice Blvd 203 La CA 90034

We currently offer semi-private, small group, and large group fitness and nutrition programs which motivate, educate, and support men, women, and teens to improve their health, fitness, and performance. All clients start with a minimum initial 2 week Fast Start program which includes: nutrition counseling, fitness and mobility testing, body composition analysis, and weekly training sessions. 

If you are accepted for this position, you will be working M-F (some Saturdays) during our business hours at a rate of $11 per hour for the first 90 days. Continued employment and compensation will be based on performance and job scope.  Hours TBD. 

Tasks We Need You To Perform 
  
Making Great First Impressions: In many cases, you will be the first person a customer, potential customer, or visitor interacts with. Whether you are answering the door, replying to emails or answering and returning phone calls, you'll be responsible for making sure everyone gets the information they need and feel taken care of from the moment they first interact with you. 

Answering and returning phone calls from customers and prospects: You will be the first point of contact for all prospective clients and customers. Also, when you're not here to answer the phone, many of the calls will go to voicemail. You'll be responsible for returning those calls the next day.  
Responding to customer service phone calls and emails: We get quite a few phone calls and email every day. I am very big on customer service. You will need to respond to each of these within 24 hours or next business day with basic information that we'll provide to you. So you must be comfortable with the phone, using email, and be a good typist.  
Filing: Basic stuff to keep up with the paper flow.  
Client and Trainer Scheduling: You will be in charge of updating any changes on a client's and trainer's schedule on a daily basis into our company software.  
Required Skills 

These are the skills you must already have in order to qualify for this position: 
  
A "Stewardship Mentality": You will be taking care of our customers and prospective customers. They are all VERY important, so you must be comfortable conversing on the phone, in person, and through email.  You must be relentless in finding solutions for them. We'll teach you the basics of what to say and do, but we can't teach you how to have a great attitude and a strong desire to help people. 
Microsoft Word: You must be very comfortable using Word  
Microsoft Excel: You must have basic Excel skills - you won't have to do anything advance with this software, just some simple spreadsheets, but you must be comfortable doing what we need you to do.  
Good Phone Personality/Etiquette: You will be talking with our clients and customers, who are VERY important to us, and prospective customers, who are also important! You must be comfortable conversing on the phone, in person, and through email. You must know how to conduct yourself professionally, take clear messages, and deliver clear instructions to the prospect or client. We'll teach you everything you need to say and do, but we can't teach you manners and professionalism.  
Customer Service and People Skills: You must have a natural ability or "servant hood" mentality, positive attitude, and have impeccable people skills.  
Email: A great deal of your work will be via email. We use a web-based program that's easy to learn (you'll understand it within 30 minutes). You must be very comfortable and proficient with email.  
Thoughtfulness and Organization: We need you to be able to think for yourself and be organized. I am very serious about this one! I do not want a robot, I want someone who learns and grows with our company.  
Attention to Detail: This is a must! You will need to catch the little things from scheduling, to wording, numbers, cleaning, etc. 
Flexibility: We are a small business and as such things change very fast.  So we need someone that can adapt to change on the fly.  
Bonus Skills  
If you have these additional skills, your resume will go right to the top of the stack (but if you don't have these skills, you should still apply because these are not mandatory). 
Adobe Creative Suite/Graphic Design: We publish a monthly newsletter and special announcement flyers in publisher, and you'll need to be able to go in and make edits/changes to the file when necessary and get it ready to print  
Mindbody and Photoshop a huge plus
Editing and Cropping Pictures: We take before and after photos to be used as social proof and testimonials for our company. 

How To Apply 
  
We're looking to hire the right person as soon as possible for the WL- Mid-city locations and mainly from 12pm - 8 pm, with some weekends. So if this job sounds good to you, follow these instructions now. 

Here's what I want from you. NOTE: Failure to follow these instructions will result in your resume going in the circular file. This is your first test, okay? 
Write a resume that includes your education, ALL prior work experience (yes, we even want to know if you mowed lawns when you were 14), and any skills you have. It should be 1 or 2 pages in length, but no longer. 
Write me a 100-250 word (we will count) cover letter explaining why you are the perfect person to fill this position. Include full contact information (name, address, phone, email) on this cover letter.  Also include our core value of Delivering Fun in the first paragraph of this letter (explain how you have delivered fun in past positions or how you will with our organization). 
On a separate sheet of paper list at least three references with phone numbers and what your relationship is with the references (i.e. - previous employer, college professor, etc). 
Put the cover letter on top of your resume and the reference sheet underneath your resume, staple together in the top left corner. 
Send resume to by forwarding it to this post for fast reponse!
Mail to: Attention Future Fitness family, Fitness Transformation Academy LLC 8885 Venice Blvd 203 La CA 90034
You can also respond to this post and forward it but you must provide it in a Word/PDF document and it must be in the same format as listed above.  The subject line for the email must be "I want to Bring It!" 
Do not call and do not drop off your resume! 
I will review your resume. If we feel you're a good prospect, we'll call or email you to set up a personal interview. 

The sooner we get your resume, the better. This will not be a long, drawn out process. I believe in taking action quickly. So get your resume over to me pronto! I look forward to reviewing it and hopefully meeting you personally. 

Again, thanks very much for your interest.  

Yours in Health, 
Irma Sandoval

Title: Sales / Designer
Description:
Do you love helping people get organized?
Does your closet look like one of our ads?
Do you like to organize your friends and family for fun? 

If you answered YES! ...then this job is for you.

We offer the following: 
* No Cold Calling! 
* Paid Training 
* New and existing client appointments
* Excellent marketing materials 
* Work from home 
* Flexible schedule, full time work 

We are looking for people who have: 

* Great people skills 
* Fun and outgoing personalities

Title: Executive Assistant/Resource Coordinator
Description:
PRIMARY FUNCTION:	
Provides a broad range of administrative support to the Chief Executive Officer and act as liaison with all levels of internal management, staff, business partners, clients and vendors exercising strict levels of confidentiality and discretion.     

KEY ROLES (Essential Job Responsibilities):

1.Office Management
•Provides direct administrative support to the President/CEO.
•Plans, schedules and organizes complex assignments including Executive Board, staff and special meetings, travel and 
 conference arrangements, social and business functions and events and other department activities. 
• Assist with all aspects of administrative management, logistics, and services.
•Ensure that the administrative office maintains a fresh, welcoming, clean and professional appearance for visitors, guests and staff through proper maintenance of reception area, conference room, and that supply levels and equipment are maintained, organized and functional for staff. 
•Assists/supports all resource development functions, to include stewardship and special events. 
•Documents all financial donations in Excel and Salesforce and coordinate information with Development and Finance Departments.
•Document all in-kind donations in Salesforce and coordinate with Programs Department for distribution.    
•Coordinating with Development Director prepares and mails all acknowledgements, thank you letters and receipts. 

2.Communication Liaison
•Manage the flow of information as directed by the CEO to Board members, leadership team, staff, guests, visitors.  
•Screen phone calls, open, sort summarize mail, reports and memos and directs to appropriate area.  
•Draft and edit general and specific correspondence, reports, charts, tables and assembles highly confidential and sensitive information.  
•Acts as a liaison with other departments and outside agencies.  

3.Records Management
•Develop and manage electronic and paper filing systems and documentation to ensure accuracy, easy retrieval and ensure that the Club is in compliance with applicable record-keeping requirements.   
 
4.Project Management
•Works independently and within teams on special nonrecurring and ongoing projects.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
5.All other related duties as assigned.

RELATIONSHIPS:
Internal:   Maintain excellent rapport with supervisor, staff, colleagues, volunteers, community members and others for the purpose of exchange of information.

REQUIRED:
Education, Training, and Experience
•Any combination of education, training, and/or experience equivalent to the completion of a
Bachelor's degree with a concentration in Business, Management, Communications or 
similar fields of study.  

Related Work Experience
•5 - 7 years of professional and progressive work experience in a similar position and environment.

Skill / Knowledge / Abilities 
•Ability to establish and maintain cooperative relationships with those contacted in the course of work and able to respond to sensitive matters and/or situations with discretion, tact, and diplomacy.
•Knowledge and demonstrated use of good communication (oral and written) and organizational skills.
•Ability to work independently or in collaboration with others on assignments and exercise good judgement in prioritizing and meeting deadlines with minimal direction.  
•Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, mail merges, email, web searches tools and other technology products and resources.  
•Ability to develop and manage  projects and budgets and effectively manage timelines and monitor expenditures. 
•Skill and ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with Club staff, Board members, volunteers, community groups, business partners and other related agencies on behalf of the President/CEO.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/WORK ENVIRONMENT:

•	Regularly sits at a computer station and operates electronic equipment.
•	Frequently lifts, carries and positions objects weighing up to 30 pounds when moving supplies. 
•	Typically stands, bends, stoops and crouches.
•	Regularly moves about the facility to coordinate work.

Title: VIP BOTTLE SERVICE MODEL/ COCKTAIL SERVER
Description:
Position Overview:

The primary responsibility of the Model / Bottle Service / Cocktail Server is to provide an engaging, sophisticated guest service experience in a nightlife venue. This position will provide beverage service including the upsell of bottles and VIP services. All duties are to be performed in accordance within the venue's policies, practices, and procedures.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

Key Responsibilities
o Takes and delivers accurate drink orders to the guests in a timely manner with a positive attitude
o Provides information to venue guests regarding available beer, wine and premium spirits
o Upsell of Bottles, Beverages and VIP Services to venue guests
o Maintains active social media accounts to promote the venue
o Communicates with management and other staff to rectify any and all guests' needs, comments or incidents
o Handles cash and credit transactions accurately and efficiently
o Consistently maintains a professional, neat and well-groomed appearance, posture and hygiene adhering to company appearance standards and the theme of the venue
o Attend all required training sessions


Minimum Qualifications:
21+ years of age, proof of authorization/eligibility to work in the United States
High School Diploma or equivalent 
Two (2) or more years of recent (within the last 5 years) experience providing bottle service and upselling VIP Services 
Ability to communicate effectively in spoken and written English
Recent knowledge and terminology of beer, wine, and spirits. Must be familiar with domestic and import beers, different types of wine, premium and brand name spirits and champagne, garnishes and beverage presentations
Interpersonal skills with focused attention to guest needs
Must work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays
Must be able to work in a fast-paced, busy, and engaging environment while providing unmatched guest service
Maintain clean and organized work stations.

Physical Requirements:
Must have the physical ability to maneuver in crowded areas carrying a tray unassisted
Must be able to withstand prolonged standing, stretching, bending and kneeling without restriction, work indoors and be exposed to various environmental factors such as, but not limited to fatigue, loud noise, and or music
Must be able to stand or walk an eight hour shift wearing high heels
Must be able to carry or lift service trays of up to 15 pounds, unassisted, in the performance of specific tasks assigned.


Please send headshot and full body shot, including your resume.

Title: RN Supervisor
Description:
Assisted Healthcare Services of West Covina is currently seeking an RN Supervisor for our Home Healthcare division.

Are you looking to join a fabulous team in healthcare, have excellent benefits with an upward mobility opportunity?  Apply today or call our local office for details.

As an RN, Registered Nurse Clinical Supervisor you will:

Develops and implements a comprehensive plan of care including preventative and rehabilitative nursing procedures where appropriate in accordance with MD orders. Identifies problems and establishes measurable goals
Coordinates the plan of care with members of the care provider team and other agencies providing nursing or related services to provide continuity of care and to implement a comprehensive plan of care. 

Performs on-going case management/supervisory visits according to patient's needs as ordered by the physician, policy and state regulations to ensure adherence to the plan of care
Supervises patient care provided by licensed vocational nurses and paraprofessionals.  This supervision includes direct and indirect monitoring of private duty personnel interactions with patients, families, and physicians. 

Coordinates obtaining medical supplies and equipment for patients as needed. Provides instruction to private duty personnel and other care providers on the proper use and maintenance of equipment and medical supplies appropriate for care. 

Provides consultation with and education of the client and family regarding the disease process, self-care techniques and disease prevention strategies, as appropriate
Provides leadership, the application of new knowledge, and encourages staff motivation.  Acts as a resource for patient, families and private duty personnel
Participates in the On-Call rotation and as requested
Additional list of duties and responsibilities is provided in the Job Description

Qualifications:
Licensed in the State of California by the Board of Registered Nursing. 
Current CPR card, health clearance and clinical skills self-assessment
Minimum of two years of professional nursing experience.
Minimum of two years of experience as a clinical supervisor or charge nurse in a hospital or home healthcare, SNF facility, homecare setting.

Job Key Words: Nursing, RN, Registered Nurse, nursing, home care, homecare, home health, private duty nursing, hospice, palliative care

Title: EP & LP - Restaurant Server
Description:
EP Restaurant is looking for a full-time Server for immediate hire. We are looking for a candidate who is available Friday, Saturday, and Sunday in addition to one or two weekdays.

Job responsibilities:

o Servers must ensure that family meal is cleared and stored, tables and counter are set and
detailed perfectly. All water glasses must be checked and hand polished and arrangement of
table settings must be detailed before the EP pre-shift meeting at 5:30pm.
o Greeting guests in a timely fashion ascertaining water preference. 
o Informing all guests of daily specials and guiding the guest through the best way to order.
Showcasing items in all categories that are best for overall dining experience. This
requires full knowledge of current a la carte dinner menu, chef's menu, dessert menu and
focused attention on common allergens (i.e. shellfish, fish, poultry, pork, dairy, eggs, peanuts,
treenuts, soy, gluten)
o Communicating with the Chef about allergies, special requests and pacing of our restaurant
guests.
o Highlighting the bar craft cocktail program, specialty cocktail menu, wines BTG, aperitifs and
digestifs. Refer to the beverage director or sommelier for recommendations.
o Ensure that guest orders are entered in correctly, with restrictions, coursing and positions
accurately entered.
o Ensuring that food arrives in a timely fashion, while doing guest checks and upselling of cocktails
and beverages. There shouldn't be any empty glassware on the table, unless specified upon
guest request.
o Ensuring that desserts, after dinner drinks and or coffee/tea service has been offered to
complete the dining experience.
o Ensure that payment has been ascertained and paid in full before guest departure.
Secondary functions:
o Setting and detailing tables before and throughout service. Polishing silver, glassware, making
rollups.
o Aiding and communicating job tasks to the EP backwaiters.

Please submit your resume as a Word document. Thank you.

Title: Youth Development Professional
Description:
PRIMARY FUNCTION:
Responsible for providing mentorship and engage youth members in activities and programs, which enables them to develop self confidence and reach their full potential as responsible, caring citizens. Directs the planning and implementation of National Club Programs and Local Initiative Activities that will leave a positive impact on youth members, while maintain a positive, safe environment and atmosphere at all times.

LEADERSHIP
•Develop commitment from members to ensure active participation in Programs and Activities.
•Empower members to be leaders through positive role modeling.
•Facilitate National Program sessions and Local Initiative Activities in the following Skills, The Art, and Sports, Fitness, & Recreation.
•Provide recognition to members through positive validations, healthy incentives, and affirmation on a regular basis.
•Team Building mentality is exemplified in all work done.
•Positively influence and uplift members and other affiliates.
•Ensure productive and effective performance by all program staff and volunteers.

MANAGE & DEVELOP RESOURCES
•Monthly program planning is required to ensure preparation and successful programs and activities.
•Attend and participate in Staff Training, which is essential to professional development.
•Follow all policies and procedure at all times, including the Club's Code of Conduct, which can be found in the Staff Manual.

COMMUNICATION
•Must be able to inform important and relevant information in Staff Meetings and to members, parents, co-workers, Branch Director/Supervisor, VP of Operations and other Boys & Girls Club affiliates.
•Must be able to listen to co-workers, parents, youth members and community and other Boys & Girls Club affiliates.
•Must be able to present important and relevant information and/or presentations through program facilitation, staff meetings or training, and/or other Boys & Girls Club events.
•Must be able to write and compose clear, concise, accurate written documentation and data reports.

SUPERVISION & SAFETY
•Must be able to supervise youth members during program time.
•Provide sound and reasonable discipline of youth members at necessary times through written documentation (i.e. write-up), and/ or parent phone call.
•Practice and constantly be aware of safe practices like Crisis Management, Emergency Preparedness, CPR and First Aid, etc.
•Maintain a clean and orderly work space at all times.

SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE:
•Must be at least 18 years of age and have valid identification.
•Work experience with Boys & Girls Club of other youth serving organization.
•Ability to organize, supervise, and discipline youth members.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/WORK ENVIRONMENT:
•Maintain a high energy level.
•Be comfortable performing multi-faceted projects in conjunction with day-to-day activities.
•Speak clearly and hear normal conversations as well as out of the ordinary noises.
•Sit or stand for four plus hours per day.
•Stoop, bend, climb and walk frequently.
•Lift up to 40 pounds.

Title: High School Math Tutor
Description:
High School Math Tutor at Sylvan Learning Center

Sylvan Learning is the industry leader in providing supplemental education to children in pre-kindergarten through 12th grade. With nearly 30 successful years in the business, we guarantee positive educational results every step of the way. Our passionate instructors are certified, and our expert approach is personal and prescriptive, with each individual child's needs in mind.

Our talented employees experience daily the impact they make. We're an organization that prides itself in instilling knowledge and confidence in each customer we benefit! Join us, and be inspired!

**We are currently looking for teachers to teach our HS Math courses (Algebra through Calculus), We are looking for teachers who are available beginning at 3:00 in the afternoon on weekdays, and also available some weekends.**

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Why did you first decide to become a Teacher? At Sylvan, we remember why.

As an Instructor at Sylvan, your primary responsibilities are:
Just Teaching. No Lesson Plans. No Preparation.

As a part-time Sylvan Instructor, you will be trained on the Sylvan curriculum and given the tools to teach in a small group, 3:1 setting. We offer instruction in Reading, Writing, Math, Study Skills, SAT/ACT prep and State exams to students of all levels. (Again, we are currently looking specifically for High School Math and Science teachers/tutors).

As a part-time Instructor you will need to be available 5-20 hours week, between the hours of 3:30-7:30 Monday-Friday, and a few Saturdays and/or Sundays a month.
If you aspire to inspire, then we want you on our team.

As a successful Instructor, you will:
Deliver Quality Education:
Teach using Sylvan based programs
Supervise, interact with and motivate students during instruction hour while they work with equipment and materials
Reward students for completed assignments
Evaluate and document student progress
Communicate student needs to the center manager

Inspire Students:
Develop rapport with students and establishes a fun learning environment
Maintain a positive attitude and demonstrate enthusiasm for teaching and Sylvan

We require:
Bachelor's degree
Minimum 1 year of teaching or tutoring experience High School Math/Science topics


If you want to be a part of an inspired organization that believes in fostering knowledge and confidence in children, improving the lives of thousands of families every day - apply today, and don't let this opportunity pass you by! Please submit resume and cover letter to the email address listed above.

 Ensuring that all employees are following company policies and procedures as specified

Title: Looking for an experienced SCREEN PRINTER! (Part Time Only)
Description:

Title: WORK WITH SPECIAL NEEDS CHILDREN*WE PROVIDE TRAINING
Description:
CARE is a group of compassionate, intelligent and giving professionals passionate about maximizing individual potential. CARE serves multiple populations, from newborns birth to adult, with a variety of services. We are dedicated to providing quality services to families, schools, and communities. We utilize the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis. We are a cohesive team of supportive professionals who love being in service and know and value the importance of integrity, excellence, and building trust.

 Seeking to make a difference?

 Here is your opportunity! We are seeking a BEHAVIOR THERAPISTS , we provide Training!

 As a Behavioral Therapist, you get to be in service to a unique population, full of undiscovered potential and help coaxes out their best. You will be there to help through the challenges of change and celebrate the milestones. You will be responsible for implementing individual programs as written or advised by the Behavior Supervisor/Clinical Team. Please note, all positions for BEHAVIOR THERAPISTS are PART-TIME

 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Essential Duties and Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:
•Working with individual during one-on-one instruction
•Collecting data and maintaining documentation for the assigned individual
•Adhering to all agency policies and procedures; act as a member of the Interdisciplinary Team
•Treating students with respect and dignity
•Communicating effectively with all agency personnel
•Providing direct instruction to the students; working cooperatively with clients and families
•Following behavioral programs
•Completing data forms as required; graph data accurately using forms provided
•Collecting all required paperwork in a timely and accurate manner
•Meeting with all appropriate staff as necessary
•Providing documentation on progress for reviews and meetings
•Acting as a role model for clients
•Willingness to accept reassignment as required

 CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:
•A passion for service and CARE's mission
•Completion of a Bachelor's degree
•,Ability to pass background/fingerprint clearance, and provide/obtain TB clearance
•Reliable transportation, proof of valid California driver's license, safe driving record, proper auto insurance

Title: Warehouse Associate
Description:
Position Title: Warehouse Associate
Location: Vernon, CA
Job Type: Full Time

Position Overview:
The Warehouse Associate is responsible for movement, storage, documentation, and inventory of incoming and outgoing product. 

Responsibilities:
• Responsible for movement, storage, documentation, and inventory of incoming and outgoing product. This includes operating a forklift, moving material from various locations, loading and unloading vehicles. 
• May do high stacking and is expected to perform with a high degree of speed, accuracy, and safety.
• Will be required to use proprietary system and scanning equipment to maintain inventory counts and record inventory transactions as required. 
• Performs inventory functions as necessary. 
• May on occasion work in the following roles: 
- Supports the generalist concept by performing various sanitation duties, maintenance, housekeeping and other functions as assigned.
- May perform general laborer work on seasonal basis.
• Responsible for completing various documents and reports including daily lift sheet. 
• Performs other duties and responsibilities as required or assigned by supervisor.

Required Minimum Qualifications: 
• 1 year prior forklift driver experience preferred. Must be a licensed forklift driver and/or be able to pass a certification course.
• Position requires excellent communication skills and a basic understanding of machine operations. Must be able to climb up and down ladders and catwalks. 
• Must be able to identify and solve problems independently, coordinate workflow and meet output standards. 
• Must be able to work overtime and weekends as necessary.
• Position requires the ability to work in noisy areas with exposure to heat, cold, and movement of vehicles. 
• Daily lifting and carrying requirements of this position: lifting and carrying up to 50lbs. 

Additional Preferred Qualifications:
Prior forklift driver in a warehouse environment.
OSHA Forklift Operator certificate preferred.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office a plus.

Educational Requirements:
High School Diploma or equivalent.


Young International Trading promotes a safe and healthy work environment, and in doing so, we will perform background and drug tests for each candidate who accepts a position with our team.

Title: Guest Relations Representative (Full-time and Part Time)
Description:
Job Duties:

* Greet, register, and assign rooms to guest.
* Verify customers Identification and establish how the customer will pay for the accommodation.
* Keep records of room availability and guests' accounts, manually and through the computer system.
* Work with housekeeping and/or maintenance staff when guests report problems and when rooms have been vacated and need cleaning or servicing.
* Make, confirm and enter reservation into the system and ensure all reservations are placed in the correct area.
* Perform bookkeeping activities, such as balancing accounts and conducting nightly audits.
* Record guest comments or complaints, referring customers to managers as necessary.
* Assist guess with questions on the hotel, surrounding areas, directions and recommendations on where to shop, dine and tourist areas.
*Review accounts and charges with guest during the check out process.
* Transmit and receive messages, using telephone switchboards.
* Clean (dust and mop) the lobby and restocking supplies.
* Setting up food services such as coffee or breakfast.
* Provides EXCELLENT customer service.

Skills:

* Must have aggressive hospitality skills;
* Smile, greet and speak to the every guest as they are valued.
* Anticipated guest needs and be flexible in responding to them
* Be knowledgeable about the hotel, the surrounding areas.
* Be able to take ownership of guest issues and resolve them in a timely manner.
* Must be a self-starter
* Ensure uniform is followed and you are well groomed.
* Be flexible on what needs to be done.
 
Must have availability to work flexible shifts; You will be given a normal time slot but we may need you to work a different shift depending on needs. Full-time shifts are scheduled Monday through Sunday and will be 11pm-7am, 7am-3pm or 3pm-11pm. Weekend shifts are mandatory. Must have the flexibility to fill in shifts as needed. Must have dependable transportation and valid credentials to work in the United States.

Title: MIBC Instructor/MAA Instructor- AM Class
Description:
Become an Education Leader and join our team of dedicated Professionals.

North-West College is part of a stable and growing system of seven campuses in California and Nevada which is a leader in Medical Career Training since 1966.Our everyday mission is to train students in short term programs for gainful employment.

POSITION : Medical Insurance Biller and Coder Instructor/Medical Administrative Assistant Instructor

Go to website for opportunities: 

LOCATION AVAILABLE : Van Nuys

PART TIME Monday through Thursday, 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. class

POSITION SUMMARY :

Plans, teaches, directs, and supervises all student learning experiences in the classroom, skills lab, and clinical areas, following the curriculum of the school approved by the Accreditation Bureau.

RESPONSIBILITY:

This is a faculty position directly reporting to the Campus Director

PERSONAL:

Willingness to provide a professional role model for students Ability to work effectively with others. Demonstrates pleasant and effective verbal and written communication. Demonstrates integrity and progressive self-improvement.

FUNCTIONS:

Teaches and implements the total curriculum, as assigned by, and under the direction and supervision of your direct supervisor.
Plans and assigns student activities in the classroom and/or clinical settings. Is instrumental in identifying individual and collective learning needs of assigned students, being cognizant of the physical, mental and emotional status of the learners.
Maintains records of student progress and performance, attendance and grades.
Prepares, administers, and grades, written and practical examinations during course of study.
Devises written lesson plans and implements them through lecture, demonstration, discussion, etc.
Discusses with students their concerns and/or problems directly or indirectly related to learning experience.
Participates in regularly scheduled meetings with Program Director or her designee.
Is responsible to assist the student to develop an understanding of values, attitudes, and ideals appropriate to the health care profession. Participates in the selection and preparation of instructional materials.
Provides a professional role model for students.
REQUIREMENTS AND EDUCATION :

3 years experience in the field as a MIBC
3 years experience in the field as a MA
High School Diploma
MIBC Certification
MA Certification
New Program Starting 09/05/2017

Title: Busy Family Law Firm seeking motivated 1st/2nd year Associate Attorney
Description:
Busy boutique Family Law Firm seeking a highly motivated 1st/2nd year Associate Attorney hungry for experience. 

This is an excellent opportunity for a new attorney looking to advance in a small but rapidly expanding law firm. Ideal candidate will have family law experience drafting and preparing Requests for Orders and other family law forms, Trial Briefs, propounding and responding to discovery, meeting with clients, making court appearances for Requests for Orders, Restraining Orders, Trial Setting Conferences, attending depositions and settlement conferences, and drafting correspondence to the court and opposing counsel. Title: Team Supervisor (Youth Residential Campus)
Description:
We are looking for a qualified Team Supervisor to supervise the Team Leaders and to assist with the supervision of Team Support Workers and the day to day campus activities. Duties include: As a member of the Treatment Team, assists in the planning and implementation of treatment program for the clients in accordance with the approved treatment model. Maintains the working files on the clients under his/her supervision, which includes quarterly reports and other correspondence as necessary to ensure a complete, accurate, and up-to-date record of each client in accordance with the standards of the California Administrative Code, Title 22. Responsible for scheduling medical treatment, clothing purchases, visiting privileges, phone calls, and such other contacts with persons outside the Trinity program. The Team Supervisor plans off ground trips in cooperation with the Recreation Coordinator; acts as a liaison between the clients and the teachers at the school on matters concerning the individual performance and educational progress of each client; and acts as a liaison between each child and his/her parents, members of the immediate family, and/or Probation Officer. Skills/Requirements: A High school diploma or GED required, in addition to one or more of the following; Bachelor's Degree in the Social Sciences or Child Development, or 1) previous employment as a staff or service as a volunteer at a group home, STRTP, or substance abuse treatment program for at least one year; 2) lived experience in the child welfare, mental health, juvenile justice, or developmental disabilities system as a consumer or caregiver; 3) have at least one hundred (100) hours of relevant experience working with youth as a mentor, athletic coach, teacher, vocational coach, tutor, counselor. Experience working in a facility/program similar to Trinity or one involved with the counseling, education, or recreation of youth is preferred. Must be at least 21 years of age or older, able to pass a physical examination; drug clearance; criminal background check; Child Abuse Index check. Must hold a valid California driver's license with clean DMV history, be able to safely operate a motor vehicle and be insurable by Trinity's insurance carrier. Must have a special interest in working with youth and must fulfill the general requirements as established in the California Administrative Code, Title 22. Be able to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing in English. Writing, verbal skills, and the ability to compose quality reports and other necessary correspondence are essential. Bilingual is a plus. Pay range between $13.78 to $15.30 per hour; depending on experience and education. 

Our mission is to help children and families create a better future. Our vision is to be the first choice in providing quality care for children, youth and families. Make a difference in the life of a child, join the Trinity team!

Founded in 1966, Trinity is a premier provider of programs and services to children and families throughout the United States. We seek team members with a genuine commitment to the empowerment of at-risk children and their families, and a willingness to work in a highly demanding, fast paced environment, which requires dedication and a desire to provide positive role models for the youth in our care. The agency is in the process of implementing Trauma Informed Care (TIC) as the primary, daily practice model for working with clients. Our commitment to each of our clients, and their families, is to provide them with the knowledge, tools and skills to cope with their trauma in a manner that enables them to create positive, lasting relationships at home and in the community and to behave responsibly and reasonably in daily situations.

Title: Server with Fine Dining Experience (432 N Fairfax)

It is the primary responsibility of the Server to be the voice of the kitchen while providing courteous and prompt tableside service to all guests. Must be able to describe all dishes brought to the dining room in a detailed manner and answer pertinent questions. 

This is not your typical "Fine Dining" restaurant. We are a venue that has the potential for every night of the week to be programmed differently. The main consistent factor is the quality of our food and the service in which we provide.

Audio Video Inside Sales / Warehouse Position
Description:
We're a manufacturer located near UCLA and are growing extremely fast. We're looking for an audio video sales / customer service person who's detail oriented and has great communication skills. The job breaks down as follows:

45% Inside Sales / Customer Service for our Will-Call customers
45% Warehouse work
10% Other general office help

We're looking for someone who's great with customers but can also handle the physical work of a warehouse. Our company has an aggressive business style suited for "A-Level Players" only. Knowledge and experience in the Custom Audio Video market and / or wire and cable is pretty much a must. Without it, you'll be considered but behind. Customer service experience is also a must as are strong personal skills. You will learn a TON about business here and get to experience a growing organization from the inside.

Duties include:
•	Customer Service and sales of AV equipment and Wire & Cable at the will-call counter in Westwood.
•	Daily shipping and receiving, document preparation and product put-away in the warehouse.
•	Warehouse organization, management and occasional assembly work.
•	Other general upkeep duties as necessary (ie. Organizing samples, building cable wands etc...)

The successful candidate will possess the following qualities:
•	A great attitude, a team player and the ability to be assertive.
•	Highly organized, detailed and energetic with a proactive approach.
•	Excellent communication skills, both interoffice as well as with customers, vendors and associates. 
•	Ability to multi-task effectively. The environment is quite dynamic and can be fast paced.

We'll train you on our processes and set you up to be successful. The environment is great. We have a dynamic and personable, yet professional working atmosphere. If this sounds like it's for you, we can't wait to hear from you. The job is full-time, Monday - Friday, 8:30am to 5pm. The salary is ~$18/hour + benefits and may be adjusted up or down based on experience.

When responding to this ad, please use "Inside Sales/Will Call - CS" as your subject line and include a cover letter to tell us a bit about yourself. Those contacting us by phone will not be considered (thanks in advance for respecting the process).

Title: Professional Server Position - Paramount Coffee Project LA
Description:
Paramount Coffee Project currently has an opening for a professional server. The potential candidate must be someone who is passionate and engaged about both coffee and exceptional customer service. For this position, the individual must have a positive attitude, understand the principles of providing great hospitality, be able to work efficiently in a fast paced environment and collaborate with others. They must have the desire/ability to connect with guests and build positive relationships with all customers. They must have a casual approach to excellent service and be able to demonstrate a true interest and passion in taking care of people.

Barista experience is a serious plus! We would love for candidates to have the ability to be flexible throughout the cafe, spending some days working the floor and others behind the bar. 

All potential candidates must have experience in the hospitality industry, MUST be available to work weekends and some holidays. 3-4 days a week required.

Please send your resume and cover letter.

A little about us! Paramount Coffee Project was established in Surry Hills, Sydney, envisioned as a space that would showcase the variety of styles and approaches of specialty coffee. PCP is a cafe showcasing exceptional local and international roasters presented in an unbiased and educational format. It is a platform for establishing connections and creating relationships between local and international roasters, farmers and brewers. PCP creates a way to cross-promote from a neutral perspective with only the integrity of the coffee in mind.
	On a day-to-day basis PCP is a cafe which focuses on unique, delicious food and exceptional customer service.  As a result there is a real emphasis on the quality of the coffee and paying tribute to all the hard work it takes to get the coffee in the cup. Our food menu focuses on breakfast and lunch and offers a variety of unique and delicious dishes. We strive for quality to filter down through all aspects of the business. 
	After success in Sydney, PCP chose to take their format to Los Angeles and present to an American audience. Our first location in Los Angeles is located at 456 Fairfax Ave. We have been serving coffee and food in the format of a typical Sydney/Melbourne Café in Los Angeles for a little bit over a year now. We are excited for our newest location coming to DTLA next year!

Title: E-Commerce and Marketplace Manager
Description:
Our company is an online retailer of Shoes, Clothing, Toys, and Accessories.  We are looking for a qualified individual to lead our E commerce marketplace division.  We are major players on the following marketplaces: Amazon, Ebay, Walmart, and Jet. We are looking to expand to over 15 marketplaces and push our own E commerce website to the next level.  We are looking for someone who has vast the technical knowledge and leadership experience to grow with our dynamic company.   

Position Summary:

•	Lead our marketplace listing team with the detailed maintenance and improvement of listings on the various marketplaces 
        (title, description, images, reviews, prices, product specs, customer questions, etc.) to increase product ranking and buyer 
        experience.
•	Hold best practice meetings and introduce new processes to our marketplace team.
•	Drive traffic and execute marketing campaigns (Sponsorship ads, lightning deals, EBC, etc) to increase revenue
•	Lead and complete new marketplace launches using our ERP system and various API connections available.
•	Pull and scrub reports from marketplaces, translate findings into insights and actionable growth tactics
•	Monitor and analyze KPIs (visits, conversation rate, ROI, cost analysis, return rate, etc.)
•	Inventory planning: compare past and current sales trends to determine future inventory demand.  
•	Take command of aging inventory by finding the reasons for slowing demand and passing the solution to listing team for 
        corrections
•	Assist in SEO strategies and initiatives by ensuring sites are properly optimized for search engine success.
•	Promotion tracking and coordination: report as necessary account specific promotional plans in a timely and effective manner.
•	Communicate effectively both internally and externally to meet customer needs and expectations.
•	Proactively research online marketplace to ensure accuracy and delivery of our content, while continuously looking at ways to 
        improve our brand position.
•	Manage e-commerce website and oversee internet assortment, sales, staffing, and goals
•	Plan and execute all website promotions, SEO, SEM, display, retargeting, e-mail, and social media advertising campaigns
•	Identify new digital trends and applications that have the ability to increase brand awareness and sales
        
Position Requirement's:

•	Bachelor's degree in a technical field is required.
•	3+ years' experience in the Amazon marketplace and website management.
•	Strong knowledge of Microsoft  Excel, including .csv & .txt files, filtering, conditional formatting, macros, pivot tables, 
        and VLOOKUP & SUMIF functions.
•	Strong communication and leadership skills.
•	Ability to meet deadlines, multitask and follow instructions.
•	Have initiative, resourcefulness, self-motivation, and a high level of ownership.
•	Knowledge of Internet best practices and the impact they have on SEO 
•	Experience with PPC - Management of Pay per click programs.
•	An in depth understanding of search engines, search engine optimization and factors that influence high rankings in Google
•	Experience with web analytics tools (Urchin, Webtrends, and Ominiture).
•	+ Experience with Nestuite or similar ERP a Plus
•	+ Experience and knowledge of Suitescript, HTML, PHP, Java Script, and Web Services.

Title: Merchandiser
**** JOIN ME Flipping Houses - We Will Train ****
Description:
Please read this ad very carefully, If interested, please visit my website:  


We are full-time Investors part of a Real Estate Club closing deals throughout Southern California. We are real people, doing real deals, and doing very well in this market but want to do more.  As senior members of the club for the over 5 years, we have been very successful teaching others to work alongside us, helping them to get their start in this business closing deals and splitting profits.  
 
We are not looking for everyone to join us. This business takes time, determination, and persistence. This is NOT a get rich quick or network marketing or MLM system. Having a current job to help pay your bills until you close your first deal is not only important, but necessary.
 
People who want to learn this business are usually concerned about what it takes to get started.  Not having the capital to buy a house is usually the biggest concern.  What most people need is a team, and one that already has the resources available to plug into, allowing you to ride on the coattails of those more experienced. Our office has everything needed to close real estate transactions such as: 
  
•	Title/ Escrow  
•	Transaction Coordinators   
•	Bank Negotiators  
•	Real Estate Agents 
•	Real Estate Attorneys 
•	Contractors
•	Capital to fund deals 
  
We are currently expanding in different cities and looking for individuals with entrepreneurial drive and determination to build a business for themselves.  Most people start on a part-time basis, leaning on others credibility until they can close deals, build their network and replace their primary income.  
  
There's a lot of great deals in So Cal, and how to find those deals is what we teach. Below are the strategies we are currently using:  
  
•	Fix n Flips  
•	Wholesale  
•	Foreclosures  
•	Short Sales  
•	Probate  
•	Lease Options etc  
•	Vacant Houses  
•	Property Tax Defaults 
 
*NO REAL ESTATE LICENSE OR EXPERIENCE IS REQUIRED.  
 
   
  
The key to growth is surrounding yourself with people who are already doing what you want to do. Starting this business is about leverage.  You are looking to leverage what we already have to help you get started.  In turn, we are looking to leverage you to close more deals.  In the process, we get paid when we close deals, splitting profits, and helping you to build your own business.  As club members, we have many benefits that have led to us closing over 100 deals in the past few years. 

You don't need capital to buy a house or experience, but you will have to dedicate time and effort to make money in this business.  Unlike the TV shows and real estate seminars, we do actually tell you that it is impossible to make money overnight.  

We get together several times a month in multiple locations including, Riverside, Irvine, Oceanside and Los Angeles. Our system has a proven record for many years now. What we do has afforded us the opportunity to help others get to their first deal and more. 

If you want to partner with experienced investors who can bring the capital and systems to the table, and are the type of person that wants to run your own business at some point, we should talk. Keep in mind, we are very busy and a large reason for placing this ad is to meet the right people looking to get started in this business who see the value of creating partnerships. 





Once we have you're info, we'll follow up within 48 hours.
***NOTE***
We are looking for potential Business Partners, not EMPLOYEES. Only contact me if you are serious. If you are currently unemployed and need money fast, now is not the right time for you. ALL RESUMES WILL BE IGNORED.

Title: Entry Level Sales - Technical Recruiter
Description:
Jobspring Partners, a leading provider of contractor and permanent technology recruiting services, is
rapidly expanding due to significant growth in the IT staffing sector. Join our team to become a highly
successful Tech Recruiting Specialist and enter into our proven training and leadership development
program to potentially earn a role as a business manager overseeing sales operations in any of our 21
locations in North America.

As a Tech Recruiting Specialist you will be working with industry-leading technology companies - from
cutting edge early startups to Fortune 500 companies, develop a strong professional network, and grow
your own profitable book of business. This position is in our Los Angeles office, located in the
Westwood region, right off the 405 on Wilshire Blvd and Veteran Ave.

You will become skilled at...
• Sourcing candidates/clients through our proven sourcing and market research methodology
• Opening new accounts using effective sales practices over the phone and online
• Executing a successful recruiting process from start (source) to finish (hire) using our vast set of
'best practices' guides and tools
• Educating and advising candidates/clients to build strong and trustworthy relationships with
customers
• Working within a collaborative team to collectively deliver the best possible recruitment
experience
• Networking and becoming a well-connected member of your local tech community via our
proprietary technology meetup series "Tech in Motion" events

You will receive...
• Training, training, and more training - our training program is unlike any other. A vast library of
60+ courses build the necessary skills to succeed and flourish in your role
• Ongoing one-on-one support and mentorship in all aspects of your role and development
• Accelerated title and salary growth potential (our most successful Recruiters are promoted into
a management seat within two years)
• A fun and energetic work environment that makes you excited to go to work every day.
• Base compensation with merit-based raises throughout the first year with clear path to
commission
• Highly competitive benefit package: health, vision, dental, 401k, gym reimbursement and more!

As an ideal candidate, you will...
• Communicate confidently in person, over the phone, and online
• Focus on the positive and strive for continual improvement
• Be ambitious and motivated to achieve results
• Display a strong interest in business development and sales
• Collaborate and operate well in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment
• Be effective at building strong relationships
• Adhere to a strong work ethic and sense of commitment
• Enjoy learning about the IT industry
• Hold a Bachelor's degree or honorable discharge from military service

Title: Release of Information Specialist/ Field Agent
Description:
About Us:

Diversified Medical Records Services is a successful and established nationwide company specializing in medical records services for doctors' offices, medical facilities and hospitals. We have been in business over twenty years and our client base exceeds 1,000 physicians, groups and facilities across the country.

Description:

We have a permanent,full-time position available M -F handling medical records requests at client medical offices. This position requires working independently to provide Release of Information services, high level of customer service and driving to client locations up to fifty+ miles per day. Mileage reimbursement is provided. Industry experience is not necessary; we will train. Day time hours only-- no weekends or evening work. Full-time with benefits: Mileage, health, paid holidays, sick time, vacation and 401k.

We are seeking professional and responsible applicants with an exceptional work ethic.

Successful Candidates Must Also Possess:
- High energy level and positive attitude
- Reliable automobile, driver's license and insurance
- Basic computer skills
- Organizational and time management abilities
- Attention to detail

Interested candidates may forward resumes to the link provided herein.Due to the high volume of responses, only selected applicants will receive a reply.

Prior to employment, eligible candidate must pass drug screen and background check.
